name: Amnesty International (AI)
aims: Mobilize public opinion to introduce effective international machinery to guarantee freedom of speech and religion as set out in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights; work for the release of men and women in prison for their beliefs and for the relief, where necessary, of their families.
activities: Prisoner of Conscience Index; investigations of conditions under which prisoners are held; formation of local groups undertaking to work for the release of at least three prisoners each; missions; campaign for the abolition of torture; action against the death penalty; sending observers to attend political trials.

name: Association for the Promotion of the International Circulation of the Press (DISTRIPRESS)
aims: Assist in the promotion of the freedom of the press throughout the world; support and aid UNESCO in promoting the free flow of ideas by word and image; further the interests of the press distribution trade.

name: International Alliance of Women (IAW)
aims: Promote all reforms as are necessary to establish a real equality of liberties, status, and opportunities between men and women; urge women to use their rights and influence in public life to ensure that the status of every individual, without distinction of sex, race, or creed, shall be based on respect for human personality, the only guarantee for individual freedom; take part in constructive work for good understanding between nations

name: International Association of Democratic Lawyers (IADL)
aims: Facilitate contact and exchange among lawyers in order to develop a spirit of mutual understanding and fraternity; encourage study of legal science and international law and support democratic principles favourable to maintenance of peace and cooperation between nations; promote independence of all peoples, and oppose any restriction thereof, whether by legislation or practice
activities: Research on legal problems; study and practice of the principles of democracy making for the maintenance of peace and cooperation between nations, defense and development of democratic rights and liberties in legislation and in the practice of law.

name: International Bar Association
aims: Establish and maintain permanent relations and exchanges between Bar Associations throughout the world and their members; discuss problems of professional organization and status; advanced the science of jurisprudence in all its phases; by common study of practical legal problems, promote uniformity and definition in appropriate fields of law; promote the administration of justice under law among peoples of the world; in execution of these objects promote in their legal aspects the principles and aims of the United Nations and cooperate with, and promote coordination among, international juridical organizations having similar purposes.
activities: Extensive work in such fields as: restoration of the law after World War II; nationalization, confiscation and expropriation; investments abroad; coastal waters and appurtenant subsoil; foreign Estates; international shipbuilding contracts; international judicial cooperation; double taxation; domestic relations; atomic operations; sovereign immunity; foreign subsidiaries. Section on Business Law (22 committees) formed 1970. Section on General Practice (17 committees) formed 1974. Set up International Legal Aid Association (ILAA). Standing committees: finance; planning; seminars; constitutional review; nominations; membership; member organizations; European affairs; ombudsman; IBa-UIA Joint Committee; United Nations affairs; professional ethics; human rights; Law Asia Liaison.

name: International Commission of Jurists (ICJ)
aims: Support and advance those principles of justice which constitute the basis of the Rule of Law; mobilize jurists of the world in support of the Rule of Law through public meetings, conferences and congresses, publications, and other appropriate types of activities
activities: World enquiry into the definition of the Rule of Law; observers at trials; reports on situations (Spain, Portugal, South Africa, Turkey, Cuba, Pakistan, Uganda, Chile, Uruguay, Iran; Rhodesia, Philippines, etc.); missions and visits to countries; participation in UN seminars; international exchanges; activities for law students and young lawyers.

name: International Council of Women (ICW)
aims: Bring together women's organizations of all races and creeds from all parts of the world for consultation on action to be taken to promote the welfare of mankind, of the family and of the individual; help make women aware, not only of the rights but also of their civic, social and political responsibilities to society as a whole; work for the removal of all disabilities for women.
activities: Has supported from the beginning the ideas of international peace and arbitration, equal legal status for women (including suffrage and rights of citizenship, equal pay for equal work), family and child welfare. International standing committees (13) on: Arts and letters (with a sub-committee on music); Child and family; economics; education; environment and habitat; health; home economics; International relations and peace; laws and status of women; mass media; migration; social welfare; women and employment. Study of questions which affect the status of women and their capacity to play an active part in all aspects of life. Regional seminars on human rights, literacy, education, the advancement of women and their participation in economic and social development.

name: International League for Human Rights (ILHR)
aims: Application of those guarantees of civil, political, economic and social rights contained in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights adopted by the UN in 1948 and in the International Covenants on Human Rights.
activities: Works to implement international human rights standards and agreements, adopted by the UN and other intergovernmental bodies. Investigates human rights violations; intervenes directly with governments; makes representations before international bodies; conducts research and educational programmes; publishes special reports on human rights conditions; assists victims; sends observers to political trials; dispatches special investigative missions to inquire into specific violations and effect redress; supports and helps establish human rights groups in different countries; works to establish international human rights standards. Public and private meetings. Annual Human Rights Prize awarded.

name: International Organization of Journalists (IOJ)
aims: By free and true information, help maintain peace and friendship among nations; defend freedom of the press and journalists, and fight for their better material and social position; support fully friendly cooperation of all journalists throughout the world and help to achieve their unity.
activities: Investigation of various professional and social problems of journalists, professional training, specific branches of journalistic activities, working conditions and social welfare (wages, medical treatment, pensions). Conferences, seminars, symposia, training courses. Permanent international commissions: Professional Questions; Social Problems. Specialized international professional sections and clubs (press photography, agriculture, radio and TV, automobilism). International press photography exhibitions INTERPRESSFOTO. Permanent international training center in Budapest. International journalists' houses at Black Sea (Bulgaria) and Lake Balaton (Hungary).

name: International PEN
aims: Promote and maintain friendship and intellectual cooperation between men of letters in all countries in the interests of literature, freedom of expression and international goodwill. PEN is not concerned with state or party politics and must not be used to serve their interests.
activities: Local meetings organized individually by Centres, many of which publish their own newsletters, books and pamphlets. PEN Writers in Prison Committee works for the release of writers imprisoned for expressing their opinions.

name: International Press Institute (IPI)
aims: Furtherance and safeguarding of freedom of the press, by which is meant: free access to news, free expression of views, free publication of newspapers, achievement of understanding among editors and so among peoples; promotion of free exchange of accurate and balanced news among nations; improvement of the practices of journalism.
activities: Press Centre gives information on press freedom and editorial research.

name: International Union of Socialist Youth (IUSY)
aims: Propagate amongst the younger generation the principles of free and democratic socialism; further the practical cooperation of democratic socialist youth and student organizations of all countries in order to strengthen international solidarity among all young socialists of the world in the fight against imperialism, fascism, racism, and for the liberation of man from all exploitation and for the right of all peoples to free and independent social development
activities: Leader courses; summer schools; seminars.

name: Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU)
aims: Promote personal contacts between members of all Parliaments, constituted into National Groups, and unite them in common action to secure and maintain the full participation of their respective States in the firm establishment and development of representative institutions and in the advancement of the work of international peace and cooperation, particularly by supporting the objectives of the United Nations; express the Union's views on all questions of an international character suitable for settlement by parliamentary action and make suggestions for the development of parliamentary institutions, with a view to improving the working of those institutions and increase their prestige
activities: Objective examination of all international questions suitable for settlement by parliamentary action. Two major sessions annually. Standing study committee set up by the inter-Parliamentary Council (5): Political Questions, International Security and Disarmament; Parliamentary, Judicial and Human Rights Questions; Economic and Social; education; science, culture, and environment; Non-Self-Governing Territories and Ethnic Questions. Programme of technical cooperation (services to Parliaments to train or to improve the qualifications of their staff and their working methods). In 1976, the Union adopted a 'Procedure for the Examination and Treatment of Communications Concerning the Violation of the Human Rights of Parliamentarians' which is applicable to any member of Parliament from any country who is the victim of arbitrary measures during the exercise of his mandate, whether the Parliament was in session or in recess or has been dissolved by unconstitutional or emergency measures. Since Nov 1979, IPU has organized meetings of parliamentarians attending the UN General Assembly in New York. Development of representative institutions has been regularly and thoroughly debated by the Union and studied by International Centre for Parliamentary Documentation - Centre international de documentation parlementaire (CIDP), which systematically gathers and distributes information on the organization and functioning of representative institutions, the development of the organization and working methods of assemblies and the status of their members. Association of Secretaries General of Parliaments (ASGP) - Association des secretaires generaux des Parlements, which is a consultative organism of the Union, provides an opportunity for senior parliamentary officials to meet, study parliamentary law and procedure and to propose measures for improving the working methods of different Parliaments and for securing cooperation between their services of different Parliaments. International conferences, meetings, symposia and seminars.

name: Women's International Democratic Federation (WIDF)
aims: Unite women regardless of race, nationality, religion and political opinion, so that they may work together to win, implement and defend their rights as mothers, workers and citizens; defend the rights of children to life, well-being and education; win and defend national independence and democratic freedoms, eliminate apartheid, racial discrimination and fascism; work for peace and universal disarmament
activities: Works for the rights of women in society and family for: the right to work; the right to equal pay for equal work; the right to education at all levels; the recognition of the social role of motherhood; the integration of women in all spheres of political, social and cultural life. Support women suffering oppression, racial discrimination, apartheid fascism in all its forms, colonialism and neocolonialism, with solidarity activities, study trips, seminars, round-table meetings and publications. As far as children are concerned, WIDF works: for a secure and happy future for all children; for the right of all children to education, health care and adequate nutrition; that nowhere in the world children starve or die of hunger; for the right of each child to a happy childhood and a life in a harmonious family. As regards the peace problem, WIDF works: for preservation and consolidation of peace; against the arms race (including weapons of mass destruction and nuclear weapons); against the constantly increasing military expenditure. In 1978 established a Regional Centre in Havana (Cuba).

name: World Anti-Communist League (WACL)
aims: Fight and strive to remove all forms of totalitarianism including communism from the face of the earth wherever they may be found; uphold human rights, most important of which are liberty, freedom of religious beliefs, social justice, and the self-determination of peoples.

name: World Federation of Democratic Youth (WFDY)
aims: Strive, with due regard for differing political tendencies, religious beliefs and forms of activity of member organizations, for closer international understanding and cooperation amongst all international and national youth organizations, with a view to coordinating their efforts for the solution of their common problems and the achievement of their ideal democracy, friendship and world peace.
activities: Seminars, voluntary work camps; international solidarity aid fund. Specialize bureaus: rights of youth; students; culture; youth women; children. Attached bureaus: International Bureau for Tourism and Youth Exchanges (BITEJ); International Youth Sport Committee; International Voluntary Service for Youth Solidarity and Friendship; International Committee of Children's and Adolescents' Movements (ICCAM). Organizes World Festivals.

name: Commonwealth Press Union (CPU)
aims: Promote welfare of the Commonwealth newspaper press and of those concerned with dissemination of news and information; give effect to the opinion of members on matters which might affect the freedom and efficiency of the newspaper and periodical press throughout the Commonwealth; promote conferences; promote, through the press, understanding and goodwill among the constituent parts of the Commonwealth
activities: Watches for and opposes all measures or proposals likely to affect the freedom of the press in any part of the world; works for improved telecommunication facilities for the reporting and transmission of news; promotes measures for the education and training of journalists.

name: International Association for Religious Freedom (IARF)
aims: Bring into closer union the historic liberal churches, the liberal element in all churches, and isolated congregations and workers for religious freedom; draw into the same fellowship free religious groups throughout the world which share the basic values of openness and free religious inquiry, human dignity and common service; open and maintain communications with free Christian groups in all lands who are striving to unite religion and liberty and increase fellowship and cooperation among them
activities: Library (over 8,000 volumes). Study groups for: religious education, social questions, problems of theology and church.

name: Socialist International Women (SIW)
aims: Strengthen relations between members; exchange experiences between members on ways and means of promoting, among the women of their respective countries, a knowledge and understanding of the aims and tasks of democratic socialism; seek to extend relations between SIW members and other socialist-oriented women's groups, not in membership, which desire cooperation; promote action programmes to overcome any discrimination in society, including any inequality between men and women, and work for human rights in general, development and peace
activities: Exchange visits. Seminars. International Women's Day meetings. Projects for help to women in developing countries, including scholarships awarded to women from Africa, Asia and Latin America. Contributions to such topics as: new international economic order; development and disarmament; the future generation; socialism and feminism.

name: International Federation of Newspaper Publishers
aims: Safeguard the ethical and economic interests of newspapers by studying and putting into operation all means likely to guarantee to newspapers in the international sphere the position to which their importance in contemporary life gives them a right; create conditions favorable to development of press activities; participate in any international activity of interest to the profession; defend freedom of information in cooperation with other international press organizations

name: International Union for Moral and Social Action (IUMS)
aims: Coordinate efforts undertaken in different countries to ensure the respect of human dignity and oppose violations thereof
activities: Draft international convention has been submitted to government authorities

name: International Union of Judges
aims: Defend the independence of the judiciary, as an essential condition of the judicial function, and guarantee the rights and freedom of man, protect the constitutional and moral position of the judiciary; exchange of cultural relations; organize and intensify cordial relations between judges of different countries.
activities: Congresses and meetings for the study of the judicial system and the unification of law generally; assistance in the arrangements of exchange visits

name: International Union of Young Christian Democrats (IUYCD)
aims: Contribute to the establishment throughout the world of a social, economic and political democracy of Christian democratic inspiration; spread the Christian democrat ideal and prepare the younger generation of Christian democrats for political, economic, and social responsibilities; coordinate the activities of member organizations to attain these aims
activities: Regional congresses; seminars and round tables.

name: Law Association for Asia and the Western Pacific (LAWASIA)
aims: Promote the administration of justice, protect human rights, maintain the rule of law; advance the standard of legal education, further international understanding in goodwill, and foster the standards of the legal profession within the ESCAP region.

name: Asian-Pacific Parliamentarians' Union  (APPU)
aims: Achieve and preserve full freedom and genuine democracy, thereby securing enduring peace and prosperity in Asia, by: exerting efforts to strengthen mutual understanding and unity of the nations in Asia (including the Pacific countries), promoting economic cooperation and exchanges of culture and technology for the purpose of enhancing the common welfare on a humanitarian basis among the nations of Asia (including the Pacific countries), discussing all matters affecting peace and security in Asia and respecting the principles of sovereignty and territorial integrity of all nations, and the principle of non-interference in the internal affairs of another country
activities: Asian Development Center; Asian Cultural Center. Standing Committees such as: Political, Economic, Cultural, Transport and Telecommunications. Ad Hoc Committees

name: Christian Democratic Organization of America
aims: Serve as a link between Christian Democratic parties in Latin American countries by promoting the exchange of publications and ideas; organize research concerning common problems; contact similar parties in other regions of the world.

name: Christian Democratic Organization of Central Europe (CDUCE)
aims: Promote Christian principles in political, social, economic and international life; prepare programme of political, economic and social organization of the Central European region, based on federative principles and its integration in a United Europe. Youth Section prepares the younger generation for their role in future development of Central Europe.
activities: Promotion of policy towards freedom and democracy in the oppressed Central European area. Action to develop and spread Christian Democratic Movement in the world.

name: Christian Democratic Youth of America
aims: Works for the establishment in Latin America of a social, economic, and political democracy of Christian Democratic inspiration

name: European Christian Democratic Union
aims: Establish regular contacts between political groups and individuals in all countries who are inspired by the principle of Christian democracy, with a view to studying, in the light of those principles, national and international problems; compare experiences and programs and seek to realize international harmony in practical achievement within the framework of democracy and social and political peace
activities: Study sessions. Congresses.

name: European Union of Young Christian Democrats
aims: Contribute to the establishment in Europe of a social, economic, and political democracy of Christian democratic inspiration

name: Inter-American Association for Democracy and Freedom (IADF)
aims: Promote democracy in the Americas; defend human rights and protect and investigate violations of civil and political liberties; oppose dictatorship of both left and right in the Americas and in all ways further juridical stability for social, economic, and political democracy
activities: Conducts conferences, classes for discussions of Inter-American problems. Reference library. Investigates problems of human rights as they occur and acts to protest where necessary; supplies legal assistance

name: Inter-American Association of Broadcasters (IAAB)
aims: Defend broadcasting as a free means of expression of thought and fight for the freedom of social communication media; fight for the effective enforcement of the democratic system of government; promote cooperation of broadcasters with activities of public interest and social services; promote effective representation of broadcasting interests in official or private national and international organizations; sponsor continental and regional conferences of a technical, legal, or educational nature
activities: Standing committees on ethical, legal, expression and programmation, technical and frequencies, publicity and promotion, conciliation and arbitration and freedom of information problems. Campaign to extend to broadcasting the privileges granted to the press. System for exchange of programmes; information supplied on legal situation

name: Inter-American Bar Association (IABA)
aims: Establish and maintain relations between associations and organizations of lawyers, national and local, in the Americas; provide a forum for exchange of views; advance the science of jurisprudence in all its phases and particularly the study of comparative law; promote uniformity of commercial legislation; further the diffusion of knowledge of laws of the various countries of the Americas; promote the rule of law and the administration of justice through the establishment and maintenance of independent judicial systems in all countries of the Americas; ensure preservation and defense of human rights and liberties and guarantee to the peoples of the hemisphere the free exercise of their civil and political rights under the democratic principles; uphold the honor of the profession of the law; encourage cordial intercourse and fellowship among lawyers of the Western Hemisphere
activities: Permanent committees and sections, each dealing with a specific subject and reporting its work to the Conference. Permanent Committees and Section (17): public international law; private international law; constitutional law; administrative and municipal law; civil law; civil and commercial procedure; commercial law; criminal law and procedure; military law; labor law; fiscal law; development and integration; legal education; legal profession; natural resources and environmental protection; human rights and defense of Western democracy; food and drug law. Inter-American Academy of International and Comparative Law, founded in 1941, Havana, is a permanent adjunct of the Association (Headquarters: Havana 1941-1963; Lima 1963-1973; from 1973 onwards and current site: Rio de Janeiro). In Apr 1957, the Inter-American Bar Foundation was incorporated under the laws of Pennsylvania (USA) as a companion organization of IABA.

name: Inter-American Press Association (IAPA)
aims: Protect freedom of the press in Americas; foster general and specific interests of press; promote and maintain the dignity, rights, and responsibilities of the profession of journalism; encourage uniform standards of professional and business conduct; promote greater interchange among peoples of America in support of basic principles of a free society and individual liberty
activities: Fosters and protects press freedom by publishing facts of any action or attempt to restrict that freedom in the Western Hemisphere. Permanent Agencies: Inter-American Press Association Scholarship Fund, Inc.; Inter-American Press Association Technical Center, Inc.; Mergenthaler and Tom Wallace Awards. Committees on Freedom of the press, Legal, Membership, Applications Review, Awards Committee.

name: International Federation of Resistance Movements
aims: Unite resisters as in wartime resistance movements to secure the independence of their country, liberty, and world peace; cherish the memory of all who fell for their country and liberty; defend the spirit and values of the Resistance; make known its historical role and transmit its teaching to the new generations; contribute to the defense of the material and moral interests of those having due rights and causes; create and develop social services in their aid; promote attainment of the aims set out in the UN Charter and strengthen links of fraternity and solidarity between resisters in all countries; oppose racial, political, philosophical or religious discrimination of any kind; oppose neofascism; work for disarmament and detente
activities: Documentation center (about 4,000 vols, documents, photos, posters). Commissions on cultural, social, medical matters and on reparations. Annual holiday camps for children of resisters. Research services. Pilgrimages to former concentration camps. Defense of the human rights. Congresses; Medical Congresses; specialized meetings.

name: Free International Federation of Deportees and Resistance Internees
aims: Keep alive the memory of victims of oppression and of the struggle for freedom; promote on a national and international level a civic spirit and respect for and protection of democratic freedoms; strengthen fraternal bonds between members of associated organizations; ensure for all members any moral and material aid which they may require; promote and support laws and regulations likely to meet social purposes of national organizations and the international Federation.
activities: Special commissions

name: International Union of Resistance and Deportee Movements
aims: Bring together at the international level - all political or governmental intervention being excluded - associations of resisters, deportees, and victims of Nazism in order to defend their rights and claims, perpetuate the memory of their struggles in the service of freedom, oppose any resurgence of Nazism and anti-Semitism and any attacks on the rights and dignity of the human person and promote a policy of genuine peace that respects freedom and democracy
activities: Studies on: disarmament and peace; defense of liberty; German reparations; history of the Resistance; rights of resistance workers and victims of Nazism; pathology of deportation, internment and resistance. Establishment of international expert committee on the struggle against neo-Nazism and of Comite international des camps.

name: Union of Resistance Veterans for a United Europe
aims: Help constitute a united Europe open to all democratic countries and which must rest on a moral basis to which it is the vocation of the resistance to furnish an essential support; campaign in Europe against any rebirth of Nazism, anti-Semitism and all restrictions to liberty and the personal rights of man.
activities: Action against: Nazism, fascism, anti-Semitism, (information Center). Various operations in favor of a united Europe and rapprochement between France and Germany. Setting up groups of sons and daughters of resistors in order to secure support among youth for a united Europe and the ideals of freedom and respect for human rights.

name: Arab Lawyers' Union
aims: Act in the interests of the Arab Nation to achieve its national objectives; facilitate contacts between Arab lawyers; safeguard and develop legislative and judiciary language; assure the freedom of lawyers in their work and the independence of magistrates; allow all Arab lawyers to take cases in any Arab country; harmonize the conditions of the legal profession; establish and harmonize links with international legal organizations; restore the study of Muslim Law as a basis for law
activities: Commissions: Arab affairs; Palestine; Unification of law in Arab countries; defense of civil liberties and sovereignty in Arab countries; harmonization of legal terminology; rules on the legal profession; socialization; support of the Palestine Liberation Movement; Defense of Palestinian resisters. Engaged in founding an Arab Organization for Human Rights.

name: European Democrat Students (EDS)
aims: Promote cooperation between non-socialist students to work for a united and democratic Europe; strengthen the ideas of democracy, pluralism and liberty and help create a European Democratic Party of all European non-socialists
activities: Seminars on European topics; training seminars; higher education research; campaigns; publications. Annual conferences; meetings (currently 8 a year).

name: Confederation of ASEAN Journalists (CAJ)
aims: Cooperate fully in advancing journalism; promote a healthy, free and responsible press in ASEAN countries

name: International Mauthausen Committee
aims: Safeguard the interests of former prisoners of the Mauthausen concentration camp and their families; oppose fascism and Nazism in all forms

name: International Defense and Aid Fund for Southern Africa (IDAF)
aims: Assist in the development of a non-racial society in Southern Africa based on a democratic way of life; aid, defend and rehabilitate the victims of unjust legislation and oppressive and arbitrary procedures; support their families and dependents; keep the conscience of the world alive to the issues at stake.
activities: Humanitarian aid to the people of Southern Africa, with special reference to South Africa, Rhodesia and Namibia. Information and research service.

name: Amnesty International
aims: Considering that every person has the right freely to hold and to express his or her convictions and the obligation to extend a like freedom to others, to secure throughout the world the observance of the provisions of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, by: working towards the release of and providing assistance to persons who are imprisoned, detained, or otherwise physically restricted by reason of their political, religious or other conscientiously held beliefs or by reason of their ethnic origin, sex, colour or language, provided that they have not used advocated violence; opposing the detention of such prisoners of conscience or political prisoners without trial within a reasonable time or any trial procedures relating to such prisoners that do not conform to internationally recognized norms; opposing the imposition and infliction of death penalties and torture or other cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment of prisoners or other detained or restricted persons whether or not they have used or advocated violence
activities: Conducts impartial research and organizes worldwide action by local members on behalf of prisoners held in countries other than their own. Local groups appeal for release of prisoners of conscience, join campaigns highlighting political imprisonment and detention without charge or trial and participate in urgent action networks to bring immediate pressure in cases where torture, 'disappearance' or execution are feared. Observers are sent to observe trials and missions, visit countries to interview prisoners and hold talks with government officials. Organizes 'Prisoner of Conscience Week' each Oct; publicizes three 'Prisoners of the Month' each month to be the focus of postal campaigns for their release. Conference for the Abolition of Torture, 1973; Conference for the Abolition of the Death Penalty, 1977; International conference on Extrajudicial Executions 1982. Amnesty International received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1977 for its contribution to 'securing the journal for freedom, for justice, and thereby also for peace in the world'. In 1978, on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, AI was awarded the United Nations Human Rights Prize for 'outstanding achievements in the field of human rights'.

name: Association for the Promotion of the International Circulation of the Press (DISTRIPRESS)
aims: Assist in the promotion of the freedom of the press throughout the world; support and aid all national and international action promoting the free flow of ideas by word and image and intervention against all measures which hinder or aim to prevent such a free flow; further the interests of the press distribution trade
activities: Annual Congresses. Special regional Conventions (every 3 years). Working Committees investigate matters of common interest. Organizes seminars. Intervenes directly or through national or international authorities when free international circulation of the press is held up or hindered.

name: International Alliance of Women (IAW)
aims: Promote all reforms as are necessary to establish a real equality of liberties, status, and opportunities between men and women; urge women to use their rights and influence in public life to ensure that the status of every individual, without distinction of sex, race, or creed, shall be based on respect for human personality, the only guarantee for individual freedom; take part in constructive work for good understanding between nations
activities: Cooperates with other NGOs and with the United Nations specialized agencies on: peace; nationality of married women; equal pay and discrimination in employment; discrimination in education; slavery and suppression of traffic in persons; elimination of discrimination against women; better family living; equal access to technology; violence against women in the family. Congresses; regional seminars with follow-up workshops and projects

name: International Association of Democratic Lawyers (IADL)
aims: Facilitate contact and exchange among lawyers in legal science and international law and support democratic principles favourable to maintenance of peace and cooperation between nations; promote independence of all peoples, and oppose any restriction thereof, whether by legislation or practice
activities: Research on legal problems; study and practice of the principles of democracy making for the maintenance of peace and cooperation between nations; defence and development of democratic rights and liberties in legislation and in the practice of law. Organizes international commission of enquiry and conferences on specific topics such as: the new economic order; racism and apartheid; human rights; decolonization and self-determination.

name: International Bar Association
aims: Establish and maintain permanent relations and exchanges between bar associations and law associations and their members throughout the world; discuss problems of professional organization and status; advanced the science of jurisprudence in all its phases; by common study of practical legal problems, promote uniformity and definition in appropriate fields of law; promote the administration of justice under law among peoples of the world; in execution of these objects promote in their legal aspects the principles and aims of the United Nations and cooperate with, and promote coordination among, international juridical organizations having similar purposes.
activities: Extensive work in such fields as: restoration of the law after World War II; nationalization, confiscation and expropriation; investments abroad; coastal waters and appurtenant subsoil; foreign Estates; international ship building contracts; international judicial cooperation; double taxation; domestic relations; atomic operations; sovereign immunity; foreign subsidiaries. 'Section on business law' (25 committees) formed 1970. 'Section on General Practice' (19 committees) formed 1974. Set up international legal aid association. Standing committees: finance; seminars; membership; member organizations; European affairs; ombudsman; United Nations affairs; professional ethics; human rights. Organizes national, regional and international conferences and seminars.

name: International Commission of Jurists (ICJ)
aims: Support and advance those principles of justice which constitute the basis of the Rule of Law; mobilize jurists of the world in support of the Rule of Law through public meetings, conferences and congresses, publications, and other appropriate types of activities
activities: World enquiry into the definition of the Rule of Law; observers at trials; reports on situations in various countries all over the world; international exchanges; activities for law students and young lawyers

name: International Council of Women (ICW)
aims: Bring together in association women's voluntary organizations from all parts of the world for consultation and action to promote the welfare of mankind, the family and the individual; support all efforts to achieve peace through negotiation, arbitration, and conciliation; promote recognition and respect for human rights and work for the removal of discrimination, such as that based on birth, race, sex, language or religion; promote equal rights and responsibilities for both sexes in all spheres; encourage women to recognise their responsibilities in the community and train and stimulate them to participate in public life on local, national and international levels; deepen the understanding and increase the mutual sympathies of women through international contacts
activities: Has supported from the beginning the ideas of international peace and arbitration, equal legal status for women (including suffrage and rights of citizenship, equal pay for equal work), family and child welfare. Work is directed to making known the principles of human rights and achieving their application in every aspect of life. International Standing Committees (13) on: Arts and Letters (with a Sub-Committee on Music); Child and Family; Economics; Education; Environment and Habitat; Health; Home Economics; International Relations and Peace; Laws and Status of Women; Mass Media; Migration; Social Welfare; Women and Employment. Studies questions which affect the status of women and their capacity to play an active part in all aspects of life. Regional seminars on human rights, literacy, education, the advancement of women and their participation in economic and social development. Member of planning committee on 1985 World Conference of the Decade of Women.

name: International League for Human Rights (ILHR)
aims: Promote application of those guarantees of civil rights, economic rights, and social rights contained in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights adopted by the United Nations in 1948 and in the International Covenants on Human Rights.
activities: Works to implement international human rights standards and agreements, adopted by the UN and other intergovernmental bodies. Investigates human rights violations; intervenes directly with governments; makes representations before international bodies; conducts research and educational programmes; publishes special reports on human rights conditions; assists victims; sends observers to political trials; dispatches special investigative missions to inquire into specific violations and effect redress; supports and helps establish human rights groups in different countries; works to establish international human rights standards. Public and private meetings. Annual Human Rights Prize awarded.

name: International Organization of Journalists (IOJ)
aims: By free and true information, help maintain peace and friendship among nations; defend freedom of the press and journalists, and fight for their better material and social position; support fully friendly cooperation of all journalists throughout the world and help achieve their unity
activities: Investigation of various professional and social problems of journalists, professional training, specific branches of journalistic activities, working conditions and social welfare (Wages, medical treatment, pensions). Particularly involved in the issues: disarmament; human rights; racism; apartheid and decolonization. Organizes conferences, seminars, symposia, training courses. Permanent international commissions: Professional Questions; Social Problems; Studies and Documentation; Training. Organizes international press photography exhibitions INTERPRESSFOTO.

name: International PEN
aims: Promote and maintain friendship and intellectual cooperation between men of letters in all countries in the interest of literature, freedom of expression and international goodwill. PEN is not concerned with state or party politics and must not be used to serve their interests. PEN Charter affirms that literature should remain common currency in spite of political or international upheavals and that works of art are the property of humanity at large; and stands for the unhampered transmission of thought within and between nations.
activities: Local meetings organized individually by Centres, many of which publish their own newsletters, books and pamphlets. 'PEN Writers in Prison Committee' works for the release of writers imprisoned for expressing their opinions; 'PEN Foundation Emergency Fund', based in the Netherlands, gives practical aid to the dependence of imprisoned or harassed writers.

name: International Press Institute (IPI)
aims: Further and safeguard the freedom of the press, by which is meant: free access to news, free expression of views, free publication of newspapers, achieve understanding among editors and so among peoples; promote free exchange of accurate and balanced news among nations; improve the practices of journalism
activities: Press Centre gives information on press freedom and editorial research. Asian Conferences and African Training Programmes in Nairobi and Lagos. Seminars in Africa, America, Asia, Europe.

name: International Union of Socialist Youth (IUSY)
aims: Propagate amongst the younger generation the principles of free and democratic socialism; further the practical cooperation of democratic socialist youth and student organizations of all countries in order to strengthen international solidarity among all young socialists of the world in the fight against imperialism, fascism, racism, and for the liberation of man from all exploitation and for the right of all peoples to free and independent social development
activities: Leader courses; summer schools; seminars.

name: Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU)
aims: Promote personal contacts between members of all Parliaments, constituted into National Groups, and unite them in common action to secure and maintain the full participation of their respective States in the firm establishment and development of representative institutions and in the advancement of the work of international peace and cooperation, particularly by supporting the objectives of the United Nations; express the Union's views on all questions of an international character suitable for settlement by parliamentary action and make suggestions for the development of parliamentary institutions, with a view to improving the working of those institutions and increase their prestige
activities: Work is essentially carried out in two fields: action for peace and strengthening of parliamentary institutions. Examines objectively all international questions suitable for settlement by parliamentary action. Two major sessions annually. Committees set up by the Inter-Parliamentary Council (4): Political Questions, International Security and Disarmament; Parliamentary, Judicial and Human Rights Questions; Economic, Social, Cultural and Environmental Questions' Non-Self-Governing Territories and Ethnic Questions. Programme of technical cooperation (services to Parliaments to train or to improve the qualifications of their staff and their working methods). In 1976, the Union adopted 'Procedure for the Examination and Treatment of Communications Concerning the Violation of the Human Rights of Parliamentarians 'which is applicable to any member of Parliament from any country who is the victim of arbitrary measures during the exercise of his mandate, whether the Parliament was in session or in recess or has been dissolved by unconstitutional or emergency measures. Since Nov 1979, IPU has organized meetings of parliamentarians attending the UN General Assembly in New York. The development of representative institutions has been regularly and thoroughly debated by the Union and studied by International Centre for Parliamentary Documentation - Centre international de documentation parlementaire (CIDP), which systematically gathers and distributes information on the organization and functioning of representative institutions, the development of the organization and working methods of assemblies and the status of their members. Association of Secretaries General of Parliaments (ASGP) - Association des secretaires generaux des Parlements, which is a consultative organism of the Union, provides an opportunity for senior parliamentary officials to meet, to study parliamentary law and procedure and to propose measures for improving the working methods of different Parliaments and for securing cooperation between their services. International conferences, meetings, symposia and seminars.

name: Women's International Democratic Federation (WIDF)
aims: Unite women regardless of race, nationality, religion and political opinion, so that they may work together to win, implement and defend their rights as mothers, workers and citizens; defend the rights of children to life, well-being and education; win and defend national independence and democratic freedoms, eliminate apartheid, racial discrimination and fascism; work for peace and universal disarmament
activities: Works for the rights of women in society and family for: the right to work; the right to equal pay for equal work; the right to education at all levels; the recognition of the social role of motherhood; the integration of women in all spheres of political, social and cultural life. Support women suffering oppression, racial discrimination, apartheid, fascism in all its forms, colonialism and neocolonialism, with solidarity activities, study trips, seminars, round-table meetings and publications. As far as children are concerned, WIDF works: for a secure and happy future for all children; for the right of all children to education, health care and adequate nutrition; that nowhere in the world children starve or die of hunger; for the right of each child to a happy childhood and a life in a harmonious family. As regards the peace problem, WIDF works: for preservation and consolidation of peace; against the arms race (including weapons of mass destruction and nuclear weapons); against constantly increasing military expenditure. In 1978 established a Regional Centre in Havana. Initiator at the NGO level of the proclamation by the United Nations of 'International Women's Year' and contributed to the implementation of 'United Nations Decade for Women: Equality, Development, Peace'.

name: World Federation of Democratic Youth (WFDY)
aims: Contribute to the education of youth in the spirit of freedom, democracy and solidarity; end imperialism, colonialism and neocolonialism; end racist and fascist regimes; ensure peace and security in the world by supporting all initiatives and efforts to this effect; promote active participation of youth in economic social, cultural and political life by acting against all restriction and discrimination connected with age, sex, methods of education, domicile, property, social status, religion, political convictions, colour and race, so as to ensure in all countries and for all young people full freedom of speech, of the press, of religious belief, assembly and organization; support the struggle of youth for higher living standards, for better conditions of education, work and leisure and for development of cultural, educational and sports activities for all young people; further development of the younger generation in the spirit of peace and international friendship; support the principles of the United Nations Charter; support youth interests via international bodies and in affairs of an international character
activities: Works to combat: racism, racial discrimination; apartheid; fascism. Seminars, voluntary work camps; international solidarity aid fund.

name: Commonwealth Press Union (CPU)
aims: Promote welfare of the Commonwealth newspaper press and of those concerned with dissemination of news and information; give effect to the opinion of members on matters which might affect the freedom and efficiency of the newspaper and periodical press throughout the Commonwealth; promote conferences; promote, through the press, understanding and goodwill among the constituent parts of the Commonwealth
activities: Watches for and opposes all measures or proposals likely to affect the freedom of the press in any part of the world; works for improved telecommunication facilities for the reporting and transmission of news; promotes measures for the education and training of journalists; Annual and quadrennial conferences

name: International Association for Religious Freedom (IARF)
aims: Bring into closer union the historic liberal churches, the liberal element in all churches, and isolated congregations and workers for religious freedom; draw into the same fellowship free religious groups throughout the world which share the basic values of openness and free religious inquiry, human dignity and common service; open and maintain communications with free Christian groups in all lands who are striving to unite religion and liberty and increase fellowship and cooperation among them
activities: Library (over 8,000 volumes). Study groups for: religious education, social questions, problems of theology and church.

name: Socialist International Women (SIW)
aims: Strengthen relations between members; exchange experiences between members on ways and means of promoting, among the women of their respective countries, a knowledge and understanding of the aims and tasks of democratic socialism; seek to extend relations between SIW members and other socialist-oriented women's groups, not in membership, which desire cooperation; promote action programmes to overcome any discrimination in society, including any inequality between men and women, and work for human rights in general, development and peace
activities: Exchange visits. Seminars. International Women's Day meetings. Projects for help to women in developing countries. Contributions to such topics as: new international economic order; development and disarmament; the future generation; socialism and feminism

name: International Federation of Free Journalists (IFFJ)
aims: Oppose any totalitarian doctrines which misrepresent the principles of freedom of press and tasks and obligations of the press towards nations and towards humanity, and which violate the basic freedom of Man and Nations; defend freedom of press in all countries

name: International Federation of Newspaper Publishers
aims: Safeguard the ethical and economic interests of newspapers by studying and putting into operation all means likely to guarantee to newspapers in the international sphere the position to which their importance in contemporary life gives them a right; create conditions favorable to development of press activities; participate in any international activity of interest to the profession; defend freedom of information in cooperation with other international press organizations

name: International Union for Moral and Social Action (IUMS)
aims: Coordinate efforts undertaken in different countries to ensure the respect of human dignity and oppose violations thereof
activities: Draft international convention has been submitted to government authorities

name: International Association of Judges
aims: Defend the independence of the judiciary, as an essential condition of the judicial function, and guarantee the rights and freedom of man, protect the constitutional and moral position of the judiciary; promote the exchange of cultural relations; organize and intensify cordial relations between judges of different countries
activities: Congresses and meetings for the study of the judicial system and the unification of law generally; assistance in the arrangements of exchange visits

name: International Union of Young Christian Democrats (IUYCD)
aims: Contribute to the establishment throughout the world of a social, economic and political democracy of Christian democratic inspiration; spread the Christian democrat ideal and prepare the younger generation of Christian democrats for political, economic, and social responsibilities; coordinate the activities of member organizations to attain these aims
activities: World Congresses; regional congresses; seminars and round tables

name: Law Association for Asia and the Western Pacific (LAWASIA)
aims: Promote the administration of justice, the protection of human rights and the maintenance of the rule of law; advance legal education; diffuse knowledge of the laws of member countries; promote development of the law, and uniformity where appropriate; further international understanding and goodwill; foster relations and intercourse between lawyers and uphold and advance the status of the legal profession in the region
activities: Standing Committees (10): Legal aid; commercial arbitration; human rights; environmental law; intellectual property; energy law; law and drugs; industrial conciliation and arbitration; banking and finance; enforcement of foreign judgments. Interest groups (in the area of family law, commercial law, legal practice abound). Judicial section, set up in 1973. LAWASIA Research institute, formed in 1979, enables the Association to finance its Work programme. The Association holds Conferences and organizes specialist seminars.

name: International Organization for the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination
aims: Achieve the UN International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination; pay special attention to ideologies which are determined by UN General Assembly and other UN agencies as being forms of racism and racial discrimination
activities: Convenes conferences and seminars; grants Fellowship Awards to postgraduate students; 'international award for the furtherance of human understanding' and to the best book in English, French, Arabic, Spanish/Portuguese published on questions of racism and racial discrimination. Disseminates information produced by non-governmental organizations and UN bodies

name: All Asia Bar Association
aims: Ensure that the practicing lawyers of Asia play a useful and significant role in the life of the community and in the protection of the dignity and rights of people; enable and equip the legal profession in Asian to play a dynamic role in the development of the economics of the region; promote the law of human rights, and initiate and promote the setting up of regional bodies to protect, advance and enforce those rights; safeguard the independence of the judiciary and maintain high standards in the administration of justice' ensure every person at all times access to a lawyer of his choice and the right to legal representation, and if he is unable to retain one at his expense, to a competent lawyer assigned to him at the expense of the State

name: Regional Council on Human Rights in Asia
aims: Adopt and disseminate a Regional Declaration of Human Rights that reflects the culture, values, and aspirations of the people of the region and seek the support of the people of the region for that declaration' promote respect for individual and collective civil, practical, social, economic and cultural human rights; receive petitions and complaints and assist in redressing violations of these rights; encourage the governments of the region to ratify or concur in the International Conventions on Human Rights; undertake study and research

name: Inter-African Union of Lawyers
aims: Defend the integrity and the basic principles of the legal profession; safeguard the independence and freedom of the defence; work towards the establishment and strengthening of relations among African lawyers; foster a spirit of solidarity among them; defend and promote public and private freedoms, human rights and the rights of peoples; work for the establishment of an international legal order based on justice among nations; set up an efficient legal defense system; support and encourage the preservation of the rule of law and the independence of the judiciary; participate in efforts to improve legal education in universities.
activities: Makes representations to countries where legal rights have been threatened; organizes specialized meetings and symposia

name: Asian-Pacific Parliamentarians' Union  (APPU)
aims: Achieve and preserve full freedom and genuine democracy by: exerting efforts to strengthen mutual understanding and unity of the nations in Asia (including Pacific countries), promoting economic cooperation and exchanges of culture and technology, discussing all matters affecting peace and security in Asia, respecting the principles of sovereignty and territorial integrity and of non-interference in the internal affairs of another country
activities: Asian Development Center; Asian Cultural Center. Standing Committees: Political, Economic, Cultural, Transport, Telecommunications, Ad Hoc Committees

name: Christian Democratic Organization of America
aims: Serve as a link between Christian Democratic parties in Latin American countries by promoting the exchange of publications and ideas; organize research concerning common problems; contact similar parties in other regions of the world.

name: Christian Democratic Organization of Central Europe (CDUCE)
aims: Promote Christian principles in political, social, economic and international life; prepare programme of political, economic and social organization of the Central European region, based on federative principles and its integration in a United Europe. Youth Section prepares the younger generation for their role in future development of Central Europe.
activities: Promotion of policy towards freedom and democracy in the oppressed Central European area. Action to develop and spread Christian Democratic Movement in the world.

name: Christian Democratic Youth of America
aims: Works for the establishment in Latin America of a social, economic, and political democracy of Christian Democratic inspiration

name: Latin American Federation of Associations for Relatives of Disappeared-Detainees
aims: Secure the immediate release, alive, of all people who have forcibly disappeared in Latin America; immediate abolition of the practice of enforced or involuntary disappearances; demand clarification on the location of those children who were kidnapped and those who were born in clandestine jails, and their immediate reunification with legitimate families; organization of the relatives in local national committees; social and medical assistance to the families and victims when released; adoption by the United Nations of an international convention against enforced disappearances

name: European Christian Democratic Union
aims: Establish regular contacts between political parties and individuals in all countries who are inspired by the principle of Christian democracy, with a view to studying, in the light of those principles, national and international problems and seek to realize international harmony in practical achievement within the framework of democracy and social and political peace
activities: Study sessions. Congresses.

name: European Union of Young Christian Democrats (EUYCD)
aims: Contribute to the establishment in Europe of a social, economic, and political democracy of Christian democratic inspiration

name: Inter-American Association for Democracy and Freedom (IADF)
aims: Promote democracy in the Americas; defend human rights and protect and investigate violations of civil and political liberties; oppose dictatorship of both left and right in the Americas and in all ways further juridicial stability for social, economic, and political democracy
activities: Conduct conferences, classes for discussions of Inter-American problems. Maintains reference library. Investigates problems of human rights as they occur and acts to protest where necessary; supplies legal assistance

name: Inter-American Association of Broadcasters (IAAB)
aims: Defend broadcasting, whether radio or television, as a free means of expression of thought; work for freedom of social communication media and the effective enforcement of the democratic system of government; promote cooperation of broadcasters in activities of public interest and social services and the effective representation of broadcasting interests in official or private national and international organizations; sponsor continental and regional conferences of a technical, legal, or educational nature
activities: Standing committees: ethical; legal; expression and programmation; technical and frequencies; publicity and promotion; conciliation; arbitration and freedom of information problems. Campaign to extend to broadcasting the privileges granted to the press. System for exchange of programmes; information supplied on legal situation

name: Inter-American Bar Association (IABA)
aims: Establish and maintain relations between associations and organizations of lawyers, national and local, in the Americas; provide a forum for exchange of views; advance the science of jurisprudence in all its phases and particularly the study of comparative law; promote uniformity of laws; further diffusion of knowledge of laws of the various countries of the Americas; promote the rule of law and the administration of justice through the establishment and maintenance of independent judicial systems in all countries of the Americas; ensure preservation and defense of human rights and liberties and guarantee to the peoples of the hemisphere the free exercise of their civil and political rights under the democratic principles; uphold the honor of the profession of the law; encourage cordial intercourse and fellowship among lawyers of the Western Hemisphere
activities: Permanent committees, each dealing with a specific subject and reporting its work to the Conference. (12): public and private international law; constitutional law; administration law (includes: labor law, municipal law; food and drug law); civil law, procedure and litigation; commercial law and procedure; (VI) criminal law and procedure; (VII) military law; (VIII) development and integration; (IX) legal educational and legal profession; fiscal law; natural resources and environmental protection; human rights. Inter-American Academy of International and Comparative Law, founded in 1941, Havana, is a permanent adjunct of the Association (Head offices: Havana 1941-1962; Lima 1963-1973; from 1973 and current site: Rio de Janeiro). In Apr 1957, Inter-American Bar Foundation was incorporated under the laws of Pennsylvania (USA) as a companion organization of IABA. Inter-American Copyright Institute (ICI), set up in 1973, Rio de Janeiro, pursuant to a resolution adopted at the XVIII Conference of IABO.

name: Inter-American Press Association (IAPA)
aims: Protect freedom of the press in the Americas; foster general and specific interests of press; promote and maintain the dignity, rights, and responsibilities of the profession of journalism; encourage uniform standards of professional and business conduct; promote greater interchange among peoples of America in support of basic principles of a free society and individual liberty
activities: Fosters and protects press freedom by publishing facts of any action or attempt to restrict that freedom in the Western Hemisphere. Permanent Agencies: Inter-American Press Association Scholarship Fund; Seminar at IAPA Technical Center. Chamorro and Tom Wallace Awards. Committees on Freedom of the press, Legal, Membership, Applications Review, Awards Committee

name: International Association for the Defense of Religious Liberty
aims: Encourage all those who are attached to the ideal of liberty, without any distinction of race, sex, language or religion, to participate in the crusade against all forms of intolerance and fanaticism; serve throughout the world the liberty of faith
activities: World-Congress on Religious Liberty, jointly with International-Religions Liberty Association (IRLA)

name: International Federation of Resistance Movements
aims: Unite resisters as in wartime resistance movements to secure the independence of their country, liberty, and world peace; cherish the memory of all who fell for their country and liberty; defend the spirit and values of the Resistance; make known its historical role and transmit its teaching to new generations; contribute to the defense of the material and moral interests of those having due rights and causes; create and develop social services in their aid; promote aims set out in the UN Charter and strengthen links of fraternity and solidarity between resisters in all countries; oppose racial, political, philosophical or religious discrimination, neofascism, imprescriptibility of war crimes and crimes against humanity; work for disarmament and detente
activities: Documentation center. Commissions on cultural, social, medical matters and on reparations. Permanent commission on fascism. Research services. Pilgrimages to former concentration camps. Congresses; Medical Congresses; specialized meetings.

name: Free International Federation of Deportees and Resistance Internees
aims: Commemorate victims of oppression and their struggle for freedom; promote on a national and international levels the respect for and protection of democratic freedoms; strengthen bonds between members of associated organizations; ensure moral and material aid required by members; promote and support laws and regulations sympathetic to purposes of the organization

name: International Association Against Torture
aims: Defend the dignity of the human being and end the practice of torture.
activities: Organizes campaigns to denounce torture and those who practice it, to investigate its causes, and to foster solidarity for victims. Conferences; seminars; exhibitions; letter writing; petitions; press releases. Focuses on Latin America.

name: International Union of Resistance and Deportee Movements
aims: Bring together at the international level - all political or governmental intervention being excluded - associations of resisters, deportees, and victims of Nazism in order to defend their rights and claims, perpetuate the memory of their struggles in the service of freedom, oppose any resurgence of Nazism and anti-Semitism and any attacks on the rights and dignity of the human person and promote a policy of genuine peace that respects freedom and democracy
activities: Studies on: disarmament and peace; defense of liberty; German reparations; history of the Resistance; rights of resistance workers and victims of Nazism; pathology of deportation, internment and resistance. On the initiative of UIRD were formed: International Concentration Camp Committee, 30 Jan 1963, Frankfurt-Main

name: Union of Resistance Veterans for a United Europe
aims: Help constitute a united Europe open to all democratic countries and which must rest on a moral basis to which it is the vocation of the resistance to furnish essential support; campaign in Europe against any rebirth of Nazism, anti-Semitism and all restrictions to liberty and personal human rights.
activities: Action against: Nazism, fascism, anti-Semitism. Information Centre. Various operations in favor of a united Europe and rapprochement between France and Germany. Setting up groups of sons and daughters of resistors in order to secure support among youth for a united Europe and the ideals of freedom and respect for human rights.

name: Arab Lawyers' Union
aims: Act in the interests of the Arab Nation to achieve its national objectives; facilitate contacts between Arab lawyers; safeguard and develop legislative and judiciary language; assure the freedom of lawyers in their work and the independence of magistrates; allow all Arab lawyers to take cases in any Arab country; harmonize the conditions of the legal profession; establish and harmonize links with international legal organizations; restore the study of Muslim Law as a basis for law; promote and protect human rights
activities: Commissions (10): Arab affairs; Palestine; Unification of law in Arab countries; defense of civil liberties and rule of law in Arab countries; harmonization of legal terminology; rules on the legal profession; socialization; support of the Palestine Liberation Movement; Defense of Palestinian resistance workers. Engaged in founding an Arab Organization for Human Rights. Decolonization action against racism, racial discrimination and apartheid

name: European Democrat Students (EDS)
aims: Promote cooperation between non-socialist students to work for a united and democratic Europe; strengthen the ideas of democracy, pluralism and liberty and help create a European Democratic Party of all European non-socialists
activities: Seminars on European topics; training seminars; higher education research; coordination of important campaigns; publications; conferences and meetings (currently 8 a year)

name: Standing Conference of Latin American Political Parties
aims: Analyze events in Latin America and the Caribbean; coordinate efforts for peace and democracy
activities: Organizes seminars, congresses, symposia and colloquia

name: Union of African Parliaments (UAP)
aims: Contribute to strengthening the role and prestige of the institution of Parliament by taking inspiration from fundamental African values; encourage liberty, justice, and representative democracy in Africa
activities: Encourages contacts between African Members of Parliament amongst themselves and with those of the rest of the world; works for the progressive establishment of a genuine African juridicial community and contributes to the fulfillment of the OAU

name: Commonwealth Lawyers' Association (CLA)
aims: Maintain and promote the rule of law throughout the Commonwealth by ensuring that the people of the Commonwealth are served by an independent and efficient legal profession
activities: Advises and assists in the organization of the Commonwealth Law Conference and on follow-up action. Administers grants and assists in the formation of regional groups of Commonwealth lawyers

name: International Young Democratic Union (IYDU)
aims: Further the ideals of human dignity, liberty and social justice; defend these ideals and the cultural heritage of the Western democracies

name: Federation of Latin American Journalists
aims: Defend the freedom of the press and of access to information; improve working conditions; contribute to friendship among the peoples of Latin America and the Caribbean; show solidarity with journalists who are persecuted

name: Confederation of ASEAN Journalists (CAJ)
aims: Cooperate fully in advancing journalism; promote a healthy, free and responsible press in ASEAN countries

name: International Mauthausen Committee
aims: Safeguard the interests of former prisoners of the Mauthausen concentration camp and their families; oppose fascism and Nazism in all forms
activities: Collaborates with International Committees of other Nazi concentration camps

name: International Sachsenhausen Committee
aims: Commemorate the victims of the concentration camp at Sachsenhausen; promote peace and friendship between peoples so as to avoid all return to fascism

name: Hansard Society for Parliamentary Government
aims: Promote parliament and political awareness
activities: Organizes conferences for young people in the UK and international conferences; promotes research on controversial aspects of modern democratic government and unbiased political education in schools and institutes of further education

name: World Anti-Communist League (WACL)
aims: Fight, and strive to remove, all forms of totalitarianism, including communism, whenever they may be found; uphold human rights, especially liberty, freedom of religious belief, social justice and the self-determination of all peoples.
activities: Regional bodies (5): Organization for African freedom (OAF) assaulted campaigns against communism and aggression in Africa and organizes its own programs; Asian peoples' anti-Communist league (APACL), from which WACL derives; European counsel for world freedom (EC WF); North American regional WACL organization (NARWACL); Latin American anti-communist confederation (CAL).

name: Amnesty International (AI)
aims: Secure the immediate and unconditional release of all prisoners of conscience (men and women detained anywhere for their beliefs, colour, sex, ethnic origin, language or religion, provided they have not used or advocated violence); ensure fair and prompt trials for all political prisoners; abolish torture and execution or other cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment of all prisoners without reservation.
activities: Conducts impartial research and organizes worldwide action by local members on behalf of prisoners held in countries other than their own. Local groups appeal for release of prisoners of conscience, join campaigns highlighting political imprisonment and detention without charge or trial and participate in urgent action networks to bring immediate pressure in cases where torture, 'disappearance' or execution are feared. Observers are sent to observe trials and missions, visit countries to interview prisoners and hold talks with government officials. Organizes 'Amnesty International Week' each Oct; publicizes three 'Prisoners of the Month' each month to be the focus of postal campaigns for their release. Conference for the Abolition of Torture, 1973; Conference for the Abolition of the Death Penalty, 1977; International Conference on Extrajudicial Executions 1982. Amnesty International received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1977 for its contribution to 'securing the journal for freedom, for justice, and thereby also for peace in the world'. In 1978, on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, AI was awarded the United Nations Human Rights Prize for 'outstanding achievements in the field of human rights'.

name: Association for the Promotion of the International Circulation of the Press (DISTRIPRESS)
aims: Assist in the promotion of the freedom of the press throughout the world; support and aid all national and international action promoting the free flow of ideas by word and image and intervention against all measures which hinder or aim to prevent such a free flow; further the interests of the press distribution trade
activities: Annual Congresses. Special regional Conventions (every 3 years). Working Committees investigate matters of common interest. Working Committees (6): Membership; Marketing; New Technologies Development; Tax; Transport; Europe 1992. Organizes seminars. Intervenes directly or through national or international authorities when free international circulation of the press is held up or hindered.

name: International Alliance of Women (IAW)
aims: Secure all such reforms as are necessary to establish a real equality of liberties, status, and opportunities between men and women in all spheres of life; urge women to accept their responsibilities and use their rights and influence in public life to ensure that the status of every individual, without distinction of sex, race, or creed, shall be based on respect for human personality, the only guarantee for individual freedom; take part in constructive work for good understanding between nations.
activities: Cooperates with other NGOs and with the United Nations specialized agencies on: peace; nationality of married women; equal pay and discrimination in employment; discrimination in education; slavery and suppression of traffic in persons; elimination of discrimination against women; better family living; equal access to technology; violence against women in the family. Congresses; regional seminars with follow-up workshops and projects.

name: International Association of Democratic Lawyers (IADL)
aims: Facilitate contact and exchange among lawyers in order to develop a spirit of mutual understanding and fraternity; encourage study of legal science and international law and support democratic principles favourable to maintenance of peace and cooperation between nations; promote independence of all peoples, and oppose any restriction thereof, whether by legislation or practice.
activities: Research on legal problems; study and practice of the principles of democracy making for the maintenance of peace and cooperation between nations; defence and development of democratic rights and liberties in legislation and in the practice of law. Organizes international commission of enquiry and conferences on specific topics such as: the new economic order; racism and apartheid; human rights; decolonization and self-determination.

name: International Bar Association (IBA)
aims: Establish and maintain permanent relations and exchanges between bar associations and law societies and their members throughout the world; discuss problems of professional organization and status; advance the science of jurisprudence in all its phases; by common study of practical legal problems, promote uniformity and definition in appropriate fields of law; promote the administration of justice under law among peoples of the world; in execution of these objects promote in their legal aspects the principles and aims of the United Nations and cooperate with, and promote coordination among, international juridical organizations having similar purposes.
