activities: Extensive work in all aspects of law of interest to the international practising lawyers. 'Section on Business Law' (26 Committees) formed 1970.  'Section on General Practice' (22 Committees) formed 1974. 'Section on Energy and Natural Resources' (6 Committees) formed 1983. Standing Committees: Arab Region Credentials; Confidentiality; Finance; General Professional Programme; Human Rights; International Liaison with Legal Organisations; Membership; Nominations; Professional Ethics. Organizes national, regional and international conferences and seminars.

name: International Commission of Jurists (ICJ)
aims: Support and advance those principles of justice which constitute the basis of the Rule of Law; mobilize jurists of the world in support of the Rule of Law through public meetings, conferences and congresses, publications, and other appropriate types of activities; give aid and encouragement to those who are denied the rule of law.
activities: World equiry into definition of the Rule of Law; observers at trials; reports on situations in various countries all over the world; missions and visits to different countries; participation in UN seminars; international exchanges; activities for law students and young lawyers; promoting legal services in rural areas and independence of judges and lawyers in Asia, Africa, Latin America and the Caribbean. ICJ was awarded: the first European Human Rights Prize, 1980; Wateler Peace Prize, 1984; Erasmus Prize, 1989.

name: International Council of Women (ICW)
aims: Bring together in association women's voluntary organizations from all parts of the world for consultation and action to promote the welfare of mankind, the family and the individual; support all efforts to achieve peace through negotiation, arbitration, and conciliation; promote recognition and respect for human rights and work for the removal of discrimination, such as that based on birth, race, sex, language or religion; promote equal rights and responsibilities for both sexes in all spheres; encourage women to recognise their responsibilities in the community and train and stimulate them to participate in public life on local, national and international levels; deepen the understanding and increase the mutual sympathies of women through international contacts.
activities: Has supported from the beginning the ideas of international peace and arbitration, equal legal status for women (including suffrage and rights of citizenship, equal pay for equal work), family and child welfare. Work is directed to making known the principles of human rights and achieving their application in every aspect of life. International Standing Committees (13) on: Arts and Letters (with a Sub-Committee on Music); Child and Family; Economics; Education; Environment and Habitat; Health; Home Economics; International Relations and Peace; Laws and Status of Women; Mass Media; Migration; Social Welfare; Women and Employment. Studies questions which affect the status of women and their capacity to play an active part in all aspects of life. Regional seminars on human rights, literacy, education, the advancement of women and their participation in economic and social development. Member of planning committee on 1985 World Conference of the Decade of Women.

name: International League for Human Rights (ILHR)
aims: Promote application of those guarantees of civil, economic and social rights contained in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights adopted by the United Nations in 1948 and in the International Covenants on Human Rights.
activities: Works to implement international human rights standards and agreements, adopted by the United Nations and other intergovernmental bodies. Monitors and contributes to human rights work of the United Nations through: United Nations Commission on Human Rights; United Nations Sub-Commission on the Prevention of Discrimination and Protection of Minorities; United Nations Human Rights Committee; and United Nations Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination. Investigates human rights violations; intervenes directly with governments; makes representations before international bodies; conducts research and educational programmes; publishes special reports on human rights conditions; assists victims; sends observers to political trials; dispatches special investigative missions to inquire into specific violations and effect redress; supports and helps establish human rights groups in different countries; works to establish international human rights standards. Public and private meetings. Annual Human Rights Prize awarded.

name: International Organization of Journalists (IOJ)
aims: Maintain peace and consolidation of friendship among peoples through free, accurate and honest information of public opinion; struggle against spreading of war psychosis and war propaganda, against fascist propaganda of any sort, nationalist or racial hatred and against creation of international tension by means of falsehoods and calumnies; protect freedom of the press and of journalists against the influence of monopolies; defend the right of every journalist to write according to his conscience and conviction; protect the rights of colonial peoples and national minorities to publish newspapers in their native language; support journalists who have been persecuted for defence of peace, progress, justice and independence of their countries; protect journalists' rights; struggle for the improvement of journalists' material conditions; gather and disseminate all information concerning living conditions of journalists in all countries (collective agreements, salaries, professional training); struggle against falsehoods; calumnies and misinformation, against every form of journalistic activity in the service of interests which are contrary to those of the working masses.
activities:
Deals with the status, rights and responsibilities of journalists, their professional and social problems, protection of journalists while exercising their profession, issues of journalistic ethics and training of journalists. Special attention is devoted to peace, disarmament, human rights, racism, apartheid, decolonization and the establishment of the New International Information and Communication Order. Organizes conferences, seminars, symposia, exhibitions and training courses. Engages in publishing and information activity. A database to serve as a clearing house for mass communication is being set up.
IOJ maintains Training Centres, Solidarity Schools and Clubs:
Georgi Dimitrov International Institute of Journalism (#EE0196), Sofia; International House of Journalists, Balatonszeplak (#UG4406), Balatonszeplak, Hungary; International Rest Home for Journalists, Varna (#UG4407), Varna (Sofia); International Section of the Faculty of Journalism of the 'Stefan Gheorghiu Academy', Bucharest; Interpress Auto Club (#FF4409), Warsaw; IOJ Budapest International Institute for Training of Journalists (IITJ, #EE4008), Budapest; IOJ International Club of Agricultural Journalists (#FF8852) in Sofia; IOJ International Photosection (#EE4408), Berlin (German DR); Jose Marti International Institute of Journalism (#EE6153), Havana, 'IOJ Julius Fucik School of Solidarity in Czechosiovakia', Prague; 'School of Solidarity for the Training and Qualification of Journalists' Baghdad; Werner Lamberz International Institute of Journalism, College of Solidarity (#GG6653), Berlin (German DR). Instrumental in setting up International Court of Honour (#HH7263)

name: International PEN
aims: Promote and maintain friendship and intellectual cooperation between men of letters in all countries in the interests of literature, freedom of expression and international goodwill. PEN is not concerned with State or party politics and must not be used to served their interests. PEN Charter affirms that literature should remain common currency in spite of political or international upheavals and that works of art are the property of humanity at large; and stands for the unhampered transmission of thought within and between nations.
activities: Local meetings organized individually by Centres, many of which publish their own newsletters, books and pamphlets. 'PEN Writers in Prison Committee' works for the release of writers imprisoned for expressing their opinions; 'PEN Foundation Emergency Fund,' based in the Netherlands, gives practical aid to the dependents of imprisoned or harassed writers. Programme and Translations Committee encourages translation from and between 'small' languages.

name: International Press Institute (IPI)
aims: Further and safeguard the freedom of the press, by which is meant: free access to news, free expression of views, free publication of newspapers; achieve understanding among editors and so among peoples; promote free exchange of accurate and balanced news among nations; improve the practices of journalism.
activities: Press Centre gives information on press freedom and editorial research and arranges Conferences. Training Programmes and Seminars in Africa, North America, South America, Asia, Europe.

name: International Union of Socialist Youth (IUSY)
aims: Propagate amongst the younger generation the principles of free and democratic socialism; further the practical cooperation of democratic socialist youth and student organizations of all countries in order to strengthen international solidarity among all young socialists of the world in the fight against imperialism, fascism, racism and for the liberation of man from all exploitation and for the right of all peoples to free and independent social development.
activities: Summer camps; seminars; briefings on specific topics; delegations; missions; solidarity campaigns; solidarity brigades; speaking tours; study sessions. Organizes IUSY World Festivals (about every 2-3 years), gatherings of members of all affiliates during 7-10 days, with political and cultural programs. Instrumental in setting up European Political Youth Council (EPYC, #EE0949).

name: Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU)
aims: The Inter-Parliamentary Union is the international organization which brings together the representatives of the Parliaments of sovereign States. As the focal point for world-wide parliamentary dialogue, the inter-Parliamentary Union works for peace and cooperation among peoples and for the firm establishment of representative institutions. To that end, it: (a) Fosters contacts, coordination and the exchange experience among Parliaments and parliamentarians of all countries; (b) Considers questions of international interest and expresses its views on such issues with a view to bringing about action by parliaments and their members; (c) Contributes to better knowledge of the working of representative institutions and to the strengthening of their means of action.
activities:
Work is essentially carried out in two fields: action for peace and strengthening of parliamentary institutions. Examines objectively all international questions suitable for settlement by parliamentary action. Two major sessions annually. Committees set up by the Inter-Parliamentary Conference (5): Political Questions, International Security and Disarmament; Parliamentary, Juridical and Human Rights Questions; Economic, and Social Questions; Non Self-Governing Territories and Ethnic Questions; Education, Science, Culture and Environment. Meetings of participating women parliamentarians are held on the occasion of every statutory Conference. A permanent Ad Hoc Committee on Environment was established by IPU in 1989 to study environmental matters on a continuing basis. Programme of technical cooperation (services to Parliaments to train or to improve the qualifications of their staff and their working methods). In 1976, the Union adopted 'Procedure for the Examination and Treatment of Communications Concerning the Violation of the Human Rights of Parliamentarians' which is applicable to any member of Parliament from any country who is the victim of arbitrary measures during the exercise of his mandate, whether the Parliament was in session or in recess or has been dissolved by unconstitutional or emergency measures. 
Since Nov 1979, IPU has organized meetings of parliamentarians attending the UN General Assembly in New York. The development of representative institutions has been regularly and thoroughly debated by the Union and studied by International Centre for Parliamentary Documentation (#EE5303), which systematically gathers and distributes information on the organization and functioning of representative institutions, the development of the organization and working methods of assemblies and the status of their members. Association of Secretaries General of Parliaments (ASGP, #BB0160), which is a consultative organism of the Union, provides an opportunity for senior parliamentary officials to meet, to study parliamentary law and procedure and to propose measures for improving the working methods of different Parliaments and for securing cooperation between their services. International conferences, meetings, symposia and seminars.

name: World Federation of Democratic Youth (WFDY)
aims: Contribute to the education of youth in the spirit of freedom, democracy and solidarity; end imperialism, colonialism and neocolonialism; end racist and fascist regimes; ensure peace and security in the world by supporting all initiatives and efforts to this effect; promote active participation of youth in economic, social, cultural and political life by acting against all restriction and discrimination connected with age, sex, methods of education, domicile, property, social status, religion, political convictions, colour and race, so as to ensure in all countries and for all young people full freedom of speech, of the press, of religious belief, assembly and organization; support the struggle of youth for higher living standards, for better conditions of education, work and leisure and for development of cultural, educational and sports activities for all young people; further development of the younger generation in the spirit of peace and international friendship; support the principles of the United Nations Charter; support youth interests via international bodies and in affairs of an international character.
activities: Works to combat: racism; racial discrimination; apartheid; fascism. Seminars; voluntary work camps; international solidarity aid fund. Specialised regional commissions for Africa, Asia, Europe and North America, Middle East, Latin America and Caribbean, and thematical departments for Peace and Disarmament, Solidarity, Youth Rights, Global Problems, International Cooperation, Press and Information, as well as working groups on Sport and Culture, Problems of Young Women. Attached Bureaus (3): International Bureau for Youth Tourism and Exchanges (#CC1423); International Committee of Children's and Adolescents' Movements (ICCAM, #BC1606); International Voluntary Service for Solidarity and Friendship of Youth (#FF0870).

name: Commonwealth Parliamentary Association (CPA)
aims: Promote knowledge and education about the constitutional, legislative, economic, social and cultural systems within a parliamentary democratic framework, with particular reference to the countries of the Commonwealth of Nations and to other countries having close historical and parliamentary associations with it; foster understanding and cooperation among Members of Commonwealth Parliaments; promote the study of and respect for parliamentary institutions.
activities: Provides the sole means of regular consultation between members of Commonwealth Parliaments. Organizes: exchange of inter-Commonwealth visits and information; plenary and regional conferences; study tours; study group meetings and parliamentary seminars. Maintains 'Parliamentary Information and Reference Centre' at office of headquarters which assembles through direct acquisitions and exchanges with members, officials of parliaments and parliamentary librarians, a comprehensive collection of materials on parliaments and other legislatures; provides a full information service; publishes CPA publications.

name: Commonwealth Press Union (CPU)
aims: Promote the concept and ideals of the Commonwealth; foster mutual understanding and goodwill through regular conferences in constituent parts of it; advance the welfare of the newspaper and periodical press of the Commonwealth through action to safeguard press freedom, measures for training and educating journalists.
activities: Watch for and oppose all measures or proposals likely to affect press freedom; promote measures for educating and training journalists, in the Commonwealth. Annual meetings and conferences (biennially outside UK). Instrumental in setting up International Press Telecommunications Council (IPTC, #DC2626).

name: International Association for Religious Freedom (IARF)
aims: Promote development of the religious life in which freedom of conscience is an essential element; promote development of mutual understanding and cooperation among nations of all continents, and tolerance in all areas of culture and religion in the spirit of the kinship of all people; open, maintain and expand relationships with and between organizations and individuals striving for international understanding, cooperation and tolerance and a vital religious life, especially organized liberal movements in all religions throughout the world; promote development of culture and education; promote development aid.
activities: Constituent membership includes faith traditions of Buddhism, Christianity, Hinduism, Islam, Shintoism, Sikhism and traditional religions, subscribing to the principle of openness. Conducts interreligious dialogues; intercultural encounters; social service network (includes development projects and emergency relief program). Study groups on: religious education, social questions, problems of theology and church. Triennial Congress, Regional (Continental) Conferences, Commissions, Chapters. Library (over 8,000 volumes).

name: International Union of Lawyers
aims: Promote, in the interests of the litigant, basic principles of the lawyer's profession, with particular reference to independence and freedom; establish permanent relations and exchanges among bars, societies and national federations or associations of lawyers and support their action and work; defend ethical and material interests of members of the profession and jointly study questions related to professional status and organization; contribute to the establishment of an international legal order based on the principle of justice among nations through law for the sake of peace.
activities: Organizes congresses, symposia, seminars.

name: Socialist International Women (SIW)
aims: Strengthen relations between members; exchange experiences between members on ways and means of promoting, among the women of their respective countries, a knowledge and understanding of the aims and tasks of democratic socialism; seek to extend relations between SIW members and other socialist-oriented women's groups, not in membership, which desire cooperation; promote action programmes to overcome any discrimination in society, including any inequality between men and women, and work for human rights in general, development and peace.
activities: Exchange visits. Seminars. International Women's Day meetings. Projects for help to women in developing countries. Contributions to such topics as: new international economic order; development and disarmament; the future generation; socialism and feminism.

name: International Federation of Free Journalists (IFFJ)
aims: Oppose any totalitarian doctrines which misrepresent the principles of freedom of press and tasks and obligations of the press towards nations and towards humanity, and which violate the basic freedom of Man and Nations; defend freedom of press in all countries
activities: Compiles and updates registers of persecuted journalists in Central and Eastern Europe; participates in human rights conferences.

name: International Federation of Newspaper Publishers
aims: Defend and promote press freedom, and economic independence of newspapers as an essential condition for that freedom; contribute to development of newspaper publishing by fostering communications and contacts between newspaper executives; promote cooperation among newspaper publishers in member nations; promote and develop a free press and information activities in developing countries.

name: International Union for Moral and Social Action (IUMS)
aims: Coordinate efforts undertaken in different countries to ensure respect for human dignity and oppose violations thereof.
activities: Draft international convention submitted to government authorities.

name: International Association of Judges
aims: Defend the independence of the judiciary, as an essential condition of the judicial function, and guarantee the rights and freedom of man, protect the constitutional and moral position of the judiciary; promote the exchange of cultural relations; organize and intensify cordial relations between judges of different countries
activities: Congresses and meetings for the study of the judicial system and the unification of law generally; assistance in the arrangements of exchange visits.

name: International Union of Young Christian Democrats (IUYCD)
aims: Contribute to the establishment throughout the world of a social, economic and political democracy of Christian democratic inspiration; spread the Christian democrat ideal and prepare the younger generation of Christian democrats for political, economic, and social responsibilities; coordinate the activities of member organizations to attain these aims
activities: International, regional and national congresses, seminars and round tables. Focuses on issues related to human rights, social justice and pluralism in society.

name: Law Association for Asia and the Western Pacific (LAWASIA)
aims: Promote the administration of justice, the protection of human rights and the maintenance of the rule of law; advance legal education; diffuse knowledge of the laws of member countries; promote development of the law, and uniformity where appropriate; further international understanding and goodwill; foster relations and intercourse between lawyers and uphold and advance the status of the legal profession in the region
activities: Standing Committees (13): legal Aid; Commercial Arbitration; Human Rights; Environmental Law; Intellectual Property; Energy Law; Law and Drugs; Labour Law, Banking and Finance; Enforcement of Foreign Judgments; Communications Law; Consumer Protection Law; Taxation Law. Interest Groups in the area of commercial law. Judicial Section, set up in 1973. LAWASIA Research Institute, formed in 1979, enables the Association to finance its Work Programme. LAWASIA holds Conferences and organizes Specialist Seminars. Instrumental in setting up: Asian Coalition of Human Rights Organizations (ACHRO, #DD7373).

name: Commonwealth Magistrates' and Judges' Association (CMJA)
aims: Advance administration of the law by promoting the independence of the judiciary; promote education in law, administration of justice, treatment of offenders and prevention of crime within the Commonwealth; disseminate information and literature on matters concerning the legal process; effect closest possible links between members.
activities: Emphasizes magistracy (or primary judiciary) where over 90 percent of judicial matters are handled. Provides advice and resource center; organizes seminars, regional meetings, conferences, penal training, exchange visits.

name: International Organization for the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (EAFORD)
aims: Achieve the UN International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination; pay special attention to ideologies which are determined by UN General Assembly and other UN agencies as being forms of racism and racial discrimination
activities: Convenes conferences and seminars. Grants Fellowship Awards to postgraduate students. 'International award for the furtherance of human understanding' and to the best book in English, French, Arabic, Spanish/Portuguese published on questions of racism and racial discrimination. Disseminates information produced by non-governmental organizations and UN bodies

name: Society for Threatened Peoples
aims: Disseminate information to provide international hearing to plight of peoples, often ethnic or religious minorities, subjected to persecution or genocide.

name: Regional Council on Human Rights in Asia
aims: Adopt and disseminate a Regional Declaration of Human Rights that reflects the culture, values, and aspirations of the people of the region and seek the support of the people of the region for that Declaration; promote respect for individual and collective civil, political, social, economic and cultural human rights; receive petitions and complaints and assist in redressing violations of these rights; encourage governments of the region to ratify or concur in the International Conventions on Human Rights; undertake studies and research.
activities: In 1984, the Council decided to concentrate on two tasks: to spread and explain the Declaration of Basic Duties among peoples of the ASEAN region; to campaign for the release of political prisoners in the region.

name: Inter-African Union of Lawyers (IAUL)
aims: Defend integrity and basic principles of the legal profession; safeguard the independence and freedom of the defence; work towards the establishment and strengthening of relations among African lawyers; foster a spirit of solidarity among them; defend and promote public and private freedoms, human rights and the rights of peoples; work for the establishment of an international legal order based on justice among nations; set up an efficient legal defense system; support and encourage the preservation of the rule of law and the independence of the judiciary; participate in efforts to improve legal education in universities.
activities: Makes representations to countries where legal rights have been threatened; organizes specialized meetings and symposia.

name: Christian Democratic Organization of America
aims: Serve as a link between Christian democratic parties in Latin American countries by promoting the exchange of publications and ideas; organize research concerning common problems; contact similar parties in other regions of the world.

name: Christian Democratic Organization of Central Europe
aims: Promote Christian principles in political, social, economic and international life; prepare programme of political, economic and social organization of the Central European region, based on federative principles and its integration in a United Europe. Youth Section prepares the younger generation for their role in future development of Central Europe.
activities: Promotion of policy towards freedom and democracy in the oppressed Central European area. Action to develop and spread Christian Democratic Movement in the world.

name: Ibero-American Lawyers' Union
aims: Promote and ensure the following of dignity, independence and freedom in the legal profession as essential values for the realization of justice; protect the interests of lawyers and students of law, promote cooperation among members and the development of legal science.

name: Latin American Federation of Associations for Relatives of Disappeared Detainees
aims: Secure the immediate release, alive, of all people who have forcibly disappeared in Latin America; promote immediate abolition of the practice of enforced or involuntary disappearances; demand clarification on the location of those children who were kidnapped and those who were born in clandestine jails, and their immediate reunification with legitimate families; organize the relatives in local national committees; ensure social and medical assistance to the families and victims when released; promote the adoption by the United Nations of an international convention against enforced disappearances.

name: European Union of Christian Democrats (EUCD)
aims: Establish regular contacts between political parties and individuals in all countries who are inspired by the principle of Christian democracy, with a view to studying, in the light of those principles, national and international problems; compare experiences and programmes; seek to realize international harmony in practical achievements within the framework of democracy and social and political peace.
activities: Study sessions. Congresses. Instrumental in setting up: Association europeenne des elus locaux democrates chretiens (#DD8818); European Union of Christian Democratic Workers (EUCDW, #DD1966).

name: European Young Christian Democrats (EYCD)
aims: Unite political organizations and movements of young Christian democrats; contribute to the construction of a free, just and united European society, rejecting nationalism, totalitarianism and any privilege resulting from class, culture or race.
activities: Seminars on subjects such as: European integration; youth policy; Christian democracy; East-West relations; North-South relations; actual political problems. Statutory meetings. All events take place in different European countries with participation of international young political leaders. Instrumental in setting up European Political Youth Council (EPYC, #EE0949).

name: International Association of Broadcasting (IAB)
aims: Defend broadcasting, whether radio or television, as a free means of expression of thought; work for freedom of social communication media; promote cooperation of broadcasters in activities of public interest and social services and the effective representation of broadcasting interests in official or private national and international organizations; sponsor continental and regional conferences of a technical, legal, or educational nature
activities: Standing committees: legal; technical; on copyright; on freedom of expression.

name: Inter-American Bar Association (IABA)
aims: Establish and maintain relations between associations and organizations of lawyers, national and local, in the Americas; provide a forum for exchange of views; advance the science of jurisprudence in all its phases and particularly the study of comparative law; promote uniformity of laws; further the diffusion of knowledge of laws of the various countries of the Americas; promote the rule of law and the administration of justice through the establishment and maintenance of independent judicial systems in all countries of the Americas; ensure preservation and defence of human rights and liberties and guarantee to the peoples of the hemisphere the free exercise of their civil and political rights under the democratic principles; uphold the honor of the profession of the law; encourage cordial intercourse and fellowship among lawyers of the Western Hemisphere.

name: Inter-American Press Association (IAPA)
aims: Protect freedom of the press in the Americas, foster general and specific interests of press; promote and maintain the dignity, rights and responsibilities of the profession of journalism; encourage uniform standards of professional and business conduct; promote greater interchange among peoples of America in support of basic principles of a free society and individual liberty.
activities: Fosters and protects press freedom by publishing facts of any action or attempt to restrict that freedom in the Western Hemisphere. Permanent Agencies; Inter-American Press Association Scholarship Fund. Maintains Inter-American Press Association Institute - lnstituto de la Sociedad lnteramericana de Prensa - lnstituto da Sociedade lnteramericana de lmprensa which organizes seminars. Chamorro and Tom Wallace  Awards. Committees (5): Freedom of the Press; Legal; Membership; Applications Review; Awards.

name: International Association for the Defense of Religious Liberty
aims: Encourage all those who are attached to the ideal of liberty, without any distinction of race, sex, language or religion, to participate in the crusade against all forms of intolerance and fanaticism; serve throughout the world the liberty of faith.
activities: World Congress on Religious Liberty, jointly with International Religious Liberty Association.

name: Andean Commission of Jurists (ACJ)
aims: Promote, defend and publish the principles that constitute the rule of law; promote the protection of human rights in the Andean subregion.

name: International Federation of Resistance Movements
aims: Unite resisters in peacetime as they were united in wartime resistance movements to secure the independence of their countries, liberty and world peace, actively defend and maintain freedom and human dignity; cherish the memory of all who fell for their country and liberty; defend the spirit and values of the Resistance; make known its historical role and transmit its teaching to new generations; denounce the horrors of concentration camps and prisons and demand due punishment for crimes against humanity; defend the material and moral interests of those having due rights and causes; create and develop social services in their aid; promote aims set out in the UN Charter and strengthen links of fraternity and solidarity between resisters in all countries; oppose racial, political, philosophical or religious discrimination, neofascism, 'imprescriptibility' of war crimes and crimes against humanity; work for disarmament and detente.
activities: Documentation centre. Commissions on cultural, social, medical matters and on reparations. Permanent commission on fascism. Research services. Pilgrimages to former concentration camps. Congresses; medical symposia; specialized meetings; consultative meetings.

name: Free International Federation of Deportees and Resistance Internees
aims: Commemorate victims of oppression and their struggle for freedom; promote on a national and international levels the respect for and protection of democratic freedoms; strengthen bonds between members of associated organizations; ensure moral and material aid required by members; promote and support laws and regulations sympathetic to purposes of the organization.

name: International Association Against Torture
aims: Defend the dignity of the human being and end the practice of torture.
activities: Organizes campaigns to denounce torture and those who practice it, to investigate its causes, and to foster solidarity for victims. Conferences; seminars; exhibitions; letter writing; petitions; press releases. Focuses on Latin America.

name: International Union of Resistance and Deportee Movements
aims: Bring together at the international level - all political or governmental intervention being excluded - associations of resisters, deportees, and victims of Nazism in order to defend their rights and claims, perpetuate the memory of their struggles in the service of freedom, oppose any resurgence of Nazism and anti-Semitism and any attacks on the rights and dignity of the human person and promote a policy of genuine peace that respects freedom and democracy.
activities: Studies on: disarmament and peace; defense of liberty; German reparations; history of the Resistance; rights of resistance workers and victims of Nazism; pathology of deportation, internment and resistance. On the initiative of UIRD were formed: International Concentration Camp Committee (ICCC, #DD1646), 30 Jan 1963, Frankfurt-Main; and International Committee of Experts for the Campaign Against the Revival of Neo-Nazism and Antisemitism (#DD3353).

name: International Union of Socialist Democratic Teachers (IUSDT)
aims: Realize the idea of democratic socialism; unite all socialist educational organizations sharing a political responsibility and an affiliation to a section of the Socialist International; bring into association, at international level, all groups of teachers and professors affiliated to the Socialist International, or persons who, though not engaged in teaching, have an official educational responsibility; advocate optimum education of the individual and improvement in society's standard of education; coordinate efforts of member organizations to use teaching in all countries to promote social justice respect of human rights and international understanding; through an education drawing on discerning mental attitudes and international political awareness, endeavour to establish a socialist society in which every individual has at his or her disposal every method or aid for full development, whether children, young people or adults.
activities: Exchange of teachers and pupils.

name: Union of Resistance Veterans for a United Europe
aims: Help constitute a united Europe open to all democratic countries and which rests on a moral basis to which it is the vocation of the resistance to furnish essential support; campaign in Europe against any rebirth of Nazism, anti-Semitism and all restrictions to liberty and personal human rights.
activities: Action against: Nazism, fascism, anti-Semitism. Information Centre. Various operations in favor of a united Europe and rapprochement between France and Germany. Setting up groups of sons and daughters of resistors in order to secure support among youth for a united Europe and the ideals of freedom and respect for human rights. Instrumental in setting up Comite de coordination des mouvements miitants pour l'unite europeene and Centre international d'information sur les activites nazistes et fascistes, now defunct.

name: Arab Lawyers' Union
aims: Act in the interests of the Arab Nation to achieve its national objectives; facilitate contacts between Arab lawyers; safeguard and develop legislative and judiciary language; assure the freedom of lawyers in their work and the independence of magistrates; allow all Arab lawyers to take cases in any Arab country; harmonize the conditions of the legal profession; establish and harmonize links with international legal organizations; restore the study of Muslim Law as a basis for law; promote and protect human rights.
activities: Commissions (9): Arab Affairs; Palestine; Unification of Law in Arab Countries; Defence of Civil Liberties and Rule of Law in Arab Countries; Harmonization of Legal Terminology; Rules on the Legal Profession; Socialization; Support of the Palestine Liberation Movement; Defence of Palestinian Resistance Workers. Engaged in founding an Arab Organization tor Human Rights (AOHR, #DD9700). Decolonization action against racism, racial discrimination and apartheid.

name: European Democrat Students (EDS)
aims: Work for a united, free Europe and for the realization of human rights in East and West; give students the possibility to meet on an international level in order to promote understanding; discuss educational matters and present solutions reached to relevant political bodies; work for mutual recognition of diplomas in Europe; serve as a network for discussion and exchange of ideas among member organizations; strengthen the ideas of democracy, pluralism and liberty and help create a European Democrat Party of all European non-socialists.
activities: Organizes seminars and conferences to provide practical training in international work for representatives of member organizations. Annual Summer University, hosted by member organizations in turn; organizes human rights campaigns and campaigns for European Parliament.

name: Standing Conference of Latin American Political Parties
aims: Coordinate efforts for peace and democracy in Latin America and the Caribbean.
activities: Organizes seminars, congresses, symposia and colloquia.

name: Central American Association of Families of Missing Detainees
aims: Work for the re-appearance, alive, of missing detainees, particularly those detained in violation of human rights in El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras; support all international action denouncing forced disappearance of individuals as practised by governments; encourage governments and intergovernmental organizations to consider such forcible disappearance as a crime against humanity; assist in creating commissions of enquiry which carry out searches for these missing persons with the aid of their families; demand that governments punish those responsible for instigating forced disappearances; assist medical, psychiatric, juridicial and economic agencies to alleviate the sufferings of families whose parents have disappeared.
activities: Denunciation of cases of detained-disappeared persons in Central America, asking solidarity, especially by sending letters to responsible governments, claiming their release or consigning to a legal jury. Petitions for the release of missing persons, supposedly kept within clandestine jails, tortured and under poor conditions. Gives moral support to local committees in their struggle against forced disappearance. Research, especially in order to determine the influence of forced disappearances on society as a whole.

name: Union of African Parliaments (UAP)
aims: Contribute to strengthening the role and prestige of the institution of Parliament by taking inspiration from fundamental African values; contribute to the reign of liberty and justice, and the effective functioning of representative democracy in Africa.
activities: Encourages contacts between African members of Parliaments amongst themselves and with those of the rest of the world; works for the progressive establishment of a genuine African juridicial community and contributes to the fulfillment of the objectives of OAU.

name: Commonwealth Lawyers' Association (CLA)
aims: Maintain and promote the rule of law throughout the Commonwealth by ensuring that the people of the Commonwealth are served by an independent and efficient legal profession
activities: Advises and assists in the organization of the Commonwealth Law Conference and on follow-up action. Administers grants and assists in the formation of regional groups of Commonwealth lawyers

name: Union of African Journalists (UAJ)
aims: Work for the benefit of the Continent and African journalists in a spirit of cooperation and African unity; promote cooperation among journalists; coordinate professional activities; defend the right to freedom of expression in the spirit of realistic understanding, especially in the struggle against apartheid.
activities: Training programmes; seminars; conferences. Library.

name: Federation of Latin American Journalists
aims: Defend the freedom of the press and of access to information; improve working conditions; contribute to friendship among the peoples of Latin America and the Caribbean; show solidarity with journalists who are persecuted.

name: International Democrat Union (IDU)
aims: Promote a free, open and democratic society, the socially-orientated market economy, the rule of law, social justice, the natural role of the family, and a society where conditions are created to enable everyone to reach their full potential and carry out their responsibilities to their fellow men and women; foster the common philosophy of member parties; establish permanent relations at a bilateral and multilateral level and encourage mutual support; provide a forum for the exchange of views and information on matters of interest to all or a considerable number of member parties.
activities: Undertakes fact-finding missions, for example to: Central America; the Middle East Standing Committee on Foreign Affairs develops internal reports on specific international questions, providing the basis for brief public communiques and more detailed recommendations to the leadership of member parties. Occasional Ad Hoc Groups established to monitor important national elections or to prepare for future work, namely Informal Group on Africa.

name: Latin American Federation of Press Workers
aims: Promote the organization of workers in the press sector in all countries of Latin America, providing material and technical assistance as necessary, and organizing necessary services at the Latin American level, cooperating in national-level provision of such services; promote unity at the national level among all organizations in the sector to render the activities more effective; study, promote, defend and represent the interests of press workers with government bodies in Latin America and worldwide, in line with workers' rights and interests; defend and promote the right for free and democratic organization of all press workers; monitor respect for freedom of information and expression.
activities: Organizes meetings, seminars, training workshops, correspondence courses.

name: Arab Organization for Human Rights (AOHR)
aims: Call for respect of human rights and fundamental freedoms of all citizens and individuals in the Arab countries in accordance with the provisions of international human rights instruments; defend any individual or group whose human rights are subjected to violations which are contrary to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights; endeavour, regardless of political considerations, to obtain release of detained or imprisoned persons, and seek relief and assistance for persons whose freedom is restricted in any way or who are subject to coercion of any kind because of their beliefs and political convictions, or for reasons of race, sex, colour or language; protest in cases where a fair trial is not guaranteed; provide legal assistance where necessary and possible; call for improvements in conditions of prisoners of conscience; work for amnesty of persons sentenced for political reasons.
activities: Carries out field missions in an effort to release political prisoners, in some cases as an observer and in other as a member of the defence panel. Receives complaints from individuals, groups and organizations and contacts the concerned authorities. In addition to the offering of legal assistance in several cases, the Organization provides financial assistance to families of victims. In coordination with Arab Lawyers' Union launched a campaign for 'Freedom for Prisoners of Conscience in the Arab World'. Conferences and seminars. Instrumental in setting up Arab Institute for Human Rights, Tunisia (#JJ7400).

name: Confederation of ASEAN Journalists (CAJ)
aims: Cooperate fully in advancing journalism; promote a healthy, free and responsible press in ASEAN countries.

name: South American Commission for Peace, Regional Security and Democracy
aims: Contribute to the conversion of South America into a peace region; consolidate the democratic process in the region; promote the development of democratic concepts of regional security; stimulate regional political cooperation in peace and security matters.
activities: Seminars; meetings; working groups.

name: International Mauthausen Committee
aims: Safeguard the interests of former prisoners of the Mauthausen concentration camp and their families; oppose fascism and Nazism in all forms.
activities: Collaborates with International Committees of other Nazi concentration camps.

name: International Secretariat of Jurists for Amnesty and Democracy in Paraguay
aims: Seek to defend and protect threatened persons in Paraguay; promote the establishment and consolidation of democracy in Paraguay.

name: Confederation of the Socialist Parties of the European Community (CSPEC)
aims: Serve as a liaison body between European socialist parties both within and outside the European community; promote exchanges between member parties and establish common policy guidelines in response to the main problems posed by the existence of the European community.
activities: Priorities: the growth of employment and the fight against unemployment; freedom, the rights of the citizen and individual self-fulfillment; abolition of all forms of discrimination; protection of environment; justice and social protection; peace and security. Secretariat responsible for organizing meetings and providing research/background material. Congresses (every 2 years).

name: International Sachsenhausen Committee
aims: Commemorate the victims of the concentration camp at Sachsenhausen; promote peace and friendship between peoples so as to avoid all return to fascism

name: Asian Regional Exchange for New Alternatives (ARENA)
aims: Improve the quality of life for the vast majority of the underprivileged; prevent the marginalisation of peoples and communities, and thus promoting justice and peace in the relationships between the state and the people and between nations in Asia; strengthen participatory democracy as against authoritarian centralization; establish a non-destructive relationship to nature and ecosystems and promote the evolution of a more holistic long-term understanding of nature and the use of natural resources; use the traditional knowledge systems in strengthening the role and contribution of such 'other' or 'alternative stocks of knowledge' in a non-dichotomous sense to that of the practice of 'modern' knowledge.
activities: Work organized around clusters on themes of concern. Current themes of concern: Alternative development paradigms and social research; Critical Asian thinking; Science, technology and technology hazards; Ecology, environment and sustainable agriculture; Ethnic, religious and linguistic problems; New information technologies and NGO information activity; Women's question; Social movements; Law, rights and participation. Activities of ARENA related to these areas of concern are carried through linking up with ongoing national activities and initiation of specific projects on a country, multi-country, and sub-regional basis. ARENA HK Centre acts as a documentation and information centre as well as a clearing house. The programmes of ARENA are also carried out with a special emphasis on sub-regional activity and interaction. For this purpose the regional coverage pf ARENA is sub-divided into 3 sub-regions - East Asia, South-East Asia and South Asia. Sub-regional activities, such as inquiries, training and workshops that specifically address the sub-regional realities are done on a sub-regional basis.

name: Christian Democrat International (CDI)
aims: Promote and coordinate international activity of Christian democratic parties, ensuring political solidarity; carry out doctrinal and political research of general interest for Christian democracy; disseminate Christian democratic ideas and promote knowledge of their achievements.
activities: Seminars on the ideological and political platform of CDI. Permanent Committees (4) on: Development; Economic Problems; Human Rights; Relations with the United Nations. Information and documentation service for members. Coordinates political and vocational training centres in most member countries. Instrumental in setting up International Foundation (#FF2034).

name: Anti-Bolshevik Bloc of Nations (ABN)
aims: Liberate nations subjugated by Soviet Russian imperialism and communism through coordinated national liberation uprisings on the territories of these nations and the re-establishment of independent, sovereign, and democratic states.
activities: International conferences and congresses; publications; press conferences; meetings with international political figures; aid to the subjugated nations.

name: World Organization Against Torture
aims: Struggle against torture, summary executions, disappearances, psychiatric internment for political reasons and all other cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment.

name: Hansard Society for Parliamentary Government
aims: Promote parliament and political awareness.
activities: Organizes conferences for young people in the United Kingdom and international conferences. Promotes research on controversial aspects of modern democratic government and unbiased political education in schools and institutes of further education. Monitors the televising of the House of Lords and the House of Commons (UK). Runs the Hansard Scholars Programme.

name: Nordic Christian Democratic Youth
aims: Increase, by a stronger and expanded cooperation between member organizations, Christian democratic influence, especially in Scandinavian politics.
activities: Acts as a forum for political discussions. Discuss his practical cooperating questions. Arrange his meetings and seminars. Participates in the yearly Nordic youth Council and the Nordic Council sessions.

name: Caribbean Human Rights Network
aims: Disseminate information to national, regional and international organizations; promote human rights at a regional level - this includes embarking on regional campaigns; assist in the coordination of regional human rights action programmes; facilitate the exchange of visits between persons or groups with a human rights interest; mount missions - fact-finding and elections observer missions.
activities: Promotion of human rights in the Caribbean by means of: (a) coordination of regional campaigns on human rights issues; (b) urging ratification of Conventions and strengthening inter-governmental machinery; (c) creating an informed regional public opinion through education awareness; (d) strengthening the capacity of local human rights bodies for effective action. As far as the methods of work are concerned, the Network: (a) Routinely cooperates with regional and international human rights bodies in the exchange of information, joint actions and facilitating missions and visits in the region; (b) Takes initiatives at the request of affiliates; (c) Attempts to interest the Caribbean media in human rights issues. Major areas of concern: police brutality; elections and democracy; freedom of expression. Current new programmes: (i) Death Penalty; (ii) Democracy within the Region; (iii) Prison  Conditions Survey; (iv) Communications; (v) Legal Aid.

name: World Union of Free Romanians (WUFR)
aims: Fight for the following objectives: national sovereignty and independence; territorial integrity within the natural borders of the Romanian people; democracy; equal rights for all Romanian citizens, regardless of ethnic, religious or social belonging; the defense of the rights of Romanians living abroad; the setting-up of associations of nations, so as to prevent the emergence of hegemony; preservation of Armenian culture and traditions; accumulation of knowledge about the intimate structure of communism in order to combat it effectively.

name: European Parliament Liberal, Democratic and Reformist Group
aims: Defend and promote liberal doctrine in the European Parliament.

name: Alliance of Russian Solidarists
aims: Promote democratic ideas in Russia (USSR)

name: Socialist International (SI)
aims: Promote social justice by strengthening relations between member parties and organizations; coordinate their political programmes through consensual methods; establish contacts with those progressive forces around the world which work for the application of the principles of democratic socialism.
activities: Current major activities centre on: promotion of arms control and disarmament; promotion of concrete action to further North-South dialogue; study of problems of economic development, including questions of energy, employment and environment, promotion of human rights, contributing to peaceful solutions to regional conflicts; support for national liberation struggle in South Africa; development of a democratic socialist strategy for Latin America and the Caribbean; search for peace in the Middle East; enlarging Socialist lnternational's presence in the Asia Pacific region. Committees and Study Groups (13): Asia-Pacific Socialist Organization (APSO, #ED5419); Chile Committee; Committee on Economic Policy (SICEP); Committee on the Environment (previously Committee on Acid Rain, SICAR); Committee on Human Rights; Socialist International Committee for Latin America and the Caribbean (SICLAC, #EE3030); Socialist International Disarmament Advisory Council (SIDAC, #EE373O); Finance and Administration Committee (SIFAC); Middle East Committee (SIMEC); New Declaration of Principles Committee (SINDEC); Southern Africa Committee (SISAC); Study Group on Africa (SISGA); Study Group on the Mediterranean. Socialist International party leaders' conferences are held regularly in confidential and informal sessions.

name: World Anti-Communist League (WACL)
aims: Fight, and strive to remove, all forms of totalitarianism, including communism, whenever they may be found; uphold human rights, especially liberty, freedom of religious belief, social justice and the self-determination of all peoples.

name: Amnesty International
aims: Campaign to free all prisoners of conscience - people detained anywhere for their beliefs or because of their ethnic origin, sex, colour, or language - who have not used or advocated violence; ensure fair and prompt trials for political prisoners; abolish the death penalty, torture and other cruel treatments of prisoners; end extrajudicial executions and disappearances; oppose abuses by opposition groups, such as hostage taking, torture, killing of prisoners and other arbitrary killings.
activities: Conducts impartial research and organizes worldwide action by local members on behalf of prisoners held in countries other than their own. Local groups appeal for release of prisoners of conscience, join campaigns highlighting political imprisonment and detention without charge or trial and participate in urgent action networks to bring immediate pressure in cases where torture, 'disappearance' or execution are feared. Medical groups involved in campaigning and awareness-raising within the medical profession. Observers are sent to observe trials and delegates visit countries to interview prisoners and hold talks with government officials. Organizes 'Amnesty International Week' each October; publicizes three 'Worldwide Appeals' cases each month to be the focus of postal campaigns for the release of prisoners and/or investigation of their case. Conference for the Abolition of Torture, 1973; Conference for the Abolition of the Death Penalty, 1977; International Conference on Extrajudicial Executions 1982; International Conference on Disappearances and Political Killings, 1992. Amnesty International received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1977 for its contribution to 'securing the journal for freedom, for justice, and thereby also for peace in the world'. In 1978, on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, AI was awarded the United Nations Human Rights Prize for 'outstanding achievements in the field of human rights'.

name: Association for the Promotion of the International Circulation of the Press (DISTRIPRESS)
aims: Assist in the promotion of the freedom of the press throughout the world; support and aid all national and international action promoting the free flow of ideas by word and image and intervention against all measures which hinder or aim to prevent such a free flow; further the interests of the press distribution trade
activities: Annual Congresses. Special regional Conventions (every 3 years). Working Committees investigate matters of common interest. Working Committees (6): Membership; Marketing; New Technology; Tax; Transport; Europe. Organizes seminars. Intervenes directly or through national or international authorities when free international circulation of the press is held up or hindered.

name: International Alliance of Women (IAW)
aims: Secure all such reforms as are necessary to establish a real equality of liberties, status, and opportunities between men and women in all spheres of life; urge women to accept their responsibilities and use their rights and influence in public life to ensure that the status of every individual, without distinction of sex, race, or creed, shall be based on respect for the person, indispensable for obtaining individual freedom and peace; take part in constructive work for good understanding between nations.
activities: Cooperates with other NGOs and with the United Nations specialized agencies on: peace; nationality of married women; equal pay and discrimination in employment; discrimination in education; slavery and suppression of traffic in person; elimination of discrimination against women; better family living; equal access to technology; violence against women in the family. Congresses; regional seminars with follow-up workshops and projects.

name: International Association of Democratic Lawyers (IADL)
aims: Facilitate contact and exchange among lawyers in order to develop a spirit of mutual understanding and fraternity; encourage study of legal science and international law and support democratic principles favourable to maintenance of peace and cooperation between nations; promote independence of all peoples, and oppose any restriction thereof, whether by legislation or practice.
activities: Research on legal problems; study and practice of the principles of democracy making for the maintenance of peace and cooperation between nations; defence and development of democratic rights and liberties in legislation and in the practice of law. Organizes international commission of enquiry and conferences on specific topics such as: the new economic order; racism and apartheid; human rights; decolonization and self-determination.

name: International Bar Association (IBA)
aims: Establish and maintain permanent relations and exchanges between bar associations and law societies and their members throughout the world; discuss problems of professional organization and status; advance the science of jurisprudence in all its phases; by common study of practical legal problems, promote uniformity and definition in appropriate fields of law; promote the administration of justice under law among peoples of the world; in execution of these objects promote in their legal aspects the principles and aims of the United Nations and cooperate with, and promote coordination among, international juridicial organizations having similar purposes.
activities: Extensive work in all aspects of law of interest to the international practising lawyers. 'Section on Business Law' (27 Committees) formed 1970. 'Section on General Practice' (22 Committees) formed 1974. 'Section on Energy and Natural Resources 'Law (6 Committees) formed 1983. Specialist fora covering Arab, Asia-Pacific and Eastern European regions and representing academics, judges and capital markets. Standing Committees: Arab Region Credentials; Confidentiality; Finance; General Professional Programme; Human Rights; International Liaison with Legal Organisations; Membership; Nominations; Professional Ethics. Organizes national, regional and international conferences and seminars.

name: International Commission of Jurists (ICJ)
aims: Support and advance those principles of justice which constitute the basis of the rule of law; promote and protect human rights; mobilize the jurists of the world in support of the rule of law through public meetings, conferences and congresses, publications, and other appropriate types of activities; give aid and encouragement to those who are denied the rule of law.
activities: World enquiry into definition of the Rule of Law; observers at trials; reports on human rights situations in various countries all over the world; missions and visits to different countries; participation in UN seminars; international exchanges; activities for law students and young lawyers; promoting legal services in rural areas and independence of judges and lawyers in Asia, Africa, Latin America and the Caribbean. Created Center for the Independence of Judges and Lawyers (CIJL, #01831) to promote and protect the independence of the judiciary and the legal profession. Proposed the setting up of African Court of Human and Peoples' Rights. ICJ was awarded: the first European Human Rights Prize, 1980; Wateler Peace Prize, 1984; Erasmus Prize, 1989; UN Human Rights Prize, 1993.

name: International Council of Women (ICW)
aims: Bring together in association women's voluntary organizations from all parts of the world for consultation and action to promote the welfare of mankind, the family and the individual; support efforts to achieve peace through negotiation, arbitration and conciliation; promote recognition and respect for human rights and work for removal of discrimination, such as that based on birth, right race, sex, language or religion; promote equal rights and responsibilities for both sexes in all spheres; encourage women to recognize their responsibilities in the community and train and stimulate them to participate in public life on local, national and international level; deepen the understanding and increase the mutual sympathies of women through international contacts.
activities: Has supported from the beginning the ideas of international peace and arbitration, equal legal status for women (including suffrage and rights of citizenship, equal pay for equal work), family and child welfare. Work is directed to making known the principles of human rights and achieving their application in every aspect of life. International Standing Committees (13) on: Arts and Letters (with a Sub-Committee on Music); Child and Family; Economics; Education; Environment and Habitat; Health; Home Economics; International Relations and Peace; Laws and Status of Women; Mass Media; Migration; Social Welfare; Women and Employment. Studies questions which affect the status of women and their capacity to play an active part in all aspects of life. Regional seminars on human rights, literacy, education, the advancement of women and their participation in economic and social development. Member of planning committee on 1985 World Conference of the Decade of Women.

name: International League for Human Rights (ILHR)
aims: Promote application of those guarantees of civil, political, economic and social rights contained in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights adopted by the United Nations in 1948 and in the international covenants on human rights.
activities: Works to implement international human rights standards in agreements, adopted by United Nations and other intergovernmental bodies. Monitors and contributes to human rights work of the United Nations through such bodies as: Committee Against Torture; Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women; United Nations Commission on Human Rights; United Nations Sub-Commission on the Prevention of Discrimination and Protection of Minorities. Investigates human rights violations; intervenes directly with governments; makes representations before international bodies; conducts research and educational programs; Publishes special reports on human rights conditions; assists victims; sends observers to political trials; dispatches special investigative missions to inquire into specific violations and effect redress; supports and helps establish human rights groups in different countries; works to establish international human rights standards. Public and private meetings. Annual Human Rights Prize awarded.

name: International Organization of Journalists (IOJ)
aims: Protect and strengthen the professional rights and freedoms of journalists; encourage the creation and development of journalists' trade unions for the defense of their moral and material rights, in particular through collective bargaining; promote the professional standards of journalism and strengthen their social responsibilities in line with international ethical principles; defend and promote the rights of the peoples to freedom of information and expression in line with the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights and the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights; promote the democratization and decolonization of local, national, regional and international media, above all by fighting to promote world unity and solidarity of journalists, particularly through coordination of actions for protection of journalists on dangerous missions; assure contacts, cooperation and exchange of information among member organizations; establish and maintain close relations with national, regional and other international organizations in the interest of the world community of journalists; represent the profession at the United Nations and its specialized agencies; fight for job security; defend the right of access to information sources and the right to protect the sources of information; disseminate information on copyright and promote its defense; contribute to the struggle of the peoples for peace, disarmament, development and progress, against racism and all other forms of discrimination.
activities: Struggle against any form of censorship and for democratization of mass communication media in different regions of the world, with priority to the trade union movement of journalists defending their material, professional and moral interests, focusing in particular on security in the exercise of the profession. Development of programs in the field of professional training and permanent study on the impact of new technologies currently introduced in mass media. Involvement in worldwide efforts to preserve environment and promote constant economic development. Defense of a new International Information Order with a view to balancing the information flow between different regions of the world. Determination to unify the international movement of journalists, seeking cooperation with the International Federation of Journalists (IFJ) and with national and regional organizations of journalists even if they are not directly associated with IOJ. IOJ maintains International Rest Home for Journalists, Varna, Varna (Sofia) and has relations with: Jose Marti International Institute of Journalism, Havana; International Institute of Journalism, Berlin (Germany), Berlin. Instrumental in setting up International Court of Honor (inactive).

name: International PEN
aims: Promote and maintain friendship and intellectual cooperation between men of letters in all countries in the interests of literature, freedom of expression and international goodwill. PEN is not concerned with State or party politics and must not be used to serve their interests. PEN Charter affirms that literature should remain common currency in spite of political or international upheavals and that works of art are the property of humanity at large; and stands for the unhampered transmission of thought within and between nations.
activities: Organizes international Congresses; other Congresses, symposia, seminars, regional conferences and dialogues. Local meetings organized by Centers, many of which publish their own newsletters, books and pamphlets. 'PEN Writers in Prison Committee' works for the release of writers imprisoned for expressing their opinions; Foundation PEN Emergency Fund, based in the Netherlands, gives practical aid to the dependents of imprisoned or harassed writers; 'Translations and Linguistic Rights Committee – encourages translation from and between 'small' languages.

name: International Press Institute (IPI)
aims: Further and safeguard the freedom of the press: free access to news; free expression of views; free publication of newspapers; achieve understanding among editors and so among peoples; promote free exchange of accurate and balanced news among nations; improve the practices of journalism.
activities: Information on press freedom and editorial research. Organizes conferences. Training programmes and seminars in Africa, North America, South America, Asia, Europe (including Central and Eastern Europe).

name: International Union of Local Authorities (IULA)
aims: Promote local autonomy; contribute towards improvement of local administration; study questions concerning life and activities of local authorities and the welfare of citizens; promote the idea of participation of the population in civic affairs; establish and develop international municipal relations.
activities: Specialist interest groups meet regularly, hold seminars and conferences. Holds World Congresses (every two years) and regional seminars, conferences, symposia. Founding member of: International Council for Local Environmental Initiatives (ICLEI, #06895); International Daughter Companies Network of IULA (IDCN); Municipal Insurance Group; Towns and Development (TandD, #11432); World Academy for Local Government and Democracy (WALD, Turkey); World Union of Wholesale Markets within IULA (WUWM, #12463). Proposed, 28 Apr 1993, creation of Red de Asociaciones Municipales de America Latina (#10400).

name: International Union of Socialist Youth (IUSY)
aims: Propagate amongst the younger generation the principles of free and democratic socialism; further practical cooperation among democratic socialist youth and student organizations of all countries so as to strengthen international solidarity among young socialists worldwide in the fight against fascism, racism, discrimination and for the liberation of men and particularly women from all exploitation and for the rights of all peoples to free and independent development, for protection of environment and for human rights
activities: Summer camps; seminars; briefings on specific topics; delegations; missions; solidarity campaigns; solidarity brigades; speaking tours; study sessions. Organizes IUSY world festivals (about every 2 to 3 years), gatherings of members of all affiliates during 7-10 days, with political and cultural programs. Instrumental in setting up European Political Youth Council (EPYC, #04265).

name: Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU)
aims: The Inter-Parliamentary Union is the international organization which brings together the representatives of the Parliaments of sovereign States. As the focal point for world-wide parliamentary dialogue, the inter-Parliamentary Union works for peace and cooperation among peoples and for the firm establishment of representative institutions. To that end, it: (a) Fosters contacts, coordination and the exchange experience among Parliaments and parliamentarians of all countries; (b) Considers questions of international interest and expresses its views on such issues with a view to bringing about action by parliaments and their members; (c) contributes to the defense and promotion of human rights; (d) Contributes to better knowledge of the working of representative institutions and to the strengthening of their means of action.
activities: Work is essentially carried out in two fields: action for peace and cooperation, human rights of parliamentarians and strengthening of parliamentary institutions. Examines objectively all international questions suitable for settlement by parliamentary action. Two major sessions annually. Committees set up by the Inter-Parliamentary Conference (4): Political Questions, International Security and Disarmament; Parliamentary, Juridical and Human Rights Questions; Economic, and Social Questions; Education, Science, Culture and Environment. Meetings of participating women parliamentarians are held on the occasion of every statutory Conference. A permanent Ad Hoc Committee on Environment was established by IPU in 1989 to study environmental matters on a continuing basis; the committee involved in 1994 into the committee on Environment and Sustainable Development. Program for the Study and Promotion of Representative Democracy (services to Parliaments to help them meet the requirements of their members more effective, including technical assistance, and activities related to elections). In 1976, the Union adopted 'Procedure for the Examination and Treatment of Communications Concerning the Violation of the Human Rights of Parliamentarians' which is applicable to any member of parliament from any country who is the victim of arbitrary measures during the exercise of his mandate, whether the parliament was in session or in recess or has been dissolved by unconstitutional or emergency measures. Since Nov 1979, IPU has organized meetings of parliamentarians attending the UN General Assembly in New York. Association of Secretaries General of Parliaments (ASGP, #01330), which is a consultative organism of the Union, provides an opportunity for senior parliamentary officials to meet, to study parliamentary law and procedure and to propose measures for improving the working methods of different Parliaments and for securing cooperation between their services. International conferences, meetings, symposia and seminars.

name: Women's International Democratic Federation (WIDF)
aims: Unite women regardless of race, nationality, religion and political opinion, so that they may work together to win, implement and defend their rights as mothers, workers and citizens; defend the rights of children to life, wellbeing and education; win and defend national independence and democratic freedoms, eliminate apartheid, racial discrimination and fascism; work for peace and universal disarmament.
activities: Works for the rights of women in society and family for: the right to work; the right to equal pay for equal work; the right to education at all levels; the recognition of the social role of motherhood; the integration of women in all spheres of political, social and cultural life. Supports women suffering oppression: racial discrimination, apartheid, fascism in all its forms, colonialism and neocolonialism, with Solidarity activities, study trips, seminars, round-table meetings and publications. As far as children are concerned, WIDF works: for a secure and happy future for all children; for the right of all children to education, healthcare and adequate nutrition; that nowhere in the world children starve or die of hunger; for the right of each child to a happy childhood and a life in a harmonious family. As regards the peace problem, WIDF works: for preservation and consolidation of peace; against the arms race (including weapons of mass destruction and nuclear weapons); against constantly increasing military expenditure. Initiator at the NGO level of the proclamation by the United Nations of 'International Women's Year' and contributed to the implementation of the United Nations Decade for Women: Equality, Development, Peace.'

name: World Federation of Democratic Youth (WFDY)
aims: Contribute to the education of youth in the spirit of freedom, democracy and solidarity; end imperialism, colonialism, neocolonialism; end racist and fascist regimes; ensure peace and security in the world by supporting all initiatives and efforts to this effect; promote active participation of youth in economic, social, cultural and political life by acting against all restriction and discrimination connected with age, sex, methods of education, domicile, property, social status, religion, political convictions, color and race, so as to ensure in all countries and for all young people full freedom of speech, of the press, of religious belief, assembly and organization; support the struggle of youth for higher living standards, for better conditions of education, work and leisure and for development of cultural, educational and sports activities for all young people; further development of the young generation in the spirit of peace and international friendship; support the principles of the United Nations Charter; support youth interests via international bodies and in affairs of an international character.
activities: Works to combat: racism; racial discrimination; apartheid; fascism.
