Organizes seminars and voluntary work camp; carries out research on youth needs; facilitates and encourages joint actions by youth organizations of different countries, bilateral and multilateral contacts and other means serving the causes of friendship, understanding and cooperation; promotes international youth events contributing to solution of youth problems; promotes and assists youth organizations whose work is hampered through being victim of imperialist aggression, colonial domination, repression, persecution or national disaster, especially through International Solidarity Fund; helps to develop tourist exchanges, holiday schemes, festivals, cultural and sports competitions; cooperates with national, continental and international organizations including trade unions and other professional organizations, especially for implementing rights of youth. Thematic departments for peace and disarmament, solidarity, youth rights, global problems, international cooperation, press and information, as well as working groups on sport and culture, problems of young women. Attached bureaux (3): International Bureau for Youth Tourism and Exchanges (BITEJ, inactive) (which has consultative status with WFDY); International Committee of Children's and Adolescents' Movements (ICCAM, no recent information); International Voluntary Service for Solidarity and Friendship of Youth (SIVSAJ, #08649). Instrumental in setting up World Youth Rainforest Action (WYRA).

name: Commonwealth Parliamentary Association (CPA)
aims: Promote knowledge and education about the constitutional, legislative, economic, social and cultural systems within a parliamentary democratic framework, with particular reference to the countries of the Commonwealth of Nations and other countries having close historical and parliamentary associations with it; foster understanding and cooperation among members of Commonwealth Parliaments; promote the study of and respect for parliamentary institutions.
activities: Provides the sole means of regular consultation between members of Commonwealth Parliaments. Organizes: exchange of inter-Commonwealth visits and information; plenary and regional conferences; study tours; study group meetings and parliamentary seminars. Maintains 'Parliamentary Information and Reference Centre' at office headquarters which assembles through direct acquisitions and exchanges with members, officials of parliaments and parliamentary librarians, a comprehensive collection of materials on parliaments and other legislatures; provides a full information service; publishes CPA publications.

name: Commonwealth Press Union (CPU)
aims: Promote the concept and ideals of the commonwealth; foster mutual understanding and goodwill through regular conferences in constituent parts of it; advance the welfare of the newspaper and periodical press of the Commonwealth through action to safeguard press freedom, measures for training and educating journalists.
activities: Watch for and oppose all measures or proposals likely to affect press freedom; promote measures for educating and training journalists, in the Commonwealth. Annual meetings and conferences (every two years). Instrumental in setting up International Press Telecommunications Council (IPTC, #07936).

name: International Association for Religious Freedom (IARF)
aims: Promote development of the religious life in which freedom of conscience is an essential element; promote development of mutual understanding and cooperation among nations of all continents, and tolerance in all areas of culture and religion in the spirit of the kinship of all people; open, maintain and expand relationships with and between organizations and individuals striving for international understanding, cooperation tolerance and a vital religious life, especially organized liberal movement in all religions throughout the world; promote development of culture and education; promote development aid.
activities: Constituent members include Buddhist, Christians, Hindus, Muslims, Jews, Shintoists, Sikhs, Unitarians, Universalists and members of tribal religious traditions. Conducts interreligious dialogue; intercultural encounters; social service network (includes development projects and emergency relief program); advocacy for religious freedom and other fundamental human rights. Study groups on: religious education, social questions, problems of theology in church. Triennial Congress, regional (Continental) conferences, commissions, chapters. Library (over 8000 volumes).

name: International Association of Lawyers
aims: Promote, in the interests of the litigant, basic principles of the lawyer's profession, with particular reference to independence and freedom; establish permanent relations and exchanges among bars, societies and national federations or associations of lawyers and support their action and work; defend ethical and material interests of members of the profession and jointly study questions related to professional status and organization; contribute to the establishment of an international legal order based on the principle of justice among nations through law for the sake of peace.
activities: Organizes congresses, symposia, seminars. Has produced an 'International Charter of Defense Rights', an 'International Charter of Access to Justice for All' and the 'Charter of the Rights of Minorities'.

name: Socialist International Women (SIW)
aims: Strengthen relations between members; Exchange experiences between members on ways and means of promoting, among the women of their respective countries, a knowledge and understanding of the aims and tasks of democratic socialism; seek to extend relations between SIW members and other socialist-oriented women's groups, not in membership, which desire cooperation; promote action programs to overcome any discrimination in society, including any inequality between men and women, and work for human rights in general, development and peace.
activities: Exchange visits. Seminars. International Women's Day meetings. Projects to help women in developing countries. Themes recently dealt with: disarmament; socialism and feminism; women's work and working hours; equal rights for women; nuclear-free zones; disarmament and development; cuts in military expenditure; women and the new economic order; women against the new right; United Nations Decade for Women; sexual mutilation of women; Nairobi - results and consequences for Socialist International Women; a Socialist Decade for Women; young women - our future; after Nairobi - women's participation in the development process; women - a key factor in the economic development of Africa; disarmament for development; women and political power; the future we want is possible - women's work, women's right to health services, children's rights; prevention of sexual exploitation - a challenge for action; discrimination against women in legislation; foreign debt - how can women break the cycles of affluence and poverty; organizing and educating women in politics; women and health; the family - women's responsibility?; Women in changing economic systems; women and violence in society; ideological changes - continuing male dominance; women changing places.

name: International Federation of Free Journalists (IFFJ)
aims: Uphold the principles of freedom of the press; promote human and national rights; defend the rights of individuals to objective and complete information; propagate honesty of news; raise standards and ethics of journalism.
activities: Makes representations against activities threatening freedom of expression, against the harassment, persecution and detention without trial of journalists and against censorship and suppression of mass media. Cooperates in inter-European affairs, maintaining contact with the newly independent states of Central and Eastern Europe through their diplomatic representatives. Participates in human rights conferences

name: International Federation of Newspaper Publishers
aims: Defend and promote press freedom, and economic independence of newspapers as an essential condition for that freedom; contribute to development of newspaper publishing by fostering communications and contacts between newspaper executives; promote cooperation among newspaper publishers in member nations; promote and develop a free press and information activities in developing countries.
activities: Set up Coordinating Center for Independent Media of the Balkan Region, Ljubljana (# 12397).

name: International Association of Judges (IAJ)
aims: Defend the independence of the judiciary, as an essential condition of the judicial function, and guarantee the rights and freedom of man, protect the constitutional and moral position of the judiciary; promote the exchange of cultural relations; organize and intensify cordial relations between judges of different countries.
activities: Congresses and meetings for the study of the judicial system and the unification of law generally; assistance in the arrangements of exchange visits.

name: International Union of Young Christian Democrats (IUYCD)
aims: Contribute to the establishment throughout the world of a social, economic and political democracy of Christian democratic inspiration; spread the Christian democrat ideal and prepare the younger generation of Christian democrats for political, economic, and social responsibilities; coordinate the activities of member organizations to attain these aims
activities: International, regional and national congresses, seminars and round tables. Focuses on issues related to human rights, social justice and pluralism in society.

name: Law Association for Asia and the Western Pacific (LAWASIA)
aims: Promote the administration of justice, the protection of human rights and the maintenance of the rule of law; advance legal education; diffuse knowledge of the laws of member countries; promote development of the law, and uniformity where appropriate; further international understanding and goodwill; foster relations and intercourse between lawyers and uphold and advance the status of the legal profession in the region
activities: Standing committees (13): legal aid; commercial arbitration; human rights; environmental law; intellectual property; energy law; crime; labor law; banking and finance; enforcement of foreign judgment; communications law; consumer protection law; taxation law; insurance law; maritime law; construction law; Women in the law. Observer mission program. Interest groups in the area of commercial law. Judicial section, set up in 1973. LAWASIA Research Institute, formed in 1979, enables the association to finance its work program. LAWASIA holds conferences and organizes specialist seminars. Instrumental in setting up: Asian Coalition of Human Rights Organizations (ACHRO, #00726).

name: North Atlantic Assembly (NAA)
aims: Strengthen cooperation and understanding among member countries of the Atlantic Alliance; urge governments to take account of the alliance viewpoint in their legislations; promote security and stability in Europe and assist development of parliamentary democracy in Central and Eastern Europe; promote development of a common feeling of Atlantic solidarity.
activities: Although completely independent of NATO (#09788), constitutes a link between parliamentarians and the alliance, acting as Interparliamentary Assembly. Votes recommendations and resolutions in Plenary Sessions (directed to relevant member governments, parliaments, international organizations); produces detailed reports. Works through Committees (5): defense and security; economic; civilian affairs; political; scientific and technical; also special group on civil-military relations. Sub-Committees (8): Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe (CSCE); Mediterranean Basin; Defense and Security Cooperation between Europe and North America; Future of the Armed Forces; East-West Economic Cooperation and Convergence; Eastern Europe and the Former Soviet Union; Southern Region; Proliferation of Military Technology. Working groups (3): Northern Security Issues; New European Security Order; NATO Engagement. Organizes: annual military tours; seminars on European security, parliamentary control over the fence matters with East Europe civil servants, officials and parliamentarians.

name: International Association of Young Lawyers
aims: Encourage meetings and promote cooperation and mutual respect among young lawyers from all countries; defend the interest of young lawyers and study questions of relevance to them; help set up groups of young lawyers in countries where none as yet exists; play an active role in development of the legal profession and harmonization of its professional rules; contribute to provision of full and effective protection of the right of all lawyers to practice their profession freely and of every person to be added, counselled or represented by a lawyer freely chosen and to be entitled to a fair trial by an impartial and independent judge within a reasonable period of time.
activities: Organizes annual congress, seminars, law courses, and intercontinental and regional meetings. Trainee Exchange Programme. Standing Commissions (12): Human and Procedural Rights and Responsibilities; Intellectual Property and New Technologies; International Business Law, including 3 sub-commissions: Franchising and Distribution, Labour Law, Bankruptcy; Future of the Profession; Family and Estate Law; Civil Procedure; Tax Law; International Arbitration; European Community Law; Banking and Finance; Corporate Acquisition and Joint Ventures. Includes lawyers emergency defense committee (#09078), which aims to ensure protection of the right of every lawyer to practice his profession freely and for every person to be entitled to legal representation and fair trial. 'Permanent Bureau for International Exchange'. 'Declaration of Athens' on defense of common principles, adopted 25 August 1966, Athens. 'Declaration of Lausanne' on recognition that regard for professional confidentiality is fundamental to the principle of the right to a fair trial, adopted 27 August 1982, Lausanne (Switzerland) and 2 September 1983, Helsinki.

name: Commonwealth Magistrates' and Judges' Association (CMJA)
aims: Advance administration of the law by promoting the independence of the judiciary; promote education in law, administration of justice, treatment of offenders and prevention of crime within the Commonwealth; disseminate information and literature on matters concerning the legal process; effect closest possible links between members.
activities: Emphasizes magistracy (or primary judiciary) where over 90 percent of judicial matters are handled. Provides advice and resource center; organizes seminars, regional meetings, conferences, penal training, exchange visits.

name: International Organization for the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (EAFORD)
aims: Consistent with the UN International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination: support respect for, and the role of, international law as essential to maintenance of world order and peace; promote anti-racism and self-determination as affirmed in the Charter of the United Nations; promote equality and dignity and rights; support the United Nations and cooperate with its member states; defend the interests of people who are victims of racism and racial discrimination, especially their rights to culture, land and self-determination; support and promote international consensus.
activities: Convenes conferences and seminars. Grants Fellowship Awards to postgraduate students; 'International Award for the Furtherance of Human Understanding' and to the best book published in English, French, Arabic, Spanish/Portuguese on questions of racism and racial discrimination. Disseminate information produced by non-governmental organizations and UN bodies. Current areas of concentration: Palestine; southern Africa; indigenous peoples; local racism; minority and discrimination issues.

name: Society for Threatened Peoples
aims: Disseminate information to provide international hearing to plight of peoples, often ethnic or religious minorities, subjected to persecution or genocide.

name: Regional Council on Human Rights in Asia
aims: Adopt and disseminate a Regional Declaration of Human Rights that reflects the culture, values, and aspirations of the people of the region and seek the support of the people of the region for that Declaration; promote respect for individual and collective civil, political, social, economic, and cultural human rights; receive petitions and complaints and assist in redressing violations of these rights; encourage governments of the region to ratify or concur in the International Conventions on Human Rights; undertake studies and research.
activities: In 1984, the council decided to concentrate on two tasks: to spread and explain the Declaration of Basic Duties among peoples of the ASEAN region; to campaign for the release of political prisoners in the region.

name: Anti-Slavery International (ASI)
aims: Endeavor to obtain the elimination of all forms of slavery, including forced labor, through research leading to awareness raising, lobbying of governments and international bodies and public campaigning; complement and support efforts of groups with similar concerns; promote the well-being of indigenous peoples and other peoples.
activities: Collects and assesses information. Seeks to persuade the governments concerned to cooperate in introducing reforms and persuade more member states of the United Nations to ratify the Supplementary Convention on Slavery (1956); works through research, awareness raising, lobbying, public campaigns and support for like-minded organizations. Current concerns include debt bondage, child labor/prostitution, servile and early marriage, forced labor. Makes Anti-Slavery Award.

name: Inter-African Union of Lawyers (IAUL)
aims: Defend integrity and basic principles of the legal profession; safeguard the independence and freedom of the defense; work towards establishment and strengthening of relations among African lawyers; foster a spirit of solidarity among them; defend and promote public and private freedoms, human rights and the rights of peoples; work for establishment of an international legal order based on justice among nations; set up an efficient legal defense system; support and encourage preservation of the rule of law and independence of the judiciary; participate in efforts to improve legal education in universities
activities: Make representations to countries where legal rights have been threatened; organizes specialized meetings and symposia.

name: Christian Democratic Organization of America
aims: Serve as a link between Christian Democratic parties in Latin American countries by promoting the exchange of publications and ideas; organize research concerning common problems; contact similar parties in other regions of the world; promote and reinforce the democratization process in Latin America and the Caribbean

name: Young Christian Democrats of America (YCDA)
aims: Works for the establishment in Latin America of a social, economic and political democracy of Christian democratic inspiration.

name: Ibero-American Lawyers' Union
aims: Promote and ensure the following of dignity, independence and freedom in the legal profession as essential values for the realization of justice; protect the interests of lawyers and students of law; promote cooperation among members in the development of legal science.

name: Latin American Federation of Associations for Relatives of the Detained and Disappeared
aims: Fight against the forced disappearance in Latin America and the Caribbean through denunciation of this misdemeanor, the clarification of the truth about the facts, the judgment and sanction of those responsible for the crime, the promotion of national and international legal norms which prevent the impunity and the education in the field of the human rights so that such facts occur never again
activities: Main activities: denunciation (immediate and permanent); investigation; prevention and education; coordination. Gathers reports of forced disappearance; issues appeals to authorities; transmits denunciations to competent international authorities; assist members in searching, exchanging experience and publishing information; develops and promotes international solidarity through support groups; provides medical, psychological and social assistance to relatives through support groups in various countries; assists and drafting and promoting adoption of international instruments aimed at preventing forced disappearance

name: European Union of Christian Democrats (EUCD)
aims: Establish regular contacts between political parties and individuals in all countries who are inspired by the principle of Christian democracy, with a view to studying, in the light of those principles, national and international problems; compare experiences and programmes; seek to realize international harmony in practical achievements within the framework of democracy, social and political peace, political cooperation and mutual assistance.
activities: Study sessions. Congresses. Joint committees with EPP (4): Central and Eastern Europe; Security and Defense; International Relations; Latin America. Instrumental in setting up: Christian Democrat Parliamentary Group in the Council of Europe (#01924); European Association of Locally and Regionally Elected Christian Democrats (#03127); Groupe de coordination 'Europe centrale et orientale'.

name: Pacific Islands News Association (PINA)
aims: Promote freedom of expression; raise professional standards of journalism; assist training and communication.

name: European Young Christian Democrats (EYCD)
aims: Unite political organizations and movements of young Christian democrats; contribute to the construction of a free, just and united European society, rejecting nationalism, totalitarianism and any privilege resulting from class, culture or race.
activities: Seminars on subjects such as: European integration; youth policy; Christian democracy; East-West relations; North-South relations; current political problems. Statutory meetings. Events are held in different European countries with the participation of international young political leaders. Instrumental in setting up European Political Youth Council (EPYC, #EE0949).

name: International Association of Broadcasting (IAB)
aims: Defend broadcasting, whether radio or television, as a free means of expression of thought; work for freedom of social communication media; promote cooperation of broadcasters in activities of public interest and social services and the effective representation of broadcasting interests in official or private national and international organizations; sponsor world and regional conferences of a technical, legal, or educational nature
activities: Standing committees: legal; technical; on copyright; on freedom of expression.

name: Inter-American Bar Association (IABA)
aims: Establish and maintain relations between associations and organizations of lawyers, national and local, in the Americas; provide a forum for exchange of views; advance the science of jurisprudence in all its phases and particularly the study of comparative law; promote uniformity of laws; further the diffusion of knowledge of laws of the various countries of the Americas; promote the rule of law and the administration of justice through the establishment and maintenance of independent judicial systems in all countries of the Americas; ensure preservation and defence of human rights and liberties and guarantee to the peoples of the hemisphere the free exercise of their civil and political rights under the democratic principles; uphold the honor of the profession of the law; encourage cordial intercourse and fellowship among lawyers of the Western Hemisphere.

name: Caribbean Democrat Union
aims: Advocate promotion of freedom and an economic system based on a social market economy through consideration of matters of political organization and policies.
activities: Charter covers: democracy; freedom and the individual; the individual in the community; private property and private enterprise; international relations Programme includes seminars on: environment; drug abuse; training of young leaders; women and development.

name: Inter American Press Association (IAPA)
aims: Defend and promote the right of the people of the Americas to be fully and freely informed through an independent press;  protect freedom of the press in the Americas; Foster general and specific interests of press; promote and maintain the dignity, rights and responsibilities of the profession of journalism; encourage uniform standards of professional and business conduct; promote greater interchange among peoples of America in support of basic principles of a free society and individual liberty.
activities: Fosters and protects press freedom by publishing facts of any action or attempt to restrict that freedom in the Western Hemisphere. Circulation auditing service. Inter-American Press Association Scholarship Fund, set up in 1954. Maintains: Inter-American Press Association Technical Center (IAPA Technical Center), which organizes Annual General Assembly, Annual Mid-Year Meeting and seminars, and produces publications. Office of Certified Circulation (OCC), started 1954, subsequently became autonomous and was then replaced by national and regional organizations which continue helping to increase advertising income and thus financial independence. Chamorro and Tom Wallace Awards. Committees include: freedom of the press and information; newsprint; ethics; advertising; technical information; legal; membership; applications review; awards. Set up Inter-American Investigative Journalism Review (USA).

name: International Association for the Defence of Religious Liberty
aims: In the belief that the right to religious freedom is a gift of God; encourage all those who are attached to the ideal of liberty, without any distinction of race, sex, language or religion, to participate in the crusade against all forms of intolerance and fanaticism; value human dignity such that each individual has access to true existence in every domain and to a flowering of his being so as to discover his true identity; serve freedom of faith throughout the world; create a climate of the greatest understanding and reciprocal respect among people of every faith and conviction, to assist humanity in solving the major problems of peace, liberty and justice.
activities: World Congress on religious liberty, jointly with international religious liberty association; regional Congress is in cooperation with other NGOs.

name: International Federation of ACAT - Action by Christian for the Abolition of Torture (IFACAT)
aims: Sensitize Christian communities to the atrocity of torture; invite all church members to participate in action on behalf of tortured prisoners; bring messages of hope into the heart of the reality of torture; contribute to creation, promotion and dissemination of legal instruments against torture; exercise a preventative function of vigilance and human rights education.
activities: Organizes: seminars; symposia. Individual members of national ACATs write 'urgent appeals' on behalf of tortured prisoners to authorities responsible for torture in various countries.IFACAT mobilizes all national ACATs for specific situations. Members meet for prayer, theological study and reflection.

name: Confederation of Cooperatives of the Caribbean and Central America (CCC-CA)
aims: Foster and encourage development, integration, consolidation, representation and defense of cooperatives in the region; as an effective manner to achieve structural change in the countries, so they can democratize their political, social and economic life within a concept of justice, participation and peace.
activities: Organizes about 40 national and regional events annually. Sets out strategic guidelines for a common agenda under the headings: integration; development; inter-cooperation; solidarity; representation and defense; institutional consolidation; social justice. Programs: education and training; strategic planning; research; communication; commercialization; development of sectors; business development; information; organization and development. Policies relate to participation of women and youth and environmental issues.

name: Andean Commission of Jurists
aims: Formulate and defend proposals on reinforcing institutions and strengthening civilian society and the rule of law; contribute to bettering the knowledge and protection of human rights; alert society as to the fundamental problems which affect human rights and the stability of democracy.
activities: Research programs (5): constitutional approach; drug control and human rights; indigenous people; violence and peace process; protection of human rights. Each program organizes international conferences dealing with regional considerations. Organizes international and national events. Intervenes before governments and disseminates press releases on human rights violations and the drug control efforts. Sponsors proposals before international organizations to promote mechanisms for the protection of human rights.

name: Nordic Christian Democrats
activities: Congresses, Nordic contact meetings, meetings of presidents, meetings of general secretaries.

name: International Federation of Resistance Movements
aims: Unite resisters in peacetime as they were united in wartime resistance movements to secure the independence of their countries, liberty and world peace; actively defend and maintain freedom and human dignity; cherish the memory of all who fell for their country and liberty; defend the spirit and values of the resistance; make known its historical role and transmit its teachings to new generations; denounce the horrors of concentration camps and prisons and demand due punishment for crimes against humanity; defend the material and moral interests of those having due rights and causes; create and develop social services in their aid; promote aims set out in the UN charter and strengthen links of fraternity and solidarity between resisters in all countries; oppose racial, political, philosophical or religious discrimination, neofascism, and 'prescriptability' of war crimes and crimes against humanity; work for disarmament and detente.
activities: Documentation center. Commissions on cultural, social, medical matters and on reparations. Permanent commission on fascism. Research services. Pilgrimages to former concentration camps. Congresses; Medical symposia; specialized meetings; consultative meetings

name: Free International Federation of Deportees and Resistance Internees
aims: Commemorate victims of oppression and their struggle for freedom; promote on a national and international levels respect for and protection of democratic freedoms; strengthen bonds between members of associated organizations; ensure moral and material aid required by members; promote and support laws and regulations sympathetic to purposes of the organization.

name: European Lawyers Union
aims: Unite lawyers who are members of a European Union bar so as to carry out common activities to favorize: professional practice, freedom of establishment and freedom to offer services; coming together of juridical statutes and professional and ethical practices of lawyers in member states of the European Union leading to an integrated conception of the profession in EU; practice of EC/EU law and law arising from the European convention for the protection of human rights and fundamental freedoms.
activities: Scientific Congress (held annually in May/June); colloquia and seminars; study days.

name: International Association Against Torture (IAAT)
aims: Defend the dignity of the human being and end the practice of torture.
activities: Furthers research and advocacy on the theme of the right to development as the basis for human rights work. Works against the violations of human rights. Advances the discussion of 'The Right of Sovereignty and Self-Determination' as a basis for consideration of human rights, recognizing that the economic models for development being advanced by restricted democracies leave aside this right. Focuses on the discussions around the foreign debt in light of the impact it has upon the economic and social rights of the citizens of the countries with a large debt. Works on the campaign for the 'Respect for International Law'. Monitors prison conditions and treatment of prisoners. Conferences; seminars; exhibitions; letter writing; positions; press releases. Focuses on Latin America.

name: International Rehabilitation Council for Torture Victims (IRCT)
aims: Accumulate and disseminate information about torture, consequences of torture, and possibilities for rehabilitating persons who have been tortured; support international and national initiatives, organizations and agencies concerned with torture; support establishment and maintenance of rehabilitation services for torture survivors; support research into all aspects of torture; support education and training of health professionals and other relevant professions in the medical, social, legal and ethical aspects of torture; support all other activities that may contribute to prevention of torture; serve as an international clearinghouse for information.
activities: Provides information via: international correspondence; information kits (basic, medical, ethics, nurses, doctors, children); foreign visitors (professionals) - groups and individuals - for teaching and information sessions; public relations activities (visits by journalists, press conferences, radio and television, films). Participates in international meetings and conferences. Supports rehabilitation activities by means of colon counseling and support; direct financial support; exchange of experience. Participates in international research and development projects on the nature and extent of consequences of torture with regards to prevention, treatment and rehabilitation - including work related to Human Rights Information and Documentation Systems, International (HURIDOCS, #05418) and its international standards. Academic research group connected to RCT discusses current projects and plans future research work. Communicates RCT's research results. Education and training activities, in Denmark and elsewhere, including training seminars. Following Tromso resolution: establishing a tribunal for examining and disseminating information on doctors' involvement in torture; monitoring doctors' involvement in torture; protection of doctors threatened because of human rights activities. International Documentation Center, inaugurated 1987, participates in HURIDOCS.

name: Asia-Pacific Lawyers Association (APLA)
aims: Within the region: enhances status of the legal profession; foster relations, communication and exchange of ideas between lawyers and associations and organization of lawyers; promote administration of justice, protection of human rights and maintenance of the rule of law; advance standards of legal education. Advance the science of jurisprudence in all its phases and promote the study and development of international law and comparative law.
activities: Committees (12): Business Law, including 2 sub-committees - Banking, Insurance; Chinese Law (ad hoc); Dispute Settlement and Arbitration; General Practitioner; Human Rights; Immigration and Naturalization; Intellectual Property, Labor and Employment Law; Maritime Law; Natural Resources and Energy Product Liability; Tax Law. Centers (2): Labor and Management Law; Traffic Law. General Assembly Meetings, seminars, symposia.

name: International Union of Resistance and Deportee Movements
aims: Bring together at the international level - all political or governmental intervention being excluded - associations of resistors, deportees and victims of Nazism in order to defend their rights and claims, perpetuate the memory of their struggles in the service of freedom, oppose any resurgence of Nazism and anti-Semitism and any attacks on the rights and dignity of the human person; promote a policy of genuine peace that respects freedom and democracy.
activities: Studies on: disarmament and peace; defense of liberty; German reparations; history of the Resistance; rights of resistance workers and victims of Nazism; pathology of deportation, interment and resistance. On the initiative of UIRD were formed: International Concentration Camp Committee (ICCC, #06751), 30 Jan 1963, Frankfurt-Main; and International Committee of Experts for the Campaign Against a Revival of Neo-Nazism and Anti-Semitism (inactive).

name: International Union of Socialist Democratic Teachers (IUSDT)
aims: Realize the idea of democratic socialism; unite all socialist educational organizations sharing a political responsibility and an affiliation to a section of the socialist international; link internationally all groups of teachers and professors affiliated to the socialist international and persons having official educational responsibility; advocate optimum education of the individual and improvement in society's standard of education; coordinate efforts of member organizations to use teaching in all countries to promote social justice, respect of human rights, peace and international understanding; through an education drawing on discerning mental attitudes and international political awareness, endeavor to establish a socialist society in which every individual has at his or her disposal every method or aid for full development, whether children, young people or adults.
activities: Exchange of teachers and pupils; exchange of information on educational programs of member parties and of the projects put into effect by socialist governments.

name: African Society of International and Comparative Law (ASICL)
aims: Promote advancement of public education in the field of law and civil liberties in Africa; protect individual liberties; raise standards in administration of justice; provide a comprehensive legal aid system in each African country; with cooperation of justice departments, organize an itinerant ombudsman service for dispute settlement in rural areas; promote the African contribution to the international law; promote formulation of clear, established rules to deal with multiplicity of legal systems - local, religious, national - found in many African countries.
activities: Fieldwork in rural areas to raise standards of justice administration, mainly through national branches. Encourages formation of women's groups to advise on their specific problems, and of law teachers' and practitioners' groups. Preparing legal documentation to provide a record of legal affairs in Africa. Establishing an African Research Library in Africa. Plans setting up African Academy of International Law, loosely modelled on the Hague Academy, and a 'School for Diplomats' to provide centralized training for African diplomats. With law-enforcement agencies, organizes workshops for police and other law officers on civil liberties.

name: Pan African Reconciliation Council (PARC)
aims: Promote peace, liberation, human rights, and social justice in Africa through nonviolent means; strive to build a social order that will utilize the resources of human ingenuity and wisdom for the benefit of all and in which no individual or group will be exploited or oppressed for the profit or pleasure of others; or to abolish war and create a community of concern, transcending national boundaries and selfish interests; refused to participate in physical, moral, psychological or financial preparation for war or violence, advocate fair and compassionate methods of dealing with offenders against society; serve as advocates for victims of crime and their families; endeavor to show reverence for personality in the home, vocational relationships, school and other educational processes, in association with persons of other races, creeds or nations; need to avoid bitterness or contention in dealing with controversy and maintain the spirit of self-giving love while engaged in the effort to achieve these purposes; identify with every nation, race, sex or religion which is victim of injustice and exploitation; seek to develop resources of active nonviolent intervention to help rescue them from such circumstances; encourage campaigns for prompt elimination of threats to peace in Africa and the world; support, publicize and work with international agencies in the field.

name: Youth Against Racism in Europe (YRE)
aims: Combat racism and fascism.
activities: Organizes international demonstrations; street campaigns, pickets.

name: International Association for Democracy in Africa
aims: Promote human rights and democracy in Africa.
activities: Training; documentation; conferences, radio and TV programs, exhibitions; research into electoral processes; research on a charter for political parties; observer to elections. Programs: democratic culture and human rights; development; women and children.

name: Regional Asia-Pacific Secretariat for Rehabilitation of Survivors of Organized Violence
aims: Initiate advocacy efforts to prevent torture from taking place; assist in setting up rehabilitation centers for survivors; encourage cooperation among affiliates in training, research and documentation; motivate health and other professionals to work for rehabilitation of torture survivors.
activities: Regional torture monitoring desk being set up. Organizes seminars, conferences and exchange of professional resources; prepares and disseminate reports; sends fact-finding missions to countries participating in torture; rehabilitation center set up in Dhaka.

name: Arab Lawyers' Union
aims: Act in the interests of the Arab Nation to achieve its national objectives; facilitate contacts between Arab lawyers; safeguard and develop legislative and judiciary language; assure the freedom of lawyers in their work and the independence of magistrates; allow all Arab lawyers to take cases in any Arab country; harmonize the conditions of the legal profession; establish and harmonize links with international legal organizations; restore the study of Muslim Law as a basis for law; promote and protect human rights
activities: Commissions (9): Arab affairs; Palestine; Unification of law in Arab countries; defense of civil liberties and rule of law in Arab countries; harmonization of legal terminology; rules on the legal profession; socialization; support of the Palestine Liberation Movement; Defense of Palestinian resistance workers. Engaged in founding an Arab Organization for Human Rights (AOHR, #00506). Decolonization action against racism, racial discrimination and apartheid.

name: International Association of Political Consultants (IAPC)
aims: Promote, sustain, and foster the democratic process as a matter of principle and practice; bring together political consultants, both specialists and generalists, from various countries to exchange views and information about political developments and techniques
activities: Organizes annual World conference where International Democracy Award is made

name: European Democrat Students (EDS)
aims: As an organization of Christian Democrat, conservative, liberal and centrist student and youth organizations in Europe: work for a united, free Europe and for the realization of human rights in the whole world of Europe; give students the possibility to meet on an international level in order to promote understanding; discuss educational matters and present solutions reached to relevant political bodies; work for mutual recognition of diplomas in Europe; serve as a network for discussion and exchange of ideas among member organizations; strengthen the ideas of democracy, pluralism and liberty and help create a European Democrat party of all European non-socialists.
activities: Organizes seminars and conferences to provide practical training in international work for representatives of member organizations. Annual Summer University, hosted by member organizations in turn. Organizes human rights campaigns and campaigns for European Parliament.

name: Federation of Arab Journalists (FAJ)
aims: Serve the objectives of the Arab people in their unity; defend the causes of Arab journalists and develop their talents and abilities.
activities: Supports and coordinate the activities of member organizations. Collaborates with international press organizations and with organizations engaged in the defense of human rights and fundamental freedoms. Organizes or sponsors meetings, fora, exhibitions, training courses and exchange of delegations. Publishing activities.

name: Conferencia Permanente de Partidos Politicos de America Latina (COPPPAL)
Central American Association of Families of Missing Detainees
aims: Work for the re-appearance, alive, of missing detainees, particularly those detained in violation of human rights in El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras; support all international action denouncing forced disappearance of individuals as practised by governments; encourage governments and intergovernmental organizations to consider such forcible disappearance as a crime against humanity; assist in creating commissions of enquiry which carry out searches for these missing persons with the aid of their families; demand that governments punish those responsible for instigating forced disappearances; assist medical, psychiatric, juridicial and economic agencies to alleviate the sufferings of families whose parents have disappeared; promote educational activities in the field; provide scholarships to children of Central America's disappeared who would otherwise be unable to continue their education; provide peace and human rights education for children and young people in Central America.
activities: Denunciation of cases of detained-disappeared persons in Central America, asking solidarity, especially by sending letters to responsible governments, claiming their release or consigning to a legal jury. Petitions for the release of missing persons, supposedly kept within clandestine jails, tortured and under poor conditions. Gives moral support to local committees in their struggle against forced disappearance. Research, especially in order to determine the influence of forced disappearances on society as a whole. Special attention focused on education about human rights. Youth and Childhood Education and Assistance Program, including Francisco Almengor Scholarship Program for Children of Central America's Disappeared. Production and distribution of peace education materials for young people in Central America.

name: Union of African Parliaments (UAP)
aims: Contribute to: strengthening the role and prestige of the institution of Parliament by drawing inspiration from fundamental African and universal human values; effective concretization of the ideals of liberty, peace and justice; deepening the concept of representative democracy and its effective functioning. Encourage contacts among African members of parliament and between them and member of parliament of other continents; work for the progressive establishment of a genuine African juridicial community founded on political, economic, social and cultural realities of the continent; contribute to fulfillment of the objectives of the organization of African Unity for establishment of a lasting peace through dialogue within the framework of inter-African cooperation and promotion of policies of good neighborliness, non-alignment, peaceful coexistence and African unity.

name: Commonwealth Lawyers' Association (CLA)
aims: Maintain and promote the rule of law throughout the Commonwealth by ensuring: that the people of the Commonwealth are served by an independent and efficient legal profession; that a common bond of Commonwealth is preserved and fostered; professional links among members of the legal profession; maintenance of honour and integrity and promotion of uniform standards of professional ethics; improved standards of education and promotion of exchange of lawyers and students.
activities: Facilitates flow of professional information among law societies and bar associations; response to ad hoc requests for information; supports related Commonwealth and regional professional legal association; organizes workshops and discussions; advises and assists in organization of the Commonwealth Law Conference and on follow-up action; administers grants and assists in the formation of regional groups of Commonwealth lawyers. Book recovery program with CLEA. Instrumental in setting up Commonwealth Human Rights Initiative (CHRI, #02198). Set up Commonwealth Association of Armed Forces Lawyers (#02161); proposes setting up Commonwealth Group of Public Sector Lawyers.

name: Union of African Journalists (UAJ)
aims: Work for the benefit of the Continent and African journalists in a spirit of cooperation and African unity; promote cooperation among journalists; coordinate professional activities; defend the right to freedom of expression in the spirit of realistic understanding, especially in the struggle against apartheid; defend African cause in general.
activities: Training programmes; seminars; conferences. Library.

name: Christian Democrat Feminine International (CDFI)
aims: Promote and coordinate international action of Christian democrat parties; pursue doctrinal studies and promote political studies; ensure the affirmation of humanist and Christian values and principles of freedom, democracy and social justice.
activities: Seminars, meetings, conferences on topics such as women, human rights, civil and political rights.

name: International Young Democratic Union (IYDU)
aims: Promote and defend the ideals and cultural heritage of pluralist democracies; contribute to and participate in the workings of IDU; extend and strengthen cooperation among member organizations

name: Federation of Latin American Journalists
aims: Defend the freedom of the press and of access to information; improve working conditions; contribute to friendship among the peoples of Latin America and the Caribbean; show solidarity with journalists who are persecuted.

name: International Democrat Union (IDU)
aims: Promote a free, open and democratic society, the free market economy, the rule of law, social justice, the role of the family, and a society where conditions are created to enable everyone to reach their full potential and carry out their responsibilities to their fellow men and women; Foster the common philosophy of member parties; establish permanent relations at a bilateral and multilateral level and encourage mutual support; provide a forum for the exchange of views and information on matters of interest to all or a considerable number of member parties
activities: Undertakes fact-finding missions, for example to: Central America; the Middle East. SFCA develops internal reports on specific international questions, providing the basis for public communiques and for recommendations to the leadership of member parties. Occasional ad hoc groups monitor important national elections and prepare for future work, notably Informal Group on Africa

name: Latin American Federation of Press Workers
aims: Promote the organization of workers in the press sector in all countries of Latin America, providing material and technical assistance as necessary, and organizing necessary services at the Latin American level, cooperating in national-level provision of such services; promote unity at the national level among all organizations in the sector to render the activities more effective; study, promote, defend and represent the interests of press workers with government bodies in Latin America and worldwide, in line with workers' rights and interests; defend and promote the right for free and democratic organization of all press workers; monitor respect for freedom of information and expression.
activities: Organizes meetings, seminars, training workshops, correspondence courses. Hold congresses (every four years).

name: Arab Organization for Human Rights (AOHR)
aims: Call for respect of human rights and fundamental freedoms of all citizens and individuals in Arab countries in accordance with provisions of international human rights instruments; defend any individual or group whose human rights are subjected to violations which are contrary to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant of Economic, Social, and Cultural Rights and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights; endeavor, regardless of political considerations, to obtain release of detained or imprisoned persons, and seek relief and assistance for persons whose freedom is restricted in any way or who are subjected to coercion of any kind because of their beliefs and political convictions, or for reasons of race, sex, color or language; protest in cases where a fair trial is not guaranteed; provide legal assistance were necessary and possible; call for improvement in conditions of prisoners of conscience; work for amnesty of persons sentenced for political reasons.
activities: Carries out field missions in an effort to release political prisoners, in some cases as an observer and in others as a member of the defense panel. Receives complaints from individuals, groups and organizations and contacts the concerned authorities. In addition to the offering of legal assistance in several cases, the organization provides financial assistance to families of victims. In coordination with the Arab Lawyers' Union launched a campaign for 'Freedom for Prisoners of Conscience in the Arab World'. Conferences and seminars. Instrumental in setting up Arab Institute for Human Rights. (IADH, #00475).

name: Inter-African Union of Human Rights
aims: Ensure that the rule of law is pre-eminent and that rights and liberties are respected; encourage the study and promotion of human and peoples' rights; stimulate the study and recognition of new human rights made necessary by economic, industrial and scientific development; strive that, by supplementing and reinforcing rather than replacing national human rights organizations, serve as the collective watchdog, at the African level, of principles embodied in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the African Charter of Human and Peoples' Rights.
activities: Field investigations in tension areas; campaigns to promote signing and ratification of human rights instruments and procedures for harmonizing international law with international human rights treaties; roster of eminent individuals committed to human rights.

name: South American Commission for Peace, Regional Security and Democracy
aims: Contribute to the conversion of South America into a peace region; consolidate the democratic process in the region; promote the development of democratic concepts of regional security; stimulate regional political cooperation in peace and security matters.
activities: Seminars; meetings; working groups. Instrumental in setting up People's Alliance for Social Development.

name: North American Federation for Freedom and Democracy (NAFFD)
aims: Support and champion the cause of democratic freedom in North America and throughout the world.

name: Common Office for European Training
aims: Promote the union of the peoples of Continental and overseas Europe, for safeguarding an environment of peace and democracy.
activities: Dissemination of information; publishing activity; organization of conferences, symposia, discussions. Maintains 'Reseau des citoyen d'Europe - Club 93 (Belgium).

name: Asian Regional Exchange for New Alternatives (ARENA)
aims: Improve the quality of life for the vast majority of the underprivileged; prevent the marginalization of peoples and communities, and thus promoting justice and peace in the relationships between the state and the people and between nations in Asia; strengthen participatory democracy as against authoritarian centralization; establish a non-destructive relationship to nature and ecosystems and promote the evolution of a more holistic long-term understanding of nature and the use of natural resources; use the traditional knowledge systems in strengthening the role and contribution of such 'other' or 'alternative stocks of knowledge' in a non-dichotomous sense to that of the practice of 'modern' knowledge.
activities: Work organized around clusters on themes of concern. Current themes of concern: Alternative development paradigms and social research; Critical Asian thinking; Science, technology and technology hazards; Ecology, environment and sustainable agriculture; Ethnic, religious and linguistic problems; New information technologies and NGO information activity; Women's question; Social movements; Law, rights and participation. Activities of ARENA related to these areas of concern are carried through linking up with ongoing national activities and initiation of specific projects on a country, multi-country, and sub-regional basis. ARENA HK Centre acts as a documentation and information centre as well as a clearing house. The programmes of ARENA are also carried out with a special emphasis on sub-regional activity and interaction. For this purpose the regional coverage pf ARENA is sub-divided into 3 sub-regions - East Asia, South-East Asia and South Asia. Sub-regional activities, such as inquiries, training and workshops that specifically address the sub-regional realities are done on a sub-regional basis.

name: Christian Democratic International (CDI)
aims: Promote and coordinate international activity of Christian democratic parties, ensuring political solidarity; carry out doctrinal and political research of general interest for Christian democracy; disseminate Christian democratic ideas and promote knowledge of their achievements.
activities: Seminars on the ideological and political platform of CDI. Permanent Committees (4) on: development; economic problems; human rights; relations with the United Nations. Information and documentation service for members. Coordinates political and vocational training centers in most member countries. Instrumental in setting up International Foundation (#07347).

name: Assembly of the Block of Nations in Europe and Asia for Freedom and Democracy (ABN)
aims: Liberate nations subjugated by Soviet Russian imperialism and communism through coordinated efforts of these nations and the re-establishment of independent, sovereign, and democratic states.
activities: International conferences and congresses; publications; press conferences; meetings with international political figures; aid to the subjugated nations.

name: Christian Democratic Women of America (CDWA)
aims: Works for transforming Latin America according to the Christian democratic principles; further and defend the values of the human being and the principles of liberty, democracy, justice and peace; strive to achieve the full promotion of women at all levels of the society especially in the political field.
activities: Training courses; fight for the promotion of women; seminars, meetings.

name: International Movement Against All Forms of Discriminiation and Racism (IMADR)
aims: Embody the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and other international human rights instruments, in keeping with the spirit of the United Nations Charter and in close cooperation with United Nations in human rights activities; in particular, eliminate all forms of discrimination from all parts of the world and promote the human rights; make contributions in order to properly resolve problems in the above field, through such means as investigations, research, educational and appealing activities.
activities: Investigations and research concerning all forms of discrimination existing in the world. Lecture classes and meetings; study meetings. Participates in and makes proposals to human rights related conferences held by the United Nations and its specialized agencies. Publishing activity.

name: World Organization Against Torture (OMCT)
aims: Struggle against torture, summary executions, disappearances, psychiatric internment for political reasons and all other cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment.
activities: Facilitates virtually instantaneous intervention on behalf of people threatened by torture, thanks to the information transmitted daily by the Organization's world-wide network of reliable organizations. Operates on four levels (1): by ensuring rapid distribution of information; (2) by offering a contact NGO policy for action; (3) by advising organizations about international procedures; (4) by bringing urgent assistance to victims of torture and those seeking to help them in the field.

name: Women and Law in Southern Africa Research Trust (WLSA)
aims: Improve the research skills of women's law researchers; encourage researchers by regional networking; explore and develop appropriate methodologies; involve more researchers in women's large research in each country; provide information on women's legal rights to already existing programs to educate grassroots women about the law and each country; pretty state it for each country which can assist governments, international organizations, women's groups and NGOs to improve status of women; produce comparative data for the region, with a view to assisting those who seek to improve the status of women; disseminate information within each country about women's legal rights; Exchange information between countries about women's legal rights, strategies for change, progress and problems; use research results to develop strategies to empower women to use the law to improve their day-to-day lives.
activities: Development of a regional network of women and men researching women's legal rights. Regional seminars. Studies for all six member countries.

name: East-West Cooperation Programme
aims: Assist in constructing independent, democratic and high quality media in Central and Eastern Europe by promoting cooperation between media professionals - representatives of broadcasting organizations, of the press and of media-related organizations - from all countries of Europe.
activities: Research projects; training of entrants into the media professions; exchanges for media professionals; holding of seminars for broadcasters and media policymakers; monitoring of media developments in countries of Eastern and Central Europe, namely during elections.

name: European Democrat Group (EDG)
aims: As a center-right coalition of members of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe, promote the respect of individual liberty and human rights and responsibilities under the rule of law, pluralist democracy and the support of a free market economy.

name: Europe 2000, Bruxelles
aims: Study systematically and promote, outside any political interference, the conditions liable to favor the maintenance of the state governed by the rule of law, based on the respect of the human rights in the European society of the second millennium.
activities: Submits proposals for appropriate action and legislation to constituted authorities, as well as executive, judicial and consultative bodies. In support of its objectives, Europe 2000 pursues programmes like: organization of conferences and seminars; provision of expert counsel to public and private bodies; assistance to groups and individuals pursuing the same objectives.

name: Romanian World Congress (RWC)
aims: Through peaceful means, assist the democratic forces in Romania to change the communist regime into a democratic regime; implement democratic reforms which should result in social and political liberation of Romania; replace the state-owned economy with free market economy; establish a democratic society in which all human rights are to be observed and guaranteed, thus eliminating any possible discrimination.
activities: Sends humanitarian assistance, medicine and medical equipment to Romania. Cooperates with Christian children funds to assist Romanian orphanages. Propagates inside Romania the goals of a free and democratic Romania. Works with the politicians of the democratic countries to explain the situation in Romania and cooperates with them in achieving the goals of RWC.

name: Unrepresented Nations and Peoples Organization (UNPO)
aims: Represent minority groups and occupied territories not officially recognized by the United Nations; promote the interests of ethnic minorities and peoples seeking independence by the peaceful resolution of conflicts; act as an alternative United Nations offering a voice to officially unrecognized peoples.
activities: Emphasis is on non-violence and movements associated with terrorism are not admitted. Members will be provided with training in diplomacy, conflict resolution and negotiation. Advice will be given on environmental protection and on establishment of democratic institutions.

name: Asian-Pacific League for Freedom and Democracy (APLFD)
aims: Help unite peoples of Asia and the Pacific in promoting freedom, democracy and human rights and also in enhancing friendly cooperation for the economic and social well-being and security of the peoples of Asia and the Pacific region.

name: Caribbean Human Rights Network
aims: Disseminate information to national, regional and international organizations; promote human rights at the regional level - this includes embarking on regional campaigns; assist in the coordination of regional human rights action programmes; facilitate the exchange of visits between persons or groups with a human rights interest; mount missions - fact-finding and election observer missions.
activities: Promotion of human rights in the Caribbean by means of: (a) coordination of regional campaigns on human rights issues; (b) urging ratification of Conventions and strengthening inter-governmental machinery; (c) creating an informed regional public opinion through education awareness; (d) strengthening the capacity of local human rights bodies for effective action. As far as the methods of work are concerned, the Network: (a) Routinely cooperates with regional and international human rights bodies in the exchange of information, joint actions and facilitating missions and visits in the region; (b) Takes initiatives at the request of affiliates; (c) Attempts to interest the Caribbean media in human rights issues. Major areas of concern: police brutality; elections and democracy; freedom of expression. Current new programmes: (i) Death Penalty; (ii) Democracy within the Region; (iii) Documentation; (iv) Penal Reform and Improvement of Prison Conditions; (v) Monitoring Socio-Economic Conditions and its Negative Impact on Caribbean peoples.

name: World Union of Free Romanians (WUFR)
aims: Fight for the following objectives: national sovereignty and independence; territorial integrity within the natural borders of the Romanian people; democracy; equal rights for all Romanian citizens, regardless of ethnic, religious or social belonging; the defense of the rights of Romanians living abroad; the setting up of associations of nations, so as to prevent the emergence of hegemony; preservation of Romanian culture and traditions; accumulation of knowledge about the intimate structure of totalitarianism in order to combat it effectively.

name: Helsinki Citizens' Assembly (HCA)
aims: As a forum for citizens to express their views independently of governments: articulate and promote views, interests and political vision of civil society in the Helsinki region, rejuvenating and institutionalizing the Helsinki process to provide a common security background for acceleration of European integration; strive to create effective guarantees for free and democratic development in the region and its individual countries; promote developments of peaceful relations between states and between government and citizens; encourage new human relations free of ideology in the widest cultural, humanitarian, scientific, ecological and economic dimensions; play an active role in developing peaceful models of conflict resolution.
activities: Concentrate on problems of European, especially Central European, integration: monitors and Cole creates general social, political and other pre-conditions of the integration process; supports transnational and regional integration processes on the level of civil society. Commission themes: 1. 'Problems of Nationalism and (Con)federal Structures'. Main project European Civic Center for Conflict Resolution (#03372). 2. 'Economy and Ecology', including: arms conversion; privatization and economic democracy in Central and Eastern Europe. 3. 'Demilitarization and Peace Politics', including survey on existing conflict mediation concepts and cooperation with existing projects.  4. 'Human Rights, including rights of minorities' - Helsinki Refugee Consensus. 5. 'Civil Society and the Institutionalization of the Process of European integration' - including ongoing workshops (3): (i) A Charter for the HCA - Magna Charter Gentium - European Constitution, cooperating with United Nations Center for Human Rights (#11684); (ii) Direct involvement of civil society (HCA) in the Helsinki Process; (iii) a road for Europe - from confederal to federal structures. Europe of regions project. 6. 'Status of Women'. Middle East Project 'Citizens Dialogue between Europe and the Middle East.' Among other activities, commissions and projects hold seminars and publish reports and newsletters.

name: International Institute for Democracy
aims: Encourage cooperation on a worldwide scale among: national and international foundations and institutions, both public and private; governmental, non-governmental and interparliamentary organizations; and national Parliament, with a view to promoting and strengthening pluralist democracy and coordinating and promoting research into parliamentary democracy.
activities: Collects information on national and international foundations and institutions with which the Institute establishes contacts. Serves as a clearinghouse for the dissemination of information on the current efforts of various organizations and institutions involved in promoting democracy. Promotes research into parliamentary democracy in cooperation with universities and acts as a documentary center on parliamentary democracy. Meetings; training seminars; assistance.

name: Transparency International (TI)
aims: Curb corruption through international and national coalitions encouraging governments to establish and implement effective laws, policies and anti-corruption programs; strengthen public support and understanding for anti-corruption programs and enhance public transparency and accountability in international business transactions and in the administration of public procurement; encourage all parties to international business transactions to operate at the highest levels of integrity, guided in particular by TI's Standards of Conduct.
activities: At the international level TI focuses on the elimination of serious corruption in international business transactions, concentrating on transactions that are currently financed from public funds. In the short term, TI is reaching agreements with a small number of governments in the South and the East to assist them in evolving national strategies to curb corruption in international transactions. TI is bringing its Standards of Conduct to the attention of parties engaged in international business; it encourages these parties to voice support for the concepts underpinning the standards and to make constructive contributions to encourage more partners to take similar actions. Studies and research in the field; provision of specialist advice to governments and other interested parties.

name: European Parliament - Group of the European Liberal, Democrat and Reform Party (ELDR)
aims: Defend and promote liberal doctrine in the European Parliament.

name: Alliance of Russian Solidarists
aims: Promote democratic ideas in Russia.

name: Study and Research Group on Democracy, Economic and Social Development in Africa (GERDDES-Africa)
aims: Promote the democracy for favoring the economic and social development of African countries.
activities: Through its research and program execution body, International Center for Research on Democracy and Development (CIRD), GERDDES-Africa initiated, since 1994, 6 main programs: GERDDES-Elections; GERDDES-Good Governance; GERDDES-Humanitarian; GERDDES-Environment; publications and development of the independent press; general studies and research on democracy and development.

name: Commonwealth Local Government Forum (CLGF)
aims: Provide a broad platform for organizations promoting local democracy and decentralization in the member countries of the Commonwealth; assist creation of partnerships and linking; support capacity-building for local government practitioners; share the practice of good governance with countries and institutions embarking on the path to democracy; build on links within the Commonwealth at nongovernmental and professional levels. Particular concern is sustainable development.
activities: Regional policy workshops. Conferences. Concerns: provision of basic services; low-cost housing and management of squatter camps; basic healthcare; education and management capacity. Instrumental in setting up Commonwealth Local Agenda 21 Network.

name: Socialist International (SI)
aims: Promote social justice by strengthening relations between member parties and organization; coordinate their political programs through conventional methods; establish contact with those progressive forces around the world which work for the application of the principles of democratic socialism.
activities: Current major activities center on: promotion of arms control and disarmament; promotion of concrete action to further north - south dialogue; study of problems of economic development, including questions of energy, employment and environment, promotion of human rights, contributing to peaceful solutions to regional conflicts; support for the democratization process in Africa; advancement and consolidation of democracy in Central and Eastern Europe; development of a democratic socialist strategy for Latin America and the Caribbean; support for the peace process in the Middle East; enlarging Social International's presence in the Asia-Pacific region. Committees and Study Groups (10): SI Asia-Pacific Committee; Committee on Economic Policy, Development and Environment (SICEDE); Socialist International Committee for Latin America and the Caribbean (SICLAC); Socialist International Peace, Security and Disarmament Council (SIPSAD); Finance and Administration Committee (SIFAC); Middle East Committee (SIMEC); SI Africa Committee; SI Committee for the Mediterranean. Socialist International party leaders' conferences are held regularly in confidential and informal sessions.

name: Asian Forum for Human Rights and Development (FORUM-ASIA)
aims: Facilitate collaboration among human rights organizations in Asia so as to develop a regional response for the promotion of human rights and democracy in the region.
activities: Education and training, including voter education programmes to strengthen democracy, programmes for awareness of internationally accepted human rights standards and their integration by local human rights organizations and programmes for awareness and use of UN mechanisms, especially human rights conventions; campaigns and joint action with other organizations on specific issues; fact-finding and research; documentation of human rights violations; assistance to members in election monitoring; internships and exchange visits. Setting up working groups (South Asian and Southeast Asia) to study human rights dimensions of displacement.

name: CIVICUS - World Alliance for Citizen Participation
aims: Promote active citizenship and civil society on a global scale, through voluntary initiative, philanthropy and community service; encourage regional and national associations whose purpose is to strengthen local efforts for involvement and impact of citizens; help establish an International climate to provide global moral, technical and legal support to those trying to develop pluralism and empowerment in their countries in communities.

name: World League for Freedom and Democracy (WLFD)
aims: Spread to all parts of the world the ideas of freedom and democracy and encourage and support their universal application; promote respect for, and observance of, human rights and fundamental freedoms for all peoples; be an agent and coordinating center for international cooperation in economic development and educational and cultural exchange designed to contribute to social progress and better standards of life; combine staunch efforts against aggression, imperialism, totalitarianism, and authoritarianism of whatever form and pretensions, whenever and wherever any of such evil forces appears.

name: World Jurist Association (WJA)
aims: Mobilize the international legal profession through voluntary international cooperation to build law, rules and legal institutions to promote the rule of law; coordinate the development of international law as a requisite foundation for the establishment and maintenance of world law and order; act as a world center for information and communication for the international legal profession; sponsor regional and world conferences on various aspects of public and private international law; promote projects and research to advance the development of international law; coordinate the computerization of law internationally
activities: Sections (32). Serves as worldwide coordinator for development of international law and as a world clearinghouse of legal information and reference services; organizes and sponsors projects of creative research and action in international law; coordinates automation of international law; sponsors international conference for judicial cooperation, and World Law Day and World Exhibition of Law Codes and Historic Law Documents; organizes international demonstration trials; organizes world and regional conferences. Instrumental in setting up World Association of Law Students.

name: IFEX Clearing House
aims: Assist international campaigns for human rights by supplying information on freedom of expression and press freedom, including attacks on writers and journalists and the use of censorship and press laws; provide information to these organizations, the academic community and general public for educational purposes.
activities: Action Alert Network; disseminate information on serious cases of threats to journalists, writers or media organizations via electronic mail and fax. Helps coordinate campaigns in response to extreme attacks on freedom of expression.

name: Avocats sans frontiéres (ASF)
aims: Ensure that every lawyer can act without undue constraints, whenever the right of defense is in question; seek to ensure the organization of a proper defense at the scene of each violence of fair process of law.
activities: Any person or group knowing of a situation in which the right of defense is in jeopardy can seek the help of ASF at the permanent office or from any bar or lawyer within ASF membership. On the one hand a subsidiary assistance, which enables the defense lawyer on the spot to act with all freedom and independence, may be offered, and, on the other hand, a delegate from ASF takes charge of organizing the defense.

name: El Taller
