aims: As a worldwide movement of (NGDOs), work towards building a strong civil society dedicated to democracy, human rights and sustainable development; encourage and facilitate reflection, networking and innovation around development issues.
activities: Supports capacity building in NGOs through a major three-month course organized twice a year (Spring and Autumn). Regional programs for global understanding; international conferences and networking; communication and publications.

name: Reporters sans frontieres - international
aims: Defend the press freedom worldwide.
activities: Working to help threatened or imprisoned journalists and censored media. Organizes sponsorship for imprisoned journalists by newspapers, radio and TV stations. Publicizing violations of press freedom. Encouraging debate on problems connected with press freedom, especially issues involving professional standards and codes of conduct. Interceding with major international organizations.

name: European People's Party - Christian Democrats (EPP)
aims: Contribute to the building of a federal Europe and a world based on cooperation and on joints working of all people worldwide; ask every man and woman - be they Christians or not, be they believers or not - to join the Christian Democrats in order to build together a better world based on greater justice, greater solidarity and greater democracy.
activities: Statutory converses. Relations with the Council of Europe through Christian Democrat Parliamentary Group in the Council of Europe (#01924) and the Committee of Regions through Group of the European People's Party in the Committee of the Regions (#05301). Joint Committees with EUCD (4): Central and Eastern Europe; security and defense; international relations; Latin America. Set up Christian Democratic Academy for Central and Eastern Europe (Hungary). Instrumental in setting up Groupe de coordination 'Europe central et orientale'. Proposes setting up Scientific Institute of the European People's Party.

name: Amnesty International
aims: Campaign to free all prisoners of conscience - people detained anywhere for their beliefs or because of their ethnic origin, sex, colour, or language - who have not used or advocated violence; ensure fair and prompt trials for political prisoners; abolish the death penalty, torture and other cruel treatments of prisoners; end extrajudicial executions and disappearances; oppose abuses by opposition groups, such as hostage taking, torture, killing of prisoners and other arbitrary killings.
activities: Conducts impartial research and organizes worldwide action by local members on behalf of prisoners held in countries other than their own. Local groups appeal for release of prisoners of conscience, join campaigns highlighting political imprisonment and detention without charge or trial and participate in urgent action networks to bring immediate pressure in cases where torture, 'disappearance' or execution are feared. Medical groups involved in campaigning and awareness raising within the medical profession. Observers are sent to observe trials and delegates visit countries to interview prisoners and hold talks with government officials. Organizes 'Amnesty International Week' each October; publicizes three 'Worldwide Appeals' cases each month to be the focus of postal campaigns for the release of prisoners and/or investigation of their case. Conference for the Abolition of Torture, 1973; Conference for the Abolition of the Death Penalty, 1977; International conference on Extrajudicial Executions 1982; International Conference on Disappearances and Political Killings, 1992;appeal for the establishment of an International Criminal Court (ICC, #13920) by the year 2000, launched Oct 1996. Amnesty International received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1977 for its contribution to 'securing the journal for freedom, for justice, and thereby also for peace in the world'. In 1978, on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, AI was awarded the United Nations Human Rights Prize for 'outstanding achievements in the field of human rights'.

name: Association for the Promotion of the International Circulation of the Press (DISTRIPRESS)
aims: Assist in the promotion of the freedom of the press throughout the world; support and aid all national and international action promoting the free flow of ideas by word and image and intervention against all measures which hinder or aim to prevent such a free flow; further the interests of the press distribution trade
activities: Annual Congresses. Special regional Conventions (every 3 years). Working Committees investigate matters of common interest. Working Committees (6): Membership; Marketing; New Technology; Tax; Transport; Competition and External Relations. Organizes seminars. Intervenes directly or through national or international authorities when free international circulation of the press is held up or hindered.

name: International Alliance of Women (IAW)
aims: Secure all such reforms as are necessary to establish a real equality of liberties, status, and opportunities between men and women in all spheres of life; urge women to accept their responsibilities and use their rights and influence in public life to ensure that the status of every individual, without distinction of sex, race, or creed, shall be based on respect for the person, the only guarantee for individual freedom and peace; promote a better quality of life and good understanding among peoples
activities: Organizes: triennial Congress with workshops to formulate an action program for next triennium, which is then approved in plenary sessions; regional board meeting and seminar (annual), with follow-up workshops and projects. Priorities for 1999-2002: civil and political rights; education for all - legal literacy; poverty; violence, including - (a) trafficking in women and children, (b) domestic violence, (c) violence in general; health; nutrition; environment and habitat. Cooperates with other NGOs and with the United Nations specialized agencies on: peace; nationality of married women; equal pay and discrimination in employment; discrimination in education; slavery and suppression of traffic in persons; elimination of discrimination against women and girls; equal access to technology; violence against women in the family

name: International Association of Democratic Lawyers (IADL)
aims: (a) Facilitate contact and exchanges of views between lawyers and lawyers' associations of all countries and foster understanding and goodwill among them; (b) work together to achieve the aims set out in the Charter of the United Nations; (c) ensure common action by lawyers: - (i) to encourage in the realm of law the study and practice of the principles of democracy, making for the maintenance of peace and cooperation among nations; (ii) - to restore, defend and develop democratic rights and liberties in legislation and in the practice; (iii) - to promote the independence of all peoples and oppose any restriction on this independence whether in law or in practice; (vi) - to defend and promote human rights and peoples rights; (v) - to promote preservation of ecology and healthy environment; (vi) - to work for strict adherence to rule of law and independence of judiciary and legal profession; (vii) - to defend peoples' rights to development and for the creation of conditions of economic equality, enjoyment of fruits of scientific progress and natural resources
activities: Research on legal problems; study and practice of the principles of democracy making for the maintenance of peace and cooperation between nations; defence and development of democratic rights and liberties in legislation and in the practice of law. Organizes international commission of enquiry and conferences on specific topics such as: the new economic order; racism and apartheid; human rights; decolonization and self-determination.

name: International Bar Association
aims: Establish and maintain permanent relations and exchanges between bar associations and law societies and individual lawyer members throughout the world; discuss problems of professional organization and status; advance the science of jurisprudence in all its phases; by common study of practical legal problems, promote uniformity and definition in appropriate fields of law; promote the administration of justice under law among peoples of the world; in execution of these objects promote in their legal aspects the principles and aims of the United Nations and cooperate with, and promote coordination among, international juridicial organizations having similar purposes.
activities: IBA works through three main areas of activity: (i) support for C03 activities of bar associations and in particular developing bars; (ii) support of human rights for lawyers worldwide; (iii) services for individual lawyer members through the 3 sections, specialist committees and fora. International Bar Association – Section on Business Law (SBL) (26 committees) formed in 1970, includes capital markets forum for participating in ICMG. International Bar Association – Section on Legal Practice (22 committees) formed in 1974. International Bar Association – Section on energy and natural resources Law (7 committees) formed in 1983. Specialist fora covering Arab, Asia-Pacific and Eastern European regions and representing academics, judges and capital markets. Standing committees: credentials; confidentiality; educational trust; finance; foreign legal practitioners; general professional program; globalization of law; human rights - IBA human rights Institute, launched December 5, 1995; IBA foundation; international liaison with legal organizations; multi-disciplinary practice; nominations; PR and marketing; Professional ethics; Twinning; UNWOC (United Nations and other worldwide organization committee); WTO working party on professional services. Organizes national, regional and international conferences and seminars.

name: International Commission of Jurists (ICJ)
aims: Support and advance those principles of justice which constitute the basis of the rule of law; mobilize the jurists of the world in support of the rule of law; promote and protect human rights; aid and encourage those who are denied the rule of law.
activities: Organizes: public meetings; conferences; congresses; missions and visits to different countries; international exchanges; activities for law students and young lawyers. Observes trials and reports on human rights situations in various countries worldwide and has promoted independence of judges and lawyers in Asia, Africa, Eastern Europe and former USSR, Latin America and the Caribbean. Participates in UN seminars. Works to improve legal services in rural areas. Carrying out a world inquiry into definition of the rule of law. Created center for the independence of judges and lawyers to promote and protect the independence of the judiciary and the legal profession. Proposed the setting up of African Court of Human and Peoples' Rights.

name: International Council of Women (ICW)
aims: Bring together in association women's voluntary organizations worldwide for consultation and action to promote the welfare of mankind, the family and the individual; support the ideas of international peace and arbitration, equal legal status for women - including suffrage and rights of citizenship, equal pay for equal work - family and child welfare; support efforts to achieve peace through negotiation, arbitration and conciliation; promote recognition and respect for human rights and work for removal of discrimination, such as that based on birth, right race, sex, language or religion; promote equal rights and responsibilities for both sexes in all spheres; encourage women to recognize their responsibilities in the community and train and stimulate them to participate in public life on local, national and international level; deepen understanding and increase mutual sympathies of women through international contacts.
activities: Work is directed to make known the principles of human rights and achieving their application and every aspect of life. Studies questions which affect the status of women and their capacity to play an active part in all aspects of life; organizes regional seminars on human rights, literacy, education, the advancement of women and their participation in economic and social development; European center of the international Council of women promotes women's interests with the European Union. International standing committees (5) Status of women subcommittees - legislation; implementation of conventions; human rights; international relations and peace. 'Sustainable development' subcommittees - economics; consumer affairs; women in employment; rural and urban women. 'General well-being' subcommittees - health; environment; habitat; nutrition. 'Communication' subcommittees - education; mass media; arts and letters; music. 'Social issues' subcommittees - Child and family; youth; aging; migration.

name: International League for Human Rights (ILHR)
aims: Promote application of those guarantees of civil, political, economic and social rights contained in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights adopted by the United Nations in 1948 and in the International Covenants on Human Rights.
activities: Works to implement international human rights standards in agreements, adopted by United Nations and other intergovernmental bodies. Monitors and contributes to human rights work of the United Nations through such bodies as: Committee Against Torture; Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women; United Nations Commission on Human Rights; United Nations Sub-Commission on the Prevention of Discrimination and Protection of Minorities. Investigates human rights violations; intervenes directly with governments; makes representations before international bodies; conducts research and educational programs; Publishes special reports on human rights conditions; assists victims; sends observers to political trials; dispatches special investigative missions to inquire into specific violations and effect redress; supports and helps establish human rights groups in different countries; works to establish international human rights standards. Public and private meetings. Annual Human Rights Prize awarded.

name: International Organization of Journalists (IOJ)
aims: Combat any form of censorship; work for democratization of mass communication media in different regions of the world, giving priority to the trade union movement defending material, professional and moral interests of journalists, focusing in particular on security and the exercise of the profession; encourage creation and development of journalists' trade unions for the defense of their moral and material rights, in particular through collective bargaining; protect and strengthen professional rights and freedoms of journalists; promote professional standards of journalists and strengthen their social responsibility in line with international ethical principles; defend and promote the right of the peoples to freedom of information and of expression in line with The Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the international covenant on civil and political rights and the international covenant on economic, social and cultural rights; promote the democratization and decolonization of local, national, regional and international media, above all by promoting world unity and solidarity of journalists, particularly through coordination of actions for protection of journalists on dangerous missions; assure contacts, cooperation and exchange of information among member organizations; establish and maintain close relations with national, regional and other international organizations in the interest of the world community of journalists; represent the profession at the United Nations and its specialized agencies; fight for job security; defend the right of access to information sources and the right to protect the sources of information; disseminate information on copyright and promote its defense; contribute to the struggle of the peoples for peace, disarmament, development and progress, against racism and all other forms of discrimination; support worldwide efforts to preserve the environment and promote constant economic development; defense of a new international information order with a view to balancing the information flow between different regions of the world.
activities: Develops programs in the field of professional training and permanent study on the impact of new technology currently introduced in mass media. Works to unify the international movement of journalists by seeking cooperation with the international Federation of journalists (IFJ) and with national and regional organizations of journalists even if they are not directly associated with IOJ. Maintains international rest home for journalists.

name: International PEN
aims: Promote and maintain friendship and intellectual cooperation between men of letters in all countries in the interests of literature, freedom of expression and international goodwill. PEN is not concerned with State or party politics and must not be used to serve their interests. PEN Charter affirms that literature should remain common currency in spite of political or international upheavals and that works of art are the property of humanity at large; and stands for the unhampered transmission of thought within and between nations.
activities: Organizes: international Congresses; other Congresses; symposia; seminars; regional conferences; dialogs. Local meetings organized by Centers, many of which publish their own newsletters, books and pamphlets. 'PEN Writers in Prison Committee' works for the release of writers imprisoned for expressing their opinions; foundation PEN emergency fund, based in the Netherlands, gives practical aid to the dependents of imprisoned or harassed writers; translations and linguistic rights committee – encourages translation from and between 'small' languages. Includes: international PEN women writers committee (IPWWC).

name: International Press Institute (IPI)
aims: Further and safeguard the freedom of the press: free access to news; free expression of views; free publication of newspapers. Achieve understanding among editors and so among peoples; promote free exchange of accurate and balanced news among nations; improve the practice of journalism.
activities: Provides information on press freedom; carries out editorial research. Organizes: conferences; training programmes and seminars in Africa, North America, South America, Asia and Europe (including Central and Eastern Europe).

name: International Union of Local Authorities (IULA)
aims: Promote local government as a corner stone of democracy; represent and defend the interests of local government at the national and international level; foster improvement in the quality of local decision-making, administration and service provision; strengthen local government and its institutions as instruments for socioeconomic development, with special emphasis on national associations; promote and encourage international information exchange and cooperation between local governments.
activities: Specialist interest groups meet regularly, hold seminars and conferences. Holds world Congresses (every two years) and regional seminars, conferences, symposia. Associated organizations: international city/county management association; international Council for local environmental initiatives; International daughter company's network of IULA (IDCN); IULA Municipal Insurance Group; IULA Office for Research and Training; Towns and Development; World Academy for Local Government and Democracy; World union of wholesale markets within IULA. A standing committee, called World capitals Forum (WCF), promotes exchanges between mayors and governors of capital cities around the world. Instrumental in setting up: world Association of cities and local authorities coordination.

name: International Union of Socialist Youth (IUSY)
aims: Propagate amongst the younger generation the principles of free and democratic socialism; further practical cooperation among democratic socialist youth and student organizations of all countries so as to strengthen international solidarity among young socialists worldwide in the fight against fascism, racism, discrimination and for the liberation of men and particularly women from all exploitation and for the rights of all peoples to free and independent development, for protection of environment and for human rights
activities: Summer camps; training seminars; briefings on specific topics; worldwide and regional political campaigns and gatherings; missions; delegations; solidarity brigades; speaking tours; study sessions. Publishing activity. Promotes exchanges among the various organizations. Organizes international conferences. Organizes IUSY world festivals (about every 2 to 3 years), gatherings of members of all affiliates during 7-10 days, with political and cultural programs. Instrumental in setting up European Political Youth Council (EPYC).

name: Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU)
aims: As the world organization of sovereign states and focal point for world-wide parliamentary dialogue, work for peace and cooperation among peoples and for the firm establishment of representative institutions. To that end, it: (a) Fosters contacts, coordination and exchange of experience among Parliaments and parliamentarians of all countries; (b) Consider questions of international interest and express views on such issues with a view to bring about action by parliaments and parliamentarians; (c) contribute to the defense and promotion of human rights, which are universal in scope and respect for which is an essential factor of parliamentary democracy and development; (d) contribute to better knowledge of the working of representative institutions and to the strengthening and development of their means of action.
activities: Examines objectively all international questions suitable for settlement by parliamentary action, in particular at two major sessions annually. Work is essentially carried out in five fields: promotion of democracy; action for peace and cooperation, including a process for Interparliamentary Conference on Security and Cooperation in the Mediterranean (CSCM); human rights, including human rights of parliamentarians; women's issues with special emphasis on women's participation in politics; sustainable development. In 1976, the Union adopted 'Procedure for the Examination and Treatment of Communications Concerning the Violation of the Human Rights of Parliamentarians' which is applicable to any member of parliament from any country who is the victim of arbitrary measures during the exercise of his mandate, whether the parliament was in session or in recess or has been dissolved by unconstitutional or emergency measures. Since Nov 1979, IPU has organized meetings of parliamentarians attending the UN General Assembly in New York and in 1996 concluded a formal cooperative agreement with the United Nations and recently with FAO, ILO, UNESCO, and UNDP.

name: Women's International Democratic Federation (WIDF)
aims: Unite women regardless of race, nationality, religion and political opinion, so that they may work together to win, implement and defend their rights as mothers, workers and citizens; defend the rights of children to life, well-being an education; win and defend national independence and democratic freedoms, eliminate apartheid, racial discrimination and fascism; work for peace and universal disarmament.
activities: Works for (1) women's rights in society and in the family and for their right to work, to receive equal pay for equal work, to receive education at all levels and for recognition of their social and cultural life – supports women suffering oppression, racial discrimination, apartheid, any form of fascism, colonialism or neocolonialism, through solitary activities, study trips, seminars, roundtable meetings and publications; (2) The right to healthcare and adequate nutrition, so children do not die of hunger; (3) children's, especially girls', right to education, protection of children from violence and respect for their individual rights. With respect to peace, works: (1) for preservation and consolidation of peace; against the arms race, including weapons of mass destruction and nuclear weapons (2) against constantly increasing military expenditure. With respect to NGO activities; was an initiator of the proclamation by the United Nations of 'international women's year' and contributed to the implementation of 'United Nations Decade for Women: equality, development, peace.'

name: World Federation of Democratic Youth (WFDY)
aims: Contribute to the education of youth in the spirit of freedom, democracy and solidarity; end imperialism, colonialism, neocolonialism and racist and fascist regimes; ensure peace and security in the world by supporting all initiatives and efforts to this effect; promote active participation of youth in economic, social, cultural and political life by acting against all restriction and discrimination connected with age, sex, methods of education, domicile, property, social status, religion, convictions, color and race, so as to ensure in all countries and for all young people full freedom of speech, of the press, of religious belief, assembly and organization; support the struggle of youth for higher living standards, for better conditions of education, work and leisure and for development of cultural, educational and sports activities for all young people; further development of the young generation in the spirit of peace and international friendship; support the principles of the United Nations charter; support youth interests via international bodies and in affairs of an international character.
activities: Works to combat: racism; racial discrimination; apartheid; fascism. Organizes seminars and voluntary work camp; carries out research on youth needs; facilitates and encourages joint actions by youth organizations of different countries, bilateral and multilateral contacts and other means serving the causes of friendship, understanding and cooperation; promotes international youth events contributing to solution of youth problems; promotes and assists youth organizations whose work is hampered through being victim of imperialist aggression, colonial domination, repression, persecution or national disaster, especially through international solidarity fund; helps to develop tourist exchanges, holiday schemes, festivals, cultural and sports competitions; cooperates with national, Continental and international organizations including trade unions and other professional organizations, especially for implementing rights of youth. Thematic departments for peace and disarmament, solidarity, youth rights, global problems, international cooperation, press and information, as well as working groups on sport and culture, problems of young women. Attached bureaux (3): international bureau for youth tourism and exchanges (which has consultative status with WFDY); international Committee of children's and adolescents' movements; international voluntary service for solidarity and friendship of youth (SIIVSAJ). Instrumental in setting up world youth rainforest action (WYRA).

name: Commonwealth Parliamentary Association (CPA)
aims: Promote knowledge and education about the constitutional, legislative, economic, social and cultural systems within a parliamentary democratic framework, with particular reference to the countries of the Commonwealth of Nations and other countries having close historical and parliamentary associations with it; foster understanding and cooperation among members of Commonwealth Parliaments; promote the study of and respect for parliamentary institutions.
activities: Provides regular consultation between members of Commonwealth Parliaments. Organizes: exchange of inter-Commonwealth visits and information; plenary and regional conferences; study tours; study group meetings; annual seminar on parliamentary practice and procedure, held in Westminster since 1951; annual parliamentary seminar in another parliamentary jurisdiction. Branches also hold their own seminars. Working Capital Fund supports new ventures and projects, including Commonwealth Parliamentary Conference for Small Countries, for branches of populations of 400,000 or less, held concurrently with plenary conference since 1981. Sponsors in-depth studies on parliamentary subjects by groups of prominent parliamentarians. Cooperates with ComSec in forming election observation groups, including maintenance of a register of experienced politicians to serve on Commonwealth missions.

name: Commonwealth Press Union (CPU)
aims: Promote the concept and ideals of the commonwealth; foster mutual understanding and goodwill through regular conferences in constituent parts of it; advance the welfare of the newspaper and periodical press of the commonwealth through action to safeguard press freedom, measures for training and educating journalists.
activities: Watch for and oppose all measures or proposals likely to affect press freedom; promote measures for educating and training journalists, in the Commonwealth. Annual meetings and conferences every two years. Instrumental in setting up International Press Telecommunications Council.

name: International Association for Religious Freedom (IARF)
aims: Promote development of the religious life in which freedom of conscience is an essential element; promote development of mutual understanding and cooperation among nations of all continents, and tolerance in all areas of culture and religion in the spirit of the kinship of all people; open, maintain and expand relationships with and between organizations and individuals striving for international understanding, cooperation tolerance and a vital religious life, especially organized liberal movement in all religions throughout the world; promote development of culture and education; promote development aid.
activities: Constituent members include Buddhist, Christians, Hindus, Muslims, Jews, Shintoists, Sikhs, Unitarians, Universalists and members of tribal religious traditions. Conducts interreligious dialogue; intercultural encounters; social service network (includes development projects and emergency relief program); advocacy for religious freedom and other fundamental human rights. Study groups on: religious education, social questions, problems of theology in church. Triennial Congress, regional Continental conferences, commissions, chapters. Library (over 8000 volumes). Involved in setting up: World Council of Faiths.

name: International Association of Lawyers
aims: In the interests of the litigant, promote the basic principles of the lawyer's profession, with particular reference to independence and freedom; establish permanent relations and exchanges among bars, societies and national federations or associations of lawyers and support their actions and work; defend ethical and material interests of members of the profession and jointly study questions related to professional status and organization; contribute to the establishment of an international legal order based on the principle of justice among nations through law for the sake of peace.
activities: Organizes congresses, symposia, seminars. Has produced: an 'International charter of legal defense rights'; an 'International Charter of Access to Justice for All'; 'Charter of the Rights of Minorities'.

name: Socialist International Women (SIW)
aims: Strengthen relations among member organizations; promote action programs to overcome any discrimination in society, including inequality between men and women; work for human rights in general, development and peace; promote knowledge and understanding amongst women of the aims and tasks of democratic socialism; extend relations between members and nonmember socialist-oriented women's groups which desire cooperation.
activities: Organizes: exchange visits; seminars; International Women's Day meetings; projects to help women in developing countries. Themes recently dealt with: discrimination against women in legislation; foreign debt – how can women break the cycles of affluence in poverty? Indigenous peoples of the Americas; abolition of capital punishment; referendum in Western Sahara; organizing and educating women in politics; women and Health; the family – women's responsibility? Women in changing economic systems; an end to war and the abuse of women in former Yugoslavia; women and violence in society; ideological changes – Continuing male dominance; implementation of the quota for women; women changing places; women in Tibet; UN conference on population and development, Cairo; Women and the social summit, 1995; Azerbaijan; women's education - the key to economic development; fourth world Congress on women, 1995; socialist women in the 90s and beyond - new ways of organizing; equality in the new millennium; women in Burma; rights of women in the Mediterranean region; women and the globalization of the world economy; women and sustainable development

name: International Federation of Free Journalists (IFFJ)
aims: As an international organization of professional journalists of Eastern and Central European origin, employed in newspaper and other mass media: uphold the principles of freedom of the press; promote national and human rights; defend the rights of individuals to objective and complete information; propagate honesty of news; raise standards or ethics in journalism.
activities: Makes representations against activities threatening freedom of expression, against the harassment, persecution and detention without trial of journalists and against censorship and suppression of mass media. Cooperates in inter-European affairs, maintaining contact with the newly independent states of Central and Eastern Europe through their diplomatic representatives. Participates in human rights conferences

name: World Association of Newspapers (WAN)
aims: Defend and promote press freedom, and economic independence of newspapers as an essential condition for that freedom; contribute to development of newspaper publishing by fostering communications and contacts among newspaper executives; promote cooperation among newspaper publishers in member nations; represent the newspaper industry and defend press freedom, professional interests and business interests in international discussions on media issues; oppose restrictions on circulation of newspapers and on advertising; promote and develop a free press and information activities in developing countries.
activities: Campaigns against press freedom violations; channels legal aid to victimized journalists; represents the newspaper industry in international discussions on media issues. 'Newspaper Management and Marketing Bureau' helps newspapers to: increase readership; sustain and increase advertising and other revenues. World Editors Forum provides opportunities for senior news executives to exchange ideas and information about the business of editing newspapers. Fund for press freedom development promotes growth of free and Independent newspapers in developing countries through training and other forms of assistance. Through 'Newspaper in Education Program', organizes international cooperation to encourage the culture of reading newspapers through the establishment and development of NIE activity worldwide.

name: International Association of Judges (IAJ)
aims: Defend the independence of the judiciary, as an essential requirement of the judicial function and guarantee of human rights and freedom; protect constitutional and moral position of the judiciary; promote exchange of cultural relations; organize and intensify cordial relations among judges of different countries
activities: Organizes congresses and meetings for study of the judicial system and of unification of law generally; assists in arrangement of exchange visits. Study commissions: judicial administration and status of the judiciary; civil law and procedure; criminal law and procedure; public and social law

name: Law Association for Asia and the Western Pacific (LAWASIA)
aims: Promote the administration of justice, the protection of human rights and the maintenance of the rule of law; advance legal education; diffuse knowledge of the laws of member countries; promote development of the law, and uniformity where appropriate; further international understanding and goodwill; foster relations and intercourse between lawyers and uphold and advance the status of the legal profession in the region
activities: Sections (5): judicial; energy loss; family law; general practice; business law. Standing committees (23): arbitrations and ADR; banking and finance; communications and media; comparative constitutional; computer and technology; consumer protection; corporate and securities; criminal law; enforcement of foreign judgments; environmental; franchising; human rights; insolvency; intellectual property; international trade law; joint ventures and investment; labor; legal aid; legal education; taxation; women in the law; aviation; infrastructure, privatization. LAWASIA holds conferences and organizes specialist seminars. Instrumental in setting up Asian Coalition of Human Rights Organizations (ACHRO, #01430); ASEAN Human Rights Mechanism; Draft Pacific Charter on Human Rights.

name: NATO Parliamentary Assembly (North Atlantic Assembly)
aims: Strengthen cooperation and understanding among member countries of the Atlantic Alliance; urge governments to take account of the alliance viewpoint in their legislations; promote security and stability in Europe and assist development of parliamentary democracy in Central and Eastern Europe; promote development of a common feeling of Atlantic solidarity.
activities: Although completely independent of NATO, constitutes a link between parliamentarians and the alliance, acting as NATO's interparliamentary organization. Votes recommendations and resolutions directed to relevant member governments, Parliament and international organizations, in plenary sessions; produces detailed reports. Works through committees, subcommittees and others subsidiary bodies - Committees (5): defense and security; economic; civilian affairs; political; science and technology. Sub-Committees (8): NATO Enlargement and the New Democracies; civilian security and cooperation; transatlantic and European relations; defense and security cooperation between Europe and North America; future of the Armed Forces; East – West economic cooperation and convergence; proliferation of technology; Northern security issues. Mediterranean special group. Steering group on European security and defense identity. NATO PA - Russian federal assembly joint monitoring group. NATO PA - Ukrainian Parliament joint monitor. Organizes: annual military tours; seminars on European security, parliamentary control over defense matters with East European civil servants, officials and parliamentarians.

name: International Association of Young Lawyers
aims: Encourage meetings and promote cooperation and mutual respect among young lawyers from all countries; defend the interest of young lawyers and study questions of relevance to them; help set up groups of young lawyers in countries where none as yet exists; play an active role in development of the legal profession and harmonization of its professional rules; contribute to provision of full and effective protection of the right of all lawyers to practice their profession freely and of every person to be added, counselled or represented by a lawyer freely chosen and to be entitled to a fair trial by an impartial and independent judge within a reasonable period of time.
activities: Organizes: annual congress; seminars; law courses; Intercontinental and regional meetings; trainee exchange programme, through Permanent Bureau for International Exchange - Secretariat permanent pour l'echange des stagiaires. Standing Commissions (14) address their specific areas through seminars, congress working sessions and publications: Human and Procedural Rights and Responsibilities; Intellectual Property and New Technologies; International Business Law, including 4 sub-commissions: Distribution, Labour Law, White Collar Criminal Law, Antitrust; Future of the Profession; Family and Estate Law; Civil Litigation; Tax Law; International Arbitration; European Law; Transportation Law; Banking and Finance Law; Corporate Acquisition and Joint Ventures: Insolvency Law; Environmental Law. Includes lawyers emergency defense committee, which aims to ensure protection of the right of every lawyer to practice his profession freely and for every person to be entitled to legal representation and fair trial. 'Declaration of Athens' on defense of common principles, adopted 27 August 1966, Athens. 'Declaration of Lausanne' on recognition that regard for professional confidentiality is fundamental to the principle of the right to a fair trial, adopted 27 August 1982, Lausanne (Switzerland) and 2 September 1983 Helsinki.

name: Commonwealth Magistrates' and Judges' Association (CMJA)
aims: Advance administration of the law by promoting the independence of the judiciary; promote education in law, administration of justice, treatment of offenders and prevention of crime within the Commonwealth; disseminate information and literature on matters concerning the legal process; effect closest possible links between members
activities: Emphasizes magistracy (or primary judiciary) where over 90 percent of judicial matters are handled. Provides advice and resource center; organizes seminars, regional meetings, conferences, penal training, exchange visits.

name: International Organization for the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (EAFORD)
aims: As an educational/informational organization, and consistent with the UN international convention on the elimination of all forms of racial discrimination: support respect for, and the rule of, international law as essential to maintenance of world order and peace; promote anti-racism and self-determination as affirmed in the charter of the United Nations; promote equality in dignity and rights of peoples and individuals; support the United Nations and cooperate with its member states; defend the interests of people who are victims of racism and racial discrimination, especially their rights to culture, land and self-determination; support and promote international consensus.
activities: Together with universities and other organizations, convenes joint conferences and seminars on racism and racial discrimination in general and on apartheid, Zionism and rights and conditions of indigenous peoples. Makes: occasional fellowship awards to post graduate students; annual 'International Award for the Furtherance of Human Understanding' for an outstanding publication in English, French, Arabic, Spanish or Portuguese on questions of racism and racial discrimination.

name: Society for Threatened Peoples
aims: Campaign against genocide and discrimination of threatened economic and religious minorities or nationalities worldwide.
activities: Disseminates press releases, making information available for the media. Organizes: conferences; talks with parliamentarians and politicians and press talks with eyewitnesses; vigils, concentrating in large-scale campaigns. Since 1987, has particularly opposed the participation of German companies in the supply of chemical, biological and nuclear arms to the Middle East

name: Regional Council on Human Rights in Asia
Anti-Slavery International (ASI)
aims: Endeavor to obtain the elimination of all forms of slavery, including forced labor and trafficking, through research leading to awareness raising, lobbying of governments and international bodies and public campaigning; complement and support efforts of groups with similar concerns particularly local groups in countries most affected.
activities: Collects and assesses information. Seeks to persuade the governments concerned to cooperate in introducing reforms and persuade more member states of the United Nations to ratify the Supplementary Convention on Slavery (1956). Works through research, awareness raising, lobbying, public campaigns and support for like-minded organizations. Current concerns include debt bondage, child labor/prostitution, servile and early marriage, forced labor and trafficking. Makes Anti-Slavery Award.

name: Inter-African Union of Lawyers (IAUL)
aims: Defend integrity and basic principles of the legal profession; safeguard the independence and freedom of the defense; work towards establishment and strengthening of relations among African lawyers; foster a spirit of solidarity among them; defend and promote public and private freedoms, human rights and the rights of peoples; work for establishment of an international legal order based on justice among nations; set up an efficient legal defense system; support and encourage preservation of the rule of law and independence of the judiciary; participate in efforts to improve legal education in universities
activities: Make representations to countries where legal rights have been threatened; organizes specialized meetings and symposia.

name: Christian Democratic Organization of America
aims: Serve as a link between Christian Democratic parties in Latin American countries by promoting the exchange of publications and ideas; organize research concerning common problems; contact similar parties in other regions of the world; promote and reinforce the democratization process in Latin America and the Caribbean

name: Young Christian Democrats of America (YCDA)
aims: Works for the establishment in Latin America of a social, economic and political democracy of Christian democratic inspiration.

name: Ibero-American Lawyers' Union
aims: Promote and ensure the following of dignity, independence and freedom in the legal profession as essential values for the realization of justice; protect the interests of lawyers and students of law; promote cooperation among members in the development of legal science.

name: Latin American Federation of Associations for Relatives of the Detained and Disappeared
aims: Fight against the forced disappearance in Latin America and the Caribbean through denunciation of this misdemeanor, the clarification of the truth about the facts, the judgment and sanction of those responsible for the crime, the promotion of national and international legal norms which prevent the impunity and the education in the field of the human rights so that such facts occur never again
activities: Main activities: denunciation (immediate and permanent); investigation; prevention and education; coordination. Gathers reports of forced disappearance; issues appeals to authorities; transmits denunciations to competent international authorities; assist members in searching, exchanging experience and publishing information; develops and promotes international solidarity through support groups; provides medical, psychological and social assistance to relatives through support groups in various countries; assists and drafting and promoting adoption of international instruments aimed at preventing forced disappearance

name: Council of European Municipalities and Regions (CEMR)
aims: Secure, strengthen and protect autonomy of local and regional authorities; facilitate operations of local authorities, safeguard their liberties and contribute to their prosperity, in particular through the development of inter-authority arrangements and undertakings; develop the European spirit amongst local and regional authorities with a view to promoting a Federation of the European States founded on the autonomy of these communities; provide for the participation and representation of local and regional communities and authorities in European and international institutions; achieve establishment amongst existing and future European institutions of an Assembly representing local and regional communities and authorities; assist in establishing local democracy in the countries of Central and Eastern Europe.
activities: Mutual Cooperation Programme', funded by ERDF, for exchange of experience, expertise and innovative ideas to prepare for the 1993 Single European Market. 'Local Democracy in Eastern Europe Program' by the European City Cooperation System (ECOS). 'Encouraging Twinning' through Twinning Department which assist European towns in search for a twin authority and in applying for twinning grants. 'Assembly of European Municipalities', every two years, addresses major problems of topical importance in Europe and their applications for local and regional government. Information seminars; study sessions. Exchange of views concerning local and regional collective. Working Groups: Environment, including CEMR Network of Local Agenda 21 National Coordinators; Transport; Employment (ad hoc); Structural Funds (ad hoc). Includes: CEMR Committee of Women Elected Representatives of Local and Regional Authorities (CWERLRA, #03539); 'PRIMEUR Network (Public Risk Management in Europe)'; 'CEMR Public Procurement Network (PPN)', set up Oct 1997, Brussels, 'Committee in the Information Society (ELANET)', set up 1997; Employers Platform.

name: Pacific Islands News Association (PINA)
aims: Develop and maintain freedom of information and expression; raise professional standards of journalism; assist training and communication.
activities: Professional development seminars; training; development of resource material; Pacific media awards.

name: International Association of Broadcasting (IAB)
aims: Defend broadcasting, whether radio or television, as a free means of expression of thought; work for freedom of social communication media; promote cooperation of broadcasters in activities of public interest and social services and the effective representation of broadcasting interests in official or private national and international organizations; sponsor world and regional conferences of a technical, legal, or educational nature
activities: Standing committees: legal; technical; on copyright; on freedom of expression.

name: Inter-American Bar Association (IABA)
aims: Provide a permanent forum for exchange of professional views and information for lawyers to promote the rule of law and protect democratic institutions in the Americas; establish and maintain relations among national and local organizations of lawyers in the region; advance the science of jurisprudence, particularly the study of comparative law; promote uniformity of laws; promote the rule of law and the administration of justice, encouraging establishment and maintenance of independent judicial systems in all countries of the Americas; preserve and defend human rights and liberties; guarantee to the peoples of the hemisphere the free exercise of their civil and political rights under democratic principles; uphold the honor of the legal profession; encourage cordial intercourse and fellowship among lawyers of the Americas.
activities: Organizes conference (about every 18 months); regional seminars. Permanent committees (20), serving as a forum for presentation of papers related to each committee's focus and reporting back to the conference: public and private international law; constitutional law; administrative law (includes: Labor law, municipal law, food and drug law); civil law and procedure; business, banking and securities law; criminal law and procedure; military law; development and integration law; legal education; fiscal law; natural resources and environmental protection; human rights law; economics and the practice of law; labor law and Social Security; philosophy and sociology of law; intellectual and industrial property law; telecommunications, science and technology law; Corporate and institutional counsel; international arbitration law; women's rights

name: Inter American Press Association (IAPA)
aims: Defend and promote the right of the people of the Americas to be fully and freely informed through an independent press; protect freedom of the press in the Americas; foster general and specific interests of the press; promote and maintain the dignity, rights and responsibilities of the profession of journalism; encourage uniform standards of professional and business conduct; promote greater exchange among people of America in support of basic principles of a free society and individual liberty
activities: Fosters and protects press freedom by publishing facts of any action or attempt to restrict that freedom in the western hemisphere. Circulation auditing service. InterAmerican press Association scholarship funds, set up in 1954. Maintains: inter-American press association press institute, which organizes annual general assembly, annual midyear meetings and seminars, and produces publications. Office of Certified Circulation (OCC) started 1954, subsequently became autonomous and was then replaced by national and regional organizations which continue helping to increase advertising income and thus financial independence. Chamorro and Tom Wallace Awards. Committees (13): Awards; Chapultepec; Finance; freedom of the press; foundations; future sites; impunity; international affairs; legal; membership; newspaper in education; nominations; program. Set up Interamerican Investigative Journalism Institute.

name: International Association for the Defence of Religious Liberty
aims: In the belief that the right to religious freedom is a gift of God; encourage all those who are attached to the idea of liberty, without any distinction of race, sex, language or religion, to participate in the crusade against all forms of intolerance and fanaticism; value human dignity such that each individual has access to true existence in every domain and to a flowering of his being so as to discover his true identity; serve freedom of faith throughout the world; create a climate of the greatest understanding and reciprocal respect among people of every faith and conviction, to assist humanity in solving the major problems of peace, liberty and justice
activities: World Congress on religious liberty, jointly with international religious liberty association; regional Congress is in cooperation with other NGOs

name: International Federation of ACAT - Action by Christian for the Abolition of Torture (IFACAT)
aims: Sensitize Christian communities to the atrocity of torture; invite all church members to participate in action on behalf of tortured prisoners; bring messages of hope into the heart of the reality of torture; contribute to creation, promotion and dissemination of legal instruments against torture; exercise a preventative function of vigilance and human rights education.
activities: Organizes: seminars; symposia. Individual members of national ACATs write 'urgent appeals' on behalf of tortured prisoners to authorities responsible for torture in various countries.IFACAT mobilizes all national ACATs for specific situations. Members meet for prayer, theological study and reflection.

name: Confederation of Cooperatives of the Caribbean and Central America (CCC-CA)
aims: Foster and encourage development, integration, consolidation, representation and defense of cooperatives in the region; as an effective manner to achieve structural change in the countries, so they can democratize their political, social and economic life within a concept of justice, participation and peace.
activities: Organizes about 150 national and regional events annually. Sets out strategic guidelines for a common agenda under the headings: integration; development; inter-cooperation; solidarity; representation and defense; institutional consolidation; social justice. Programs: education and training; strategic planning; research; communication; commercialization; development of sectors; business development; information; organization and development. Policies relate to participation of women and youth and environmental issues.

name: Andean Commission of Jurists (ACJ)
aims: Encourage institutional reform favorable to continuity of constitutional order and reinforcement of democracy; reform administration of justice, establishing an independent and efficient system with a spirit of democracy, increasing legitimacy of the judiciary and public confidence in it, and ensuring integrity of judges; promote recognition and observance of the rights of indigenous peoples in Andean countries so that legislation reflects the multi-ethnic and pluri-cultural nature of society in the region and the values and identity of the indigenous population; adopt control policies for illegal drug production, supply, abuse and trafficking which do not exaggerate the criminal dimension of penal law to the detriment of social peace and the rights of the most vulnerable sectors (coca growers whose crops are used to produce drugs, drug peddlers and consumers); protect and work towards observance of human rights in the region, encouraging greater use and efficacy of mechanisms designed for this purpose nationally and throughout the region.
activities: Research programs (5): constitutional approach; drug control and human rights; indigenous people; violence and peace process; protection of human rights. Each program organizes international conferences dealing with regional considerations. Organizes international and national events. Intervenes before governments and disseminates press releases on human rights violations and the drug control efforts. Sponsors proposals before international organizations to promote mechanisms for the protection of human rights.

name: Nordic Christian Democrats
aims: Promote Christian democracy in Nordic countries
activities: Congresses; Nordic meetings; meetings of presidents; meetings of general secretaries

name: International Federation of Resistance Movements
aims: Unite resisters in peacetime as they were united in wartime resistance movements to secure the independence of their countries, liberty and world peace; actively defend and maintain freedom and human dignity; cherish the memory of all who fell for their country and liberty; defend the spirit and values of the resistance; make known its historical role and transmit its teachings to new generations; denounce the horrors of concentration camps and prisons and demand due punishment for crimes against humanity; defend the material and moral interests of those having due rights and causes; create and develop social services in their aid; promote aims set out in the UN charter and strengthen links of fraternity and solidarity between resisters in all countries; oppose racial, political, philosophical or religious discrimination, neofascism, and 'prescriptability' of war crimes and crimes against humanity; work for disarmament and detente.
activities: Documentation center. Commissions on cultural, social, medical matters and on reparations. Permanent commission on fascism. Research services. Pilgrimages to former concentration camps. Congresses; Medical symposia; specialized meetings; consultative meetings

name: Free International Federation of Deportees and Resistance Internees
aims: Commemorate victims of oppression and their struggle for freedom; promote on a national and international levels respect for and protection of democratic freedoms; strengthen bonds between members of associated organizations; ensure moral and material aid required by members; promote and support laws and regulations sympathetic to purposes of the organization.

name: International League of Religious Socialists
aims: Promote development of democratic socialism; facilitate cooperation among and on behalf of organizations of religious socialists and circulate and provide information on their work; contribute to the official recognition of such organizations as coworkers in their respective socialist parties and in the wider socialist movement; maintain close links with socialist international; reduce historical prejudices and overcome traditional tensions between religious believers, religious communities and the socialist movement

name: European Lawyers Union
aims: Unite lawyers who are members of a European bar so as to carry out common activities to favorize: professional practice, freedom of establishment and freedom to offer services; coming together of juridical statutes and professional and ethical practices of lawyers in member states of the European Union leading to an integrated conception of the profession in EU; practice of EC/EU law and law arising from the European convention for the protection of human rights and fundamental freedoms
activities: Scientific Congress (held annually in May/June); colliquia seminars; study days

name: International Association Against Torture (IAAT)
aims: Defend the dignity of the human being and end the practice of torture.
activities: Furthers research and advocacy on the theme of the right to development as the basis for human rights work. Works against the violations of human rights. Advances the discussion of 'The Right of Sovereignty and Self-Determination' as a basis for consideration of human rights, recognizing that the economic models for development being advanced by restricted democracies leave aside this right. Focuses on the discussions around the foreign debt in light of the impact it has upon the economic and social rights of the citizens of the countries with a large debt. Works on the campaign for the 'Respect for International Law'. Monitors prison conditions and treatment of prisoners. Conferences; seminars; exhibitions; letter writing; positions; press releases. Focuses on Latin America.

name: International Rehabilitation Council for Torture Victims (IRCT)
aims: Promote the provision of appropriate treatment and rehabilitation services for primary and secondary victims of torture; contribute to prevention of torture worldwide; promote education and training of health and other professionals in the medical, social, legal and ethical aspects of torture; build up an international consortium to help victims of torture; support international efforts and activities which contribute to its prevention.
activities: Promotes treatment and rehabilitation services for victims of torture and contributes to the prevention of torture globally, and works to create awareness of torture and its effects. Cooperates with international governmental and nongovernmental organizations as well as multilateral, bilateral and private donors in attempt to secure adequate funding for rehabilitation centres and prevention activities worldwide. Works to increase the existing number of almost 200 rehabilitation centers around the world. Instrumental in setting up: International Centre for Victims of Totalitarian Regimes and Civil War.

name: Asia-Pacific Lawyers Association (APLA)
aims: Within the region: enhances status of the legal profession; foster relations, communication and exchange of ideas between lawyers and associations and organization of lawyers; promote administration of justice, protection of human rights and maintenance of the rule of law; advance standards of legal education. Advance the science of jurisprudence in all its phases and promote the study and development of international law and comparative law.
activities: Committees (12): Business Law, including 2 sub-committees - Banking, Insurance; Chinese Law (ad hoc); Dispute Settlement and Arbitration; General Practitioner; Human Rights; Immigration and Naturalization; Intellectual Property, Labor and Employment Law; Maritime Law; Natural Resources and Energy Product Liability; Tax Law. Centers (2): Labor and Management Law; Traffic Law. General Assembly Meetings, seminars, symposia.

name: International Union of Resistance and Deportee Movements
aims: Bring together at the international level - all political or governmental intervention being excluded - associations of resistors, deportees and victims of Nazism in order to defend their rights and claims, perpetuate the memory of their struggles in the service of freedom, oppose any resurgence of Nazism and anti-Semitism and any attacks on the rights and dignity of the human person; promote a policy of genuine peace that respects freedom and democracy.
activities: Studies on: disarmament and peace; defense of liberty; German reparations; history of the Resistance; rights of resistance workers and victims of Nazism; pathology of deportation, interment and resistance. On the initiative of UIRD were formed: International Concentration Camp Committee (ICCC), 30 Jan 1963, Frankfurt-Main; and International Committee of Experts for the Campaign Against a Revival of Neo-Nazism and Anti-Semitism (inactive).

name: International Union of Socialist Democratic Teachers (IUSDT)
aims: Realize the idea of democratic socialism; unite all socialist educational organizations sharing a political responsibility and an affiliation to a section of the socialist international; link internationally all groups of teachers and professors affiliated to the socialist international and persons having official educational responsibility; advocate optimum education of the individual and improvement in society's standard of education; coordinate efforts of member organizations to use teaching in all countries to promote social justice, respect of human rights, peace and international understanding; through an education drawing on discerning mental attitudes and international political awareness, endeavor to establish a socialist society in which every individual has at his or her disposal every means for full development, whether children, young people or adults; focus educational discussion and work on the New World dimension, including the situation in Europe and problems of developing countries. Promote: the passing of spiritual and cultural heritage from generation to generation; preparation of the individual for life and society on the basis of equal opportunity; tolerance and cooperation between different groups in multicultural societies.
activities: Exchange of teachers and pupils; regular exchange of information on educational programs of member parties and of the projects put into effect by socialist governments; close contact with socialist groups in European community and the Council of Europe institutions; supports establishment of socialists educational organizations in less developed countries.

name: African Society of International and Comparative Law (ASICL)
aims: Promote advancement of public education in the field of law and civil liberties in Africa; protect individual liberties; raise standards in administration of justice; provide a comprehensive legal aid system in each African country; with cooperation of justice departments, organize an itinerant ombudsman service for dispute settlement in rural areas; promote the African contribution to the international law; promote formulation of clear, established rules to deal with multiplicity of legal systems - local, religious, national - found in many African countries.
activities: Fieldwork in rural areas to raise standards of justice administration, mainly through national branches. Encourages formation of women's groups to advise on their specific problems, and of law teachers' and practitioners' groups. Preparing legal documentation to provide a record of legal affairs in Africa. Establishing an African Research Library in Africa. Plans setting up a 'School for Diplomats' to provide centralized training for African diplomats. With law-enforcement agencies, organizes workshops for police and other law officers on civil liberties.

name: Pan African Reconciliation Council (PARC)
aims: Promote peace, human rights, democracy, social justice, passive resistance to all forms of violence and oppression, emancipation of Africa and its siblings in the diaspora from the bondage of ignorance and poverty on the basis of active non-violence and self-giving love as a tool for social engineering and ultimate global order; build a social structure utilizing the resources of human ingenuity and wisdom for the benefit of all; ensure a society where no one is directly or indirectly oppressed for the benefit or pleasure of others; advocate fair and compassionate methods of treatment of offenders against society; protect, seek redress and provide welfare support for direct and indirect victims of war, natural and ecological disasters and encourage restitution and reconciliation; work towards abolition of war; help build morally disciplined homes; encourage vocational and collegial relations transcending all tribal, ethnic, creed, national or racial boundaries; promote the adversarial system of justice; uphold the truth in all facets of life.
activities: Current Programmes: Social and economic justice; non-violence; refugees; social conflicts; inter-faith activities; youth and women.

name: Youth Against Racism in Europe (YRE)
aims: Combat racism and fascism.
activities: Organizes: international youth camps; demonstrations; Street campaigns; solidarity campaigns; pickets. Plans: anti-racist educational exchange project and tour

name: Inter-Pacific Bar Association (IPBA)
aims: Promote the rule of law. Provide members with the opportunity to: contribute to development of legal profession, its status an organization, in the "region" comprising Asia and the jurisdiction within, or bordering the Pacific; contribute to development of law and legal structures within the region; meet and exchange ideas with other lawyers who live in or are interested in the region; share information and legal developments affecting the Region
activities: Organizes: annual conference; regional seminars, sometimes in conjunction with other organizations. Sponsors: M S Lin scholarship fund. Specialist legal committee/working committees (16): aerospace law; cross-border investment; dispute resolution arbitration; energy and national resources; environmental law; financial institutions and transactions; immigration, nationality and employment law; insolvency; insurance; intellectual property; international construction project; international trade; legal practice; maritime law; tax law; women business lawyers.

name: International Association for Democracy in Africa
aims: Defend and promote: democracy and human rights in a governance society for sustainable development in Africa; government by the majority; respect of human, minority and individual rights and the right to differ; responsible government for just and transparent management of public affairs; people's sovereignty, freedom of the press and other freedoms to counterbalance other powers; Independence of the judicial system and an acute sense of its responsibilities by the citizen. Monitor democracy and the achievement of the rule of law in Africa
activities: Organizes: awareness campaigns; training seminars; conferences; round tables; workshops; fora for exchange of information; radio and TV programs; exhibitions. Carries out research on: electoral processes; a charter for political parties. Acts as observer to elections. Programs: democratic culture and human rights; governance and peace; sustainable development; women, children and gender

name: Arab Lawyers' Union
aims: Act in the interests of the Arab Nation to achieve its national objectives; facilitate contacts between Arab lawyers; safeguard and develop legislative and judiciary language; assure the freedom of lawyers in their work and the independence of magistrates; allow all Arab lawyers to take cases in any Arab country; harmonize the conditions of the legal profession; establish and harmonize links with international legal organizations; restore the study of Muslim Law as a basis for law; promote and protect human rights
activities: Commissions (9): Arab affairs; Palestine; Unification of law in Arab countries; defense of civil liberties and rule of law in Arab countries; harmonization of legal terminology; rules on the legal profession; socialization; support of the Palestine Liberation Movement; Defense of Palestinian resistance workers. Engaged in founding an Arab Organization for Human Rights. Decolonization action against racism, racial discrimination and apartheid

name: International Association of Political Consultants (IAPC)
aims: Promote, sustain, and foster the democratic process as a matter of principle and practice; bring together political consultants, both specialists and generalists, from various countries to exchange views and information about political developments and techniques
activities: Organizes annual World conference where International Democracy Award is made

name: Memorial - International Historical and Educational, Human Rights and Charity Society
aims: Struggle against totalitarianism in all its manifestations; struggle for rights of the individual, for formation of a civil society and of a state governed by the rule of law which excludes the return to totalitarianism and for active participation in democratic transformation; contribute to restoration of historical truth about crimes committed by totalitarian regimes; preserve and perpetuate the memory of victims of totalitarianism; promote the complete and open rehabilitation of victims of repression and take measures to compensate for damage inflicted upon them; protect the rights of repressed victims and of members of their families, including rendering them legal assistance.
activities: Main guidelines: 1. 'Historical' - collection, study and publication of information about the history of political repression and human rights violation. 2. 'Human Rights' - Collection and study of information on the contemporary status of human rights, including public initiatives in solving the most acute problems in this sphere. 3. 'Charity' - social and medical assistance to victims of political repression. Initiates and participates in erecting memorial stones and plaques in cities of the former Soviet Union where executions and mass burials of victims of political repression have occurred, including publication of lists of executed victims and organization of exhibitions and mass actions dedicated to the victims' memory.

name: European Democrat Students (EDS)
aims: As an organization of Christian Democrat, conservative, liberal and centrist student and youth organizations in Europe: work for a united, free Europe and for the realization of human rights in the whole world of Europe; give students the possibility to meet on an international level in order to promote understanding; discuss educational matters and present solutions reached to relevant political bodies; work for mutual recognition of diplomas in Europe; serve as a network for discussion and exchange of ideas among member organizations; strengthen the ideas of democracy, pluralism and liberty and help create a European Democrat party of all European non-socialists.
activities: Organizes seminars and conferences to provide practical training in international work for representatives of member organizations. Annual summer University, hosted by member organizations in turn. Organizes human rights campaigns and campaigns for European Parliament.

name: Conferencia Permanente de Partidos Politicos de America Latina (COPPPAL)
Central American Association of Families of Missing Detainees
aims: Work for the re-appearance, alive, of missing detainees, particularly those detained in violation of human rights in El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras; support all international action denouncing forced disappearance of individuals as practised by governments; encourage governments and intergovernmental organizations to consider such forcible disappearance as a crime against humanity; assist in creating commissions of enquiry which carry out searches for these missing persons with the aid of their families; demand that governments punish those responsible for instigating forced disappearances; assist medical, psychiatric, juridicial and economic agencies to alleviate the sufferings of families whose parents have disappeared; promote educational activities in the field; provide scholarships to children of Central America's disappeared who would otherwise be unable to continue their education; provide peace and human rights education for children and young people in Central America.
activities: Denunciation of cases of detained-disappeared persons in Central America, asking solidarity, especially by sending letters to responsible governments, claiming their release or consigning to a legal jury. Petitions for the release of missing persons, supposedly kept within clandestine jails, tortured and under poor conditions. Gives moral support to local committees in their struggle against forced disappearance. Research, especially in order to determine the influence of forced disappearances on society as a whole. Special attention focused on education about human rights. Youth and Childhood Education and Assistance Program, including Francisco Almengor Scholarship Program for Children of Central America's Disappeared. Production and distribution of peace education materials for young people in Central America.

name: Union of African Parliaments (UAP)
aims: Contribute to: strengthening the role and prestige of the institution of the parliamentary institution in Africa by drawing inspiration from fundamental African and universal human values; effective concretization of the ideals of liberty, peace and justice; deepening the concept of representative democracy and its effective functioning. Encourage contacts among African members of parliament and between them and member of parliament of other continents; work for the progressive establishment of a genuine African juridicial community founded on political, economic, social and cultural realities of the continent; contribute to fulfillment of the objectives of the organization of African Unity for establishment of a lasting peace through dialogue within the framework of inter-African cooperation and promotion of policies of good neighborliness, non-alignment, peaceful coexistence and African unity.

name: Commonwealth Lawyers' Association (CLA)
aims: Maintain and promote the rule of law throughout the Commonwealth by ensuring that the people of the Commonwealth are served by an independent and efficient legal profession; that a common bond of Commonwealth is preserved and fostered; professional links among members of the legal profession; maintenance of honour and integrity and promotion of uniform standards of professional ethics; improved standards of education and promotion of exchange of lawyers and students.
activities: Facilitates flow of professional information among law societies and bar associations; response to ad hoc requests for information; supports related Commonwealth and regional professional legal association; organizes workshops and discussions; advises and assists in organization of the Commonwealth Law Conference and on follow-up action; administers grants and assists in the formation of regional groups of Commonwealth lawyers; support the organization in operation of Commonwealth Law Foundation;Sponsors commonwealth law book program to provide Commonwealth teachers and practitioners with surplus of law text and reports. Instrumental in setting up: Commonwealth Association of Armed Forces Lawyers; Commonwealth Association of Public Sector Lawyers; Commonwealth Human Rights Initiative.
