Establishing capacity building projects with members in developing Commonwealth countries.

name: European Judges for Democracy and Liberties
aims: Promote a European jurisdictional culture based on the legal values of democracy, essentially respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms; protect differences between human beings and the rights of minorities, especially of immigrants and the disadvantaged, with a view to social emancipation; support European integration in creating a European political union aimed at greater social justice; defend the independence of the judiciary from other authorities and specific interests; promote transparency of the judicial system, democratization of the magistrature and the rights of judges to meet, to express themselves and to form unions; promote exchange of information in a democratic legal culture between judges of different countries.

name: International Association of Prosecutors (IAP)
aims: In response to rapid growth of transnational crime, particularly drug trafficking, money laundering and fraud, ensure greater international cooperation among prosecutors and greater speed and mutual assistance, asset tracking and other international cooperative measures. Recognizing the increasing menace of organized and international crime and the urgent need for an effective and coherent international response: promote high standards and principles in the administration of criminal justice, including procedures to guard against or address miscarriages, in support of the rule of law; promote and enhance internationally recognized standards and principles; assist prosecutors internationally in combating organized crime and other serious crime, in particular by promoting speedy and efficient international cooperation; promote measures for elimination of corruption in public administration; promote professional interests of prosecutors and enhance recognition of the role in achieving criminal justice; promote good relations between individual prosecutors and prosecution agendas and facilitate exchange and dissemination of information, expertise and experience among them; to this end, encourage use of information technology; promote an examination of comparative criminal law and procedure and assist prosecutors engaged in justice reform projects; cooperate with international and juridicial organizations.
activities: Organize his annual conference; develops and promulgates a series of standards for prosecutors; works closely with the UN secretariat to secure assistance of experienced prosecutors for projects and advice in developing countries.

name: European Association of Lawyers for Democracy and World Human Rights (EALDH)
aims: Promote peace, disarmament and understanding between peoples; fight against racism and fascism; fight against discrimination; promote equal entitlement of women and men and respect children's rights; protect the environment.
activities: Formulating draft legal institute instruments in order to influence the development of law and democracy in all the European countries and within the European institutions as well as in the other regions of the world. Supporting concrete projects in other regions of the world with a view to the development and progress of democratic in law-governed relations, in cooperation with the lawyers of the countries concerned. Supporting all the measures undertaken by the European states in the European Union for the creation of conditions for the migratory movements of the world in accordance with human dignity. Conferences; missions; campaigns.

name: Christian Democrat Feminine International (CDFI)
aims: Promote and coordinate international action of Christian democrat feminine organizations; pursue doctrinal studies and promote political studies; ensure the affirmation of humanist and Christian values and principles of freedom, democracy and social justice.
activities: Seminars, meetings, conferences on topics such as women, human rights, civil and political rights.

name: International Young Democratic Union (IYDU)
aims: Promote and defend the ideals and cultural heritage of pluralist democracies; contribute to and participate in the workings of IDU; extend and strengthen cooperation among member organizations

name: Association of African Election Authorities (AAEA)
aims: Promote cooperation and mutual assistance among electoral organizations in the region in the pursuit of democracy by processes that ensure free, fair and peaceful elections.

name: Association of Caribbean Electoral Organizations (ACEO)
aims: Promote cooperation and mutual assistance among electoral organizations in the region in the pursuit of democracy by processes that ensure free, fair and peaceful elections.

name: Association of Asian Election Authorities (AAEA)
aims: Promote and institutionalize open and transparent elections, independent election authorities, professional election administration, citizen participation in the electoral and civic process, information sharing; develop information resources
activities: Projects include: development of Asian-based election resource centre; election observation missions and staff exchanges; distribution of election-related materials; arrangement of professional development opportunities.

name: Association of Central and Eastern European Election Officials (ACEEEO)
aims: Provide political liberty and a favorable environment for fair political, economic and social development; foster free, fair and transparent elections and universal and secret suffrage as the most appropriate means to establish and consolidate representative democracy.
activities: launched the "Eurovotes" initiative, which establishes an electoral training and study center for election officials, observers and other participants. Introduces and shares new election technologies. Maintains the 'Budapest Election Documentation Center.'

name: International Democrat Union (IDU)
aims: Promote a free, open and democratic society, the free market economy, the rule of law, social justice, the role of the family, and a society where conditions are created to enable everyone to reach their full potential and carry out their responsibilities to their fellow men and women; Foster the common philosophy of member parties; establish permanent relations at a bilateral and multilateral level and encourage mutual support; provide a forum for the exchange of views and information on matters of interest to all or a considerable number of member parties
activities: Undertakes fact-finding missions, for example to: Central America; South Africa. SFCA develops internal reports on specific international questions, providing the basis for public communiques and for recommendations to the leadership of member parties. Occasional ad hoc groups monitor important national elections and prepare for future work, notably Informal Group on Africa

name: Latin American Federation of Press Workers
aims: Promote the organization of workers in the press sector in all countries of Latin America, providing material and technical assistance as necessary, and organizing necessary services at the Latin American level, cooperating in national-level provision of such services; promote unity at the national level among all organizations in the sector to render the activities more effective; study, promote, defend and represent the interests of press workers with government bodies in Latin America, in line with workers' rights and interests; defend and promote the right for free and democratic organization of all press workers; monitor respect for freedom of information and expression.
activities: Denounces violations of the liberty of information and free expression Latin America and the Caribbean and defends the physical integrity and the human rights of journalists and press workers. Organizes meetings, seminars, training workshops, correspondence courses. Hold congresses every four years.

name: Arab Organization for Human Rights (AOHR)
aims: Call for respect of human rights and fundamental freedoms of all citizens and individuals in Arab countries in accordance with provisions of international human rights instruments; defend any individual or group whose human rights are subjected to violations which are contrary to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant of Economic, Social, and Cultural Rights and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights; endeavor, regardless of political considerations, to obtain release of detained or imprisoned persons, and seek relief and assistance for persons whose freedom is restricted in any way or who are subjected to coercion of any kind because of their beliefs and political convictions, or for reasons of race, sex, color or language; protest in cases where a fair trial is not guaranteed; provide legal assistance were necessary and possible; call for improvement in conditions of prisoners of conscience; work for amnesty of persons sentenced for political reasons.
activities: Carries out field missions in an effort to release political prisoners, in some cases as an observer and in others as a member of the defense panel. Receives complaints from individuals, groups and organizations and contacts the concerned authorities. In addition to the offering of legal assistance in several cases, the organization provides financial assistance to families of victims. In coordination with the Arab Lawyers' Union launched a campaign for 'Freedom for Prisoners of Conscience in the Arab World'. Conferences and seminars. Instrumental in setting up: Arab Human Rights Documentation and Information Network; Arab Institute for Human Rights.￼

name: Inter-African Union of Human Rights (IUHR)
aims: Ensure that the rule of law is pre-eminent and that rights and liberties are respected; encourage the study and promotion of human and peoples' rights; stimulate the study and recognition of new human rights made necessary by economic, industrial and scientific development; strive that, by supplementing and reinforcing rather than replacing national human rights organizations, serve as the collective watchdog, at the African level, of principles embodied in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the African Charter of Human and Peoples' Rights.
activities: Field investigations in tension areas; campaigns to promote signing and ratification of human rights instruments and procedures for harmonizing international law with international human rights treaties; roster of eminent individuals committed to human rights.

name: Confederation of ASEAN Journalists (CAJ)
aims: Cooperate fully in advancing journalism; promote a health, free and responsible press in ASEAN countries; promote dialogue, discussion and cooperation with journalists, scholars and professionals in the world.
activities: Organizes (every 2 years) General Assemblies and ASEAN Press Conventions. Seminars; workshops; courses.

name: Centre for the Independence of Judges and Lawyers (CIJL)
aims: Works to counter the inroads into the independence of the judiciary and the legal profession by: promoting worldwide the basic needs for an independent judiciary; organizing support for judges and lawyers who are being harassed or persecuted.
activities: Intervenes with governments in particular cases of harassment or persecution and, in some instances, solicit the aid of a network of jurist and lawyers' organizations throughout the world to do likewise. Works with the United Nations in setting standards for the independence of judges and lawyers. Organizes conferences and seminars on the independence of the judiciary and the legal profession. Sends missions to investigate situations of concern, or the status of the bar and judiciary, in specific countries. Provides technical assistance to strengthen the judiciary and the legal profession.

name: South American Commission for Peace, Regional Security and Democracy
aims: Contribute to the conversion of South America into a peace region; consolidate the democratic process in the region; promote the development of democratic concepts of regional security; stimulate regional political cooperation in peace and security matters.
activities: Seminars; meetings; working groups. Instrumental in setting up people's alliance for social development.

name: European Community Organization of Socialist Youth (ECOSY)
aims: Promote and realize ideas of democratic socialism such as expressed in the Declaration of Principles, within the European Union and in Europe as a whole, in cooperation and solidarity with the rest of the world; contribute to construction of a democratic European state; defend interests of youth in the European Union; progressively integrate member organizations on a European level.
activities: Congresses, conferences, seminars, summer camps.

name: Group of the European People's Party in the Committee of the Regions
aims: Promote the ideals of the Christian democratic movement as broadly as possible.
activities: Range of activities with local and regional authorities throughout Europe.

name: Robert Schuman Institute for Developing Democracy in Central and Eastern Europe (RSI)
aims: In the spirit of Robert Schuman, spread and strengthen open-minded democratic mentality based on classical scale of European values; train and educate young politicians from Central and Eastern Europe; organize conferences for high-ranking politicians, public persons and representatives of scientific life on current political questions; promote information flow and further contacts East-West and West-East.
activities: Organizes courses and conferences; promotes political education, training and further training; holds lectures and discussions; conducts scientific competitions. Publishing activity.

name: Comisión Jurídica para el Autodesarrollo de los Pueblos Originarios Andinos (CAPAJ)
aims: Contribute to the fighting against all the forms of discrimination or the acts that threaten the indigenous peoples and their fundamental rights contained in the constitutions of their countries and in the Universal Declaration of the Human Rights.
activities: Juridical support; participation in international and regional meetings and in national seminars and workshops. Proposes to set up: Academia Andina de Derecho Internacional Público (AADIP).

name: Europe at School
aims: Help young people to develop personal and social confidence and skills to help them meet the challenge of modern society in Europe through: general education for democracy; intercultural education; readiness for lifelong learning; mastering of new information and communication technology; transnational cooperation in the field of European education. Create and promote European awareness among pupils, students and teachers.
activities: Europe at School - European Competition – L'Europe a l'ecole  -Concours europeen held under auspices of the joint patronage of the Council of Europe, the european Commission, the European Cultural Foundation, and since 1993, the European Parliament. It comprises: annual art and essay competition; a series of youth gatherings involving prizewinners; training seminars for youth leaders; teacher seminars; 'Europe @t School' Internet Award Scheme. Also organizes: Spring meeting alternatively in Strasbourg (France) or Brussels, on invitation of the council of Europe or the European commission; Autumn meeting an invitation of national committees; European experts' conferences dealing with the European dimension in teaching and education. Coordinating unit organizers European Youth Gatherings in Strasbourg and in Budapest in cooperation with European youth centers (EYCs). Participates in and contributes to programs and projects, in particular those of patrons, allowing mutual benefit in the use of existing instruments.

name: International Federation for East Timor (IFET)
aims: Contribute to efforts being made to create an environment in which the people of East Timor can freely exercise their right to self-determination; endeavor to guarantee internationally recognized human rights for all involved in the decolonization process of the territory.
activities: Propagates the ideals and established principles of decolonization in the framework of the United Nations and disseminate information on the particular case of the decolonization of East Timor. Collects and disseminates data on the human rights situation in the territory, and, if necessary, organizes campaigns to protect people from particular instances of human rights abuse, established as such according to internationally recognized standards. Provides support for various activities needed to improve the conditions of the East Timorese in preparation for the exercise of their right to self-determination. Facilitates consultation and dialogue among member NGOs as well as other interested NGOs to coordinate activities on an international level. Communicates common concerns of participant NGOs to relevant authorities and individuals. Sends observers to UN consultation in East Timor.

name: World Association of Judges (WAJ)
aims: Advance the administration of judicial justice through cooperation and communication among ranking judicial officials of all nations in an effort to bring to bear upon the common problems of humankind the universally accepted processes, procedures, principles and institutions of the rule of law.

name: Cairo Institute for Human Rights Studies (CIHRS)
aims: Analyze and explain difficulties encountered in implementing the law of human rights in the Arab world; promote human rights in Arab countries through development of intellectually vigorous and novel approaches conducive to surrounding these problems. Priorities; democracy versus authoritarian forms of government and authoritarian tendencies within certain rising political movements; philosophy of rights in Arab culture; sectoral and functional domains of rights.
activities: Programs (4): civil and political rights; social and economic rights; women's rights; human rights education and promotion. Programs include research, education, seminars and training workshops. Complementary programs cover education, dissemination of information and international exchange. Research agenda and priorities: A. topics of general nature; B. Topics specific to Arab culture; C. Topics pertaining to modern social and political movements and human rights in today's Arab world; D. Political transformations: implications on human rights in Arab countries; E. topics pertaining to target groups (women, children, disabled, aged); F. Arab-international relations and human rights.

name: World Press Freedom Committee (WPFC)
aims: Support the freedom and independence of news media and free flow of news and information; advocate and monitor press freedom concerns in intergovernmental organizations; assist news media, journalists and journalism schools in developing and post-communist countries through training programs, manuals, provision of equipment and other means.
activities: Serve as a watchdog for news media at UNESCO, United Nations, nonaligned and other conferences. Coordinates cooperative press freedom activities with other groups for greater effectiveness. Administers the fund against censorship. Carries out projects to assist news media and journalism schools in Africa, Asia, Latin America, the Caribbean and Central and Eastern Europe.

name: European Liberal, Democrat and Reform Party (ELDR)
aims: Contribute to create a democratic European Union with decentralized characteristics.
activities: Strengthens the liberal, Democrat and reform movement in the European Union and throughout Europe. Seeks a common position on all important problems affecting the European Union. Inform the public and involves it in the construction of a united European democracy. Supports and coordinates the member parties in the elections to the European Parliament. Promotes the constitution of liberal, Democrat and reform parliamentary group in all international parliamentary assemblies. Develops working relationships among its national parties, their national parliamentary groups, ELDR group of the European Parliament and the liberal, Democrat and reform group in other international fora and ELDR Party.

name: Party of European Socialists (PES)
aims: Strengthen the socialist movement in the European Union and throughout Europe; develop cooperation and the exchange of information between parties; Attempt to define the essential guidelines and common priorities for the main problems arising from the existence of the European Union; guarantee close working relationships between member parties, PES and the Parliamentary Group of PES in the European Parliament; ensure close collaboration and mutual understanding with the Socialist Group of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe; ensure close collaboration and mutual understanding with Socialist International; promote exchanges and contacts with European trade unions, professional organizations, associations and cooperatives.
activities: Priorities: the growth of employment and the fight against unemployment; freedom, the rights of the citizen and individual self-fulfillment; abolition of all forms of discrimination; protection of environment; justice and social protection; peace and security. Secretariat responsible for organizing meetings and providing research/background material. Congresses (every 2 years).

name: International Buchenwald-Dora Committee (IBDC)
aims: Group the survivors of the Nazi concentration camps of Buchenwald, Dora and their 'Kommandos', as well as their families and descendants, in order to safeguard the places of remembrance, the memory of the history, and the struggle of the anti-fascist resistance for the liberty and human solidarity

name: International Sachsenhausen Committee
aims: Commemorate the victims of the concentration camp at Sachsenhausen; promote peace and friendship between peoples so as to avoid all return to fascism
activities: Conservation of the Memorial; contributes to youth education

name: Asian Regional Exchange for New Alternatives (ARENA)
aims: As an interdisciplinary program for Asian studies and research cooperation, recognizing that civil organizations play an important role in the process of social transformation and the search for peace and social justice: promote equity among social class, caste, ethnic groups and gender; strengthen popular participation in public life as against authoritarian centralization; prevent marginalization of communities faced with incursion by modernizing influences; improve living conditions of Asia's underprivileged; promote ecological consciousness; develop the ability to draw on aspects of indigenous knowledge systems which relate to social emancipation; bring together and feed on the experience of fellows from all geographical sub regions of Asia.
activities: Organizes: research studies; workshops; conferences; round table discussions; joint activities. Provides networking and consultancy. Currently setting up 'Exchanges', original school for alternative Praxis. Program areas: 1. 'People-to-People Alliances' - cross-border integration, study of regional integration efforts and examination of local level alliances. 2. 'Gender Issues and Women's Concerns' - interactive studies on feminism, effective sociocultural and socioeconomic formations on attempts of women's movements to understand and transform gender hierarchies. 3. 'Theories and Practices' - theoretical/conceptual research, projects include: monopolization and centralization of knowledge; future of Socialism; Asian thinkers; cultural theory and practice; ecology, science and society.

name: Christian Democratic International (CDI)
aims: Promote and coordinate international activity of Christian Democratic parties, ensuring political solidarity; carry out doctrinal and political research of general interest for Christian democracy; disseminate Christian democratic ideas and promote knowledge of their achievements.
activities: Seminars on the ideological and political platform of CDI. Permanent committees (4) on: development; economic problems; human rights; relations with United Nations. Information and documentation service for members. Coordinates political and vocational training centers in most member countries.

name: Assembly of the Block of Nations in Europe and Asia for Freedom and Democracy (ABN)
aims: Liberate nations subjugated by Soviet Russian imperialism and communism through coordinated efforts of these nations and the re-establishment of independent, sovereign, and democratic states.
activities: International conferences and congresses; publications; press conferences; meetings with international political figures; aid to subjugated nations.

name: Christian Democratic Women of America (CDWA)
aims: Works for transforming Latin America according to the Christian democratic principles; further and defend the values of the human being and the principles of liberty, democracy, justice and peace; strive to achieve the full promotion of women at all levels of the society especially in the political field.
activities: Training courses; fight for the promotion of women; seminars, meetings.

name: International Movement Against All Forms of Discriminiation and Racism (IMADR)
aims: Embody the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and other international human rights instruments, in keeping with the spirit of the United Nations Charter and in close cooperation with United Nations in human rights activities; in particular, eliminate all forms of discrimination from all parts of the world and promote the human rights; make contributions in order to properly resolve problems in the above field, through such means as investigations, research, educational and appealing activities.
activities: Investigations and research concerning all forms of discrimination existing in the world. Lecture classes and meetings; study meetings. Participates in and makes proposals to human rights related conferences held by the United Nations and its specialized agencies. Publishing activity.

name: World Organization Against Torture (OMCT)
aims: Struggle against torture, summary executions, disappearances, psychiatric internment for political reasons and all other cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment.
activities: Facilitates virtually instantaneous intervention on behalf of people threatened by torture, thanks to the information transmitted daily by the Organization's world-wide network of reliable organizations. Operates on four levels (1): ensures rapid distribution of information; (2) by offering a contact NGO policy for action; (3) by advising organizations about international procedures; (4) by bringing urgent assistance to victims of torture and those seeking to help them in the field.

name: Hansard Society for Parliamentary Government
aims: Promote knowledge of and interest in parliamentary government as well as political awareness
activities: Organizes conferences for young people in the UK and international conferences; promotes research on controversial aspects of modern democratic government and unbiased political education in schools and institutes of further education. Monitors the televising of the house of lords and the house of commons (UK). Runs: central and eastern European program; Hansard scholars program.

name: Women and Law in Southern Africa Research Trust (WLSA)
aims: Improve legal status of women in Southern Africa; develop research skills of women's laws researchers; conduct research on gender issues in Southern Africa, particularly those related to legal rights; provide information on gender and the law and influencing policy and law reform in each country and exchange this information among member countries; explore and develop new methodologies and perspectives for the study of gender and the law; cooperate and liaise with other organizations in each country, regionally and internationally.
activities: Development of a regional network of women and men researching women's legal rights. Regional seminars. Studies for all seven member countries. Programs of action (6): activist research (core program); information dissemination and documentation; legal advice and services; lobbying and advocacy for policy, legal reform and change; networking; training and education on women's rights.

name: Europe 2000, Bruxelles
aims: Independent of any political interference, study systemically and promote conditions likely to favour maintenance of the state governed by the rule of law and based on respect for human rights, in European society of the second millennium
activities: Submits proposals for appropriate action and legislation to constituted authorities, as well as executive, judicial and consultative bodies. In support of its objectives, Europe 2000 pursues programmes like: organization of conferences and seminars; provision of expert counsel to public and private bodies; assistance to groups and individuals pursuing the same objectives.

name: Romanian World Congress (RWC)
aims: Through peaceful means, assist the Democratic forces in Romania to change the communist regime into a democratic regime; implement democratic reforms which should result in social and political liberation of Romania; replace the state-owned economy with free market economy; establish a democratic society in which all human rights are to be observed and guaranteed, thus eliminating any possible discrimination.
activities: Sends humanitarian assistance, medicine and medical equipment to Romania. Cooperates with Christian children funds to assist Romanian orphanages. Propagates inside Romania the goals of a free and democratic Romania. Works with the politicians of the democratic countries to explain the situation in Romania and cooperates with them in achieving the goals of RWC.

name: Coalition of NGOs Concerned with Impunity for Violators of Human Rights
aims: Struggle for human rights throughout the world; strengthen constitutional governments in countries where gross violations of human rights have occurred; ensure full respect for human rights and peace in countries which have overcome authoritarian rule.

name: Unrepresented Nations and Peoples Organization (UNPO)
aims: Empower those nations, minorities and peoples not represented in established international forum by: providing a legitimate forum and effective channels to communicate with the international community, including governments, NGOs, IGOs, and the media; detecting and investigating situations of potential conflict, preventive diplomacy and assistance in conflict resolution processes, including negotiations; promoting democratic processes and institutions, and providing services to more effectively empower all sectors of society to participate in determining the destiny of their nations and peoples.
activities: Conflict prevention and resolution by sending fact-finding missions, assisting with negotiation, providing various training sessions and early warning through information dissemination and organizing awareness raising tours for member delegates. Promotion of democratic processes and institutions through election monitoring and providing constitutional and other advisory services. Promotion of effective participation at the United Nations through information dissemination, training and provision of technical assistance to member delegates participating in meetings of UN human rights bodies. Media and information center. Conferences and workshops. Includes friends of UNPO.

name: Asian-Pacific League for Freedom and Democracy (APLFD)
Transnational Radical Party (TRP)
aims: As a Gandhian, non-violent organization, promote international political campaigns concerning: respect for human rights, particularly in non-democratic countries; promotion of democracy and freedom; anti-prohibitionist policies on drugs and against illegal trafficking in drugs; abolition of capital punishment; language rights and the use of Esperanto as the auxiliary language of international institutions; democratic reform of the United Nations.
activities: Campaign for the setting up of international criminal court

name: Caribbean Human Rights Network
aims: Disseminate information to national, regional and international organizations; promote human rights at the regional level - this includes embarking on regional campaigns; assist in the coordination of regional human rights action programmes; facilitate the exchange of visits between persons or groups with a human rights interest; mount missions - fact-finding and election observer missions.
activities: Promotion of human rights in the Caribbean by means of: (a) coordination of regional campaigns on human rights issues; (b) urging ratification of Conventions and strengthening inter-governmental machinery; (c) creating an informed regional public opinion through education awareness; (d) strengthening the capacity of local human rights bodies for effective action. As far as the methods of work are concerned, the Network: (a) Routinely cooperates with regional and international human rights bodies in the exchange of information, joint actions and facilitating missions and visits in the region; (b) Takes initiatives at the request of affiliates; (c) Attempts to interest the Caribbean media in human rights issues. Major areas of concern: police brutality; elections and democracy; freedom of expression. Current new programmes: (i) Women's Rights; (ii) Death Penalty; (iii) Democracy within the Region; (iv) Documentation; (iv); (v) Monitoring Socio-Economic Conditions and its Negative Impact on Caribbean peoples; (vii) human rights education and training.

name: World Union of Free Romanians (WUFR)
aims: Fight for the following objectives: national sovereignty and independence; territorial integrity within the natural borders of the Romanian people; democracy; equal rights for all Romanian citizens, regardless of ethnic, religious or social belonging; the defense of the rights of Romanians living abroad; the setting up of associations of nations, so as to prevent the emergence of hegemony; preservation of Romanian culture and traditions; accumulation of knowledge about the intimate structure of totalitarianism in order to combat it effectively.

name: Helsinki Citizens' Assembly (hCa)
aims: As an international coalition of civil society initiatives, East and West, work for the integration of Europe from the citizens' level; in particular, aid the process of transition of post communist countries, especially in issues connected with basic values of democracy - tolerance, mutual understanding and confidence, human rights and political and economic reconstruction; carry out projects addressing issues of peace and integration among citizens.
activities: Functions as a network of NGOs across Europe, focusing on local and regional issues and cooperating through hCa International secretariat. Organizes: annual summer school for international dialogue; youth network; investigative missions to conflict areas; fora for international dialogue among citizens. Projects have been implemented in the trans-Caucasus countries, Hungary, Poland, Czech Republic, Slovakia and the former Yugoslav states. Commission themes: 1. 'Human Rights - including rights of minorities' - Helsinki refugee consensus. 2. 'civil society and the institutionalization of the process of European integration' - including 3 ongoing workshops: charter for the hCA - Magna Charter Gentium - European Constitution; Direct involvement of civil society (hCA) in the Helsinki process; a road for Europe - from confederal to federal structures.

name: International Institute for Democracy
aims: Encourage cooperation on a worldwide scale between governmental, non-governmental and interparliamentary organizations and among national Parliaments, with a view to promoting and strengthening pluralistic democracy. Establish contact with public and private national and international foundations and institutions and collect information on their composition, objectives and activities; serve as a clearinghouse for dissemination of information on current efforts of organizations and institutions promoting democracy; assist all countries, especially those undergoing democratization or wishing documentation on the functioning of a pluralistic democracy; promote research into parliamentary democracy in cooperation with universities; act as a documentation center on parliamentary democracy; organizes seminars on parliamentary practice and procedure for parliamentarians and civil servants of parliament in new emerging democracies.
activities: Organizes meetings and training seminars.

name: Transparency International (TI)
aims: Focus on combating international and national corruption, increasing government accountability and raising public awareness of the need to curb corruption, through international and national coalitions encouraging governments to establish and implement effective laws, policies and anti-corruption programs; strengthen public support and understanding for anti-corruption programs and enhance public transparency and accountability in international business transactions and in the administration of public procurement; encourage all parties to international business transactions to operate at the highest level of integrity, guided in particular by TI standards of conduct.
activities: Works through the national chapters, which build coalitions to strengthen integrity systems in their countries. Developed 'Islands of Integrity' based on a binding agreement - Integrity Pact - signed by all those bidding for a project and by the procurement agency. Works for international coordination to criminalize transnational corruption and to develop and implement international legal frameworks against corruption, by shaping public policy discussions in various fora.

name: European Parliament - Group of the European Liberal, Democrat and Reform Party (ELDR)
aims: Defend and promote liberal and reform doctrine in the European Parliament.

name: Parliamentarians for Global Action (PGA)
aims: Ensure that no region of the world is left in the wake of progress only to become a source of new dangers; mobilize global political action for an equitable, safe and democratic world; serve a global constituency of legislators, governments, the UN system and civil society
activities: For legislators': acts as a clearinghouse of information and analysis on international issues; provides members with UN, IGO and NGO publications; facilitates interparliamentary caucuses at UN conferences and their preparatory committees; provides informal and formal links to other parliamentarians and their peers. 'For governments': facilitates parliamentarian support for governmental policies through programs on, for example, sustainable development and population; coordinates specific intergovernmental initiatives (nuclear test ban, etc); organizes parliamentary exchanges as part of extended foreign relations. 'For the UN system': facilitates support for the UN system, including affiliated agencies; generates and sustains consensus during UN conferences and in the implementation of UN agendas. 'For civil society': joins with other NGOs to mount broad-based campaigns for specific objectives; facilitates interaction of civil society with parliament and governments. Middle powers initiative set up March 1998, continues the work commenced by PGA in the 1980s aimed at establishing a 'middle power coalition for disarmament'. Also proposes the setting up of: parliamentary early warning network: United Nations parliamentary assembly. Makes annual 'defender of democracy' award.

name: Alliance of Russian Solidarists
aims: Promote democratic ideas in Russia.

name: Study and Research Group on Democracy, Economic and Social Development in Africa (GERDDES-Africa)
aims: Promote the democracy for favoring the economic and social development of African countries.
activities: Through its research and program execution body, international research center on democracy and development (IRCD), has initiated six Main programs since 1994: GERDDES-Elections; GERDDES-Good Governance; GERDDES-Humanitarian; GERDDES-Environment; publications and development of the independent press; general studies and research on democracy and development. Organizes seminars and conferences.

name: Commonwealth Local Government Forum (CLGF)
aims: Provide a broad platform for organizations promoting local democracy and decentralization in the member countries of the Commonwealth; assist creation of partnerships and linking; support capacity-building for local government practitioners; share the practice of good governance with countries and institutions embarking on the path to democracy; build on links within the Commonwealth at nongovernmental and professional levels. Particular concern is governance/local democracy.
activities: Organizes: regional policy workshops; conferences; symposium. Concerns: provision of basic services; low-cost housing and management of squatter camps; basic healthcare; education and management capacity.

name: Socialist International (SI)
aims: Strengthen relations among member parties and organizations and coordinate their political views and activities by consent; establish contact with progressive forces worldwide working for application of the principles of democratic socialism - an international movement for freedom, social justice and solidarity.
activities: Current major activities center on: promotion of arms control and disarmament; promotion of concrete action to further North - South dialogue; study of problems of economic development, including questions of energy, employment and environment, promotion of human rights, contributing to peaceful solutions to regional conflicts; support for the democratization process in Africa; advancement and consolidation of democracy in Central and Eastern Europe; development of a democratic socialist strategy for Latin America and the Caribbean; support for the peace process in the Middle East; enlarging Social International's presence in the Asia-Pacific region. Committees (10) which meet at least twice a year, develop and further policies of SI on particular subsections or regions: SI Asia-Pacific Committee; SI Africa Committee; SI Committee for Central and Eastern Europe (SICEE); SI Committee on Economic Policy, Development and environment (SICEDE); SI committee on human rights (SICOHR); SI committee for Latin America and the Caribbean (SICLAC); SI committee for the Mediterranean; SI Middle East committee (SIMEC); SI peace, security and disarmament counsel (SIPSAD); SI local authorities committee. European Forum for Democracy and Dolidarity (EFDS) assists Central and European countries in transition and includes Central and Eastern European network for gender issues. Socialist international party leaders' conferences are held regularly in confidential and informal sessions.

name: Asian Forum for Human Rights and Development (FORUM-ASIA)
aims: Facilitate collaboration among human rights organizations in Asia so as to develop a regional response for the promotion of human rights and democracy in the region.
activities: Education and training, including voter education programmes to strengthen democracy, programmes for awareness of internationally accepted human rights standards and their integration by local human rights organizations and programmes for awareness and use of UN mechanisms, especially human rights conventions; campaigns and joint action with other organizations on specific issues; fact-finding and research; documentation of human rights violations; assistance to members in election monitoring; internships and exchange visits. Setting up working groups (South Asian and Southeast Asia) to study human rights dimensions of displacement.

name: CIVICUS - World Alliance for Citizen Participation
aims: As a global alliance of citizens and their organizations, pursue a world in which: citizen action is a predominant feature of the political, economic and cultural life of all societies; private action for the public good is expressed by organizations operating sometimes apart and sometimes in dialogue with the government and business; society involves equitable relationship among citizens, their associations in foundations, businesses and governments. Nurture the foundation, growth, protection and resourcing of citizen action worldwide, especially where participatory democracy, freedom of association of citizens and their funds for public benefit are threatened; advance regional and national agendas of common initiatives to strengthen the capacity of civil society; serve as an open forum to facilitate and establish cross sector world dialogue, exchange information, developed a common understanding and shared identity, solidarity, cooperation, and communication within civil society from various regions and promote a common vision about the role of civil society.
activities: International task forces guide special projects to foster progress in 3 areas: increasing visibility and understanding of civil society; enhancing the resource base; advocating freedom of association (international principles for law and regulation for civil society organizations).

name: International Freedom of Expression Exchange (IFEX)
aims: Assist international campaigns for human rights by supplying information on freedom of expression and press freedom, including attacks on writers and journalists and the use of censorship and press laws; provide information to news organizations, the academic community and general public for educational purposes
activities: Through IFEX Clearing House, operates: (i) Action Alert Network (AAN), whereby member organizations report free expression abuse in their geographic region or area of expertise to the clearinghouse, which circulates this information and regular 'action alerts' to other members and interested organizations all over the world, thus allowing members to stay abreast of their counterparts' activities, share information and research and focus their energies where most needed and allowing rapid, worldwide and coordinated response to press freedom and freedom of expression violations. Action alerts help turn the spotlight onto those responsible for human rights violations and lead to coordinated letter-writing campaigns which have helped release prisoners, lift publication bans and even save lives. (ii) IFEX Outreach Programme, launched 1995, based on a recognition of current North-south disparities and designed to support and strengthen fledgling freedom-of-expression organizations in the developing world, Eastern Europe and the former Soviet Union. IFEX provides information, financial and technical resources, expertise and international support and recognition, helping organizations in these countries to build links with the international freedom of expression community. Internet is the main means of communication for the IFEX community, since its speed and relative low-cost allows even those members with very limited resources and international exposure to bring immediate attention to those arrested or endangered for speaking out.

name: World League for Freedom and Democracy (WLFD)
aims: Spread to all parts of the world the ideas of freedom and democracy and encourage and support their universal application; promote respect for, and observance of, human rights and fundamental freedoms for all peoples; be an agent and coordinating center for international cooperation in economic development and educational and cultural exchange designed to contribute to social progress and better standards of life; combine staunch efforts against aggression, imperialism, totalitarianism, and authoritarianism of whatever form and pretensions, whenever and wherever any of such evil forces appears.
activities: Regular activities: annual conferences; annual event of the world freedom day; international academic symposium. Organizes, sponsors or cosponsors such occasional activities and events as exchanges of visits, missions, symposia.

name: World Jurist Association (WJA)
aims: Mobilize the international legal profession through voluntary international cooperation to build law, rules and legal institutions to promote the rule of law; coordinate the development of international law as a requisite foundation for the establishment and maintenance of world law and order; act as a world center for information and communication for the international legal profession; sponsor regional and world conferences on various aspects of public and private international law; promote projects and research to advance the development of international law; coordinate the computerization of law internationally
activities: Sections (32). Serves as worldwide coordinator for development of international law and as a world clearinghouse of legal information and reference services; organizes and sponsors projects of creative research and action in international law; coordinates automation of international law; sponsors international conference for judicial cooperation, and World Law Day and World Exhibition of Law Codes and Historic Law Documents; organizes international demonstration trials; organizes world and regional conferences. Instrumental in setting up World Association of Law Students.

name: Liberal, Democratic and Reformers' Group (LDR)
aims: As a political group, represent liberal and Democratic views in the parliamentary assembly of the Council of Europe.
activities: Bureau meetings, meetings of the faction to prepare plenary sessions of the parliamentary assembly, seminars.

name: Trans-Baltic Network (TBN)
aims: Promote a community of states in the Baltic region living together in sustainable security not only from military conflict but of civil society, with clean environment, respect for human rights, participatory democracy and sustainable development; seek to give NGOs in the region a voice in regional governmental, intergovernmental and non-governmental political processes; enable NGOs from Central and Eastern Europe to participate on an equal basis through building up civil society in those regions by economic and information support.
activities: Annual conferences; further conferences; information seminars.

name: ZaMir Transnational Net
aims: Help peace oriented people and groups, humanitarian organizations, NGOs and the independent media in order to improve their communication possibilities; serve people working for: the prevention of warfare; the elimination of militarism; protection of the environment; the advancement of human rights and the rights of people regardless of race, ethnic background, sex or religion or political convictions; the achievement of social and economic justice; women's rights; the elimination of poverty; the promotion of sustainable and equitable development; more and better democratic structures in society, especially the advancement of participatory democracy; non-violent conflict resolution.
activities: From 4 to 12 times a day, the electronic-mail and news systems exchange public and private messages with each other and with other networks in Europe and around the world. Conferences/newsgroups.

name: International Campaign for Tibet (ICT)
aims: Monitor and promote internationally recognized human rights, democratic freedoms and self-determination for Tibetans and protect their culture and environment.
activities: Working closely with Allied committee of the peoples of eastern Turkmenistan, inner Mongolia and Tibet: conducts fact-finding missions to Tibet, India and Nepal; monitors and investigates human rights conditions; testifies before national and international bodies; promotes news coverage of issues in Tibet. China Project: networks with exiled Chinese democracy and overseas Chinese organizations, works with Chinese language media, conducts research on Chinese rule of Tibet. Contacts with academic, civic and community groups.

name: International Network of Political Leaders Promoting Democracy in Burma (PD Burma)
aims: Improve freedom of speech, respect for human rights; promote democratization process in Burma
activities: Engages in lobby work, communication. Organizes workshops and conferences.

name: Network for the Defence of Independent Media in Africa (NDIMA)
aims: Promote, encourage and safeguard freedom of expression and human rights in Africa, in particular for the press, print, electronica media, publishers and for individuals working for the right to life and human dignity, personal liberty, fair trial and equality before the law; promote artistic talent; support establishment of rural press; educate and create awareness among Africans on public issues, politics and international relations; address new forms of censorship and strengthen emerging independent media in Africa.
activities: Works through contact with governments and authorities, appeals and public meetings. Raises funds to support human rights and freedom of expression. Organizes training programs for journalists. Programmes: Human rights; advocacy and media support

name: Alliance of Universities for Democracy (AUDEM)
aims: Enhance the role of education in promoting democratic institutions and economic development

name: AISHA Arab Women's Forum
aims: Promote legal rights of Arab women; eliminate all forms of discrimination and abuse against Arab women; advance the principles of gender equality; encourage participation of women in social and economic development and decision-making
activities: Organizes conferences

name: Forum International Development Democratie (FIDDEM)
aims: Combine a thematic and global approach, foster interaction and use significant experience to analyze approaches and procedures in the activities and mode of existence of communities, associations and institutions and thus encourage citizenship and support the exercise of democratic participation.
activities: Current program covers Western Europe, Central Europe and Latin America and includes: 'neighborhood democracy, a means of building up Europe' (project supported financially by the European commission); 'migrants and nationals working together', with a view to living together in a climate of trust; provision of services and facilities for the well-being of families – emergence of new partnerships; 'for a civil, democratic and participate of society at the local level' - support to and creation of common working areas (Latin America); Young people – local protagonists and citizens in their town (Latin America - Europe); new experience of integrating juvenile delinquents into society (France – USA).

name: European Civic Forum (ECF)
aims: Exchange information between grassroots groups in Eastern and Western Europe.
activities: Supports the exchange between young people from Eastern and Western Europe; run studies about consequences of the nationalization of agriculture in Eastern Europe and its impact on the world development; supports the independent medias in eastern Europe; runs studies about and supports local democracy in eastern Europe; supports deserters and draft resisters in the war in former Yugoslavia; supports "AIM" an international information agency in former Yugoslavia and the Balkans; supports "Causes Communes" a network of partnerships between municipalities in Switzerland and interethnic communes in former Yugoslavia.

name: Lawyers without Borders
aims: Ensure that every lawyer can act without undue constraints, whenever the right of defense is in question; seek to ensure the organization of a proper defense at the scene of each violence of fair process of law.
activities: Any person or group knowing of a situation in which the right of defense is in jeopardy can seek the help of ASF at the permanent office or from any bar or lawyer within ASF membership. On the one hand a subsidiary assistance, which enables the defense lawyer on the spot to act with all freedom and independence, may be offered, and, on the other hand, a delegate from ASF takes charge of organizing the defense. Set up: Arusha School on International Criminal Law and Human Rights.

name: El Taller
aims: Participate in a worldwide movement of NGOs working toward building a strong civil society dedicated to democracy, human rights and sustainable development; offer a space for analysis and action learning on critical issues; networking and innovation around issues of development and peace.
activities: Supports capacity building in NGOs through regional 2 - 3 month training courses for NGO leaders in the south and training courses of shorter duration in various regions (Arab world, Africa, Asia and Latin America). International roundtables; Courts of women; international conferences; networking; research and communications.

name: Reporters sans frontieres - international (RSF)
aims: Defend the press freedom worldwide
activities: Working to help threatened or imprisoned journalists and censored media. Organizes sponsorship for imprisoned journalists by newspapers, radio and TV stations. Informing media about violations of press freedom. Helping newspapers which are victims of banning. Encouraging debate on problems connected with press freedom, especially issues involving professional standards and codes of conduct. Intercedes with major international organizations.

name: Free Vietnam Alliance (FVA)
aims: Work towards democracy in Vietnam.
activities: Organizes conferences.

name: European People's Party - Christian Democrats (EPP)
aims: Ensure close permanent collaboration among members in order to achieve their common policies; promote and organize common action at European level; work to achieve a free and pluralist democracy; pursue the process of federal unification and integration in Europe and unite towards the realization of a 'United States of Europe'
activities: Organizes a statutory Congress. Provides different services for member parties. Through their national policies member parties undertake to support positions taken by EPP in the context of the European Union. Parliamentarians elected to the European Parliament on their lists and/or sent to parliamentary assemblies of the Council of Europe, committee of regions, WEU, OSCE or NATO are obliged by their respective EPP member parties to join the relevant EPP groups associated with those assemblies. Athena group - Group Athena, set up in response to the Athena Programme launched 1992, Athens, works towards a federal Europe and includes pro-Europe parties of EPP. Instrumental in setting up: Groupe de coordination/Europe centrale et orientale/; EPP Assocciation for Regional Politics; Jan 1996, EPP Economic and Independent Business Association (#06287), replacing European Independent Business Confederation (EIBC, #08086). Proposes setting up Scientific Institute of the European People's Party.

name: Network of Cities of Asylum
aims: Work against intolerance and for protection of menaced and persecuted writers.
activities: Member cities pledge to: put residences at the disposal of persecuted writers; provide them with access to municipal public services (restaurants, transport, schools); assist in obtaining visas and residence permits; provide them with a grant.

name: Amnesty International (AI)
aims: Undertake research and action focused on preventing and ending grave abuses of the rights to physical and mental integrity, freedom of conscience and expression and freedom from discrimination within the context of its work to promote human rights.
activities:
Opposes abuses by opposition groups, including hostage-takings, torture and killings of prisoners and other deliberate and arbitrary killings; assists asylum-seekers who are at risk of being returned to a country where they will be at risk of violations of basic and fundamental human rights; cooperates with other non-governmental organizations, the United Nations (UN) and with regional intergovernmentaI organizations; campaigns to increase accountability in international military, security and police relations; organizes human rights education and awareness-raising programmes. Oct 2002, launched worldwide campaign to highlight discrepancy between human rights protection which those living in the Russian Federation have in international and national law and the reality of widespread human rights abuses committed in a climate of impunity. During 2003, delegates visited dozens of countries and territories to meet victims of human rights violations, observe trial and interview local human rights activists and officials. Together with Oxfam International and IANSA, launched an arms control campaign calling for a Global Arms Trade Treaty and for local action to protect civilians from armed violence.
Recent mainstream activities include not only opposition to and denouncing of violations of civil and political human rights but also preventative human rights work such as human rights awareness and human rights education programmes. As of 1998/1999, AI sections in over 50 countries had adopted a range of approaches, including: lobbying to ensure incorporation of human rights into official training and education curricular of schools, universities, military and police academies, civil service and other professional training programs; advice on curricular; workshops and training programs for target groups.
Conference for the Abolition of Torture, 1973; Conference for the Abolition of the Death Penalty, 1977; International Conference on Extrajudicial Executions 1982; International Conference on Disappearances and Political Killings, 1992; appeal for the establishment of an lnternational Criminal Court (ICC, #16240) by the year 2000, launched Oct 1996. Amnesty International received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1977 for its contribution to "securing the journal for freedom, for justice, and thereby also for peace in the world". In 1978, on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, AI was awarded the United Nations Human Rights Prize for "outstanding achievements in the field of human rights". AI campaign to mark the 50th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights culminated, 10 Dec 1998, Paris, with presentation of 13.2 million pledges from over 130 countries.

name: Association for the Promotion of the International Circulation of the Press (DISTRIPRESS)
aims: Assist in promoting freedom of press throughout the world; support and aid all national and international action promoting free flow of ideas by word, image and intervention against all measures which hinder or aim to prevent such a free flow; further the interests of the press circulation trade.

name: International Alliance of Women (IAW)
aims: Secure all such reforms as are necessary to establish a real equality of liberties, status, and opportunities between men and women in all spheres of life; urge women to accept their responsibilities and use their rights and influence in public life to ensure that the status of every individual, without distinction of sex, race, or creed, shall be based on respect for the person, the only guarantee for individual freedom and peace; promote a better quality of life and good understanding among peoples
activities: Organizes: triennial Congress with workshops to formulate an action program for next triennium, which is then approved in plenary sessions; regional board meeting and seminar (annual), with follow-up workshops and projects. Priorities for 2005-2007: human rights - women's rights; globalization; civil and political rights; education for all - legal literacy; poverty; violence, including - (a) trafficking in women and children, (b) domestic violence, (c) violence in general; health; nutrition; environment and habitat. Cooperates with other NGOs and with the United Nations specialized agencies on: peace and security; nationality of married women; equal pay and discrimination in employment; discrimination in education; slavery and suppression of traffic in persons; elimination of discrimination against women and girls; equal access to technology and resources

name: International Association of Democratic Lawyers (IADL)
aims: Facilitate contact and exchanges of use between and among lawyers and lawyers' associations of all countries and foster understanding and goodwill among them; work together to achieve the aims set out in the United Nations Charter; ensure common action by lawyers: encourage in the realm of law the study and practice of the principles of democracy, making for the maintenance of peace and cooperation among nations; restore, defend and develop democratic rights and liberties in legislation and in the practice; promote the independence of all peoples and oppose any restriction on this independence whether in law or in practice; defend and promote human rights and peoples rights; promote preservation of ecology and healthy environment; work for strict adherence to rule of law and independence of judiciary and legal profession; defend peoples' rights to development and for the creation of conditions of economic equality, enjoyment of fruits of scientific progress and natural resources
activities: Main areas: research on legal issues affecting human, political and economic rights; study and practice of democratic principles for maintenance of peace and peaceful problem-solving, and cooperation between nations; defense and development of democratic rights and liberties in legislation and in the practice of law. Organizes international commissions of enquiry and conferences on such topics as; the new economic order; racism and apartheid; human rights; decolonization and self-determination. Observer missions to trials.

name: International Bar Association
aims: Support the independence of the judiciary, the rights of lawyers to practice their profession without interference and human rights of lawyers worldwide; establish and maintain permanent relations and exchanges among bar associations and law societies and individual lawyer members; discuss problems of professional organization and status; advanced the science of jurisprudence and all its phases; by common study of practical legal problems, promote uniformity and definition in appropriate fields of law; promote administration of justice under law among peoples of the world; in execution of these objectives promote in their legal aspects the principles and aims of the United Nations and cooperate with, and promote coordination among, international juridicial organizations having similar purposes
activities: Works through: legal practice division (LPD), consisting of over 50 specialist committees covering all areas of practice, those with common interests working together under sections; public and professional interest division (PPID), covering activities of the legal profession, organized in "Constituents", and also the activities and interests of member organizations; Human Rights Institute (HRI), covering human rights and rule of law issues, including with IBA task force on international terrorism. Organizes: Annual General Meeting (biennial up to 2003); national, regional and international conferences; seminars

name: International Commission of Jurists (ICJ)
aims: Support and advance the primacy, coherence and implementation of international law and principles that advance human rights
activities: Provides legal expertise at international, regional and national levels to ensure the developments in international law adhere to human rights principles and that international standards are implemented at national level; sends observers to key trials to help protect the defendants' right to a fair trial and to identify systematic shortcomings in the justice system; observes reports on human rights situations in various countries worldwide and has promoted independence of judges and lawyers in Asia, Africa, Eastern Europe and former USSR, Latin America and the Caribbean; participates in UN seminars; carries out fact-finding and high-level advocacy missions; makes legal interventions such as submitting 'amicus curiae' briefs and important cases before domestic, regional and international tribunals; produces human rights analysis of new or proposed laws; seeks action by UN and regional human rights and political bodies; intervenes directly to protect judges and lawyers who are persecuted for carrying out their professional duties in defense of human rights; carries out ongoing research of law and legal systems throughout the world and monitors in all regions. Organizes: public meetings; conferences; congresses; missions and visits to different countries; international exchanges; activities for lost students and young lawyers. Currently carrying out a world inquiry into definition of the rule of law. Provides understanding and knowledge in three priority areas: 'Counter-terrorism and human rights' - articulates how established legislation, policies and practices in response to the threat of terrorist acts address national security and human rights in a balanced manner by engaging in dialogue with governments; mobilizes contemporary and historical experience of lawyers and partner organizations globally; explorers with military and civilian authorities the nature of today's security threats and responses by governments that are appropriate. 'Independence and Accountability of judges and lawyers' - through the Centre for independence of judges and lawyers (CIJL, #04664), works to establish justice systems that are independent in law and practice, are active in protecting human rights and freedoms and that ensure access to justice for the most marginalized. Priority is given to countries where impunity is systematic, which face a rule of law crisis or are in transition. 'International Human Rights Law-Making and Reform' - shapes and argues for new global or regional human rights standards when existing standards do not adequately protect against human rights violations; works to strengthen human rights legal accountability of corporations and international public actors; supports a new treaty to prohibit and enforced disappearances and seeks to enable victims to make individual complaints to the UN about violations of economic, social and cultural rights; supports careful reform of the United Nations and regional human rights systems

name: International Council of Women (ICW)
aims: Unite women's voluntary organizations worldwide for consultation and action to promote welfare of mankind, the family and the individual; support the ideas of international peace and arbitration, equal legal status for women – including suffrage and rights of citizenship, equal pay for equal work – and family and child welfare; support efforts to achieve peace through negotiation, arbitration and conciliation; make known the principles of human rights and achieve their application in every aspect of life; promote recognition and respect for human rights and work for the removal of discrimination based on birth, race, sex, language or religion; promote equal rights and responsibilities for both sexes in all spheres; encourage women to recognize their responsibilities in the community and train and stimulate them to participate in public life on local, national and international levels; deepen understanding and increase mutual sympathy of women through international contact
activities: Studies questions which affect the status of women and their capacity to play an active part in all aspects of life; organizes regional seminars on human rights, literacy, education, the advancement of women and their participation and economic and social development. European center of the international council of women (ECICW #08317) promotes women's interests with the European Union. International Standing Committees (5): 'Status of Women' Sub-Committees - Legislation; implementation of conventions; human rights; international relations and peace. 'Sustainable Development' Sub-Committees - economics; consumer affairs; women in employment; rural and urban women. 'General Wellbeing' Sub-Committees - health; environment; habitat; nutrition. 'Communication' Sub-Committees - education; mass media; arts and letters; music. 'Social issues' Sub-Committees - Child and family; youth; aging; migration.

name: International PEN
aims: As a world Association of writers, editors and translators in all branches and classes of literature, letters, poetry, drama, fiction, history, biography, science, translation and philosophy, promote and maintain friendship and intellectual cooperation among men of letters in all countries in the interests of literature, freedom of expression and international goodwill; enable the unhampered transmission of thought within and among nations. PEN is not concerned with state or party politics and must not be used to serve their interests. It's charter firms that literature should remain common currency in spite of political or international upheavals and that works of art are the property of humanity at large.
activities: Organizers: international Congresses; other Congresses; symposia; seminars; regional conferences; dialogs. Centers organize their own local meetings and many publish their own newsletters, books and pamphlets. Committees (4): PEN Writers in Prison Committee - works for the release of riders in prison for expressing their opinions – foundation PEN emergency fund, based in the Netherlands, gives practical aid to the dependents of imprisoned or harassed writers; translations and linguistic rights committee – encourages translation from and between 'small' languages; writers for peace committee; international PEN women writers committee (IPWWC)

name: International Union of Socialist Youth (IUSY)
aims: Propagate amongst the younger generation the principles of free and democratic socialism; further practical cooperation among democratic socialist youth and student organizations of all countries so as to strengthen international solidarity among young socialists worldwide in the fight against fascism, racism, discrimination and for the liberation of men and particularly women from all exploitation and for the rights of all peoples to free and independent development, for protection of environment and for human rights
activities: Organizes: international conferences; world festivals (about every 2 to 3 years) with political and cultural programs; summer camps; training seminars; briefings on specific topics; worldwide and regional political campaigns and gatherings; missions; delegations; solitary brigades; speaking tours; study sessions. Promotes exchange among the various organizations.

name: Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU)
aims: As focal point for worldwide parliamentary dialogue, work for peace and cooperation among peoples and for firm establishment of representative institutions. To that end: (a) foster contacts, coordination and exchange of experience among parliaments and parliamentarians of all countries; (b) consider questions of international interest and expressed views on such issues in order to bring about action by parliaments and parliamentarians; (c) contribute to defense and promotion of human rights - an essential factor of parliamentary democracy and development; (d) contribute to better knowledge of the working of representative institutions and to the strengthening and development of their means of action.
activities: Organizes two main sessions a year. Carries out objective examination of international questions suitable for settlement by parliamentary action. Main fields of work (5): promotion of democracy; action for peace and cooperation, including a process for interparliamentary conference on security and cooperation in the Mediterranean (CSCM); human rights, including human rights of parliamentarians; women's issues with special emphasis on women's participation in politics; sustainable development. Since Nov 1979, organize meetings of parliamentarians attending UN General Assembly in New York NY. In 1976, adopted 'procedure for the examination and treatment of communications concerning violations of the human rights of parliamentarians', applicable to any member of parliament from any country who is alleged to be victim of arbitrary measures during the exercise of his or her mandate, whether parliament was in session or in recess or had been dissolved by unconstitutional or emergency measures.

name: Women's International Democratic Federation (WIDF)
aims: Unite women regardless of race, nationality, religion and political opinion, so that they may work together to win, implement and defend their rights as mothers, workers and citizens; defend the rights of children to life, well-being and education; win and defend national independence and democratic freedoms, eliminate apartheid, racial discrimination and fascism; work for peace and universal disarmament
activities: Works for: (1) women's rights in society and in the family and for their right to work, to receive equal pay for equal work, to receive education at all levels and for recognition of their social and cultural life - supports women suffering oppression, racial discrimination, apartheid, any form of fascism, colonialism or neocolonialism, through solidarity activities, study trips, seminars, roundtable meetings and publications; (2) the right to healthcare and adequate nutrition, so children do not die of hunger; (3) children's, especially girls', right to education, protection of children from violence and respect for their individual rights. With respect to peace, works: (1) for preservation and consolidation of peace; against the arms race (including weapons of mass destruction and nuclear weapons); (2) against constantly increasing military expenditure. With respect to NGO activities: was an initiator of the proclamation by the United Nations of 'International Women's Year' and contributed to the implementation of 'United Nations Decade for Women: Equality, Development, Peace'.

name: World Federation of Democratic Youth (WFDY)
aims: Contribute to the education of youth in the spirit of freedom, democracy and solidarity; end imperialism, colonialism, neocolonialism and racist and fascist regimes; ensure peace and security in the world by supporting all initiatives and efforts to this effect; promote active participation of youth and economic, social, cultural and political life by acting against all restriction and discrimination connected with age, sex, methods of education, domicile, property, social status, religion, convictions, color and race, so as to ensure in all countries and for all young people full freedom of speech, of the press, of religious belief, assembly and organization; support the struggle of youth for higher living standards, for better conditions of education, work and leisure and for development of cultural, educational and sports activities for all young people; further development of the young generation in the spirit of peace and international friendship; support the principles of the United Nations charter; support youth interests via international bodies and in affairs of an international character.
