activities: Organizes seminars and voluntary work camps; carries out research on youth needs; facilitates and encourages joint actions by youth organizations of different countries, bilateral and multilateral contacts and other means serving the causes of friendship, understanding and cooperation; promotes international youth events contributing to solution of youth problems; promotes and assists youth organizations whose work is hampered through being victim of imperialist aggression, colonial domination, repression, persecution or natural disaster, especially through international solidarity fund; helps to develop tourist exchanges, holidays games, festivals, cultural and sports competitions; cooperates with national, Continental and international organizations including trade unions and other professional organizations, especially for implementing rights of youth. Thematic departments for peace and disarmament, solidarity, youth rights, global problems, international cooperation, press and information, as well as working groups on sport and culture, problems of young women. Attached bureaux (3): International bureau for youth tourist and exchanges (BITEJ #15239) (which has consultative status with WFDY); International committee of children's and adolescents' movements (ICCAM, #15728); International voluntary service for solidarity and friendship of youth (SIVSAJ, no recent information). Instrumental in setting up world youth rainforest action (WYRA, no recent information).

name: Commonwealth Parliamentary Association (CPA)
aims: Promote knowledge and education about the constitutional, legislative, economic, social and cultural systems within a parliamentary democratic framework, with particular reference to the countries of the Commonwealth of Nations and to other countries having close historical and parliamentary associations with it; foster understanding and cooperation among members of Commonwealth parliaments; promote the study of and respect for parliamentary institutions.
activities: Provides regular consultation between members of Commonwealth parliaments. Organizes: exchange of inter-Commonwealth visits and information; plenary and regional conferences; study tours; study group meetings; annual seminar on parliamentary practice and procedure, held in Westminster (UK) since 1951; annual parliamentary seminar in another parliamentary jurisdiction; regional seminars; parliamentary workshops. Branches also hold their own seminars. Working Capital Fund (set up 1978) supports new ventures and projects, including Commonwealth Parliamentary Conference for Small Countries, for branches with populations of 400,000 or less, held concurrently with plenary conference since 1981. Sponsors in-depth studies on parliamentary subjects by study groups of prominent parliamentarians. Expert groups focus on developmental and training needs of parliamentarians. Cooperates with ComSec in forming election observation groups, including maintenance of a register of experienced politicians to serve on Commonwealth missions.

name: Commonwealth Press Union (CPU)
aims: Promote the concept and ideals of the Commonwealth; foster mutual understanding and goodwill through regular conferences in constituent parts of it; advance the welfare of the newspaper and periodical press of the Commonwealth through action to safeguard press freedom, measures for training and educating journalists.
activities: Watch for and oppose all measures or proposals likely to affect press freedom; promote measures for educating and training journalists, in the Commonwealth. Annual meetings and conferences (every 2 years). Instrumental in setting up International Press Telecommunications Counsel (IPTC, #18342).

name: International Association for Religious Freedom (IARF)
aims: Work for freedom of religion and belief, as a human right, through: freedom from oppressive interference or discrimination by the state, government or society's institutions on the grounds of religion or belief; mutual understanding, respect and the promotion of harmony, or at least 'tolerance', between communities or individuals of different religions or beliefs; an essential accountability by religious communities to ensure that their own practices uphold the fundamental dignity and human rights of their members and others.
activities: Strategic Plan (2001-2007): support affected communities; non-formal diplomacy; young adult programs; codes of conduct; preventive strategies. Organizes quadrennial Congress, regional (Continental) conferences, commissions and chapters.

name: Union Internationale des Avocats (UIA)
aims: Promote the basic principles of the legal profession; participate in the development of legal knowledge at an international level; contribute to the establishment of an international legal order based on the principles of human rights and justice among nations, through the law and for the cause of peace; establish relations and exchanges between bars, bar associations and law societies at an International level; defend the profession.
activities: Organizes congresses, symposia, seminars. Has produced: an 'International charter of legal defense rights'; an 'International Charter of Access to Justice for All'; 'Charter of the Rights of Minorities'; 'Resolution of Multi-disciplinary Practice'; Principles of Professional Conduct for the Legal Profession in the 21st century', 'Resolution on the Abolition of Capital Punishment.'

name: Socialist International Women (SIW)
aims: Strengthen relations among member organizations; promote action programs to overcome any discrimination in society, including inequality between men and women; work for human rights in general, development and peace; promote knowledge and understanding amongst women of the aims and tasks of democratic socialism; extend relations between members and nonmember socialist-oriented women's groups which desire cooperation.
activities: Organizes: exchange visits; seminars; International Women's Day meetings; projects to help women in developing countries. Themes recently dealt with: discrimination against women in legislation; foreign debt – how can women break the cycles of affluence in poverty? Indigenous peoples of the Americas; abolition of capital punishment; referendum in Western Sahara; organizing and educating women in politics; women and Health; the family – women's responsibility? Women in changing economic systems; an end to war and the abuse of women and former Yugoslavia; women and violence in society; ideological changes – Continuing male dominance; implementation of the quota for women; women changing places; women in Tibet; UN conference on population and development, Cairo; Women and the social summit, 1995; Azerbaijan; women's education - the key to economic development; fourth world Congress on women, 1995; socialist women in the 90s and beyond - new ways of organizing; equality in the new millennium; women in Burma; rights of women in the Mediterranean region; women and the globalization of the world economy; women and sustainable development

name: International Federation of Free Journalists (IFFJ)
aims: As an international organization of professional journalists of Eastern and Central European origin, employed in newspaper and other mass media: uphold the principles of freedom of the press; promote national and human rights; defend the rights of individuals to objective and complete information; propagate honesty of news; raise standards or ethics in journalism.
activities: Makes representations against activities threatening freedom of expression, against the harassment, persecution and detention without trial of journalists and against censorship and suppression of mass media. Cooperates in inter-European affairs, maintaining contact with the newly independent states of Central and Eastern Europe through their diplomatic representatives. Participates in human rights conferences

name: World Association of Newspapers
aims: Defend and promote press freedom, and economic independence of newspapers as an essential condition for that freedom; contribute to development of newspaper publishing by fostering communications and contacts among newspaper executives; promote cooperation among newspaper publishers in member nations; represent the newspaper industry and defend press freedom, professional interests and business interests in international discussions on media issues; impose restrictions on circulation of newspapers and on advertising; promote and develop a free press and information activities in developing countries.
activities: Campaigns against press freedom violations; channels legal aid to victimized journalists; represents the newspaper industry in international discussions on media issues. 'AMJ Formation Sarl/WAN Training and Events' organizes conferences, study tours and all marketing activities. World editors forum provides opportunities for senior news executives to exchange ideas and information about the business of editing newspapers. Fund for press freedom development promotes growth of free and Independent newspapers in developing countries through training and other forms of assistance. Through 'Newspaper in Education Program', organizes international cooperation to encourage the culture of reading newspapers through the establishment and development of NIE activity worldwide.

name: International Association of Judges (IAJ)
aims: Defend the independence of the judiciary, as an essential requirement of the judicial function and guarantee of human rights and freedom; protect constitutional and moral position of the judiciary; promote exchange of cultural relations; organize and intensify cordial relations among judges of different countries
activities: Organizes congresses and meetings for study of the judicial system and of unification of law generally; assists in arrangement of exchange visits. Study commissions: judicial administration and status of the judiciary; civil law and procedure; criminal law and procedure; public and social law

name: Law Association for Asia and the Western Pacific (LAWASIA)
aims: Promote the administration of justice, the protection of human rights and the maintenance of the rule of law; advance legal education; diffuse knowledge of the laws of member countries; promote development of the law, and uniformity where appropriate; further international understanding and goodwill; foster relations and intercourse between lawyers and uphold and advance the status of the legal profession in the region
activities: Sections (5): judicial; energy loss; family law; general practice; business law. Standing committees (23): International trade and arbitrations; banking, finance and insurance; communications and media; comparative constitutional; computer and technology; consumer protection; criminal law; enforcement of foreign judgments; environmental; franchising; human rights; insolvency; intellectual property; international trade law; corporate securities and investment; labor; legal aid; legal education; taxation; women in the law; aviation; infrastructure, privatization; young lawyers. Organizes: conference (every two years); energy law conference.

name: NATO Parliamentary Assembly (NATO PA)
aims: Foster dialogue among parliamentarians on major security issues; facilitate parliamentary awareness and understanding of alliance policies; strengthen the transatlantic relationship; assist in development of parliamentary democracy throughout the Euro-Atlantic area; assist in the development of parliamentary mechanisms, practices and 'know-how' related to democratic control of Armed Forces; contribute to making the policies of the alliance more transparent and comprehensible to parliaments and their public.
activities: Committees (5): defense and security; economics and security; civilian dimension of security; political; science and technology. Sub-Committees (8): democratic governance; NATO partnerships; transatlantic relations; transatlantic defense and security cooperation; future security and defense capabilities; East – West economic cooperation and convergence; transatlantic economic relations; proliferation of military technology. Organizes 'Rose-Roth Seminars' (3 a year) to facilitate dialogue between parliamentarians and other policymakers particularly in the Balkans and the Caucasus. Also organizes: 'Mediterranean Dialogue Seminar' (annual); 'New Parliamentarians Programme' (annual); 'Parliamentary Transatlantic Forum' in the USA; hearings at the European Parliament.

name: International Association of Young Lawyers
aims: Encourage meetings and promote cooperation and mutual respect among lawyers younger than 45 from all countries; defend the interest of young lawyers and study questions of relevance to them; help set up groups of young lawyers in countries where none as yet exist; play an active role in development of the legal profession and harmonization of its professional rules; contribute to provision of full and effective protection of the right of all lawyers to practice their profession freely and of every person to be added, counselled or represented by a lawyer freely chosen and to be entitled to a fair trial by an impartial and independent judge within a reasonable period of time.
activities: Organizes: annual congress; seminars; law courses; Intercontinental and regional meetings; trainee exchange programme, through Permanent Bureau for International Exchange - Secretariat permanent pour l'echange des stagiaires (SPES). Co-organizes the 'International Competition of Counsel's Speeches in defense of Human Rights'. Temporary Exchange-Multinational Placement (TEMP) program. Standing Commissions (20) address their specific areas through seminars, congress working sessions and publications: Human and Procedural Rights and Responsibilities; Intellectual Property and New Technologies; Telecommunications and Energy; International Business Law; Distribution, Labour Law, Commercial Fraud; Antitrust; Future of the Profession; Family and Estate Law; Civil Litigation; Tax Law; International Arbitration; European Law; Transportation Law; Banking and Finance Law; Corporate Acquisition and Joint Ventures: Insolvency Law; Environmental Law; Corporate Counsel. Includes Lawyers Emergency Defense Committee, which aims to ensure protection of the right of every lawyer to practice his profession freely and for every person to be entitled to legal representation and fair trial. 'Declaration of Athens' on defense of common principles, adopted 27 August 1966, Athens. 'Declaration of Lausanne' on recognition that regard for professional confidentiality is fundamental to the principle of the right to a fair trial, adopted 27 August 1982, Lausanne (Switzerland) and 2 September 1983 Helsinki.

name: Commonwealth Magistrates' and Judges' Association (CMJA)
aims: Advance administration of the law by promoting the independence of the judiciary; promote education in law, administration of justice, treatment of offenders and prevention of crime within the Commonwealth; disseminate information and literature on matters concerning the legal process; effect closest possible links between members.
activities: Emphasizes magistracy (or primary judiciary) where over 90 percent of judicial matters are handled. Provides advice and resource centre; organize seminars, regional meetings, conferences, penal training, exchange visits.

name: International Organization for the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination
aims: As an educational/informational organization, and consistent with the UN international convention on the elimination of all forms of racial discrimination: support respect for, and the rule of, international law as essential to maintenance of world order and peace; promote anti-racism and self-determination as a friend in the charter of the United Nations; promote equality in dignity and rights of peoples and individuals; support the United Nations and cooperate with its member states; defend the interests of people who are victims of racism and racial discrimination, especially their rights to culture, land and self-determination; support and promote international consensus.
activities: Together with universities and other organizations, convenes joint conferences and seminars on racism and racial discrimination in general and on apartheid, Zionism and rights and conditions of indigenous peoples. Makes: occasional fellowship awards to post graduate students; annual 'International Award for the Furtherance of Human Understanding' for an outstanding publication in English, French, Arabic, Spanish or Portuguese on questions of racism and racial discrimination.

name: Society for Threatened Peoples
aims: Campaign against genocide and discrimination of threatened economic and religious minorities or nationalities worldwide.
activities: Organizes: rallies; demonstrations and visuals; international conferences and publicity-attracting actions; Press conferences and lecture tours; discussions.

name: Regional Council on Human Rights in Asia
aims: Adopt and disseminate a Regional Declaration of Human Rights that reflects the culture, values, and aspirations of the people of the region and seek the support of the people of the region for that declaration; promote respect for individual and collective civil, practical, social, economic and cultural human rights; receive petitions and complaints and assist in redressing violations of these rights; encourage the governments of the region to ratify or concur in the International Conventions on Human Rights; undertake studies and research
activities: In 1984, the council decided to concentrate on two tasks: to spread and explain the declaration of basic duties among people of the ASEAN region; to campaign for the release of political prisoners in the region.

name: Anti-Slavery International
aims: Through research, raising awareness and campaigning, work to eliminate all forms of contemporary slavery, including: debt bondage, forced labor, forced marriage, the worst forms of child labor, trafficking, and traditional slavery, by pressuring governments to acknowledge slavery and abolish its practice and by giving local organizations an international voice. Persuade governments concerned to cooperate in introducing reforms; persuade more UN member states to ratify the Supplementary Convention on Slavery (1956) and sign, ratify and implement anti-slavery laws.
activities: Relevant convention: elementary convention on the abolition of slavery, the slave trade, and institutions and practices similar to slavery (1956). Collects and assesses information. Works through research, awareness raising, lobbying, public campaigns, coordination of meetings and support for like-minded organizations. Current concerns include debt bondage, child labor/prostitution, servile and early marriage, forced labor and trafficking. Offers Anti-Slavery Award.

name: Christian Democratic Organization of America
aims: Serve as a link between Christian democratic parties in Latin American countries by promoting the exchange of publications and ideas; organize research concerning common problems; contact similar parties in other regions of the world; promote and reinforce the democratization process in Latin America and the Caribbean.
activities: Carries out activities centered on 4 areas: South Cone; Andean; Caribbean; Central America. Instrumental in setting up: Christian Parliamentary Coordination (PARLA-DC, no recent information); International Union of Young Christian Democrats (IUYCD, #19774).

name: Ibero-American Lawyers' Union
aims: Promote and ensure the following of dignity, independence and freedom in the legal profession as essential values for the realization of justice; protect the interests of lawyers and students of law; promote cooperation among members in the development of legal science.

name: Latin American Federation of Associations for Relatives of the Detained and Disappeared
aims: Fight against the forced disappearance in Latin America and the Caribbean through denunciation of this misdemeanor, the clarification of the truth about the facts, the judgment and sanction of those responsible for the crime, the promotion of national and international legal norms which prevent the impunity and the education in the field of the human rights so that such facts occur never again
activities: Main activities: denunciation (immediate and permanent); investigation; prevention and education; coordination. Gathers reports of forced disappearance; issues appeals to authorities; transmits denunciations to competent international authorities; assist members in searching, exchanging experience and publishing information; develops and promotes international solidarity through support groups; provides medical, psychological and social assistance to relatives through support groups in various countries; assists and drafting and promoting adoption of international instruments aimed at preventing forced disappearance

name: Council of European Municipalities and Regions (CEMR)
aims: Secure, strengthen and protect autonomy of local and regional authorities; facilitate operations of local authorities, safeguard their liberties and contribute to their prosperity, in particular through the development of inter-authority arrangements and undertakings; develop the European spirit amongst local and regional authorities with a view to promoting a Federation of the European States founded on the autonomy of these communities; provide for the participation and representation of local and regional communities and authorities in European and international institutions; achieve establishment amongst existing and future European institutions of an Assembly representing local and regional communities and authorities
activities: Activities focus on: shaping the future of Europe; promoting local and regional democracy; influencing laws and policies of the European Union; exchanging experiences; acting in the world. 'Community Aid to Twinning Programme', through Twinning Department and Twinning Officers, assists European towns in searching for a twin authority and in applying for twinning grants. Involved in support of local and regional governments in new member states of the European Union. Facilitates, at the European level, the exchange of experiences, the sharing of ideas, best practices and know-how among members. Organizes: training seminars for twinning officers and organizers; Congress of Europe Twinned Towns every 3-4 years; information seminars; study sessions; exchange of views concerning local and regional collectivities. Committees (5): Environment; Transport; Employment and Social Policy; Euro-Mediterranean Partnership (COPPEM); CEMR Committee of Women Elected Representatives of Local and Regional Authorities (CWERLRA) and its European Network of Women Elected Representatives of Local and Regional Authorities (ENWERLRA), which includes all CEMR member countries. Working Groups (3): Cohesion Policy; Twinning; LOGON -  of associations and daughter companies dealing with information society issues. 'Employers' Platform' represents local and regional authority associations in their role as employers vis-à-vis the European institutions and organizes the exchanges of experience on issues related to labor market policy and working conditions. Instrumental in setting up:  'Standing Conference of Local and Regional Authorities of Europe' - the precursor to CLRAE; the previous Consultative Council of Local and Regional Authorities (inactive). National sections set their own policies, organize dialogue with central government as appropriate and ensure that central governments adopt and respect European Charter of Local Self-Government (1985).

name: Pacific Islands News Association (PINA)
aims: Develop and maintain freedom of information and expression; raise professional standards of journalism; assist training and communication.
activities: Professional development seminars; training; development of resource material; Pacific media awards.

name: Internatonal Association of Broadcasting (IAB)
aims: Defend broadcasting, whether radio or television, as a free means of expression of thought; work for freedom of social communication media; promote cooperation of broadcasters in activities of public interest and social services and the effective representation of broadcasting interests in official or private national and international organizations; sponsor world and regional conferences of a technical, legal, or educational nature
activities: Standing committees: legal; technical; on copyright; on freedom of expression.

name: Inter-American Bar Association (IABA)
aims: Provide a permanent forum for exchange of professional views and information for lawyers to promote the rule of law and protect democratic institutions in the Americas; establish and maintain relations among national and local organizations of lawyers in the region; advance the science of jurisprudence, particularly the study of comparative law; promote uniformity of laws; promote the rule of law and the administration of justice, encouraging establishment and maintenance of independent judicial systems and all countries of the Americas; preserve and defend human rights and liberties; guarantee to the peoples of the hemisphere the free exercise of their civil and political right under democratic principles; uphold the honor of the legal profession; encourage cordial intercourse and fellowship among lawyers of the Americas
activities: Organizes conference about every 18 months; regional seminars. Permanent committees (19), serving as a forum for presentation of papers related to each committee's focus and reporting back to the conference: public and private international law; constitutional law; administrative law (includes: Labor law, municipal law, food and drug law); civil law and procedure; business banking and securities law; criminal law and procedure; military law; development and integration law; legal education; fiscal law; natural resources and environmental protection; human rights law; practice of law; labor law and Social Security; intellectual and industrial property law; telecommunications, science and technology law; Corporate and institutional counsel; international arbitration law; women's rights

name: Caribbean Democrat Union
aims: Advocate promotion of freedom and an economic system based on a social market economy through consideration of matters of political organization and policies.
activities: Charter covers: democracy; freedom and the individual; the individual in the community; private property and private enterprise; international relations Programme includes seminars on: environment; drug abuse; training of young leaders; women and development.

name: Inter-American Press Association (IAPA)
aims: Protect freedom of the press in the Americas and defend and promote the right of American peoples to be fully and freely informed through an independent press; foster and protect press freedom by publishing facts of any action or attempt to restrict that freedom in the western hemisphere; foster general and specific press interests; promote and maintain the dignity, rights and responsibilities of the profession of journalism; encourage uniform standards of professional and business conduct; promote greater exchange among American people's in support of basic principles of a free society and individual liberty
activities: Maintains: Inter-American press association press institute, which organizes annual General assembly, annual mid-year meeting and seminars and produces publications; IAPA scholarship fund (no recent information), set up 1954. Set up: Inter-American investigative journalism institute (no recent information), Office of Certified Circulation (OCC), started 1954, Which subsequently became autonomous and was then replaced by national and regional organizations which continue helping to increase advertising income and thus financial independence. Provides circulation auditing service. Makes Chamorro and Tom Wallace awards.￼

name: International Association for the Defense of Religious Liberty
aims: In the belief that the right to religious freedom is a gift of God; encourage all those who are attached to the idea of liberty, without any distinction of race, sex, language or religion, to participate in the crusade against all forms of intolerance and fanaticism; value human dignity such that each individual has access to true existence in every domain and to a flowering of his being so as to discover his true identity; serve freedom of faith throughout the world; create a climate of the greatest understanding and reciprocal respect among people of every faith and conviction, to assist humanity in solving the major problems of peace, liberty and justice
activities: World Congress on religious liberty, jointly with international religious liberty association; regional Congress is in cooperation with other NGOs

name: European Parliamenterians for Africa (AWEPA)
aims: Support rehabilitation programs in Africa, directed towards the consolidation of democracy and human rights, the promotion of closer regional economic relations and meeting the needs of people adversely affected by regional conflicts and the legacy of apartheid and destabilization.
activities: Action is undertaken for human resource development with parliamentarians and other elected representatives and institutional capacity building within parliaments and decentralized authorities. Priorities: key role of well functioning parliaments with regards to democracy, human rights and peaceful conflict management; attainment of gender equality at all levels of political decision-making; African-European sharing of parliamentary experiences; building parliamentary networks at national, regional and into regional levels for political and non-governmental action. Instrumental in setting up SADC Parliamentary Forum (#24365).

name: International Federation of ACAT - Action by Christian for the Abolition of Torture
aims: Sensitize Christian communities to the atrocity of torture; invite all church members to participate in action on behalf of tortured prisoners; bring messages of hope into the heart of the reality of torture; contribute to creation, promotion and dissemination of legal instruments against torture; exercise a preventative function of vigilance and human rights education.
activities: Organizes: seminars; symposia. Individual members of national ACATs write 'urgent appeals' on behalf of tortured prisoners to authorities responsible for torture in various countries. FIACAT mobilizes all national ACATs for specific situations. Members meet for prayer, theological study and reflection.

name: Confederation of Cooperatives of the Caribbean and Central America (CCC-CA)
aims: Foster and encourage development, integration, consolidation, representation and defense of cooperatives in the region; by this means achieve structural change in the countries concerned, so they can democratize their political, social and economic life within a concept of justice, participation and peace.
activities: Organizes about 150 national and regional events annually. Sets out strategic guidelines for a common agenda under the heading: integration; development; inter-cooperation; solidarity; representation and defense; institutional consolidation; social justice. Programs: education and training; strategic planning; research; communication; commercialization; development of sectors; business development; information; organization and development. Policies relate to participation of women and youth and environmental issues.

name: Andean Commission of Jurists (ACJ)
aims: Encourage institutional reform favorable to continuity of constitutional order and reinforcement of democracy; reform administration of justice, establishing an independent and efficient system with a spirit of democracy, increasing legitimacy of the judiciary and public confidence in it, and ensuring integrity of judges; promote recognition and observance of the rights of indigenous peoples in Andean countries so that legislation reflects the multi-ethnic and pluri-cultural nature of society in the region and the values and identity of the indigenous population; adopt control policies for illegal drug production, supply, abuse and trafficking which do not exaggerate the criminal dimension of penal law to the detriment of social peace and the rights of the most vulnerable sectors (coca growers whose crops are used to produce drugs, drug peddlers and consumers); protect and work towards observance of human rights in the region, encouraging greater use and efficacy of mechanisms designed for this purpose nationally and throughout the region.
activities: Research programs (5): constitutional approach; drug control and human rights; protection of human rights. Each program organizes international conferences dealing with regional considerations. Organizes international and national events. Intervenes before governments and disseminates press releases on human rights violations and the drug control efforts. Sponsors proposals before international organizations to promote mechanisms for the protection of human rights.

name: Nordic Christian Democrats
aims: Promote Christian democracy in Nordic countries
activities: Congresses; Nordic meetings; meetings of presidents; meetings of general secretaries and international secretaries

name: International Federation of Resistance Movements
aims: Unite resistors in peacetime as they were united in warTime resistance movements to secure the independence of their countries, liberty and world peace; actively defend and maintain freedom and human dignity; cherish the memory of all who fell for their country and liberty; defend the spirit and values of the resistance; make known its historical role and transmit its teachings to new generations; denounce the horrors of concentration camps and prisons and demand due punishment for crimes against humanity; defend the material and moral interests of those having due rights and causes; create and develop social services in their aid; promote aims set out in the UN charter and strengthen links of fraternity in solidarity between resistors in all countries; oppose racial, political, philosophical or religious discrimination, neofascism, and 'prescriptability' of war crimes and crimes against humanity, work for disarmament and detente.
activities: Documentation center. Commissions on cultural, social, medical matters and on reparations. Permanent commission on fascism. Research services. Pilgrimages to former concentration camps. Congresses; Medical symposia; specialized meetings; consultative meetings

name: Free International Federation of Deportees and Resistance Internees
aims: Commemorate victims of oppression and their struggle for freedom; promote on a natural and international levels respect for and protection of democratic freedoms; strengthen the bonds between members of associate organizations; ensure moral and material aid required by members; promote and support laws and regulations sympathetic to purposes of the organization.
activities: Organizes biennial meetings.

name: International League of Religious Socialists (ILRS)
aims: Promote development of democratic socialism; facilitate cooperation among and on behalf of organizations of religious socialists and circulate and provide information on their work; contribute to the official recognition of such organizations as coworkers in their respective socialist parties and in the wider socialist movement; maintain close links with socialist international; reduce historical prejudices and overcome traditional tensions between religious believers, religious communities and the socialist movement
activities: Organizes conferences, seminars and political campaigns on various issues of interest to the socialist movement as well as civil society

name: European Lawyers Union
aims: Unite lawyers who are members of a European Union bar so as to carry out common activities to favourize: professional practice, freedom of establishment and freedom to offer services; coming together of juridicial statutes and professional and ethical practices of lawyers in member States of the European Union leading to an integrated conception of the profession in the EU; practice of EC/EU law and law arising from the European Convention for the protection of human rights and fundamental freedoms.
activities: Organizes: Scientific congresses (held annually in May/June); colloquia and seminars; study days.

name: International Rehabilitation Council for Torture Victims (IRCT)
aims: Promote and support rehabilitation of torture victims; work for prevention of torture worldwide.
activities: Promotes treatment and rehabilitation services for victims of torture; contributes to the prevention of torture globally; works to create awareness of torture and its effects; cooperates with international governmental organizations and non-governmental organizations as well as multilateral, bilateral and private donors in attempt to secure adequate funding for rehabilitation centers and prevention activities worldwide; works to increase the existing number of almost 200 Rehabilitation Centers around the world, through technical support, training, advocacy and documentation.

name: International Union of Social Democratic Teachers (IUSDT)
aims: Realize the idea of democratic socialism; unite all socialist educational organization sharing a political responsibility and an affiliation to a section of the socialist international; link internationally all groups of teachers and professors affiliated to the socialist international and other persons having official educational responsibility; advocate optimum education of the individual and improvement in society standard of education; coordinate efforts of member organizations to use teaching in all countries to promote social justice, respect of human rights, peace and international understanding; through an education drawing on discerning mental attitudes and international political awareness, endeavor to establish a socialist society in which every individual has at his or her disposal every means for full development, whether children, young people or adults; focus educational discussion and work on the New World dimension, including the situation in Europe and problems of developing countries. Promote: the passing of spiritual and cultural heritage from generation to generation; preparation of the individual for life and society on the basis of equal opportunity; tolerance and cooperation between different groups in multicultural societies.
activities: Exchange of teachers and peoples; regular exchange of information on educational programs of member parties and of projects put into effect by socialist governments; close contact with socialist groups in European community and Council of Europe institutions; supports establishment of socialist educational organizations in less developed countries.

name: African Society of International and Comparative Law (ASICL)
aims: Promote advancement of public education in the field of law and civil liberties in Africa; protect individual liberties; raise standards in administration of justice; provide a comprehensive legal aid system in each African country; with cooperation of justice departments, organize an itinerant ombudsman service settlement in rural areas; promote the African contribution to international law; promote formulation of clear, established rules to deal with multiplicity of legal systems - local, religious, national - found in many African countries.
activities: Fieldwork in rural areas to raise standards of justice administration, mainly through national branches. Encourages formation of women's groups to advise on their specific problems, and of law teachers' and practitioners' groups. Preparing legal documentation to provide a record of affairs in Africa. Establishing an African Research Library in Africa. Plans setting up a 'School for Diplomats' to provide centralized training for African diplomats. With law enforcement agencies, organizes workshops for police and other law officers on civil liberties.

name: Pan-African Reconciliation Council (PARC)
aims: Promote peace, human rights, democracy, social justice, passive resistance to all forms of violence and oppression, emancipation of Africa and its siblings in the diaspora from the bondage of ignorance and party on the basis of active non-violence and self-giving love as a tool for social engineering and ultimate global order; build a social structure utilizing the resources of human ingenuity and wisdom for the benefit of all; ensure a society where no one is directly or indirectly oppressed for the benefit or pleasure of others; advocate fair and compassionate methods of treatment of offenders against society; protect, seek redress and provide welfare support for direct and indirect victims of war, natural and ecological disasters and encourage restitution and reconciliation; work towards abolition of war; help build morally disciplined homes; encourage vocational and collegial relations transcending all tribal, ethnic, creed, national or racial boundaries; promote the adversarial system of justice; uphold the truth in all facets of life.

name: Youth Against Racism in Europe (YRE)
aims: Combat racism and fascism.
activities: Organizes: international youth camps; demonstrations; Street campaigns; solidarity campaigns; pickets. Plans: anti-racist educational exchange project and tour

name: Inter-Pacific Bar Association (IPBA)
aims: Promote the rule of law. Provides members with the opportunity to: contribute to the development of the legal profession, its status and organization, in the "region" comprising Asia and the jurisdiction within, or bordering the Pacific; contribute to the development of law and legal structures within the region; meet and exchange ideas with other lawyers who live in or are interested in the region; share information on legal developments affecting the region.
activities: Organizes: annual conference; regional seminars, sometimes in conjunction with other organizations. Sponsors: M S Lin Scholarship Fund. Specialist Legal Committees/Working Committees (16): Aerospace law; cross-border investment; dispute resolution and arbitration; energy and national resources; environmental law; financial institutions and transactions; immigration, nationality and employment law; insolvency; insurance; intellectual property; international construction projects; international trade; legal practice; maritime law; tax law; women business lawyers.

name: International Association for Democracy in Africa
aims: Defend and promote: democracy and human rights in a governance society for sustainable development in Africa; government by the majority; respect of human, minority and individual rights and the right to differ; responsible government for just and transparent management of public affairs; people's sovereignty, freedom of the press and other freedoms to counterbalance other powers; Independence of the judicial system and an acute sense of its responsibilities by the citizens. Monitor democracy and the achievement of the rule of law in Africa
activities: Organizes: awareness campaigns; training seminars; conferences; round tables; workshops; for exchange of information; radio and TV programs; exhibitions. Carries out research on: electoral processes; a charter for political parties. Acts as observer to elections. Programs: democratic culture and human rights; governance and peace; sustainable development; women, children and gender

name: Arab Lawyers' Union (ALU)
aims: Act in the interests of the Arab Nation to achieve its national objectives; facilitate contacts between Arab lawyers; safeguard and develop legislative and judiciary language; assure the freedom of lawyers in their work and the independence of magistrates; allow all Arab lawyers to take cases in any Arab country; harmonize the conditions of the legal profession; establish and harmonize links with international legal organizations; restore the study of Muslim Law as a basis for law; promote and protect human rights.
activities: Commissions (9): Arab Affairs; Palestine; Unification of Law in Arab Countries; Defence of Civil Liberties and Rule of Law in Arab Countries; Harmonization of Legal Terminology; Rules on the Legal Profession; Socialization; Support of the Palestine Liberation Movement; Defence of Palestinian Resistance Workers. Engaged in founding an Arab Organization for Human Rights (AOHR, #01231). Decolonization action against racism, racial discrimination and apartheid.

name: International Association of Political Consultants (IAPC)
aims: Promote, sustain, and foster the democratic process as a matter of principle and practice; bring together political consultants, both specialists and generalists, from various countries to exchange views and information about political developments and techniques
activities: Organizes annual World conference where International Democracy Award is made

name: Memorial - International Historical and Educational, Charity and Human Rights Society
aims: Struggle against totalitarianism in all its manifestations; struggle for rights of the individual, for formation of a civil society and of a state governed by the rule of law which excludes the return to totalitarianism and for active participation and democratic transformation; contribute to restoration of historical truth about crimes committed by totalitarian regimes; preserve and perpetuate the memory of victims of totalitarianism; promote the complete and open rehabilitation of victims of repression and take measures to compensate for damage inflicted upon them; protect the rights of repressed victims and of members of their families, including rendering them legal assistance.
activities: Main guidelines: 1. 'Historical' - collection, study and publication of information about the history of political repression and human rights violation. 2. 'Human Rights' - Collection and study of information on the contemporary status of human rights, including public initiatives in solving the most acute problems in this sphere. 3. 'Charity' - social and medical assistance to victims of political repression. Initiates and participates in erecting memorial stones and plaques in cities of the former Soviet Union where executions and mass burials of victims of political repression have occurred, including publication of lists of executed victims and organization of exhibitions and mass actions dedicated to the victims' memory.

name: European Democrat Students (EDS)
aims: Work for a free, united and reconciled Europe; create by all possible means a better understanding of each other's cultural and political situation; promote contact and cooperation between Christian Democrat, conservative and liberal students from different countries; seek common action where possible, particularly towards the European institutions; engage in political campaigning upon various political issues; exchange information on education policy and other political matters; give support to countries where democracy is threatened.
activities: Working groups (4): higher education; agenda for Europe; future of Europe; campaigning. Organizes seminars and conferences to provide practical training and international work for representatives of member organizations. Annual Summer University, hosted by member organizations intern. Organizes human rights campaigns and campaigns for European elections.

name: General Federation of Arab Journalists (GFAJ)
aims: Serve the objectives of the Arab people in their unity; defend the causes of Arab journalists and develop their talents and abilities; defend the rights and freedoms of Arab journalists and human rights.
activities: Supports and coordinates the activities of member organizations. Collaborates with international press organizations and with organizations engaged in the defense of human rights and fundamental freedoms. Organizes or sponsors meetings, fora, exhibitions, training courses and exchange of delegations. Publishing activity.

name: Conferencia Permanente de Partidos Politicos de America Latina (COPPPAL)
aims: Coordinate efforts for peace and democracy in Latin America and the Caribbean.
activities: Organize the seminars, Congress Inns, symposia and colloquia.

name: Nordic Organization of Workers' Educational Associations (WEA in the Nordic Countries)
aims: Promote development of society within the ideological framework of democratic socialism through independent and voluntary popular education.
activities: Organizes: annual Nordic AOF School to increase knowledge of social, economic and cultural conditions in Nordic countries; local, regional and Nordic seminars, courses and study tours. Projects emphasize learning about people in other Nordic countries, in particular the self-governing areas of Aland, Faeroe Is and Greenland

name: African Parliamentary Union (APU)
aims: Unite parliamentary institutions of African states; favor contacts among parliamentary Africans and with parliamentarians worldwide; contribute to strengthening the institution of Parliament in Africa, to promoting democracy and human rights and to realizing of objectives of the Organization of African Unity for establishment of a durable peace.
activities: Observes elections in African countries. Organizes the medical conferences. Conducts information and training seminars.

name: Commonwealth Lawyers' Association (CLA)
aims: Maintain and promote the rule of law throughout the Commonwealth by ensuring: that the people of the Commonwealth are served by an independent and efficient legal profession; that a common bond of Commonwealth is preserved and fostered; professional links among members of the legal profession; maintenance of honour and integrity and promotion of uniform standards of professional ethics; improved standards of education and promotion of exchange of lawyers and students.
activities: Facilitates flow of professional information among law societies and bar associations; responds to ad hoc requests for information; supports related commonwealth and regional professional legal associations; organizes workshops and discussions; advises and assists in organization of the Commonwealth Law Conference and on follow-up action; administers grants and assists in the formation of regional groups of Commonwealth lawyers; supports the organization and operation of Commonwealth Law Foundation (inactive); Instrumental in setting up: Commonwealth Association of Armed Forces Lawyers (CAAFL, #05712); Commonwealth Association of Public Sector Lawyers (#05726); Commonwealth Human Rights Initiative (CHRI, #05763). Establishing capacity building projects with members in developing Commonwealth countries.

name: European Association of Magistrates for Democracy and Liberties
aims: Promote a European jurisdictional culture based on the legal values of democracy, essentially respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms; protect differences between human beings and the rights of minorities, especially of immigrants and the disadvantaged, with a view to social emancipation; support European integration in creating a European political union aimed at greater social justice; defend the independence of the judiciary from other authorities and specific interests; promote transparency of the judicial system, democratization of the magistrate sure and the right of judges to meet, to express themselves and to form unions; promote exchange of information and of a democratic legal culture between judges of different countries.

name: Union Internationale des Journalistes Africains (UIJA)
aims: Work for the benefit of the continent and African journalists in a spirit of cooperation and African unity; promote cooperation among journalists; coordinate professional activities; defend the right to freedom of expression in the spirit of realistic understanding, especially in the struggle against apartheid; defend African causes in general.
activities: Organizes: training programs; seminars; conferences. Library.

name: International Association of Prosecutors (IAP)
aims: Promote effective, fair, impartial and efficient prosecution of criminal offences; respect and seek to protect human rights as laid down in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights proclaimed at the General Assembly of the United Nations on 10 Dec 1948; promote high standards and principles in administration of criminal justice, including procedures to guard against or address miscarriages, in support of the rule of law, promote and enhance those standards and principles which are generally recognized internationally as necessary for proper and independent prosecution of offences; promote measures for elimination of corruption in public administration; promote professional interests of prosecutors and enhance recognition of their crucial role in achieving criminal justice; promote good relations between individual prosecutors and prosecution agencies; facilitate exchange and dissemination of information, expertise and experience, and to that end, encourage use of information technology; promote examination of comparative criminal law and procedures and assist prosecutors engaged in justice reform projects; cooperate with international juridical organizations in furtherance of IAP's aims. Assist prosecutors internationally in the fight against organized or other serious crime, and for that purpose: promote international cooperation in gathering and providing evidence, in tracking, seizing and forfeiting the proceeds of serious crime and in the prosecution of fugitive criminals; promote speed and efficiency in such international cooperation.
activities: Works closely with the UN Secretariat to secure assistance of experienced prosecutors for projects and advice in developing countries; organizes annual conference; develops and promulgates a series of standards for prosecutors.

name: European Association of Lawyers for Democracy and World Human Rights (EALDH)
aims: Promote human rights, peace, disarmament and understanding between peoples; fight against racism and fascism; fight against discrimination; promote equal entitlement of women and men and respect children's rights; protect the environment.
activities: Formulates draft legal instruments in order to influence the development of law and democracy in all European countries and within European institutions, as well as in the other regions of the world; supports concrete projects in other regions of the world with a view to develop and progress of democratic and law-governed relations, in cooperation with the lawyers of the countries concerned; supports all the measures undertaken by the European states and the European Union for creation of conditions for migratory movements of the world in accordance with human dignity; organizes conferences, missions and campaigns.

name: International Young Democrat Union (IYDU)
aims: Promote and defend the ideals and cultural heritage of pluralist democracies; contribute to and participate in the workings of IDU; extend and strengthen cooperation among member organizations

name: Federation of Latin American Journalists
aims: Defend the freedom of the press and of access to information; improve working conditions; contribute to friendship among the peoples of Latin America and the Caribbean; show solidarity with journalists who are persecuted.

name: Association of African Election Authorities (AAEA)
aims: Promote cooperation and mutual assistance among electoral organizations in the region in the pursuit of democracy by processes that ensure free, fair and peaceful elections.

name: Association of Caribbean Electoral Organizations (ACEO)
aims: Promote cooperation and mutual assistance among electoral organizations in the region in the pursuit of democracy by processes that ensure free, fair and peaceful elections.

name: Association of Asian Election Authorities (AAEA)
aims: Promote and institutionalize open and transparent elections, independent election authorities, professional election administration, citizen participation in the electoral and civic process, information sharing; develop information resources.
activities: Projects include: development of Asian-election law compendium; election observation missions and staff exchanges; distribution of election-related materials; arrangement of professional development opportunities.

name: Association of Central and Eastern European Election Officials (ACEEEO)
aims: Provide a non-partisan forum, independent of national governments, for information exchange among election officials and experts throughout the Central and Eastern European region to discuss and act upon ways to promote open and transparent elections with the objective of supporting good governance and democracy.
activities: Maintains an Election Documentation Centre. Offers electoral training and studies. Conducts election observation missions.

name: Asian Federation Against Involuntary Disappearances (AFAD)
aims: Promote, protect and defend the human rights of victims of involuntary disappearance in Asia and their families; facilitate the search for the disappeared, with the hope of rescuing lives; build, develop and promote international solidarity among organizations of families of the disappeared within Asia and among individual representatives of countries where these organizations cannot exist because of intense repression; assist member organizations in their local concerns on involuntary disappearance; promote awareness of disappearances and act urgently on specific cases; develop strategies and tactics for lobbying Asian government bodies at national, regional and international levels; transmit denunciations to competent international organizations; campaign actively against government measures to perpetuate impunity and for public acknowledgement of disappearances by governments and their commitment to establish mechanisms to make disappearances illegal; become avenue for discussion on substantive issues and training on relevant topics and for the holistic healing of families suffering the pain and economic loss of losing loved ones; work for adoption of international instruments aimed at preventing enforced disappearance.
activities: Formulates updates on the situation of disappearances in Asia and reports these to WGEID and other appropriate international and regional bodies; developing an e-mail urgent response network.

name: Democrat Union of Africa (DUA)
aims: Serve as a forum for dialogue between member organizations and policymakers on issues of democracy, good government, economic policy, human rights and human development.
activities: Organize meetings and seminars.

name: International Democrat Union (IDU)
aims: Promote a free, open and democratic society, the free market economy, the rule of law, social justice, the role of the family, and a society where conditions are created to enable everyone to reach their full potential and carry out their responsibilities to their fellow men and women; Foster the common philosophy of member parties; establish permanent relations at a bilateral and multilateral level and encourage mutual support; provide a forum for the exchange of views and information on matters of interest to all or a considerable number of member parties
activities: Undertakes fact-finding missions, for example to: Central America; South Africa. SFCA develops internal reports on specific international questions, providing the basis for public communiques and for recommendations to the leadership of member parties. Occasional ad hoc groups monitor important national elections and prepare for future work.

name: South East Europe Media Organization (SEEMO)
aims: Promote and safeguard freedom of the press in the South East European region; improve the standards and practices of journalism; promote cooperation, understanding and the free exchange of news; ensure safety of journalists.
activities: Programs (3): media aid; media law; media in transition. Set up 'SEEMO Emergency Fund'; organizes conferences and congresses; presents 'Dr Erhard Busek-SEEMO Award for Better Understanding in South East Europe' and 'SEEMO Award for mutual cooperation in SEE', the letter presented during international human rights day (10 Dec).

name: Federacion Latinoamericana de Trabajadores de la Comunicacion Social (FELATRACS)
aims: Promote the organization of workers in the press sector in all countries of Latin America, providing material and technical assistance as necessary, and organizing necessary services at the Latin American level, cooperating in national-level provision of such services; promote unity at the national level among all organizations in the sector to render the activities more effective; study, promote, defend and represent the interests of press workers with government bodies in Latin America and worldwide, in line with workers' rights and interests; defend and promote the right for free and democratic organization of all press workers; monitor respect for freedom of information and expression.
activities: Denounces violations of the liberty of information and free expression Latin America and the Caribbean and defends the physical integrity and the human rights of journalists and press workers. Organizes meetings, seminars, training workshops, correspondence courses. Hold congresses (every 4 years).

name: Global Organization of Parliamentarians Against Corruption (GOPAC)
aims: Fight corruption; promote integrity through the enhancement of the effectiveness of parliament and legislators; provide a voice for global parliamentarians fighting corruption.
activities: Develops: training/orientation package on budgetary oversight; a code of conduct for parliamentarians initiative; money laundering initiative; election financing initiative. Organizes biennial conference.

name: Association of Local Democracy Agencies (ALDA)
aims: Improve, sustain and develop the process of local democracy, transporter cooperation and intercultural dialogue in Europe, in particular in South East Europe.
activities: Organizes summer school; training courses.

name: European Association of Political Consultants (EAPC)
aims: Develop, support and maintain the democratic process; increase exchange of information and experience between political consultants.

name: Pan-African Lawyers Union (PALU)
aims: Strengthen the unity of Africa under the rule of law; consolidate existing efforts and develop new initiatives aimed at creating greater awareness and respect for the rule of law and fundamental rights; promote legal reforms and harmonization of laws in Africa; establish and maintain relations and promote and foster relationships, cooperation, Mutual support and exchange of ideas among Bar Associations, law societies and their members throughout Africa while respecting diversity of legal and judicial systems and cultures; support and defend independence of bar associations, law societies, lawyers, the judiciary and judges in order to approve the administration of justice and foster the achievement of sustainable development in Africa; develop and improve effective systems of legal aid and legal services to the public; promote, develop and advance the science of law and jurisprudence; develop and maintain reciprocal arrangements for the practice of law in Africa with a view to achieving uniform standards of justice and judicial administration; develop and carry out joint programs and projects; promote and protect gender equity and participation of women lawyers and advanced women's rights and social justice in Africa.

name: Arab Organization for Human Rights (AOHR)
aims: Call for respect of human rights and fundamental freedoms of all citizens and individuals in Arab countries in accordance with provisions of international human rights instruments; defend any individual or group whose human rights are subjected to violations which are contrary to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant of Economic, Social, and Cultural Rights and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights; endeavour, regardless of political considerations, to obtain release of detained or imprisoned persons, and provide relief and assistance for persons whose freedom is restricted in any way or who are subjected to coercion of any kind because of their beliefs and political convictions, or for reasons of race, sex, color or language; protest in cases where a fair trial is not guaranteed; provide legal assistance where necessary and possible; call for improvements in conditions of prisoners of conscience; work for amnesty of persons sentenced for political reasons.
activities: Carries out field missions in an effort to release political prisoners, in some cases as an observer and in other as a member of the defence panel. Receives complaints from individuals, groups and organizations and contacts the concerned authorities. In addition to the offering of legal assistance in several cases, the Organization provides financial assistance to families of victims. In coordination with Arab Lawyers' Union launched a campaign for 'Freedom for Prisoners of Conscience in the Arab World'. Conferences and seminars. Instrumental in setting up: Arab Human Rights Documentation and Information Network (AHRINET, #01176); Arab Institute tor Human Rights (AIHR, #01186).

name: Inter-African Union of Human Rights (IUHR)
aims: Ensure that the rule of law is preeminent and that rights and liberties are respected; encourage the study and promotion of human and peoples rights; simulate the study and recognition of new human rights made necessary by economic, industrial and scientific development; strive that, by supplementing and reinforcing rather than replacing national human rights organizations, serve as the collective watchdog, at the African level, of principles embodied in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the African Charter of Human and Peoples' Rights
activities: Field investigations in tension areas; campaigns to promote signing and ratification of human rights instruments and procedures for harmonizing international law with international human rights treaties; roster of eminent individuals committed to human rights

name: Confederation of ASEAN Journalists (CAJ)
aims: Cooperate fully in advancing journalism; promote a health, free and responsible press in ASEAN countries; promote dialogue, discussion and cooperation with journalists, scholars and professionals in the world.
activities: Organizes (every 2 years) General Assemblies and ASEAN Press Conventions. Seminars; workshops; courses.

name: Centre for the Independence of Judges and Lawyers (CIJL)
aims: Promote and protect judicial and legal independence and impartiality through a variety of means, basing work on the UN basic principles on the independence of the judiciary and the UN basic principles on the role of lawyers.
activities: Intervenes with governments in particular cases of harassment or persecution of jurists and, in some instances, solicits the aid of a network of jurist and lawyers' organizations throughout the world to do likewise; works with the United Nations in setting standards for the independence of judges and lawyers; observes trials which impact upon judicial independence or where lawyers are targeted; conducts fact-finding missions to countries where the function of the judiciary is under serious threat; organizes seminars to promote the UN Basic Principles on the Independence of the Judiciary and the UN Basic Principles on the Role of Lawyers; provides technical assistance to strengthen the judiciary and the legal profession; publish his country reports document in cases of harassment and persecution of judges and lawyers throughout the world.

name: European Community Organization of Socialist Youth (ECOSY)
aims: Promote and realize ideas of democratic socialism such as expressed in the Declaration of Principles, within the European Union and in Europe as a whole, in cooperation and solidarity with the rest of the world; contribute to construction of a democratic European state; defend interests of youth in the European Union; progressively integrate member organizations on a European level.
activities: Congresses, conferences, seminars, summer camps.

name: Group of the European People's Party in the Committee of the Regions
aims: Promote the ideals of the Christian democratic movement as broadly as possible.
activities: Range of activities with local and regional authorities throughout Europe.

name: United Nations University International Leadership Academy (UNU/ILA)
aims: Create a network of enlightened future leaders who will enhance global cooperation through dialogue and intercultural exchange; study conflict resolution through negotiation, democracy, justice and solidarity; through leadership training, seek to develop and strengthen responsibility, self-reliance and commitment to service.
activities: Develops programs: training; lecture and debate series; research.

name: Association for the Prevention of Torture (APT)
aims: Prevent torture in any form and under any political regime; strengthen implementation of international norms and principles prohibiting torture and seek establishment and effective implementation of instruments of international law aiming at strengthening protection against torture and cruel, and human or degrading treatment of persons deprived of their liberty; promote control mechanisms such as visits to places of dissension.
activities: Pursues the adoption of and promotes respect for standards that prevent torture and other forms of ill-treatment; supports and promotes the establishment of mechanisms visiting places of detention and other control mechanisms that prevent torture and other forms of ill-treatment. Cooperates with international, regional and national bodies preventing torture and ill-treatments. Promotes the universal ratification and implementation of convention against torture and other cruel, and human or degrading treatment or punishment (1984), its Optional Protocol, which establishes international and national mechanisms to visit persons deprived of their liberty, the effective implementation of European convention for the prevention of torture and in human or degrading treatment or punishment (1987), as well as other relevant regional instruments. Disseminates related information and provides expert advice on means to prevention of torture and other forms of ill-treatment. Organizes: seminars; information and training sessions, including interdisciplinary discussions on relevant topics in various countries and regions. Engages in constructive dialogue with police. Current regional and thematic programs (5): Africa; Americas; Europe; UN; legal and visits. Programs include: training; advice; promoting awareness; facilitating discussion and debate; calling for changes in procedures and systems.

name: Comisión Jurídica para el Autodesarrollo de los Pueblos Originarios Andinos (CAPAJ)
aims: Contribute to the fighting against all the forms of discrimination or the acts that threaten the indigenous peoples and their fundamental rights contained in the constitutions of their countries and in the Universal Declaration of the Human Rights.
activities: Juridical support; participation in international and regional meetings and in national seminars and workshops. Proposes to set up: Academia Andina de Derecho Internacional Público (AADIP, no recent information).

name: International Federation for East Timor (IFET)
aims: Provide support from international civil society for the people of Timor-Leste in freely exercising their rights to political, economic and social self-determination; endeavor to guarantee internationally recognized human rights and justice for all involved in Timor-Leste's evolution to full and genuine independence; assist the United Nations in helping Timor-Leste reach these goals by providing information to UN officials and organs, mobilizing international public opinion and advocating with UN officials and governments of member states
activities: Main activities: lobbying and advocacy; democracy development; human rights promotion; policy advice; Citizen diplomacy. Propagate the ideals and establish principles of decolonization and human rights; disseminate information on the particular case of decolonization and transition to genuine independence of Timor-Leste; collects and disseminate data on human rights and political and justice situations in the country; if necessary, organizes campaigns to support people in achieving their human, political and economic rights, according to internationally recognized standards; facilitates consultation and dialogue among member NGOs as well as other interested NGOs to coordinate activities on an international level; communicates common concerns of participant NGOs to relevant authorities and individuals. Sent observers to 1999 UN consultation in Timor-Leste and continues to advocate for justice for those who committed massive human rights violations there from 1974 through 1999. Upholds the principles recognized by the United Nations charter, particularly in regard to the decolonization process and asserts that the decolonization of Timor-Leste must be fulling in line with those internationally recognized principles.

name: Media Institute of Southern Africa (MISA)
aims: Promote free, independent and pluralistic media; promote the free flow of information and cooperation between media workers, as a principle means of nurturing democracy and human rights in Africa.
activities: Programme areas: media law and policy environment; media freedom monitoring; media accountability; organizational strengthening and capacity building; media initiatives support.

name: World Association of Judges (WAJ)
aims: Advance the administration of judicial justice through cooperation and communication among ranking judicial officials of all nations in an effort to bring to bear upon the common problems of humankind the University except processes, procedures, principles and institutions of the rule of law.

name: Asian Legal Resource Centre (ALRC)
aims: Promote awareness among the oppressed of their inalienable rights as human beings and of remedies available to them under national, regional and international instruments; promote awareness and acceptance among jurists and others whose activities affect human rights of their responsibilities to serve and protect the oppressed; provide for exchange within Asia of expertise and experience among human rights organizations and legal resources in support of such human rights in the countries of the region; promote the training of lawyers to render effective legal assistance to the oppressed and victims of human rights violations; develop methodologies for, and assistant in the training of, paralegal workers, and facilitate the sharing of such experience; develop programmes of mass education about law, and support sharing of experiences of those involved in such programmes; promote creation and strengthening of legal resource organizations in the region; promote efforts to increase access for the oppressed to judicial administrative institutions, and efforts to reform such institutions to increase their ability to provide timely and effective relief.
activities: Main functions: coordinates and shares amongst local, national and sub-regional groups and individuals information on legal service programmes and legal initiatives being taken in Asian countries, through such means as publications, exchange of materials and workshops; facilitates exchanges of people working in fields of human rights and legal resources, and encourages the sharing of information and skills and the development of such programs in places where they do not currently exist, through visits, internship and similar actions; develops training schemes to assist the creation and operation of legal resource and para-legal programmes, and promotes such programmes on a sub-regional basis; researches and analyses current legal issues concerning human rights violations and oppression of persons and peoples within Asia; encourages the development of a macro-perspective on these problems and provides such information for: Asian Human Rights Commission (AHRC, #01675).

name: Centre for Democracy and Reconciliation in Southeast Europe (CDRSEE)
aims: Foster democratic, pluralist societies and market economies that operate within the framework of the law.
activities: Organizes conferences, seminars, exchange program and research projects.

name: World Press Freedom Committee (WPFC)
aims: Support the freedom and independence of news media and free flow of news and information; advocate and monitor press freedom concerns in inter-governmental organizations; assist news media, journalists and journalism schools in developing and post communist countries through training programs, manuals, provision of equipment and other means.
activities: Serve as a watchdog for news media at UNESCO, United Nations, nonaligned and other conferences. Coordinates cooperative press freedom activities with other groups for greater effectiveness. Administers the fund against censorship. Carries out projects to assist news media and journalism schools in Africa, Asia, Latin America, the Caribbean and Central and Eastern Europe.

name: Latin American Journalism Centre
aims: Promote a free and responsible press through ongoing education and training of journalists
activities: Specialized courses for journalists and media staff.

name: International Center for Not-for-Profit Law (ICNL)
aims: Facilitate and support the development of civil society and the freedom of association; assist in creating and improving laws and regulatory systems that permit, encourage and sustain voluntary, independent, not-for-profit organizations (NPOs) worldwide
activities: Undertakes research and technical assistance projects

name: Human Rights without Frontiers International (HRWF)
aims: Promote democracy, the rule of law and the rights of the individual - men, women and child – everywhere in the world, by every appropriate means.
activities: Monitors: human rights in North Korea and Iraq; human rights in Belgium and France; freedom of religion and belief around the world; human rights activities in European institutions in Brussels; national minorities in Belgium, Iraq, Turkey etc. Organizes international press conferences.

name: European Liberal, Democrat and Reform Party (ELDR)
aims: Contribute to create a democratic European Union with decentralized characteristics
activities: Strengthens the liberal, Democrat and reform movement in the European Union and throughout Europe; seeks a common position on all important problems affecting the European Union; informs the public and involves it in the construction of the united European democracy; supports and coordinates the member parties in the elections to the European Parliament; promotes the constitution of a liberal, democrat and reform parliamentary Group in all international parliamentarian assemblies; develops working relationships among its national parties, their national parliamentary groups, ELDR Group of the European Parliament and the Liberal, Democrat and Reform Group in other international fora and ELDR party.

name: Party of European Socialists (PES)
