aims: Strengthen the socialist movement in the European Union and throughout Europe; develop cooperation and the exchange of information between parties; Attempt to define the essential guidelines and common priorities for the main problems arising from the existence of the European Union; guarantee close working relationships between member parties, PES and the Parliamentary Group of PES in the European Parliament; ensure close collaboration and mutual understanding with the Socialist Group of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe; ensure close collaboration and mutual understanding with Socialist International; promote exchanges and contacts with European trade unions, professional organizations, associations and cooperatives.
activities: Priorities: the growth of employment and the fight against unemployment; freedom, the rights of the citizen and individual self-fulfillment; abolition of all forms of discrimination; protection of environment; justice and social protection; peace and security. Secretariat responsible for organizing meetings and providing research/background material.

name: International Buchenwald-Dora Committee (IBDC)
aims: Group the survivors of the Nazi concentration camps of Buchenwald, Dora and their 'Kommandos', as well as their families and descendants, in order to safeguard the places of remembrance, the memory of the history, and the struggle of the anti-fascist resistance for the liberty and human solidarity

name: International Sachsenhausen Committee
aims: Commemorate the victims of the concentration camp at Sachsenhausen; promote peace and friendship between peoples to as to avoid all return to fascism
activities: Conservation of the Memorial; contributes to youth education

name: Centrist Democratic International (CDI)
aims: Promote and coordinate international activity of Christian Democratic parties, ensuring political solidarity; carry out doctrinal and political research of general interest for Christian democracy; disseminate Christian democratic ideas and promote knowledge of their achievements.
activities: Seminars on the ideological and political platform of CDI. Permanent committees (4) on: development; economic problems; human rights; relations with the United Nations. Information and documentation service for members. Coordinates political and vocational training centers in most member countries.

name: SEAIAC Press International
aims: Through international understanding, promote factual information and analytic research concerning the World situation; provide critical analysis of world events; promote democracy and respect for human rights.
activities: Provides research and analysis to international media, universities and academic researchers (area conflicts, arms proliferation, terrorism, etc.). Carries out aid projects, assistance for refugees and national reconstruction. Organizes/supports conferences and international exhibitions.

name: International Movement Against All Forms of Discriminiation and Racism
aims: Embody the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and other international human rights instruments, in keeping with the spirit of the United Nations charter and in close cooperation with United Nations and human rights activities; in particular, eliminate all forms of discrimination from all parts of the world and promote the human rights; make contributions in order to properly resolve problems in the above field, through such means as investigations, research, educational and appealing activities
activities: Investigations and research concerning all forms of discrimination existing in the world. Lecture classes and meetings; study meetings. Participates in and makes proposals to human rights related conferences held by the United Nations and its specialized agencies. Publishing activity.

name: World Organization Against Torture (OMCT)
aims: Work to combat torture, summary executions, disappearances, psychiatric internment for political reasons and all other cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment.
activities: Worldwide network of reliable organizations transmits information daily, allowing facilitation of virtually instantaneous intervention on behalf of people threatened by torture. Operates the SOS – torture network. Operates on four levels (1): ensures rapid distribution of information; (2) offers a contact NGO policy for action (3) advises organizations about international procedures; (4) brings urgent assistance to victims of torture and those seeking to help them in the field.

name: Hansard Society for Parliamentary Government
aims: Promote knowledge of and interest in parliamentary government as well as political awareness.
activities: Organizes conferences for young people in the United Kingdom and international conferences. Promote research on controversial aspects of modern democratic government and unbiased political education in schools and institutes of further education. Monitors the televising of the House of Lords and the House of Commons (UK). Runs: Central and Eastern Europe Program: Hansard Scholars Programme.

name: Women and Law in Southern Africa Research Trust (WLSA)
aims: Improve legal status of women in Southern Africa; develop research skills of women's law and researchers; conduct research on gender issues in Southern Africa, particularly those related to legal rights; provide information on gender and the law and influencing policy and law reform in each country and exchange this information among member countries; explore and develop new methodologies and perspectives for the study of gender and the law; cooperate and liaise with other organizations in each country, regionally and internationally.
activities: Development of a regional network of women and men researching women's legal rights. Regional seminars. Studies for all seven member countries. Programs of action (6): activist research (core program); information dissemination and documentation; legal advice and services; lobbying and advocacy for policy, legal reform and change; networking; training and education on women's rights.

name: Europe 2000, Bruxelles
aims: Independent of any political interference, study systemically, and promote conditions likely to favour, maintenance of the state governed by the rule of law and based on respect for human rights, in European society of the third millennium
activities: Submits proposals for appropriate action and legislation to constituted authorities, as well as to executive, judicial and consultative bodies. In support of its objectives, Europe 2000 pursues programmes like: organization of conferences and seminars; provision of expert council to public and private bodies; assistance to groups and individuals pursuing the same objectives.

name: Unrepresented Nations and Peoples Organization (UNPO)
aims: Empower those nations, minorities and peoples not represented in established international forum by: providing a legitimate forum and effective channels to communicate with the international community, including governments, NGOs, IGOs, and the media; detecting and investigating situations of potential conflict, preventive diplomacy and assistance in conflict resolution processes, including negotiations; promoting democratic processes and institutions, and providing services to more effectively empower all sectors of society to participate in determining the destiny of their nations and peoples.
activities: Conflict prevention and resolution by sending fact-finding missions, assisting with negotiation, providing various training sessions and early warning through information dissemination and organizing awareness raising tours for member delegates. Promotion of democratic processes and institutions through election monitoring and providing constitutional and other advisory services. Promotion of effective participation at the United Nations through information dissemination, training and provision of technical assistance to member delegates participating in meetings of UN human rights bodies. Media and information center. Conferences and workshops. Includes friends of UNPO.

name: Asian-Pacific League for Freedom and Democracy (APLFD)
aims: Help unite peoples of Asia and the Pacific in promoting freedom, democracy and human rights and also in enhancing friendly cooperation for the economic and social wellbeing and security of the peoples of Asia and the Pacific region.

name: Transnational Radical Party (TRP)
aims: As a Gandhian, non-violent organization, promote international political campaigns concerning: respect for human rights, particularly in non-democratic countries; promotion of democracy and freedom; anti-prohibitionist policies on drugs and against illegal trafficking and drugs; abolition of capital punishment; language rights and the use of Esperanto as the auxiliary language of international institutions; democratic reform of the United Nations.
activities: Campaign for the setting up of international criminal court (ICC, #16240). Proposes to set up: United States of Europe and America; World organization of democracy and of democracies.

name: Caribbean Human Rights Network
aims: Disseminate information to national, regional and international organizations; promote human rights at the regional level - this includes embarking on regional campaigns; assist in the coordination of regional human rights action programmes; facilitate the exchange of visits between persons or groups with a human rights interest; mount missions - fact-finding and election observer missions.
activities: Promotion of human rights in the Caribbean by means of: (a) coordination of regional campaigns on human rights issues; (b) urging ratification of Conventions and strengthening inter-governmental machinery; (c) creating an informed regional public opinion through education awareness; (d) strengthening the capacity of local human rights bodies for effective action. As far as the methods of work are concerned, the Network: (a) Routinely cooperates with regional and international human rights bodies in the exchange of information, joint actions and facilitating missions and visits in the region; (b) Takes initiatives at the request of affiliates; (c) Attempts to interest the Caribbean media in human rights issues. Major areas of concern: police brutality; elections and democracy; freedom of expression. Current new programmes: (i) Women's Rights (ii) Death Penalty; (iii) Democracy within the Region; (iv) Documentation; (v) Rights of People with Disabilities; (vi) Monitoring Socio-Economic Conditions and its Negative Impact on Caribbean peoples; (vii) Human Rights Education and Training.

name: Helsinki Citizens' Assembly (hCa)
aims: As an international coalition of civil society initiatives, East and West, work for the integration of Europe from the citizens' level; in particular, aid the process of transition of post communist countries, especially in issues connected with basic values of democracy - tolerance, mutual understanding and confidence, human rights and political and economic reconstruction; carry out projects addressing issues of peace and integration among citizens.
activities: Functions as a network of NGOs across Europe, focusing on local and regional issues and cooperating through hCa International secretariat. Organizes: annual summer school for international dialogue; youth network; investigative missions to conflict areas; fora for international dialogue among citizens. Projects have been implemented in the trans-Caucasus countries, Hungary, Poland, Czech Republic, Slovakia and the former Yugoslav states. Commission themes: 1. 'Human Rights - including rights of minorities' - Helsinki refugee consensus. 2. 'civil society and the institutionalization of the process of European integration' - including 3 ongoing workshops: charter for the hCA - Magna Charter Gentium - European Constitution; Direct involvement of civil society (hCA) in the Helsinki process; a road for Europe - from confederal to federal structures.

name: Transparency International (TI)
aims: Focus on combating international and national corruption, increasing government accountability and raising public awareness of the need to curb corruption, through international and national coalitions encouraging governments to establish and implement effective laws, policies and anti-corruption programs; strengthen public support and understanding for anti-corruption programs and enhance public transparency and accountability in international business transactions and in the administration of public procurement; encourage all parties to international business transactions to operate at the highest level of integrity, guided in particular by TI standards of conduct.
activities: Works through the national chapters, which build coalitions to strengthen integrity systems in their countries. Developed 'Islands of Integrity' based on a binding agreement - Integrity Pact - signed by all those bidding for a project and by the procurement agency. Works for international coordination to criminalize transnational corruption and to develop and implement international legal frameworks against corruption, by shaping public policy discussions in various fora.

name: European Parliament - Group of the European Liberal, Democrat and Reform Party (ELDR)
Parliamentarians for Global Action (PGA)
aims: Promote effective interparliamentary collaboration to mobilize global political action for an equitable, safe and democratic world. Serve a global constituency of legislators, governments, the UN system and civil society.
activities: Program areas (5): 'Peace and Democracy' - promotes peace-making and democracy and every part of the world; sends observers to monitor elections; provides problem-solving to help emerging democracies. 'International Law and Human Rights' - initiated work on international criminal court (ICC) in 1989, by resolution at the UN and through bills presented in different parliaments, culminating in the Rome Statue in 1998 and its entry into force in 2002. Advises parliamentarians on enabling legislation; coordinate a worldwide process for ratification of the ICC; hold annual consultative assembly of parliamentarians for the ICC and the rule of law. 'Sustainable Development and Population' - served in the parliamentary consensus for the Rio summit in 1992 and the Cairo population conference of 1994. Since 1995, has worked to implement program in West Africa, specifically in Ghana, Senegal, Bali and Nigeria, by coordinating legislators' delegations to the US Congress. 'Economic Revitalization' - promotes parliamentary oversight of the World Bank and other international monetary institutions; launch Parliamentary Network on the World Bank in 1998. 'Arms Control' - was instrumental in the signing of the chemical weapons convention (CTBT); supports UN peacekeeping efforts; members engage in crisis mitigation. Organizes meetings, dialogs, seminars and conferences. Offers 'annual defender of democracy award.' Middle Powers Initiative (MPI, #21399), set up Mar 1988, continues the work commenced by PGA in the 1980s aimed at establishing a 'Middle Power Coalition for Disarmament.' Also proposes the setting up of: parliamentary early warning network (no recent information); United Nations parliamentary assembly (UNPA).

name: Study and Research Group on Democracy, Economic and Social Development in Africa (GERDDES-Africa)
aims: Promote the democracy for favoring the economic and social development of African countries.
activities: Through its research and program execution body, international research center on democracy and development (IRCD), has initiated six Main programs since 1994: GERDDES-Elections; GERDDES-Good Governance; GERDDES-Humanitarian; GERDDES-Environment; publications and development of the independent press; general studies and research on democracy and development. Organizes seminars and conferences.

name: Commonwealth Local Government Forum (CLGF)
aims: Promote local democracy and decentralization in member countries of the Commonwealth; assist creation of partnerships and links for best practice in local management and service delivery; support capacity-building for local government practitioners; share the practice of good governance with countries and institutions embarking on the path to democracy; build on links within the Commonwealth at non-governmental and professional levels. Particular concern is governance/local democracy.
activities: Organizes: Commonwealth Local Government Conference; regional policy workshops; other conferences and symposium; Commonwealth local government good practice scheme. Concerns: provision of local services; low-cost housing and management of squatter camps; Basic healthcare; education and management capacity. Proposes setting up Commonwealth Fund for Democracy.

name: Socialist International (SI)
aims: Strengthen relations among member parties and organizations and coordinate their political views and activities by consent; establish contact with progressive forces worldwide working for application of the principles of democratic socialism - and international movement for freedom, social justice and solidarity.
activities: Current major activity center on: promotion of concrete action to further north - south dialogue; study of problems of economic development, including questions of energy, employment and environment, promotion of human rights, contributing to peaceful solutions to regional conflicts; support for the democratization process in Africa; advancement and consolidation of democracy in Central and Eastern Europe; development of a democratic socialist strategy for Latin America and the Caribbean; support for the peace process in the Middle East; enlarged presence in the Asia-Pacific region. Sends missions or delegations to various countries or regions. European Forum for Democracy and Solidarity (EFDS) assists Central and European countries in transition and includes Central and Eastern European network for gender issues. Party leaders' conferences are held regularly in confidential and informal sessions.

name: Asian Forum for Human Rights and Development (FORUM-ASIA)
aims: Facilitate cooperation among human rights organizations in Asia so as to develop a regional response for the promotion of human rights, economic, social and cultural rights and democracy in the region.
activities: Education and training, including voter education programs to strengthen democracy, programs for awareness of internationally accepted human rights standards and their integration by local human rights organizations and programs for awareness and use of UN mechanisms, especially human rights convention; campaigns and joint action with other organizations on specific issues; fact-finding and research; documentation of human rights violations; assistance to members in election monitoring; internships and exchange visits. Setting up working groups (South Asia and Southeast Asia) to study human rights dimensions of displacement. Project: Friends Without Borders.

name: CIVICUS - World Alliance for Citizen Participation
aims: As a global alliance of citizens and their organizations, pursue a world in which: citizen action is a predominant feature of the political, economic and cultural life of all societies; private action for the public good is expressed by organizations operating sometimes apart and sometimes in dialogue with government and business; society involves equitable relationship among citizens, their associations and foundations, business and governments. Nurture the foundation, growth, protection and resourcing of citizen action worldwide, especially where participatory democracy, freedom of association of citizens and their funds for public benefit are threatened; advance regional and national agendas of common initiatives to strengthen the capacity of civil society, serve as an open forum to facilitate and establish cross-sectoral dialogue, exchange information, develop a common understanding and shared identity, solidarity, cooperation, and communication within civil society from various regions and promote a common vision about the role of civil society.
activities: International task forces guide special projects to foster progress in 3 areas: Increasing visibility and understanding of civil society; Enhancing the resource base; Advocating freedom of association (international principles for laws and regulations for civil society organizations).

name: International Freedom of Expression Exchange (IFEX)
aims: Assist international campaigns for human rights by supplying information on freedom of expression and press freedom, including attacks on writers and journalists and the use of censorship and press laws; provide information to news organizations, the academic community and general public for educational purposes
activities: Through IFEX Clearing House, operates: (i) Action Alert Network (AAN), whereby member organizations report free expression abuse in their geographic region or area of expertise to the clearinghouse, which circulates this information and regular 'action alerts' to other members and interested organizations all over the world, thus allowing members to stay abreast of their counterparts' activities, share information and research and focus their energies where most needed and allowing rapid, worldwide and coordinated response to press freedom and freedom of expression violations. Action alerts help turn the spotlight onto those responsible for human rights violations and lead to coordinated letter-writing campaigns which have helped release prisoners, lift publication bans and even save lives. (ii) IFEX Outreach Programme, launched 1995, based on a recognition of current North-south Disparities and designed to support and strengthen fledgling freedom-of-expression organizations in the developing world, Eastern Europe and the former Soviet Union. IFEX provides information, financial and technical resources, expertise and international support and recognition, helping organizations in these countries to build links with the international freedom of expression community. Internet is the main means of communication for the IFEX community, since its speed and relative low-cost allows even those members with very limited resources and international exposure to bring immediate attention to those arrested or endangered for speaking out.

name: World League for Freedom and Democracy (WLFD)
aims: Disseminate worldwide the ideals of freedom and democracy; encourage and support the universal application; promote respect for and observation of human rights and fundamental freedoms for all peoples; act as agent and coordinating center for international cooperation and economic development and educational and cultural exchange aimed at contributing to social progress and better living standards; combine efforts against aggression, imperialism, totalitarianism and authoritarianism of whatever form and pretension, whenever and wherever any of such forces appears.
activities: Organizes: annual general conference; annual event of the world freedom day; international academic symposium. Organizes, sponsors or cosponsors occasional exchanges, missions and symposia. Instrumental in setting up: Asian Pacific youth league for freedom and democracy (APYLFD, no recent information); World youth league for freedom and democracy (WYLFD, no recent information).

name: SADC Parliamentary Forum
aims: Involve parliamentarians in SADC activities so as to strengthen SADC implementation capacity; facilitate effective implementation of SADC policies and projects; promote principles of human rights and democracy in the region; familiarize people in SADC countries with SADC aims and objectives; inform SADC of people's views on development and other relevant issues; provide a forum for discussion on matters of common interest; support development of permanent conflict resolution mechanisms in the SADC subregion so as to promote peace, democracy, security and disability on the basis of collective responsibility; promote collective self-reliance and economic efficiency so as to contribute to a more prosperous future for SADC peoples; hasten the pace of economic cooperation and development integration based on the principle of equity and mutual benefits; strengthen regional solidarity and build a sense of common destiny among SADC people; encourage good governance, transparency and accountability in the region and in the operation of SADC institutions; study and make recommendations to facilitate more effective and efficient operation of SADC institutions, including harmonization of laws; facilitate networking with other organizations of parliamentarians; promote the participation of NGOs, business and intellectual communities in SADC activities.
activities: Current areas: election observation in all SADC countries; women's empowerment in parliament - aims to achieve 30% women MPs and women in decision-making positions by 2005. Organizes workshops and seminars.

name: World Jurist Association (WJA)
aims: Mobilize the international legal profession through voluntary international cooperation to build law, rules and legal institutions to promote the rule of law; coordinate the development of international law as a requisite foundation for the establishment and maintenance of world law and order; act as a world center for information and communication for the international legal profession; sponsor a regional and world conferences on various aspects of public and private international law; promote projects and research to advance the development of international law; coordinate the computerization of law internationally

name: Liberal, Democratic and Reformers' Group (LDR)
aims: As a political group, represent liberal and Democratic views in the parliamentary assembly of the Council of Europe.
activities: Bureau meetings, meetings of the faction to prepare plenary sessions of the parliamentary assembly, seminars.

name: ZaMir Transnational Net
aims: Help peace oriented people and groups, humanitarian organizations, NGOs and the independent media in order to improve their communication possibilities; serve people working for: the prevention of warfare; the elimination of militarism; protection of the environment; the advancement of human rights and the rights of people regardless of race, ethnic background, sex or religion or political convictions; the achievement of social and economic justice; women's rights; the elimination of poverty; the promotion of sustainable and equitable development; more and better democratic structures in society, especially the advancement of participatory democracy; non-violent conflict resolution.
activities: From 4 to 12 times a day, the electronic-mail and news systems exchange public and private messages with each other and with other networks in Europe and around the world. Conferences/news groups.

name: Confederal Group of the European United Left - Nordic Green Left (EUL/NGL)
aims: Work towards European integration based on fully democratic institutions with a priority commitment to ensuring a new model of development aimed at tackling issues such as unemployment, environment and the creation of a social area providing equal rights for all citizens; encourage a broad consultation of the people.

name: International Campaign for Tibet (ICT)
aims: Monitor and promote internationally recognized human rights, democratic freedoms and self-determination for Tibetans and protect their culture and environment.
activities: Conducts fact-finding missions to Tibet, India and Nepal; monitors and investigates human rights conditions; testifies before national and international bodies; promotes news coverage of issues in Tibet. China Project: networks with exiled Chinese democracy and overseas Chinese organizations, works with Chinese language media, conducts research on Chinese rule of Tibet. Contacts with academic, civic and community groups.

name: International Network of Political Leaders Promoting Democracy in Burma (PD Burma)
aims: Improve freedom of speech, respect for human rights; promote democratization process in Burma
activities: Engages in lobby work, communication. Organizes workshops and conferences.

name: Network for the Defence of Independent Media in Africa (NDIMA)
aims: Promote, encourage and safeguard freedom of expression and human rights in Africa, in particular for the press, print, electronica media, publishers and for individuals working for the right to life and human dignity, personal liberty, fair trial and equality before the law; promote artistic talent; support establishment of rural press; educate and create awareness among Africans on public issues, politics and international relations; address new forms of censorship and strengthen emerging independent media in Africa.
activities: Works through contact with governments and authorities, appeals and public meetings. Raises funds to support human rights and freedom of expression. Organizes training programs for journalists. 'RECASU' program designed to cater to journalists escaping from repressive regimes, especially in Ethiopia, Burundi and Somalia. 'NIDMA' program involved in promoting and encouraging circulation of censored material or literature.

name: Southern Africa Human Rights NGO Network (SAHRINGON)
aims: Coordinate a regional network of committed African human rights NGOs that foster a coordinated, effective and sustained regional response to human rights violations and challenges in Southern Africa; strengthen institutional capacity of the network at national and regional level; promote transparent, democratic and accountable governments in Southern Africa; enhance policy dialogue between civil society, government and international organizations.
activities: Challenges human rights abuses campaign; implement a rapid response mechanism; engages in networking, lobbying and advocacy; organizes regional and national training workshops; organizers annual human rights festival. Currently undertakes a USAID funded project on police brutality and civil society in Southern Africa.

name: European Network for Information and Action on Southern Africa (ENIASA)
aims: Promote the advancement of peace and democracy and the reconstruction and development in Southern Africa.
activities: Organizes seminars, fora and conferences.

name: Collectif 95 Maghreb égalité
aims: Support the democratic principles of equal opportunity for all citizens, without regard for sex or social status, to benefit from and participate fully and without restriction in the efforts of the countries of the Maghreb towards development, modernization and peace; defend the broadening and consolidation of, and respect for, women's rights in the region; motivate the militant activity of member associations by aiming for the highest and carrying out publicity and research activities which national NGOs would find difficult to implement; consolidate the women's movement and civil society activity in the Maghreb and Arab-Islamic regions; act as a bridge between the pluralistic identity of the region and the rest of the Mediterranean so as to reinforce the spirit of tolerance and openness.

name: CIVITAS International
aims: Strengthen effective education for informed and responsible citizenship in new and established democracies worldwide.
activities: Provide online resources and services for international civic educational audience. Maintains a worldwide network; promotes international exchanges; strives to bring the knowledge, skills, and experience of education for democracy to bear on the tasks that confront today's democracies.

name: Alliance of Universities for Democracy (AUDEM)
aims: Enhance the role of education in promoting democratic institutions and economic development

name: Free Burma Coalition (FBC)
aims: Serve as an umbrella group of organizations working for freedom and democracy in Burma; build a grassroots movement inspired by and modeled after the anti-apartheid movement in South Africa; support Daw Aung San Suu Kyi and the National League for Democracy as the sole legitimate leader of Burma.
activities: Coordinates campaigns opposing the junta ruling Burma, including: suspension of UN General Assembly seat; consumer boycott of companies investing or operating in Burma. Organizes annual strategy conference.

name: Network of UNESCO Chairs on Human Rights, Democracy, Peace, Tolerance, and International Understanding
aims: Promote knowledge of and adherence to the values of human rights, democracy, peace, tolerance and mutual understanding at national and regional levels, based on the 'plan of action of the United Nations decade for human rights education (1995-2005)'

name: International Forum Development Democracy
aims: Combine a thematic and global approach, foster interaction and use significant experience to analyze approaches and procedures in the activities and mode of existence of communities, associations and institutions and thus encourage citizenship and support the exercise of democratic participation
activities: Current program covers Western Europe, Central Europe and Latin America and includes: 'Neighborhood democracy, a means of building up Europe' (project supported financially by the European Commission); 'Migrants and nationals working together', with a view to living together in a climate of trust; provision of services and facilities for the well-being of families – emergence of new partnerships; 'for a civil, democratic and participative society at the local level' - support to and creation of common working areas (Latin America); Young people - local protagonists and citizens in their towns (Latin America - Europe); New experience of integrating juvenile delinquents into society (France - USA). Organizes seminars.

name: European Civic Forum (ECF)
aims: Exchange information between grassroots groups in Eastern and Western Europe.
activities: Supports the exchange between young people from Eastern and Western Europe; run studies about consequences of the nationalization of agriculture in Eastern Europe and its impact on rural development; supports the independent medias in eastern Europe; runs studies about and supports local democracy in eastern Europe; supports deserters and draft resisters in the war in former Yugoslavia; supports "AIM" an international information agency in former Yugoslavia and the Balkans; supports "Causes Communes" a network of partnerships between municipalities in Switzerland and interethnic communes in former Yugoslavia.

name: Lawyers without Borders
aims: Promote and protect the human rights, and particularly the right of defense; seek to ensure the organization of a proper defense and a fair process of law; protect and ensure the exercise of the right of more vulnerable persons and groups, prevent conflicts and promote the respect of persons and peoples, as well as their social, cultural, economic and political development
activities: Provides help to any person or group knowing of a situation in which the right of defense is in jeopardy, through either subsidiary assistance enabling the defense lawyer present to act with all freedom and independence, or through an ASF delegate taking charge of organizing the defense. Set up: permanent missions in Rwanda, Burundi and Kosovo; Arusha school on international criminal law and human rights (no recent information).

name: El Taller
aims: Participate in a worldwide movement of NGOs working toward building a strong civil society dedicated to democracy, human rights and sustainable development; offer a space for analysis and action learning on critical issues; networking and innovation around issues of development and peace.
activities: Supports capacity building in NGOs through regional 2 - 3 month training courses for NGO leaders in the south and training courses of shorter duration in various regions (Arab world, Africa, Asia and Latin America). International roundtables; Courts of women; international conferences; networking; research and communications.

name: Reporters sans frontieres - international (RSF)
aims: Defend the press freedom worldwide
activities: Works to help threatened or imprisoned journalists and censored media. Organizes sponsorship for imprisoned journalists by newspapers, radio and TV stations. Informs media about violations of press freedom. Helps newspapers which are victims of banning. Encourages debate on problems connected with press freedom, especially issues involving professional standards and codes of conduct. Intercedes with major international organizations. Awards annual prize.

name: Free Vietnam Alliance (FVA)
aims: Bring about a pluralist democracy in Vietnam through nonviolent means.
activities: Organizes conferences and campaigns.

name: Pacific Islands, Australia and New Zealand Electoral Administrators Network (PIANZEA)
aims: Maintain, in the Pacific Spirit, a close association of Pacific electoral administrators within an established networking arrangement to facilitate and encourage the free flow of information among member countries and to provide assistance where possible; support members by providing the information and resources needed to improve electoral administration within their constituencies; encourage continuous improvement and provision of technical assistance among members.

name: Asian Network for Free Elections (ANFREL)
aims: As a regional network of election monitoring and human rights organizations, contribute to the democratization process by building capacities through training and supporting actual monitoring of elections by local groups, lobbying and dissemination election and democracy-related information.
activities: Regional approach and strategies, including sending international observers. Organizes training and study seminars. Conducts research.

name: European People's Party - Christian Democrats (EPP)
aims: Ensure close permanent collaboration among members in order to achieve their common policies; promote and organize common action at European level; work to achieve a free and pluralist democracy; pursue the process of federal unification and integration in Europe as a constituent element of the European Union.
activities: Organizes statutory Congresses. Provides services for member parties. Member parties undertake, through their national policies, to support positions taken by EPP in the EU context; parliamentarians elected to the European Parliament on their lists and/or sent to Parliamentary Assemblies of the Council of Europe, Committee of Regions, WEU, OSCE or NATO are obliged by their respective EPP member parties to join the relevant EPP groups associated with those assemblies. Athena group - Groupe Athena, set up in response to the Athena Programme launched 1992, Athens, works towards a federal Europe and includes pro-Europe parties of EPP. Includes EPP Association for Regional Politics (no recent information). Proposes setting up Scientific Institute of the European People's Party (no recent information).

name: International Network - Education for Democracy, Human Rights and Tolerance
aims: For the exchange of ideas and concepts in the field of tolerance-education.

name: World Movement for Democracy
aims: Strengthen, reform and invigorate democracy; bolster pro-democracy groups in countries that have not yet entered into a process of democratic transition.
activities: Establishment of regional and functional networks, including 'Africa democracy forum (ADF)', 'democracy information and communications technology (ICT) Group'; 'International movement of parliamentarians for democracy'; 'network of democracy research Institutes'.

name: World Organization of United Cities and Local Governments
aims: Serve as the united voice and world advocate of democratic local self-government; promote its values, objectives and interests through cooperation between local governments and within the international community.

name: European Digital Rights (EDRi)
aims: Promote, protect and uphold civil rights in the field of information – and communication technology.

name: Youth Participation in Local Authorities Network in Europe Today (Youth Planet)
aims: Promote citizenship through the participation of young people in local democracy in Europe.

name: Democracy and Human Rights Education in Europe (DARE Network)
aims: Promote understanding and commitment to human rights and democracy within the enlarged European Union through education.
activities: Organizes seminars.

name: Centre Afrika Obota (CAO)
aims: Promote human rights, democracy, development and solidarity in Africa.

name: Plataforma Interamericana de Derechos Humanos, Democracia y Desarrollo (PIDHDD)
aims: Promote information, exchange, formation and elaboration of proposals and monitoring of human rights, as well as economic, social and cultural rights on national and international levels; develop a culture and conscience of rights and peace with justice in society, as well as an ample political and social consensus around the integrality of human rights, democracy and development.
activities: Conceptual Production' – conceptual, methodical and instrumental document production on human rights, democracy and development. 'Public Action' – campaigns and investigative actions, education, diffusion and mobilization.

name: Asia-Pacific Philosophy Education Network for Democracy (APPEND)
aims: Foster democracy through philosophy education in the Asia-Pacific region.

name: Southern African Judges Commission (SAJC)
aims: Promote: cooperation among courts in the southern African region; the rule of law, democracy and the independence of the courts in the region; the welfare and dignity of judges in the member countries.

name: Arab NGO Network for Development (ANSD)
aims: Strengthen civil society; enhance the values of democracy, respect for human rights and sustainable development in the Arab region.
activities: Programmes: Democracy; Development; Globalization and Trade.

name: European Network of Training Organizations for Local and Regional Authorities (ENTO)
aims: As a network for staff of local authorities and regional authorities: promote cooperation between training centers throughout Europe, facilitating exchange of ideas and experiences in the field of education and training.
activities: Organizes: annual general assembly and seminar; trainers courses. Cooperates with CLRAE and directorate of cooperation for local and regional democracy by contributing its expertise to assistance programs. Engages in research projects.

name: Network of Cities of Asylum
aims: Work against intolerance and for protection of menaced and persecuted writers.
activities: Member cities pledge to: put residences at the disposal of persecuted writers; provide them with access to municipal public services (restaurants, transport, schools); assist in obtaining visas and residence permits; provide them with a grant.

name: Amnesty International (AI)
aims: Undertake research and action focused on preventing and ending grave abuses of the rights to physical and mental integrity, freedom of conscience and expression and freedom from discrimination within the context of its work to promote human rights.
activities:
Opposes abuses by opposition groups, including hostage-takings, torture and killings of prisoners and other deliberate and arbitrary killings; assists asylum-seekers who are at risk of being returned to a country where they will be at risk of violations of basic and fundamental human rights; cooperates with other non-governmental organizations, the United Nations (UN) and with regional intergovernmentaI organizations; campaigns to increase accountability in international military, security and police relations; organizes human rights education and awareness-raising programmes. Oct 2002, launched worldwide campaign to highlight discrepancy between human rights protection which those living in the Russian Federation have in international and national law and the reality of widespread human rights abuses committed in a climate of impunity. During 2003, delegates visited dozens of countries and territories to meet victims of human rights violations, observe trial and interview local human rights activists and officials. Together with Oxfam International and IANSA, launched an arms control campaign calling for a Global arms trade treaty' - a draft resolution for lnternational arms trade treaty approved by the United Nations in 2006 - and for local action to protect civilians from armed violence. Launched 'Demand Dignity Campaign', 2009 - to stop and prevent the human rights abuses that drive and deepen poverty. 
Mainstream activities include both opposition to and denouncing of violations of civil and political human rights and also preventative human rights work such as human rights awareness and human rights education programmes. Approaches have included: lobbying to ensure incorporation of human rights into official training and education curricula of schools, universities, military and police academies, civil service and other professional training programmes; advice on curricula; workshops and training programmes for target groups. Highlights: 
Conference for the Abolition of Torture, 1973. 
Conference for the Abolition of the Death Penalty, 1977. 
International Conference on Extrajudicial Executions 1982. 
International Conference on Disappearances and Political Killings, 1992. appeal for the establishment of an lnt,emationaJ Criminal Court (ICC, #17281) by the year 2000, launched Oct 1996. 
In 1977, received the Nobel Peace Prize for its contribution to "securing the journal for freedom, for justice, and thereby also for peace in the world". 
In 1978, on the 30th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, awarded the United Nations Human Rights Prize for "outstanding achievements in the field of human rights". 
Campaign to mark the 50th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights culminated, 10 Dec 1998, Paris (France), with presentation of 13.2 million pledges from over 130 countries.

name: Association for the Promotion of the International Circulation of the Press (DISTRIPRESS)
aims: Assist in promoting freedom of press worldwide; support and aid all national and international action promoting free flow of ideas by word or image, and intervention against all measures which hinder or aim to prevent such a free flow; further the interests of the press circulation trade.

name: International Alliance of Women (IAW)
aims: Secure all such reforms as necessary to establish a real equality of liberties, status and opportunities between men and women and work for equal partnership between men and women in all spheres of life; urge women to accept their responsibilities and use their rights and influence in public life to ensure that the status of every individual, without distinction of sex, race or creed, shall be based on respect for the person, the only guarantee for individual freedom and peace; promote a better quality of life and good understanding among peoples.
activities: Organizes: Triennial Congress with workshops to formulate and Action Programme for next triennium, which is then approved in plenary sessions; Regional Board Meeting and Seminar (annual), with follow-up workshops and projects. Priorities for 2005-2007: human rights – women's rights; globalization; civil and political rights; education for all - legal literacy; poverty; violence, including - (a) trafficking in women and children, (b) domestic violence, (c) violence in general; health; nutrition; environment and habitat. Cooperates with other NGOs and with the United Nations specialized agencies on: peace and security; nationality of married women; equal pay and discrimination in employment; discrimination in education; slavery and suppression of traffic in persons; elimination of discrimination against women and girls; equal access to technology and resources.

name: International Association of Democratic Lawyers (IADL)
aims: Facilitate contact and exchange of views between and among lawyers and lawyers' associations of all countries and foster understanding and goodwill among them; work together to achieve the aims set out in the United Nations Charter; ensure common action by lawyers in the study and practice of democratic principles, making for maintenance of peace and cooperation among nations; restore, defend and develop democratic rights and liberties in legislation and in the practice; promote independence of all peoples and oppose any restriction on this independence whether in law or in practice; defend and promote human rights and peoples' rights; promote preservation of ecology and healthy environment; work for strict adherence to rule of law and independence of judiciary and legal profession; defend peoples' rights to development and to conditions of economic equality, enjoyment of the fruits of scientific progress and natural resources.
activities: Main areas: research on legal issues affecting human, political and economic rights; study and practice of democratic principles for maintenance of peace and peaceful problem solving, and cooperation among nations; defense and development of democratic rights and liberties and legislation and in the practice of law. Organizes international commission of enquiry and conferences; topics have included: the new economic order; racism and apartheid; human rights; decolonization and self-determination. Provides observer missions to trials.

name: International Bar Association (IBA)
aims: Support the independence of the judiciary, the right of lawyers to practise their profession without interference, and human rights of lawyers worldwide; establish and maintain permanent relations and exchanges among bar associations and law societies and individual member lawyers; discuss problems of professional organization and status; advance the science of jurisprudence in all its phases; promote uniformity and definition in appropriate fields of law by common study of practical legal problems; promote administration of justice under law among peoples of the world; promote legal aspects of the principles and aims of the United Nations in executing these objectives; cooperate with, and promote coordination among, international juridical organizations having similar purposes.

name: International Commission of Jurists (ICJ)
aims: Support and advance the primacy, coherence and implementation of international law and principles that advance human rights; ensure that developments in international law adhere to human rights principles and that international standards are implemented at national level.

name: International Council of Women (ICW)
aims: Unite women's voluntary organizations worldwide for consultation and action to promote welfare of mankind, the family and the individual; support the ideals of international peace and arbitration, equal legal status for women - including suffrage and rights of citizenship, equal pay for equal work - and family and child welfare; support efforts to achieve peace through negotiation, arbitration and conciliation; make known the principles of human rights and achieve their application in every aspect of life; promote recognition and respect for human rights and work for the removal of discrimination based on birth, race, sex, language or religion; promote equal rights and responsibilities for both sexes in all spheres; encourage women to recognize their responsibilities in the community and train and stimulate them to participate in public life on local, national and international levels; study questions which affect the status of women and their capacity to play an active part in alt aspects of life; deepen understanding and increase mutual sympathy of women through international contact.
activities:
Organizes regional seminars on human rights, literacy, education, the advancement of women and their participation in economic and social development. European Centre of the International Council of Women (EC/CW, #08789) promotes women's interests with the European Union. International Standing Committees (5): 
'Status of Women' Sub-Committees – Legislation; Implementation of Conventions; Human Rights; International Relations and Peace. 'Sustainable Development' Sub-Committees – Economics; Consumer Affairs; Women in Employment; Rural and Urban Women. 'General Wellbeing' Sub-Committees – Health; Environment; Habitat; Nutrition. 'Communication' Sub-Committees – Education; Mass Media; Arts and Letters; Music. 'Social lssues'Sub-Committees - Child and Family; Youth; Ageing; Migration.

name: International PEN
aims: As a world association of writers, editors and translators in all branches and classes of literature, belles lettres, poetry, drama, fiction, history, biography, science, translation and philosophy, promote and maintain friendship and intellectual cooperation among men of letters in all countries in the interests of literature, freedom of expression and international goodwill; enable the unhampered transmission of thought within and among nations. PEN is not concerned with state or party politics and must not be used to serve their interests. Its Charter affirms that literature should remain common currency in spite of political or international upheavals and that works of art are the property of humanity at large.
activities: Organizes: International Congress; other congresses; symposia; seminars; regional conferences; dialogues. Centres organize their own local meetings and many publish their own newsletters, books and pamphlets. Committees (4): PEN Writers in Prison Committee- works for the release of writers imprisoned for expressing their opinions- Foundation PEN Emergency Fund, based in the Netherlands, gives practical aid to the dependents of imprisoned or harassed writers; Translations and Linguistic Rights Committee - encourages translation from and between 'small' languages; Writers for Peace Committee; International PEN Women Writers Committee (IPWWC).

name: International Union of Socialist Youth (IUSY)
aims: Propagate amongst the younger generation the principles of free and democratic socialism; further practical cooperation among democratic socialist youth and student organizations of all countries so as to strengthen international solidarity among young socialists worldwide in the fight against fascism, racism, discrimination and for the liberation of man and particularly women from all exploitation and for the right of all peoples to free and independent development, for protection of environment and for human rights.
activities: Organizes: international conferences; World Festivals (about every 2-3 years) with political and cultural programmes; summer camps; training seminars; briefings on specific topics; worldwide and regional political campaigns and gatherings; missions; delegations; solidarity brigades; speaking tours; study sessions. Promotes exchanges among the various organizations.

name: Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU)
aims: As focal point for world-wide parliamentary dialogue, work for peace and cooperation among peoples and for firm establishment of representative institutions. To that end: (a) foster contacts, coordination and exchange of experience among parliaments and parliamentarians of all countries; (b) consider questions of international interest and express views on such issues in order to bring about action by parliaments and parliamentarians; (c) contribute to defence and promotion of human rights - an essential factor of parliamentary democracy and development; (d) contribute to better knowledge of the working of representative institutions and to the strengthening and development of their means of action.
activities: Organizes 2 main sessions a year. Carries out objective examination of international questions suitable for settlement by parliamentary action. Main fields of work (5): promotion of democracy; action for peace and cooperation, including a process for Inter-Parliamentary Conference on Security and Cooperation in the Mediterranean (CSCM); human rights, including human rights of parliamentarians; women's issues with special emphasis on women's participation in politics; sustainable development. Since Nov 1979, organizes meetings of parliamentarians attending UN General Assembly in New York NY. In 1976, adopted 'Procedure for the Examination and Treatment of Communications Concerning Violations o f the Human Rights of Parliamentarians', applicable to any member of parliament from any country who is alleged to be victim of arbitrary measures during the exercise of his or her mandate, whether parliament was in session or in recess or had been dissolved by unconstitutional or emergency measures. Instrumental in setting up: Global Centre for information and Communication Technologies in Parliament (#13140).

name: Women's International Democratic Federation (WIDF)
aims: Unite women regardless of race, nationality, religion and political opinion, so that they may work together to win, implement and defend their rights as mothers, workers and citizens; defend the rights of children to life, well-being and education; win and defend national independence and democratic freedoms, eliminate apartheid, racial discrimination and fascism; work for peace and universal disarmament.
activities: Works for: (1) women's rights in society and in the family and for their right to work, to receive equal pay for equal work, to receive education at all levels and for recognition of their social and cultural life - supports women suffering oppression, racial discrimination, apartheid, any form of fascism, colonialism or neocolonialism, through solidarity activities, study trips, seminars, round-table meetings and publications; (2) the right to health care and adequate nutrition, so children do not die of hunger; (3) children's, especially girls', right to education, protection of children from violence and respect for their individual rights. With respect to peace, works: (1) for preservation and consolidation of peace; against the arms race (including weapons of mass destruction and nuclear weapons); (2) against constantly increasing military expenditure. With respect to NGO activities: was an initiator of the proclamation by the United Nations of 'International Women's Year' and contributed to the implementation of 'United Nations Decade for Women: Equality, Development, Peace'.

name: World Federation of Democratic Youth (WFDY)
aims: Contribute to the education of youth in the spirit of freedom, democracy and solidarity; end imperialism, colonialism, neocolonialism and racist and fascist regimes; ensure peace and security in the world by supporting all initiatives and efforts to this effect; promote active participation of youth and economic, social, cultural and political life by acting against all restriction and discrimination connected with age, sex, methods of education, domicile, property, social status, religion, convictions, color and race, so as to ensure in all countries and for all young people full freedom of speech, of the press, of religious belief, assembly and organization; support the struggle of youth for higher living standards, for better conditions of education, work and leisure and for development of cultural, educational and sports activities for all young people; further development of the young generation in the spirit of peace and international friendship; support the principles of the United Nations charter; support youth interests via international bodies and in affairs of an international character.
activities: Organizes seminars and voluntary work camps; carries out research on youth needs; facilitates and encourages joint actions by youth organizations of different countries, bilateral and multilateral contacts and other means serving the causes of friendship, understanding and cooperation; promotes international youth events contributing to solution of youth problems; promotes and assists youth organizations whose work is hampered through being victim of imperialist aggression, colonial domination, repression, persecution or natural disaster, especially through international Solidarity Fund; helps to develop tourist exchanges, holiday schemes, festivals, cultural and sports competitions; cooperates with national, continental and international organizations including trade unions and other professional organizations, especially for implementing rights of youth. Thematic departments for Peace and Disarmament, Solidarity, Youth Rights, Global Problems, International Cooperation, Press and Information, as well as working groups on Sports and Culture, Problems of Young Women. Attached Bureaux (2): International Bureau for Youth Tourism and Exchanges (BITEJ, #16263) (which has consultative status with WFDY); International Voluntary Service for Solidarity and Friendship of Youth (SIVSAJ, no recent information). Instrumental in setting up World Youth Rainforest Action (WYRA, no recent information).

name: Commonwealth Parliamentary Association (CPA)
aims: Promote knowledge and education about the constitutional, legislative, economic, social and cultural systems within a parliamentary democratic framework, with particular reference to the countries of the Commonwealth of Nations and to other countries having close historical and parliamentary associations with it; foster understanding and cooperation among members of Commonwealth parliaments; promote the study of and respect for parliamentary institutions.
activities: Provides regular consultation between members of Commonwealth parliaments. Organizes: exchange of inter-Commonwealth visits and information; plenary and regional conferences; study tours; study group meetings; annual seminar on parliamentary practice and procedure, held in Westminster (UK) since 1951; annual parliamentary seminar in another parliamentary jurisdiction; regional seminars; parliamentary workshops. Branches also hold their own seminars. Working Capital Fund (set up 1978) supports new ventures and projects, including Commonwealth Parliamentary Small Branches Conference, for branches with populations of 500,000 or less, held concurrently with plenary conference since 1981. Sponsors in-depth studies on parliamentary subjects by study groups of prominent parliamentarians. Expert groups focus on developmental and training needs of parliamentarians. Cooperates with ComSec in forming election observation groups, including maintenance of a register of experienced politicians to serve on Commonwealth missions.

name: Commonwealth Press Training and Education Trust
aims: Promote the concept and ideals of the Commonwealth; foster mutual understanding and goodwill through regular conferences in constituent part of it; advance the welfare of the newspaper and periodical press of the Commonwealth through action to safeguard press freedom, measures for training and educating journalists.
activities: Watch for and oppose all measures or proposals likely to affect press freedom; promote measures for educating and training journalists, in the Commonwealth. Annual meetings and conferences (every 2 years). Instrumental in setting up International Press Telecommunications Council (IPTC, #19462).

name: International Association for Religious Freedom (IARF)
aims: Work for freedom of religion and belief, as a human right, through: freedom from oppressive interference or discrimination by the state, government or society's institutions on the grounds of religion or belief; mutual understanding, respect and the promotion of harmony, or at least 'tolerance', between communities or individuals of different religions or beliefs; an essential accountability by religious communities to ensure that their own practices uphold the fundamental dignity and human rights of their members and others.
activities: Strategic Plan (2001-2007): Supporting affected communities; Non-formal diplomacy; Young adult programmes; Codes of conduct; Preventive strategies. Organizes Quadrennial Congress, Regional (Continental) Conferences, Commissions and Chapters.

name: Union internationale des avocats (UIA)
aims: Promote the basic principles of the legal profession; participate in the development of legal knowledge at an international level; contribute to the establishment of an international legal order based on the principles of human rights and justice among nations, through the law and for the cause of peace; establish relations and exchanges between bars, bar associations and law societies at a international level; defend the profession.
activities:
Organizes congresses, symposia, seminars. Has produced: an 'International Charter of Legal Defence Rights'; an 'International Charter of Access to Justice for All'; 'Charter of the Rights of Minorities'; 'Resolution on Multi-disciplinary Practice'; 'Principles of Professional Conduct for the Legal Profession in the 21st Century'; 'Resolution on the Abolition of Capital Punishment'.
Commissions (C), Sub-commissions (SC) and Working Groups-(WG): A. 'Human Rights and General Practice': Administrative Law (C); The Future of the Lawyer (C); Protection of Lawyers (C); Environment and Sustainable Development (C); Administrative Law (C); Human Rights (C); International Estate Planning (C); Private International Law (C); Environment Law (C); Family Law (C); Real Estate Law (C); Health Law (C); Tort Law (C); Criminal Law (C); Retirement and Pensions (C); Sports Law (C); Management of Law Firms (C); Judiciary and Magistrature (WG); Mediation and Conflict Prevention (WG). B. 'Business Law': Transports Law (C); International Arbitration (C); Banking Law (C); EC Law (C); Competition Law (C); Contract Law (C); International Bankruptcy (C); Financial Services (C); Tax Law (C); Mergers and Acquisitions (C); Computer and Telecommunications (C); Foreign Investment (C); Media Law (C); Labour Law (C); Intellectual Property (C); Corporate Law (C); International Sale of Goods (C); Insurance Law (C); Biotechnologies Law (WG).

name: Socialist International Women (SIW)
aims: Strengthen relations among member organizations; promote action programmes to overcome any discrimination in society, including inequality between men and women; work for human rights in general, development and peace; promote knowledge and understanding amongst women of the aims and tasks of democratic socialism; extend relations between members and non-member socialist-oriented women's groups which desire cooperation.
activities: Organizes: exchange visits; seminars; lnternational Women's Day meetings; projects to help women in developing countries. Themes recently dealt with: discrimination against women in legislation; foreign debt - how can women break the cycles of affluence and poverty ? indigenous peoples of the Americas; abolition of capital punishment; referendum in Western Sahara: organizing and educating women in politics; women and health; the family-women's responsibility ? women in changing economic systems; an end to war and the abuse of women in former Yugoslavia; women and violence in society; ideological changes - continuing male dominance; implementation of the quota for women; women changing places; women in Tibet; UN Conference on Population and Development, Cairo (Egypt); women and the social summit, 1995; Azerbaijan; women's education - the key to economic development; fourth world congress on women, 1995; socialist women in the nineties and beyond - new ways of organizing; equality in the new millennium; women in Burma; rights of women in the Mediterranean region; women and the globalization of the world economy; women and sustainable development.

name: World Association of Newspapers (WAN)
aims: Defend and promote press freedom, and economic independence of newspapers as an essential condition for that freedom; contribute to development of newspaper publishing by fostering communications and contacts among newspaper executives; promote cooperation among newspaper publishers in member nations; represent the newspaper industry and defend press freedom, professional interests and business interests in international discussions on media issues; oppose restrictions on circulation of newspapers and on advertising; promote and develop a free press and information activities in developing countries.
activities: Campaigns against press freedom violations; channels legal aid to victimized journalists; represents the newspaper industry in international discussion on media issues. 'AMJ Formation Sarl/WAN Training and Events' organizes conferences, study tours and all marketing activities. World Editors Forum provides opportunities for senior news executives to exchange ideas and information about the business of editing newspapers. Fund for Press Freedom Development (no recent information) promotes growth of free and independent newspapers in developing countries through training and other forms of assistance. Through 'Newspaper in Education Programme', organizes international cooperation to encourage the culture of reading newspapers through the establishment and development of NIE activity worldwide.

name: International Association of Judges (IAJ)
aims: Defend the independence of the judiciary, as an essential requirement of the judicial function and guarantee of human rights and freedom; protect constitutional and moral position of the judiciary; promote exchange of cultural relations; organize and intensify cordial relations among judges of different countries.
activities: Organizes congresses and meetings for study of the judicial system and of unification of law generally; assists in arrangement of exchange visits. Study Commissions: Judicial administration and status of the judiciary; Civil law and procedure; Criminal law and procedure; Public and social law.

name: LAWASIA – Law Association for Asia and the Pacific
aims: Promote administration of justice, protection of human rights and the maintenance of the rule of law; advance legal education; diffuse knowledge of the laws of member countries; promote development of the law, and uniformity where appropriate; further international understanding and goodwill; foster relations and intercourse between lawyers; uphold and advance the status of the legal profession in the region.
activities: Sections (5) with Standing Committees: 'Business Law' – Banking and Finance; Franchising; Business Law Education; Infrastructure and Privatization; Communication and Technology; Intellectual Property; Corporate Securities and Investment; International Trade and Export; Environmental Law; Taxation. 'Litigation and ADR' – ADR; Comparative Constitutional Law; Labour Law; Insurance; 'Family Law and Family Rights'; 'Energy'; 'Judicial'. Standing Committees (16): Stand Alone Committees (3): Human Rights; Young Lawyers; Women in the Law. Organizes conferences.

name: NATO Parliamentary Assembly (NATO PA)
aims: Foster dialogue among parliamentarians on major security issues; facilitate parliamentary awareness and understanding of Alliance policies; strengthen the transatlantic relationship; assist in development of parliamentary democracy throughout the Euro-Atlantic area; assist in development of parliamentary mechanisms, practices and 'know-how' related to democratic control of armed forces: contribute to making the policies of the Alliance more transparent and comprehensible to parliaments and their public.
activities: Committees (5): Defence and Security; Economics and Security; Civilian Dimension of Security; Political; Science and Technology. Sub-Committees (8): Democratic Governance; NATO Partnerships; Transatlantic Relations; Transatlantic Defence and Security Cooperation; Future Security and Defence Capabilities; East-West Economic Cooperation and Convergence; Transatlantic Economic Relations; Energy and Environmental Security. Organizes 'Rose-Roth Seminars' (3 a year) to facilitate dialogue between parliamentarians and other policymakers, particularly in the Balkans and the Caucasus. Also organizes: 'Mediterranean Dialogue Seminar' (annual); 'New Parliamentarians Programme' (annual); 'Parliamentary Transatlantic Forum'in the USA; hearings at the European Parliament.

name: International Association of Young Lawyers
aims: Encourage meetings and promote cooperation and mutual respect among lawyers younger than 45 from all countries; defend the interests of young lawyers and study questions of relevance to them; help set up groups of young lawyers in countries where none as yet exist; play an active role in development of the legal profession and harmonization of its professional rules; contribute to provision of full and effective protection of the right of all lawyers to practice their profession freely and of every person to be aided, counselled or represented by a lawyer freely chosen and to be entitled to a fair trial by an impartial and independent judge within a reasonable period of time.

name: Commonwealth Magistrates' and Judges' Association (CMJA)
aims: Advance administration of the law by promoting the independence of the judiciary; promote education in law, administration of justice, treatment of offenders and prevention of crime within the Commonwealth; disseminate information and literature on matters concerning the legal process; effect closest possible links between members.
activities: Emphasizes magistracy (or primary judiciary) where over 90 percent of judicial matters are handled. Provides advice and resource centre; organize seminars, regional meetings, conference, penal training, exchange visits.

name: Society for Threatened Peoples International (STP International)
aims: Campaign against genocide and discrimination of threatened ethnic and religious minorities or nationalities worldwide.
activities: Organizes: rallies; demonstrations and vigils; international conferences and publicity-attracting actions; press conferences and lecture tours; discussions.

name: Regional Council on Human Rights in Asia
aims: Adopt and disseminate a Regional Declaration of Human Rights that reflects the culture, values, and aspirations of the people of the region and seek the support of the people of the region for that Declaration; promote respect for individual and collective civil, political, social, economic and cultural human rights; receive petitions and complaints and assist in redressing violations of these rights; encourage governments of the region to ratify or concur in the International Conventions on Human Rights; undertake studies and research.
activities: In 1984, the Council decided to concentrate on two tasks: to spread and explain the Declaration of Basic Duties among peoples of the ASEAN region; to campaign for the release of political prisoners in the region.

name: Asian-Pacific Parliamentarians' Union (APPU)
aims: Achieve and preserve freedom and democracy, so as to secure enduring peace and prosperity and Asia and the Pacific; strengthen mutual understanding and unity of all nations and peoples in Asia and the Pacific; promote economic cooperation and exchanges of culture and technology so as to enhance common welfare on a humanitarian basis; discuss all matters affecting peace and security in Asia and the Pacific and carry out decisions that may be agreed upon; respect principles of sovereignty and territorial integrity of all nations, and the principles of non-interference in international affairs of other countries.
activities: Instrumental in setting up, 24-28 Nov 1969, Asian and Pacific Development Centre (APDC, inactive). Asian Cultural Centre. Standing Committees (5): Political; Economic; Cultural; Transport; Telecommunications. Ad Hoc Committees.

name: Christian Democratic Organization of America
aims: Serve as a link between Christian democratic parties in Latin American countries by promoting the exchange of publications and ideas; organize research concerning common problems; contact similar parties in other regions of the world; promote and reinforce the democratization process in Latin America and the Caribbean.
activities: Carries out activities centered on 4 areas: South Cone; Andean; Caribbean; Central America. Instrumental in setting up: Christian Parliamentary Coordination (PARLA-DC, no recent information); International Union of Young Christian Democrats (IUYCD, #21010).

name: Ibero-American Lawyers' Union
aims: Promote and ensure the following of dignity, independence and freedom in the legal profession as essential values for the realization of justice; protect the interests of lawyers and students of law; promote cooperation among members in the development of legal science.

name: Latin American Federation of Associations for Relatives of the Detained and Disappeared
aims: Fight against the forced disappearance in Latin America and the Caribbean through denunciation of this misdemeanour, the clarification of the truth about the facts, the judgement and sanction of those responsible for the crime, the promotion of national and international legal norms which prevent the impunity and education in the field of the human rights so that such facts occur never again.
activities: Main activities: Denunciation (immediate and permanent); Investigation; Prevention and education; Coordination. Gathers reports of forced disappearance; issues appeals to authorities; transmits denunciations to competent international authorities; assists members in searching, exchanging experience and publishing information; develops and promotes international solidarity through support groups; provides medical, psychological and social assistance to relatives through support groups in various countries; assists in drafting and promoting adoption of international instruments aimed at preventing forced disappearance.

name: Council of European Municipalities and Regions (CEMR)
aims: Secure, strengthen and protect autonomy of local and regional authorities; facilitate operations of local and regional authorities, safeguard their liberties and contribute to their prosperity, in particular through development of inter-authority arrangements and undertakings; develop the European spirit amongst local and regional authorities with a view to promoting a federation of the European States founded on the autonomy of these communities; provide for the participation and representation of local and regional authorities in European and international institutions; achieve establishment amongst existing and future European institutions of an assembly representing local and regional authorities.
activities: Activities focus on: shaping the future of Europe; promoting local and regional democracy; influencing laws and policies of the European Union; exchanging experiences; acting in the world. 'Community Aid to Twinning Programme', through Twinning Department and Twinning Officers, assists European towns in searching for a twin authority and in applying for twinning grants. Involved in support of local and regional governments in new member states of the European Union. Facilitates, at the European level, exchange of experiences, sharing of ideas, best practices and know-how among members. Organizes: training seminars for twinning officers and organizers; Congress of European Twinned Towns (every 3-4 years); information seminars; study sessions; exchange of views concerning local and regional collectivities. Committees and working groups study European Union legislation proposals and prepare common positions.
