Committees (5): Environment; Transport; Employment and Social Policy; Euro-Mediterranean Partnership (COPPEM); CEMR Committee of Women Elected Representatives of Local and Regional Authorities (CWERLRA) and its European  Network of Women Elected Representatives of Local and Regional Authorities (ENWERLRA), which includes all CEMR member countries. Working Groups (3): Cohesion Policy; Twinning; LOGON - Enlargement. Ad Hoc Working Groups. 'ELANET - Information Society' bring together representatives of associations and daughter companies dealing with information society issues. 'Employers' Platform' represents local and regional authority associations in their role as employers vis-a-vis the European institutions and organizes the exchanges of experience on issues related to labour market policy and working conditions. Instrumental in setting up: 'Standing Conference of Local and Regional Authorities of Europe'- the precursor to CLRAE; the previous Consultative Council of Local and Regional Authorities (inactive), also referred to as 'Comite consultatif des autorites locales et regionalqs aupres de la Commission europeenne'. National sections set their own policies, organize dialogue with central government as appropriate and ensure that central governments adopt and respect European charter of local self-government (1985).

name: Pacific Islands News Association (PINA)
aims: Develop and maintain freedom of information and expression; raise professional standards of journalism; assist training in communication.
activities: Professional development seminars; training; workshops; development of resource material; Pacific Media Awards. Participates in Pacific Media Assistance Scheme (PACMAS) project of Australian Agency for International Development (AusAID, #03689).

name: International Association of Broadcasting (IAB)
aims: Defend broadcasting, whether radio or television, as a free means of expression of thought; work for freedom of social communication media; promote cooperation of broadcasters in activities of public interest and social services and the effective representation of broadcasting interests in official or private national and international organizations sponsor world and regional conferences of a technical, legal or educational nature.
activities: Standing Committees: Legal; Technical; On Copyright; On Freedom of Expression.

name: Inter-American Bar Association (IABA)
aims: Provide a permanent forum for exchange of professional views and information for lawyers to promote the rule of law and protect democratic institutions in the Americas; establish and maintain relations among national and local organizations of lawyers in the region; advance the science of jurisprudence, particularly the study of comparative law; promote uniformity of laws; promote the rule of law and the administration of justice, encouraging establishment and maintenance of independent judicial systems in all countries of the Americas; preserve and defend human rights and liberties; guarantee to the peoples of the hemisphere the free exercise of their civil and political rights under democratic principles; uphold the honour of the legal profession; encourage cordial intercourse and fellowship among lawyers of the Americas.

name: Caribbean Democrat Union (CDU)
aims: Advocate promotion of freedom and an economic system based on a social market economy through consideration of matters of political organization and policies.
activities: Charter covers: democracy, freedom and the individual; the individual in the community; private property and private enterprise; international relations Programme includes seminars on: environment; drug abuse; training of young leaders; women and development.

name: Inter American Press Association (IAPA)
aims: Protect freedom of the press in the Americas and defend and promote the right of the American peoples to be fully and freely informed through an independent press; foster and protect press freedom by publishing facts of any action or attempt to restrict that freedom in the Western Hemisphere; foster general and specific press interests; promote and maintain the dignity, rights and responsibilities of the profession of journalism; encourage uniform standards of professional and business conduct; promote greater exchange among American peoples in support of basic principles of a free society and individual liberty.
activities: Maintains: Inter-American Press Association Press Institute, which organizes seminars and produces publications; IAPA Scholarship Fund (no recent information), set up 1954. Set up: Office of Certified Circulation (OGG), started 1954, which subsequently became autonomous and was then replaced by national and regional organizations which continue helping to increase advertising income and thus financial independence. Provides circulation auditing service.

name: International Association for the Defence of Religious Liberty
aims: In the belief that the right to religious freedom is a gift of God: encourage all those who are attached to the ideal of liberty, without any distinction of race, sex, language or religion, to participate in the crusade against all forms of intolerance and fanaticism; value human dignity such that each individual has access to true existence in every domain and to a flowering of his being so as to uncover his true identity; serve freedom of faith throughout the world; create a climate of the greatest understanding and reciprocal respect among people of every faith and conviction, to assist humanity in solving the major problems of peace, liberty and justice.
activities: World Congress on Religious Liberty, jointly with International Religious Liberty Association; regional congresses in cooperation with other NGOs.

name: European Parliamentarians for Africa (AWEPA)
aims: Support rehabilitation programmes in Africa, directed toward the consolidation of democracy and human rights, the promotion of closer regional economic relations and meeting the needs of people adversely affected by regional conflicts and the legacy of apartheid and destabilization.
activities: Undertakes action for human resource development with parliamentarians and other elected representatives and institutional capacity building within parliaments and decentralized authorities. Priorities: key role of well-functioning parliaments with regards to democracy, human rights and peaceful conflict management; attainment of gender equality at all levels of political decision-making; African-European sharing of parliamentary experiences; building parliamentary networks at national, regional and interregional levels for political and non-governmental action. Instrumental in setting up SADC Parliamentary Forum (#25829).

name: International Federation of ACAT – Action by Christians for the Abolition of Torture
aims: Sensitize Christian communities to the atrocity of torture; invite all Church members to participate in action on behalf of tortured prisoners; bring messages of hope into the heart of the reality of torture; contribute to creation, promotion and dissemination of legal instruments against torture; exercise a preventive function of vigilance and human rights education.
activities: Initiates joint actions and campaigns; organizes regional and international training seminars; represents ACATs in international and regional bodies or in coalitions; works with other human rights NGOs and also with churches and religious congregations.

name: Confederation of Cooperatives of the Caribbean and Central America (CCC-CA)
Andean Commission of Jurists (ACJ)
aims: Encourage institutional reform favourable to continuity of constitutional order and reinforcement of democracy; reform administration of justice, establishing an independent and efficient system with a spirit of democracy, increasing legitimacy of the judiciary and public confidence in it, and ensuring integrity of judges; promote recognition and observance of the rights of indigenous peoples in Andean countries so that legislation reflects the multi-ethnic and pluri-cultural nature of society in the region and the value and identity of the indigenous population; protect and work towards observance of human rights in the region, encouraging greater use and efficacy of mechanisms designed for this purpose nationally and throughout the region.
activities: Research Programmes: (3): Citizen Participation; Democracy; Protection of Human Rights. Each programme organizes international conferences dealing with regionaI considerations. Organizes international and national events. Intervenes before governments and disseminates press releases on human rights violations and the functioning of Democracy. Sponsors proposals before international organizations to promote mechanisms for the protection of human rights.

name: Nordic Christian Democrats
aims: Promote Christian Democracy in Nordic countries.
activities: Congresses; Nordic Meetings; meetings of Presidents; meetings of General Secretaries and International Secretaries.

name: European Union of Christian Democratic Workers (EUCDW)
aims: Unite Christian-social workers and press for the political unification of a democratic Europe based on common values and fundamental rights; promote the development of the EPP in form and content on the basis of Christian-social teaching; represent and defend worker interests within the EPP, the European institutions, especially the European Parliament, together with other social, political and trade union organizations on European level; work for the achievement of Christian-social principles and policies in the European workers' movements; step up cooperation with the workers and their organizations, particularly those, in Europe and elsewhere, with a Christian outlook; spread Christian-social ideas; promote the establishment of national and regional associations of Christian-social workers.
activities: Seminars; colloquia; meetings; working groups.

name: International Federation of Resistance Movements
aims: Unite resisters in peacetime as they were united in wartime resistance movements to secure the independence of their countries, liberty and world peace; actively defend and maintain freedom and human dignity; cherish the memory of all who fell for their country and liberty; defend the spirit and values of the Resistance; make known its historical role and transmit its teaching to new generations; denounce the horrors of concentration camps and prisons and demand due punishment for crimes against humanity; defend the material and moral interests of those having due rights and causes; create and develop social services in their aid; promote aims set out in the UN Charter and strengthen links of fraternity and solidarity between resisters in all countries; oppose racial, political, philosophical or religious discrimination, neofascism, 'imprescriptibility' of war crimes and crimes against humanity; work for disarmament and detente.
activities: Documentation centre. Commissions on cultural, social, medical matters and on reparations. Permanent commission on fascism. Research services. Pilgrimages to former concentration camps. Congresses; medical symposia; specialized meetings; consultative meetings.

name: Free International Federation of Deportees and Resistance Internees
aims: Commemorate victims of oppression and their struggle for freedom; promote on a national and international levels respect for and protection of democratic freedoms; strengthen bonds between members of associated organizations; ensure moral and material aid required by members; promote and support laws and regulations sympathetic to purposes of the organization.
activities: Organizes biennial meetings.

name: International League of Religious Socialists (ILRS)
aims: Promote development of democratic socialism; facilitate cooperation among and on behalf of organizations of religious socialists and circulate and provide information on their work; contribute to official recognition of such organizations as co-workers in their respective socialist parties and in the wider socialist movement; maintain close links with Socialist International; reduce historical prejudices and overcome traditional tensions between religious believers
activities: Organizes congresses, seminars and political campaigns on various issues of interest to the socialist movement as well as civil society.

name: European Lawyers Union
aims: Unite lawyers who are members of a European Union bar so as to promote: professional practice within the Community; teaching and continuing education; right of establishment and the free movement of services; harmonization of legal statute, professional and deontological practices; practices of EC law as derived from the European Convention for the protection of human rights and fundamental freedoms.
activities: Organizes: Scientific congresses (held annually in May/June); colloquia and seminars; study days. Remevant treaty: Convention for the protection of human rights and fundamental freedoms (1950).

name: International Social Democratic Union for Education (ISDUE)
aims: Realize the idea of democratic socialism; unite all socialist educational organizations sharing a political responsibility and an affiliation to a section of the Socialist International; link internationally all groups of teachers and professors affiliated to the Socialist International and other persons having official educational responsibility; advocate optimum education of the individual and improvement in society's standard of education; coordinate efforts of member organizations to use teaching in all countries to promote social justice, respect of human rights, peace and international understanding; through an education drawing on discerning mental attitudes and international political awareness, endeavour to establish a socialist society in which every individual has at his or her disposal every means for full development, whether children, young people or adults; focus educational discussion and work on the new world dimension, including the situation in Europe and problems of developing countries. Promote: the passing of spiritual and cultural heritage from generation to generation; preparation of the individual for life in society on the basis of equal opportunity; tolerance and cooperation between different groups in multicultural societies.
activities: Coordinates exchange of teachers and pupils; exchanges information on educational programmes of member parties and of projects put into effect by Socialist governments; maintains close contact with Socialist groups in European Community and Council of Europe institutions; supports establishment of Socialist educational organizations in less developed countries.

name: African Society of International and Comparative Law (ASICL)
aims: Promote advancement of public education in the field of law and civil liberties in Africa; protect individual liberties; raise standards in administration of justice; provide a comprehensive legal aid system in each African country; with cooperation of justice departments, organize an itinerant ombudsman service for dispute settlement in rural areas; promote the African contribution to the international law; promote formulation of clear, established rules to deal with multiplicity of legal systems - local, religious, national - found in many African countries.
activities: Fieldwork in rural areas to raise standards of justice administration, mainly through national branches. Encourages formation of women's groups to advise on their specific problems, and of law teachers' and practitioners' groups. Preparing legal documentation to provide a record of legal affairs in Africa. Establishing an African Research Library in Africa. Plans setting up a 'School for Diplomats' to provide centralized training for African diplomats. With law enforcement agencies, organizes workshops for police and other law officers on civil liberties.

name: Pan-African Reconciliation Council (PARC)
aims: Promote peace, human rights, democracy, social justice, passive resistance to all forms of violence and oppression, emancipation of Africa and its siblings in the diaspora from the bondage of ignorance and poverty on the basis of active non-violence and self-giving love as a tool for social engineering and ultimate global order; build a social structure utilizing the resources of human ingenuity and wisdom for the benefit of all; ensure a society where no one is directly or indirectly oppressed for the benefit or pleasure of others; advocate fair and compassionate methods of treatment of offenders against society; protect, seek redress and provide welfare support for direct and indirect victims of war, natural and ecological disasters and encourage restitution and reconciliation; work towards abolition of war; help build morally disciplined homes; encourage vocational and collegial relations transcending all tribal, ethnic, creed, national or racial boundaries; promote the adversarial system of justice; uphold the truth in all facets of life.
activities: Current programmes: Social and Economic Justice; Non-Violence; Refugees; Social Conflicts; Inter-Faith Activities; Youth and Women.

name: Youth against Racism in Europe (YRE)
aims: Combat racism, prejudice and the far-right.
activities: Organizes: international youth camps; demonstrations; street campaigns; solidarity campaigns; pickets.

name: Inter-Pacific Bar Association (IPBA)
aims: Promote rule of law. Provide members with the opportunity to: contribute to development of the legal profession, its status and organization, in the "Region" comprising Asia and the jurisdiction within, or bordering the Pacific; contribute to development of law and legal structures within the Region; meet and exchange ideas with other lawyers who live in or are interested in the Region; share information on legal developments affecting the Region.
activities: Organizes: annual conference; regional seminars, sometimes in conjunction with other organizations. Sponsors: M S Lin Scholarship Fund. Specialist Legal Committees/Working Committees (16): Aerospace law; Cross-border investment; Dispute resolution and arbitration; Energy and natural resources; Environmental law; Financial institutions and transactions; Immigration, nationality and employment law; Insolvency; Insurance; Intellectual property; International construction projects; International trade; Legal practice; Maritime law; Tax law; Women business lawyers.

name: International Association for Democracy in Africa
aims: Defend and promote: democracy and human rights in a governance society for sustainable development in Africa; government by the majority; respect of human, minority and individual rights and the right to differ; responsible government for just and transparent management of public affairs; people's sovereignty, freedom of the press and other freedoms to counterbalance other powers; independence of the judicial system and an acute sense of its responsibilities by the citizens. Monitor democracy and the achievement of the rule of law in Africa.
activities: Organizes: awareness campaigns; training seminars; conferences; roundtables; workshops; fora for exchange of information; radio and TV programmes; exhibitions. Carries out research on: electoral processes; a charter for political parties. Acts as observer to elections. Participates in meetings and conferences. Programmes: Democratic Culture and Human Rights; Governance and Peace; Sustainable Development; Women, Children and Gender. Cooperates with national organizations.

name: Arab Lawyers' Union (ALU)
aims: Act in the interests of the Arab Nation to achieve its national objectives; facilitate contacts between Arab lawyers; safeguard and develop legislative and judiciary language; assure the freedom of lawyers in their work and the independence of magistrates; allow all Arab lawyers to take cases in any Arab country; harmonize the conditions of the legal profession; establish and harmonize links with international legal organizations; restore the study of Muslim Law as a basis for law; promote and protect human rights.
activities: Commissions (9): Arab Affairs; Palestine; Unification of Law in Arab Countries; Defence of Civil Liberties and Rule of Law in Arab Countries; Harmonization of Legal Terminology; Rules on the Legal Profession; Socialization; Support of the Palestine Liberation Movement; Defence of Palestinian Resistance Workers. Engaged in founding an Arab Organization for Human Rights (AOHR, #01328). Decolonization action against racism, racial discrimination and apartheid.

name: International Association of Political Consultants (IAPC)
aims: Promote, sustain and foster the democratic process as a matter of principle and practice; bring together political consultants, both specialists and generalists, from various countries to exchange views and information about political developments and techniques.
activities: Organizes annual World Conference where International Democracy Award is made.

name: Memorial – International Historical and Educational, Charity and Human Rights Society
aims: Struggle against totalitarianism in all its manifestations; struggle for rights of the individual, for format ion of a civil society and of a state governed by the rule of law which excludes the return to totalitarianism and for active participation in democratic transformation; contribute to restoration of historical truth about crimes committed by totalitarian regimes; preserve and perpetuate the memory of victims of totalitarianism; promote the complete and open rehabilitation of victims of repression and take measures to compensate for damage inflicted upon them; protect the rights of repressed victims and of members of their families, including rendering them legal assistance.
activities: Main guidelines: 1. 'Historical' - collection, study and publication of information about the history of political repression and human rights violation. 2. 'Human Rights' – collection and study of information on the contemporary status of human rights, including public initiatives in solving the most acute problems in this sphere. 3. 'Charity' – social and medical assistance to victims of political repression. Initiates and participates in erecting memorial stones and plaques in cities of the former Soviet Union where executions and mass burials of victims of political repression have occurred, including publication of lists of executed victims and organization of exhibitions and mass actions dedicated to the victims' memory. Organizes conferences.

name: European Democrat Students (EDS)
aims: Work for a free, united and reconciled Europe; create by all possible means a better understanding of each other's cultural and political situations; promote contact and cooperation between Christian Democrat, Conservative and Liberal students from different countries; seek common action where possible, particularly towards the European institutions; engage in political campaigning upon various political issues; exchange information on education policy and other political matters; give support to countries where democracy is threatened.
activities: Working Groups (4): Higher Education; Agenda for Europe; Future of Europe; Campaigning. Organizes seminars and conferences to provide practical training in international work for representatives of member organizations. Annual Summer University, hosted by member organizations in turn. Organizes human rights campaigns and campaigns for European elections.

name: Federation of Arab Journalists (FAJ)
aims: Serve the objectives of the Arab people in their unity; defend the causes of Arab journalists and develop their talents and abilities; defend the rights and freedoms of Arab journalists and human rights.
activities: Supports and coordinates the activities of member organizations; collaborates with international press organizations and with organizations engaged in the defence of human rights and fundamental freedoms; organizes or sponsors meetings, fora, exhibitions, training courses and exchange of delegations. Publishing activity.

name: Conferencia Permanente de Partidos Políticos de América Latina (COPPPAL)
aims: Coordinate efforts for peace and democracy in Latin America and the Caribbean.
activities: Organizes seminars, congresses, symposia and colloquia.

name: Nordic Organization of Workers' Educational Associations (WEA in the Nordic Countries)
aims: Promote development of society within the ideological framework of democratic socialism through independent and voluntary popular education.
activities: Organizes: annual Nordic AOF School to increase knowledge of social, economic and cultural conditions in Nordic countries; local, regional and Nordic seminars, courses and study tours. Projects emphasize learning about people in other Nordic countries, in particular the self-governing areas of Aland, Faeroe Is and Greenland.

name: African Parliamentary Union (APU)
aims: Unite parliamentary institutions of African states; favour contacts among parliamentary Africans and with parliamentarians worldwide; contribute to strengthening the institution of parliament in Africa, to promoting democracy and human rights and to realizing of objectives of the Organization of African Unity for establishment of a durable peace.
activities: Observes elections in African countries. Organizes thematic conferences. Conducts information and training seminars.

name: Commonwealth Lawyers' Association (CLA)
aims: Maintain and promote the rule of law throughout the Commonwealth by ensuring: that the people of the Commonwealth are served by an independent and efficient legal profession; that a common bond of Commonwealth is preserved and fostered; professional links among members of the legal profession; maintenance of honour and integrity and promotion of uniform standards of professional ethics; improved standards of education and promotion of exchange of lawyers and students.
activities: Facilitates flow of professional information among law societies and bar associations; responds to ad hoc requests for information; supports related commonwealth and regional professional legal associations; organizes workshops and discussions; advises and assists in organization of the Commonwealth Law Conference and on follow-up action; administers grants and assists in the formation of regional groups of Commonwealth lawyers; supports the organization and operation of Commonwealth Law Foundation (inactive); Instrumental in setting up: Commonwealth Association of Armed Forces Lawyers (CAAFL, #06001); Commonwealth Association of Public Sector Lawyers (#06016); Commonwealth Human Rights Initiative (CHRI, #06057). Establishing capacity building projects with members in developing Commonwealth countries.

name: European Magistrates for Democracy and Liberties
aims: Promote a European jurisdictional culture based on the legal values of democracy, essentially respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms; protect differences between human beings and the rights of minorities, especially of immigrants and the disadvantaged, with a view to social emancipation; support European integration in creating a European political union aimed at greater social justice; defend the independence of the judiciary from other authorities and specific interests; promote transparency of the judicial system, democratization of the magistrature and the right of judges to meet, to express themselves and to form unions; promote exchange of information and of a democratic legal culture between judges of different countries.
activities: Organizes colloquia and seminars; carries out essential work on the Judiciary and its professional practices; offers an arena for exchange of opinions and debates and allows bridges to be built between judiciaries of the various European states. Public debates amongst judges and public prosecutors throughout the European Union and its member states contribute to development of European legal cooperation, based on evaluation of best national practice. Also involved in joint training programmes for judges and public prosecutors of member states, twinning and trans-national exchange programmes, which reinforce mutual trust between judiciaries of member states.

name: Union internationale des journalistes africains (UIJA)
aims: Work for the benefit of the continent and African journalists in a spirit of cooperation and African unity; promote cooperation among journalists; coordinate professional activities; defend the right to freedom of expression in the spirit of realistic understanding, especially in the struggle against apartheid; defend African cause in general.
activities: Organizes: training programmes; seminars; conferences. Library.

name: International Association of Prosecutors (IAP)
aims: Promote effective, fair, impartial and efficient prosecution of criminal offences; respect and seek to protect human rights as laid down in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights proclaimed at the General Assembly of the United Nations on 10 Dec 1948; promote high standards and principles in administration of criminal justice, including procedures to guard against or address miscarriages, in support of the rule of law, promote and enhance those standards and principles which are generally recognized internationally as necessary for proper and independent prosecution of offences; promote measures for elimination of corruption in public administration; promote professional interests of prosecutors and enhance recognition of their crucial role in achieving criminal justice; promote good relations between individual prosecutors and prosecution agencies; facilitate exchange and dissemination of information, expertise and experience, and to that end, encourage use of information technology; promote examination of comparative criminal law and procedures and assist prosecutors engaged in justice reform projects; cooperate with international juridical organizations in furtherance of IAP's aims. Assist prosecutors internationally in the fight against organized or other serious crime, and for that purpose: promote international cooperation in gathering and providing evidence, in tracking, seizing and forfeiting the proceeds of serious crime and in the prosecution of fugitive criminals; promote speed and efficiency in such international cooperation.
activities: Works closely with the UN Secretariat to secure assistance of experienced prosecutors for projects and advice in developing countries; organizes annual conference and 4 regional conferences; develops and promulgates a series of standards for prosecutors.

name: European Association of Lawyers for Democracy and World Human Rights (ELDH)
aims: Promote human rights, peace, disarmament and understanding between peoples; fight against racism and fascism; fight against discrimination; promote equal entitlement of women and men and respect children's rights; protect the environment.
activities: Formulates draft legal instruments in order to influence the development of law and democracy in all European countries and within European institutions, as well as in the other regions of the world with a view to development and progress of democratic and law-governed relations, in cooperation with the lawyers of the countries concerned; supports all the measures undertaken by the European states and the European Union for creation of conditions for migratory movements of the world in accordance with human dignity; organizes conferences, missions and campaigns.

name: Christian Democrat Feminine International (CDFI)
aims: Promote and coordinate international action of Christian democrat feminine organizations; pursue doctrinal studies and promote political studies; ensure the affirmation of humanist and Christian values and principles of freedom, democracy and social justice.
activities: Seminars, meetings, conferences on such topics as women, human rights, civil and political rights.

name: International Young Democrat Union (IYDU)
aims: Promote and defend the ideals and cultural heritage of pluralist democracies; contribute to and participate in the workings of IDU; extend and strengthen cooperation among member organizations.
activities: Organizes: meetings; Freedom Forum.

name: Federation of Latin American Journalists
aims: Defend the freedom of the press and of access to information; improve working conditions; contribute to friendship among the peoples of Latin America and the Caribbean; show solidarity with journalists who are persecuted.

name: Association of African Election Authorities (AAEA)
aims: Promote cooperation and mutual assistance among electoral organizations in the region in the pursuit of democracy by processes that ensure free, fair and peaceful elections.

name: Association of Caribbean Electoral Organizations (ACEO)
aims: Promote cooperation and mutual assistance among electoral organizations in the region in the pursuit of democracy by processes that ensure free, fair and peaceful elections.

name: Association of Asian Election Authorities (AAEA)
aims: Promote and institutionalize open and transparent elections, independent election authorities, professional election administration, citizen participation in the electoral and civic process, information sharing; develop information resources.
activities: Projects include: development of Asian-electoral information resources; election observation missions; exchange of election-related materials; arrangement of professional development opportunities.

name: Association of European Election Official (ACEEEO)
aims: Provide a non-partisan forum, independent of national governments, for information exchange among election officials and experts throughout the Central and Eastern European region to discuss and act upon ways to promote open and transparent elections with the objective of supporting good governance and democracy.
activities: Maintains an Election Documentation Centre. Offers electoral training and studies. Conducts election observation missions.

name: Asian Federation Against Involuntary Disappearances (AFAD)
aims: Promote, protect and defend the human rights of victims of involuntary disappearance in Asia and their families; facilitate the search for the disappeared, with the hope of rescuing lives; build, develop and promote international solidarity among organizations of families of the disappeared within Asia and among individual representatives of countries where these organizations cannot exist because of intense repression; assist member organizations in their local concerns on involuntary disappearance; promote awareness of disappearances and act urgently on specific cases; develop strategies and tactics for lobbying Asian government bodies at national, regional and international levels; transmit denunciations to competent international organizations; campaign actively against government measures to perpetuate impunity and for public acknowledgement of disappearances by governments and their commitment to establish mechanisms to make disappearances illegal; become avenue for discussion on substantive issues and training on relevant topics and for the holistic healing of families suffering the pain and economic loss of losing loved ones; work for adoption of international instruments aimed at preventing enforced disappearance.
activities: Formulates updates on the situation of disappearances in Asia and reports these to WGEID and other appropriate international and regional bodies; developing an e-mail urgent response network.

name: Democrat Union of Africa (DUA)
aims: Serve as a forum for dialogue between member organizations and policymakers on issues of democracy, good government, economic policy, human rights and human development.
activities: Organizes meetings and seminars.

name: International Democrat Union (IDU)
aims: Promote a free, open and democratic society, the free market economy, the rule of law, social justice, the role of the family and a society where conditions are created to enable everyone to reach their full potential and carry out their responsibilities to their fellow men and women; Foster the common philosophy of member parties; establish permanent relations at a bilateral and multilateral level and encourage mutual support; provide a forum for the exchange of views and information on matters of interest to all or a considerable number of member parties.
activities: Undertakes fact-finding missions, for example to: Central America; South Africa. SCFA develops internal reports on specific international questions, providing the basis for public communiques and for recommendations to the leadership of member parties. Occasional Ad Hoc Groups monitor important national elections and prepare for future work.

name: South East Europe Media Organisation (SEEMO)
aims: Promote and safeguard freedom of the press in the South East European region; improve the standards and practices of journalism; promote cooperation, understanding and the free exchange of news; ensure safety of journalists.
activities: Programmes (3): Media Aids; Media Law; Media in Transition. Set up 'SEEMO Emergency Fund'. Organizes conferences, congresses and regular meetings. Presents: annual SEEMO-CEI Award for Investigative Journalism; annual SEEMO Awards for Human Rights Photo; annual Dr Erhard Busek-SEEMO Award for Better Understanding in South East Europe; SEEMO Award for Mutual Cooperation in SEE (during International Human Rights Day, 10 Dec).

name: Organization of Eastern Caribbean Bar Associations (OECS Bar Association)
aims: Represent, promote and protect the interest of the legal profession within the region; be concerned with questions of human rights and the rule of law; protect the public's rights of access to the courts and to legal representation; work for the improvement of the administration of justice; undertake any action which contributes to the protection and preservation fundamental conditions for a well-ordered society.

name: Federacion Latinoamericana de Trabajadores de la Comunicacion Social (FELATRACS)
aims: Promote the organization of workers in the press sector in all countries of Latin America, providing material and technical assistance as necessary, and organizing necessary services at the Latin American level, cooperating in national-level provision of such services; promote unity at the national level among all organizations in the sector to render their activities more effective; study, promote, defend and represent the interests of press workers with government bodies in Latin America and world-wide, in line with workers' rights and interests; defend and promote the right for free and democratic organization of all press workers; monitor respect for freedom of information and expression.
activities: Denounces violations of the liberty of information and free expression in Latin America and the Caribbean and defends the physical integrity and the human rights of journalists and press workers. Organizes meetings, seminars, training workshops, correspondence courses. Holds Congresses (every 4 years).

name: European Democratic Lawyers
aims: Introduce a debate between lawyers of various countries in order to promote a democratic Europe, in particular concerning recourse to the debate towards litigation solutions, the respect of rights of defence and the harmonization of the statutes and practices of professional lawyers; guarantee independence of Bars and their members in any capacity, and in particular, the capacity of the State; defend and extend rights and prerogatives of defence, and in particular, of the physical integrity and the political, economic, social and individual freedom of lawyers at the international level; promote on behalf of citizens, notably the weakest or victims of infringements of human rights, the access to rights and to modern and humane democratic justice; carry out action for respect of the essential rights and fundamental public and individual freedoms, in particular against any abuse of the Public Power and in any capacity; develop European, democratic juridic culture, notably by regular exchange of information, continuous study of subject of common interest and organization of joint working meetings.
activities: Organizes seminars, colloquia and international conferences. As an association, AED is a civil solidarity missions with lawyers from around the world.

name: Global Organization of Parliamentarians Against Corruption (GOPAC)
aims: Fight corruption; promote integrity through the enhancement of the effectiveness of parliaments and legislatures of democratic oversight.
activities: Develops: training/orientation package on budgetary oversight; a code of conduct for parliamentarians initiative; money laundering initiative; election financing initiative. Provides: peer support to parliamentarians; information and education programs; political leadership on initiatives. Promotes the work of global Task Forces: Parliamentary Code of Conduct; Parliamentary Immunity; Parliamentary Oversight; Access to Information; International Conventions Against Corruption - Inter-American convention against corruption (1996), United Nations convention against corruption (2003); Anti-Money Laundering; Recovery of Assets.

name: Association of the Local Democracy Agencies (ALDA)
aims: Coordinate the overall activities of the 12 Local Democracy Agencies in South East Europe and the Caucasus; promote democracy at local level; foster institution-building at local level through best practice exchanges with partners from all over Europe and training of local elected representatives as well as administrators; develop a Europe-wide network of citizens committed to the respect of human and minority rights; foster the development of an inclusive civil society; promote intercultural dialogue; foster sustainable development.
activities: Seminars; conferences; youth exchanges; training of trainers; trainings for local authorities and NGOs; study visits.

name: European Association of Political Consultants (EAPC)
aims: Develop, support and maintain the democratic process; increase exchange of information and experience between political consultants.

name: Arab Organization for Human Rights (AOHR)
aims: Call for respect of human rights and fundamental freedoms of all citizens and individuals in Arab countries in accordance with provisions of international human rights instruments; defend any individual or group whose human rights are subjected to violations which are contrary to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant of Economic, Social, and Cultural Rights and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights as well as the other international human rights instruments; endeavour, regardless of political considerations, to obtain release of detained or imprisoned persons, and provide relief and assistance for persons whose freedom is restricted in any way or who are subjected to coercion of any kind because of their beliefs and political convictions, or for reasons of race, sex, color or language; protest in cases where a fair trial is not guaranteed; provide legal assistance where necessary and possible; call for improvements in conditions of prisoners of conscience; work for amnesty of persons sentenced for political reasons.
activities: Carries out fact finding missions to verify the human rights developments in Arab region, and field missions in an effort to release political prisoners, in some cases as an observer and in other as a member of the defence panel. Receives complaints from individuals, groups and organizations and contacts the concerned authorities. In addition to the offering of legal assistance in several cases, the Organization provides financial assistance to families of victims. In coordination with Arab Lawyers' Union launched a campaign for 'Freedom for Prisoners of Conscience in the Arab World'. Conferences and seminars. Instrumental in setting up: Arab Human Rights Documentation and Information Network (AHRINET, no recent information); Arab Institute tor Human Rights (AIHR, #01283).

name: Confederation of ASEAN Journalists (CAJ)
aims: Cooperate fully in advancing journalism; promote free and responsible press in ASEAN countries; promote dialogue, discussion and cooperation with journalists, scholars and professionals in the world.
activities: Organizes: (every 2 years) General Assemblies and ASEAN Press Conventions; seminars; workshops; courses.

name: European Newspaper Publishers' Association (ENPA)
aims: Enable European newspaper publishers to speak with one voice towards European institutions and influence policy in publishers' common interests; represent and defend the interests of the press; preserve and promote fundamental rights and in particular press freedom as a cornerstone of democracy, as well as commercial freedom as the precondition for economic viability; act as an early warning system for pending legislation or regulation, primarily from the European Union and Council of Europe for the industry; provide services.

name: ECOSY - Young European Socialists
aims: Promote and realize ideas of democratic socialism such as expressed in the Declaration of Principles, within the European Union and in Europe as a whole, in cooperation and solidarity with the rest of the world; contribute to construction of a democratic European state; defend interests of youth in the European Union; progressively integrate member organizations on a European level.
activities: Organizes congresses, conferences, seminars, summer camps, campaigns and demonstrations; lobbies.

name: Group of the European People's Party in the Committee of the Regions (EEP-CoR)
aims: Promote the ideals of the Christian democratic movements as broadly as possible.
activities: Range of activities with local and regional authorities throughout Europe. Organizes the annual Summer University. Commissions (6): COTER (Competences of the Commission for Territorial Cohesion); ECOS (Competences of the Commission for Economic and Social Policy); DEVE (Competences of the Commission for Sustainable Development); EDUC (Competences of the Commission for Culture, Education and Research); CONST (Competences of the Commission for Constitutional Affairs, European Governance and the Area of Freedom, Security and Justice); RELEX (Competences of the Commission for External Relations and Cooperation); CAFA (Competences of the Committee for Administrative and Financial Affairs).

name: International Mauthausen Committee
aims: Safeguard the interests of former prisoners of the Mauthausen concentration camp and their families; oppose fascism and Nazism in all forms.
activities: Collaborates with International Committees of other Nazi concentration camps.

name: Association for the Prevention of Torture (APT)
aims: Work towards a world in which no one is subjected to torture or to cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment; promote outside scrutiny and accountability of institutions where persons are deprived of their liberty, through independent visiting and other monitoring mechanisms; ensure that international, regional and national legal norms for the prevention of torture and other ill-treatment are universally promoted, respected and implemented; strengthen the capacity of national and international actors concerned with persons deprived of their liberty by increasing knowledge and commitments to prevention practices.
activities: Establishes international and regional standards and mechanisms to prevent torture, including Optional protocol to the UN convention against torture and other cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment (OPCAT, 2002). Provides advice and support for prevention of torture initiatives worldwide; provides advice on legal reform, guidance on detention monitoring and training on practices that can prevent torture.

name: Comisión Jurídica para el Autodesarrollo de los Pueblos Originarios Andinos (CAPAJ)
aims: Contribute to the fighting against all the forms of discrimination or the acts that threaten the indigenous peoples and their fundamental rights contained in the constitutions of their countries and in the Universal Declaration of the Human Rights.
activities: Juridical support; participation in international and regional meetings and in national seminars and workshops. Proposes to set up: Academia Andina de Derecho Internacional Público (AADIP, no recent information).

name: Europe at School
aims: Help young people to develop personal and social competence and skills to help them meet the challenge of modern society in Europe through: general education for democracy; intercultural education; readiness for lifelong learning; mastering of new information and communication technology; transnational cooperation in the field of European education. Create and promote European awareness among pupils, students and teachers.
activities: Europe at School - European Competition - L'Europe al'ecole - Concours europeen held under the joint patronage of the Council of Europe, the European Commission, the European Parliament and the European Cultural Foundation. It comprises: annual art and essay competition; annual 'Europe at School Internet Award Scheme'; a series of youth gatherings involving prizewinners; training seminars for youth leaders; teacher seminars. Also organizes: Spring meeting alternately in Strasbourg (France) or Brussels (Belgium), on invitation of the Council of Europe or the European Commission; Autumn meeting on invitation of National Committees; European experts' conferences dealing with the European dimension in teaching and education. Coordinating Unit organizes European Youth Gatherings in Strasbourg in cooperation with European Youth Centres (EYCs, #11711). Participates in and contributes to programmes and projects, in particular those of patrons, allowing mutual benefit in the use of existing instruments.

name: International Federation for East Timor (IFET)
aims: Propagate the ideals and established principles of decolonization and human rights; uphold internationally recognized principles enshrined in the UN Charter, particularly with respect to the decolonization process and especially as regards the decolonization of Timor-Leste; provide support from international civil society for the people of Timor-Leste in freely exercising their rights to political, economic and social self-determination; endeavour to guarantee internationally recognized human rights and justice for all involved in Timor-Leste reach these goals by providing information to UN officials and organs, mobilizing international public opinion and advocating with UN officials and governments of UN member states; facilitate consultation and dialogue among member NGOs and with other interested NGOs to coordinate activities on an international level; communicate common concerns of participant NGOs to relevant authorities and individuals.
activities: Main activities: lobbying and advocacy; democracy development; human rights promotion; policy advice; citizen diplomacy. Disseminates information on the decolonization and transition to genuine independence of Timor-Leste; collects and disseminates data on human rights and political and justice situations in the country; organizes campaigns to support people in achieving their human, political and economic rights, according to internationally recognized standards. Sent observers to 1999 UN consultation in Timor-Leste and continues to advocate the bringing to justice of those who committed human rights violations there from 1974-1999.

name: World Association of Judges (WAJ)
aims: Advance the administration of judicial justice through cooperation and communication among ranking judicial official of all nations in an effort to bring to bear upon the common problems of humankind and universally accepted processes, procedures, principles and institutions of the rule of law.

name: Asian Legal Resource Centre (ALRC)
aims: Promote awareness among the oppressed of their inalienable rights as human beings and of remedies available to them under national, regional and international instruments; promote awareness and acceptance among jurists and others whose activities affect human rights of their responsibilities to serve and protect the oppressed; provide for exchange within Asian of expertise and experience among human rights organizations and legal resources in support of such human rights in the countries of the region; promote the training of lawyers to render effective legal assistance to the oppressed and victims of human rights violations; develop methodologies for, and assistant in the training of, paralegal workers, and facilitate the sharing of such experience; develop programmes of mass education about law, and support sharing of experiences of those involved in such programmes; promote creation and strengthening of legal resource organizations in the region; promote efforts to increase access for the oppressed to judicial administrative institutions, and efforts to reform such institutions to increase their ability to provide timely and effective relief.
activities: Main functions: coordinates and shares amongst local, national and sub-regional groups and individuals information on legal service programmes and legal initiatives being taken in Asian countries, through such means as publications, exchange of materials and workshops; facilitates exchanges of people working in fields of human rights and legal resources, and encourages the sharing of information and skills and the development of such programs in places where they do not currently exist, through visits, internship and similar actions; develops training schemes to assist the creation and operation of legal resource and para-legal programmes, and promotes such programmes on a sub-regional basis; researches and analyses current legal issues concerning human rights violations and oppression of persons and peoples within Asia; encourages the development of a macro-perspective on these problems and provides such information for: Asian Human Rights Commission (AHRC, #01834).

name: Center for Democracy and Reconciliation in Southeast Europe (CDRSEE)
aims: Foster democratic, pluralist and peaceful societies in Southeast Europe by advocating principles of social responsibility, sustainable development and reconciliation among the peoples in the region.
activities: Modernizes and democratizes educational systems: creates employment opportunities; advances freedom of the press; sustains peace by bridging the gap between past and present; creates conditions for tolerant and integrated societies.

name: World Press Freedom Committee (WPFC)
aims: Support the freedom and independence of news media and free flow of news and information; advocate and monitor press freedom concerns in intergovernmental organizations; assist news media, journalists and journalism schools in developing and post-communist countries through training programs, manuals, provision of equipment and other means.
activities: Serves as watchdog for news media at UNESCO, United Nations, non-aligned and other conferences. Coordinates cooperative press-freedom activities with other groups for greater effectiveness. Administers the Fund Against Censorship. Carries out projects to assist news media and journalism schools in Africa, Asia, Latin America, the Caribbean and Central and Eastern Europe.

name: Latin American Journalism Centre
aims: Promote a free and responsible press through ongoing education and training of journalists.
activities: Specialized courses for journalists and media staff.

name: International Center for Not-for-Profit Law (ICNL)
aims: Create a world where civil society can freely develop in all its forms and participate in public decisions; promote an enabling legal environment for civil society and public participation worldwide.
activities: Helps establish legal framework for strong and effective civil society through technical assistance to over 100 countries.

name: European Parliament Former Members Association (FMA)
aims: Bring former members together and provide for them a forum for meetings, discussions and cultural, scientific and social events; facilitate exchange of information and news between former members of the European Parliament; foster relations between former and current members of the European Parliament by establishing and using an information network; use the experience of former members to strengthen parliamentary democracy and to serve European unity; promote contacts between similar organizations in Europe and elsewhere, including former members' associations of national parliaments; promote debate on development of the European Union in the political field as well as in public opinion and to study its consequences for institutions, local authorities and citizens.
activities: EP to Campus'; seminars and conferences; annual study visits; election observation missions; technical assistance missions; annual dinner; dinner-debates.

name: Human Rights without Frontiers International (HRWF)
aims: Monitor, research and analyze in the field of human rights, as well as promote democracy and the rule of law on national and international levels.
activities: Main strategies: information; communication; leverage. Advocacy activities through case studies.

name: European Liberal, Democrat and Reform Party (ELDR)
aims: Contribute to create a democratic European Union with decentralized characteristics.
activities: Strengthens the liberal, democrat and reform movement in the European Union and throughout Europe; seeks a common position on all important problems affecting the European Union; informs the public and involves it in the construction of a united European democracy; supports and coordinates the member parties in the elections to the European Parliament; promotes the constitution of a liberal, democrat and reform parliamentary Group in all international parliamentary assemblies; develops working relationships among its national parties, their national parliamentary groups, ELDR Group of the European Parliament and the Liberal, Democrat and Reform Group in other international fora and ELDR Party.

name: Party of European Socialists (PES)
aims: Strengthen the socialist movement in the European Union and throughout Europe; develop cooperation and the exchange of information between parties; Attempt to define the essential guidelines and common priorities for the main problems arising from the existence of the European Union; guarantee close working relationships between member parties, PES and the Parliamentary Group of PES in the European Parliament; ensure close collaboration and mutual understanding with the Socialist Group of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe; ensure close collaboration and mutual understanding with Socialist International; promote exchanges and contacts with European trade unions, professional organizations, associations and cooperatives.
activities: Priorities: growth of employment and the fight against unemployment; freedom, the rights of the citizen and individual self-fulfillment; abolition of all forms of discrimination; protection of environment; justice and social protection; peace and security. Secretariat responsible for organizing meetings and providing research/background material.

name: International Buchenwald-Dora Committee (IBDC)
aims: Group survivors of the Nazi concentration camps of Buchenwald, Dora and their 'Kommandos', as well as their families and descendants, in order to safeguard places of remembrance, the memory of the history, and the struggle of the anti-fascist resistance for the liberty and human solidarity

name: International Sachsenhausen Committee
aims: Commemorate the victims of the concentration camp at Sachsenhausen; promote peace and friendship between peoples so as to avoid all return to fascism.
activities: Conservation of the Memorial; contributes to youth education.

name: Christian Democratic Women of America (CDWA)
aims: Work for transforming Latin America according to the Christian Democratic principles; further and defend the values of the human being and the principles of liberty, democracy, justice and peace; strive to achieve the full promotion of women at all levels of the society, especially in the political field.
activities: Training courses; fight for the promotion of women; seminars, meetings.

name: International Movement Against All Forms of Discrimination and Racism, The (IMADR)
aims: Eliminate discrimination and racism, forge international solidarity among discriminated minorities and advance the international human rights system.
activities: Develops grassroots movements around the world; builds awareness through local, regional and international events; carries out research; promotes information sharing; campaigns for International convention on the elimination of all forms of racial discrimination (1965); lobbies at UN meetings and major world conferences.

name: World Organisation Against Torture (OMCT)
aims: Fight against torture, summary executions, enforced disappearances and all other cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment.
activities: SOS-Torture Network assembles organizations and correspondents worldwide. Secretariat provides personalized medical, legal and/or social assistance to torture victims and ensures daily dissemination of urgent appeals across the world, so as to protect individuals and fight against impunity. Programmes provide support to specific categories of vulnerable persons, such as women, children and human rights defenders. Also submits individuals communications and alternative reports to the special mechanisms of the UN, and actively collaborates in the development of international norms for the protection of human rights.

name: Women and Law in Southern Africa Research Trust (WLSA)
aims: Improve legal status of women in Southern Africa; develop research skills of women's laws researchers; conduct research on gender issues in Southern Africa, particularly those related to legal rights; provide information on gender and the law and influencing policy and law reform in each country and exchange this information among member countries; explore and develop new methodologies and perspectives for the study of gender and the law; cooperate and liaise with other organizations in each country, regionally and internationally.
activities: Development of a regional network of women and men researching women's legal rights. Regional seminars. Studies for all 7 member countries. Programmes of action (6): Activist Research (core programme); Information Dissemination and Documentation; Legal Advice and Services; Lobbying and Advocacy for Policy, Legal Reform and Change; Networking; Training and Education on Women's Rights.

name: European Democrat Group (EDG)
aims: As a centre-right coalition of members of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe, promote the respect of individual liberty and human rights and responsibilities under the rule of law, pluralist democracy and the support of a free market economy.
activities: Organizes seminars.

name: Asian-Pacific League for Freedom and Democracy (APLFD)
aims: Help unite peoples of Asia and the Pacific in promoting freedom, democracy and human rights and also in enhancing friendly cooperation for the economic and social wellbeing and security of the peoples of Asia and the Pacific region.

name: Nonviolent Radical Party
aims: As a Gandhian, non-violent organization, promote international political campaigns concerning: respect for human rights, particularly in non-democratic countries; promotion of democracy and freedom; anti-prohibitionist policies on drugs and against illegal trafficking in drugs; abolition of capital punishment; language rights and the use of Esperanto as the auxiliary language of international institutions; democratic reform of the United Nations.
activities: Campaigned for the setting up of International Criminal Court (ICC, #17281). Proposes to set up: United States of Europe and America; World Organization of Democracy and of Democracies.

name: Caribbean Human Rights Network
aims: Disseminate information to national, regional and international organizations; promote human rights at the regional level - this includes embarking on regional campaigns; assist in the coordination of regional human rights action programmes; facilitate the exchange of visits between persons or groups with the human rights interest; mount missions - fact-finding and election observer missions.
activities: Promotion of human rights in the Caribbean by means of: (a) coordination of regional campaigns on human rights issues; (b) urging ratification of Conventions and strengthening inter-governmental machinery; (c) creating an informed regional public opinion through education awareness; (d) strengthening the capacity of local human rights bodies for effective action. As far as the methods of work are concerned, the Network: (a) Routinely cooperates with regional and international human rights bodies in the exchange of information, joint actions and facilitating missions and visits in the region; (b) Takes initiatives at the request of affiliates; (c) Attempts to interest the Caribbean media in human rights issues. Major areas of concern: police brutality; elections and democracy; freedom of expression. Current new programmes: (i) Women's Rights (ii) Death Penalty; (iii) Democracy within the Region; (iv) Documentation; (v) Rights of People with Disabilities; (vi) Monitoring Socio-Economic Conditions and its Negative Impact on Caribbean peoples; (vii) Human Rights Education and Training.

name: Helsinki Citizens' Assembly (hCa)
aims: As an international coalition of civil society initiatives, work for integration of a wider Europe from the citizens' level, especially in issues connected with basic values of democracy- tolerance, mutual understanding and confidence, human rights and political and economic reconstruction; carry out projects addressing issues of peace and integration among citizens.
activities: Functions as a network of NGOs across Europe, focusing on local and regional issues and cooperating through hCa International Network. Besides local activities of each organization, organizes joint activities such as: Annual Summer School for International Dialogue; youth network; investigative missions to conflict areas; fora for international dialogue among citizens. Projects have been implemented in Hungary, Poland, Czech Rep, Slovakia, the former Yugoslav states, Turkey, Moldova, Armenia and Georgia.

name: Transparency International (TI)
aims: Work towards a world in which government, politics, business, civil society and the daily lives of people are free of corruption; focus on combating international and national corruption, increasing government accountability and raising public awareness of the need to curb corruption, through international and national coalitions encouraging governments to establish and implement effective laws, policies and anti-corruption programmes; strengthen public support and understanding for anti-corruption programmes and enhance public transparency and accountability in international business transactions and in the administration of public procurement; encourage all parties to international business transactions to operate at the highest levels of integrity, guided in particular by TI Standards of Conduct.
activities: Works through the National Chapters, which fight corruption on national level through: bringing together relevant players from government, civil society, business and the media to promote transparency in elections, public administration, procurement and business; advocacy campaigns to lobby governments to implement anti-corruption reforms. 'Global Corruption Barometer' - survey assessing general public attitudes towards and experience of corruption. 'National Integrity System' - country studies. 'Promoting Revenue Transparency Project' - raise awareness in both government and private sector of steps required for revenue transparency to be achieved, sustained and mainstreamed. 'Integrity Pact (IP)' - aims to prevent corruption in public contracting. 'Business Principles tor Countering Bribery' - provide a framework for companies to develop comprehensive anti-bribery programmes. Annual Tl Integrity Awards.

name: Alliance of Liberals and Democrats for Europe (ALDE Group)
aims: Defend and promote liberal and democratic ideals in the European Parliament; promote enlargement and development of the European Union as a democratic body empowered to act effectively in international affairs while respecting and promoting decentralization of domestic politics; work for social justice locally and a more just, prosperous and safe world order.
activities: Cover the following 10 points: (1) Promoting peace through a union in the federal tradition that respects diverse cultural, local and linguistic identities, and is open to all European States which comply with the criteria for membership; (2) Making the EU a global player bridging the gap between its economic and political dimension - Europe must speak with one voice in world affairs; (3) Opening up, democratizing, making more accountable and strengthening the institutions of the EU and also identifying forms of participation and dialogue able to bring into the European debate those who at the moment feel excluded; (4) Since Europe is a union of minorities, guaranteeing the fundamental rights of all European citizens and removing all forms of discrimination; (5) Believing that the aim of society must be sett-fulfillment of each individual by promoting education at all levels; (6) Strengthening economic governance after the introduction of the Euro; (7) Ensuring value for money for taxpayers, rooting out fraud wherever it is found, tackling unnecessary bureaucracy and reforming the system of own resources to make it more transparent, progressive and fair; (8) Making Europe the world leader in environmental protection; (9) Making globalization work for everyone; (10) Ensuring a full recognition and enhancement of the role of Europe's regions, particularly those with legislative powers, and building a structural policy which develops the potential of Europe's most needy regions. Members act as coordinators in a number of Parliamentary committees and hold offices in Parliament.

name: Parliamentarians for Global Action (PGA)
aims: Promote effective inter-parliamentary collaboration to mobilize global political action for an equitable, safe and democratic world, serve a global constituency of legislators, governments, the UN system and civil society.
activities: Programme areas (5): 'Peace and Democracy' - promotes peace-making and democracy in every part of the world; sends observers to monitor elections; provides problem-solving to help emerging democracies. 'International Law and Human Rights' - initiated work on International Criminal Court (ICC) in 1989, by resolution at tile UN and through bills presented in different parliaments, culminating in the Rome (Italy) Statute in 1998 and its entry into force in 2002. Advises parliamentarians on enabling legislation; coordinates a worldwide process for ratification of tile ICC; holds annual Consultative Assembly of Parliamentarians for the ICC and the Rule of Law. 'Sustainable Development and Population' - served in the parliamentary consensus for the Rio Summit in 1992 and tile Cairo (Egypt) Population Conference of 1994. Since 1995, has worked to implement programme in West Africa, specifically in Ghana, Senegal, Mali and Nigeria, by coordinating legislators' delegations to the US Congress.  'Economic Revitalization' - Promotes parliamentary oversight of the World Bank and other international monetary Institutions; launched Parliamentary Network on the World Bank in 1998. 'Arms Control' - was instrumental in the signing of the Chemical Weapons Convention (CTBT); supports UN peacekeeping efforts; members engage in crisis mitigation. Organizes meetings, dialogues, seminars and conferences. Offers 'Annual Defender of Democracy Award'. Middle Powers Initiative (MPI, #22682), set up Mar 1998, continues the work commenced by PGA in the 1980s aimed at establishing a 'Middle Power Coalition for Disarmament'. Also proposes the setting up of: Parliamentary Early Warning Network (no recent information); United Nations Parliamentary Assembly (UNPA).

name: Study and Research Group on Democracy, Economic and Social Development in Africa (GERDDES-Africa)
aims: Promote the democracy for favouring the economic and social development of African countries.
activities: Through its research and programme execution body, International Research Centre on Democracy and Development (IRCD), has initiated 6 main programmes since 1994; GERDDES-Elections; GERDDES-Good Governance; GERDDES-Humanitarian; GERDDES-Environment; Publications and Development of the Independent Press; General Studies and Research on Democracy and Development. Organizes seminars and conferences.

name: Commonwealth Local Government Forum (CLGF)
aims: Promote and strengthen effective democratic local government throughout the Commonwealth; facilitate the exchange of good practice in local government structures and services.
activities: Represents local government at Commonwealth level; represents members' interests on the international stage; designs and manages national, regional and pan-Commonwealth capacity-building programmes; promotes the exchange of experience and information between spheres of government and with partner organizations who work with locaI government, especially through the biennial Commonwealth Local Government Conference; organizes regional events and workshops. Proposes setting up Commonwealth Fund for Democracy and Good Governance (inactive).

name: Socialist International (SI)
aims: Strengthen relations among member parties and organizations and coordinate their political views and activities by consent; establish contacts with progressive forces worldwide working for application of the principles of democratic socialism - an international movement for freedom, social justice and solidarity.
activities: Current major activities focus on: promotion of concrete action to further North-South dialogue; study of problems of economic development, including questions of energy, employment and environment, promotion of human rights, contributing to peacefuI solutions to regional conflicts; support for the democratization process in Africa; advancement and consolidation of democracy in Central and Eastern Europe; development of a democratic socialist strategy for Latin America and the Caribbean; support for the peace process in the Middle East; enlarged presence in the Asia Pacific region. Sends missions or delegations to various countries or regions. European Forum for Democracy and Solidarity (EFDS) assists Central and Eastern European countries in transition and includes Central and Eastern European Network for Gender Issues. Party leaders' conferences are held regularly in confidential and informal sessions.

name: Asian Forum for Human Rights and Development (FORUM-ASIA)
aims: Promote and protect all human rights, including the right to development through cooperation and collaboration among civil society organizations working on human rights development in Asia; empower people by advocating social justice, sustainable human development, participatory democracy, gender equality, peace and human security.
activities: Monitoring and Documentation; Campaigning and Coalition-building; Advocacy and Lobbying; Research and Analysis; Training and Capacity-building. Thematic programmes: Democracy and Rule of Law; Peace and Human Security; Anti-Discrimination, minorities and vulnerable groups; ESCR; Women's Rights and Gender; Right to Development. Linkage programmes: UN/Regional Advocacy, Information and Communication; Capacity Building; Movement and Human Rights Defenders.

name: CIVICUS - World Alliance for Citizen Participation
aims: As a global alliance of citizens and their organizations, pursue a world in which: citizen action is a predominant feature of the political, economic and cultural life of all societies; private action for the public good is expressed by organizations operating sometimes apart and sometimes in dialogue with government and business; society involves equitable relationship among citizens, their associations and foundations, business and governments. Nurture the foundation, growth, protection and resourcing of citizen action worldwide, especially where participatory democracy, freedom of association of citizens and their funds for public benefit are threatened; advance regional and national agendas of common initiatives to strengthen the capacity of civil society, serve as an open forum to facilitate and establish cross-sectoral dialogue, exchange information, develop a common understanding and shared identity, solidarity, cooperation, and communication within civil society from various regions and promote a common vision about the role of civil society.
activities: International task forces guide special projects to foster progress in 3 areas: Increasing visibility and understanding of civil society; Enhancing the resource base; Advocating freedom of association (international principles for laws and regulations for civil society organizations).

name: International Freedom of Expression Exchange (IFEX)
aims: Defend and promote freedom of expression; maximize opportunities for collaboration, learning and engagement. Assist international campaigns for human rights by supplying information on freedom of expression and press freedom, including attacks on writers and journalists and the use of censorship and press laws; provide information to news organizations, the academic community and general public for educational purposes.
activities: Core Programmes (4): 'Information and Awareness Raising'- free expression information service through (electronic) publications. Through the Action Alert Network (AAN), member- organizations provide the- network with urgent appeals concerning threats to independent media and journalists that, in turn, the IFEX Clearing House edits and distributes around the world. 'Free Expression Capacity-Building for Development- Outreach Programme' - strengthens free expression organizations in developing countries. 'Facilitating Advocacy and Joint Campaigning' 'Institutional Strengthening' - IFEX Clearing House.

name: World League for Freedom and Democracy (WLFD)
aims: Disseminate worldwide the ideals of freedom and democracy; encourage and support their universal application; promote respect for and observance of human rights and fundamental freedoms for all peoples; act as agent and coordinating centre for international cooperation in economic development and educational and cultural exchange aimed at contributing to social progress and better living standards; combine efforts against aggression, imperialism, totalitarianism and authoritarianism of whatever form and pretension, whenever and wherever any of such forces appears.
activities: Organizes: Annual General Conference; Annual Event of the World Freedom Day; International Academic Symposium. Organizes, sponsors or co-sponsors occasional exchanges, missions and symposia. Instrumental in setting up: Asian Pacific Youth League for Freedom and Democracy (APYLFD, inactive); World Youth League for Freedom and Democracy (WYLFD, inactive).

name: SADC Parliamentary Forum
