aims: Facilitate strategic partnerships within the SADC region; promote information sharing; initiate and implement projects that enhance regional integration; promote effective and professional Parliamentary practice.
activities: Standing Committees (5): Democratization, Governance and Gender Equality; Trade, Development and Integration; Inter-Parliamentary Cooperation and Capacity Building; HIV and AIDS; Regional Women's Parliamentary Caucus Committee. Programmes (6): Regional Integration; Parliamentary Leadership Training - through SADC Parliamentary Leadership Centre (PLC, #25830); Elections Observations and Democratic Governance; HIV-AIDS; Engendering Parliaments; ICT for e-governance.

name: World Jurist Association (WJA)
aims: Mobilize the international legal profession through voluntary international cooperation to build law rules and legal institutions to promote the rule of law; coordinate the development of international law as a requisite foundation for the establishment and maintenance of world law and order; act as a world centre for information and communication for the international legaI profession; sponsor regional and world conferences on various aspects of public and private international law; promote projects and research to advance the development of international law; coordinate the computerization of law internationally.
activities: Sections (32). Serves as worldwide coordinator for development of international law and as a world clearing house of legal information and reference services; organizes and sponsors projects of creative research and action in international law; coordinates automation of international law; sponsors international conference for judicial cooperation, and World Law Day and World Exhibition of Law Codes and Historic Law Documents; organizes international demonstration trials; organizes world and regional conferences. Instrumental in setting up World Association of Law Students (inactive).

name: Alliance of Liberals and Democrats for Europe (ALDE)
aims: Guard council of Europe values, through enhanced political action inside and outside the parliamentary assembly.
activities: Organizes: International congresses; bureau meetings, meetings of the faction to prepare plenary sessions of the parliamentary assemblies, seminars.

name: ZaMir Transnational Net
aims: Help peace-oriented people·and groups, humanitarian organizations, NGOs and the independent media in order to improve their communication possibilities. Serve people working for: prevention of warfare; elimination of militarism; protection of the environment; advancement of human rights and rights of peoples regardless of race, ethnic background, sex or religion or political convictions; achievement of social and economic justice; women's rights; elimination of poverty; promotion of sustainable and equitable development; more and better democratic structures in society, especially the advancement of participatory democracy; nonviolent conflict resolution.
activities: Electronic mail and news systems exchange of public and private messages with each other and with other networks in Europe and worldwide several times daily. Organizes conferences/newsgroups.

name: Confederal Group of the European United Left - Nordic Green Left
aims: Work toward European integration based on fully democratic institutions with a priority commitment to ensuring a new model of development aimed at tackling issues such as unemployment, environment and the creation of a social area providing equal rights for all citizens; encourage a broad consultation of the people.

name: International Campaign for Tibet (ICT)
aims: Monitor and promote internationally recognized human rights, democratic freedoms and self-determination for Tibetans and protect their culture and environment.
activities: Conducts fact-finding missions to Tibet, India and Nepal; monitors and investigates human rights conditions; testifies before national and international bodies; promotes news coverage of issues in Tibet. China Project: networks with exiled Chinese democracy and overseas Chinese organizations, works with Chinese language media, conducts research on Chinese rule of Tibet. Contacts with academic, civic and community groups.

name: International Network of Political Leaders Promoting Democracy in Burma (PD Burma)
aims: Improve freedom of speech, respect for human rights; promote democratization process in Burma.
activities: Engages in lobby work, communication. Organizes workshops and conferences.

name: CIVITAS International
aims: Strengthen effective education for informed and responsible citizenship in new and established democracies worldwide.
activities: Provide online resources and services for international civic educational audience. Maintains a worldwide network; promotes international exchanges; strives to bring the knowledge, skills, and experience of education for democracy to bear on the tasks that confront today's democracies.

name: Alliance of Universities for Democracy (AUDEM)
aims: Enhance the role of education in promoting democratic institutions and economic development

name: Free Burma Coalition (FBC)
aims: Serve as an umbrella group of organizations working for freedom and democracy in Burma; build a grassroots movement inspired by and modeled after the anti-apartheid movement in South Africa; support Daw Aung San Suu Kyi and the National League for Democracy as the sole legitimate leader of Burma.
activities: Coordinates campaigns opposing the junta ruling Burma, including: suspension of UN General Assembly seat; consumer boycotts of companies investing or operating in Burma. Organizes annual strategy conference.

name: Network of UNESCO Chairs on Human Rights, Democracy, Peace, Tolerance, and International Understanding
aims: Promote knowledge of and adherence to the values of human rights, democracy, peace, tolerance and mutual understanding at national and regional levels, based on the 'Plan of Action of the United Nations Decade for Human Rights Education (1995-2005)'.

name: Avocats sans frontières (ASF)
aims: Promote and protect human rights, and particularly the right of defence; seek to ensure organization of proper defence and fair process of law; protect the right of more vulnerable persons and groups and ensure that they can exercise their rights; prevent conflict and promote respect for persons and peoples and for their social, cultural, economic and political development.
activities: Principal axes of intervention: (1) provision of legal assistance and a concern for access to justice for most vulnerable social groups; (2) support for and reinforcement of local actors working to provide legal assistance and improve access to justice for these groups; (3) information dissemination about law and its institutions amongst these groups; (4) legal monitoring activities, including provision of expert opinion and carrying out lobbying activities in respect of political decisions relating to ASF objectives; (5) reinforcement of other actors within the legal system, the latter as secondary axis of intervention. Permanent missions in Rwanda, Burundi, Congo DR and Timor-Leste.

name: Reporters sans frontieres - international (RSF)
aims: Defend the press freedom and protect journalists throughout the world.
activities: Defends journalists and media assistants imprisoned or prosecuted for doing their job and exposes the mistreatment and torture of them in many countries; fights against censorship and laws that undermine press freedom; gives financial aid each year to 100 or so journalists or media outlets in difficulty (to pay for lawyers, medical care and equipment) as well as to the families of imprisoned journalists; works to improve the safety of journalists, especially those reporting in war zones. Works closely with local and regional press freedom groups who are also members of the Reporters Without Borders network in: Afghanistan; Bangladesh; Belarus; Myanmar; Colombia; Cuba; Congo DR; Eritrea; Kazakhstan; Pakistan; Peru; Romania; Russia; Somalia; USA; Tunisia; Ukraine. Awards: Fondation de France Prize; Prix RFI-Reporters sans frontieres-OIF; Prix francophone de la liberte de la presse.

name: Free Vietnam Alliance (FVA)
aims: Bring about a pluralistic democracy in Vietnam through non-violent means.
activities: Organizes conferences and campaigns.

name: Pacific Islands, Australia and New Zealand Electoral Administrators Network (PIANZEA)
aims: Maintain, in the Pacific spirit, a close association of Pacific electoral administrators within an established networking arrangement to facilitate and encourage the free flow of information among member countries and to provide assistance where possible; support members by providing the information and resources needed to improve electoral administration within their constituencies; encourage continuous improvement and provision of technical assistance among members.

name: Asian Network for Free Elections (ANFREL)
aims: Bring a peaceful change in local democratic functions and protect the rights and freedoms of citizens, which are consistent with the States' obligations under the international law and do not violate the principle of non-discrimination on the grounds of race, colour, sex, language, religion, political or other opinion, national or social origin, property, birth or other status, through an impartial, neutral and transparent election observation mission spelling out the necessary recommendations to strengthen peoples participation and the democratic functions.
activities: Regional approach and strategies, including sending international observers. Organizes training and study seminar; conducts research; supports enhancement of integrity of electoral processes as well as minimizing elections irregularities and election-related human rights violations; provides accurate and impartial information and analysis on issues related to general elections; enhances and sustains the capacity of civil societal activity among participating nations; supports and strengthens local networks of elections observation bodies in organizing, information gathering and data exchange activities during mission.

name: International Legal Assistance Consortium (ILAC)
aims: Facilitate and assist efforts to improve efficacy and credibility of legal institutions, focusing on situations of conflict or transition.
activities: Initiated legal reform programs in Afghanistan, Iraq, Liberia and Haiti.

name: European People's Party (EPP)
aims: Ensure close permanent collaboration among center-right political parties of Europe, in order to achieve their common policies; promote and organize common action at European level; work to achieve a free and pluralist democracy; promote a Europe-wide social market economy; pursue the process of integration in Europe as a constituent element of the European Union; promote and consolidate democracy in transition countries; promote transatlantic and international relations.
activities: Organizes statutory congresses. Provides services for member parties. Member parties undertake through their national policies, to support positions taken by EPP in the EU context; parliamentarians elected to the European Parliament on their lists and/or sent to Parliamentary Assemblies of the Council of Europe Committee of Regions, WEU, OSCE or NATO are obliged by their respective EPP Member Parties to join the relevant EPP groups associated with those assemblies. In the framework of its external relations policy, develops bilateral relations with like-minded parties in other continents, under the coordination of the Secretary of External Relations.

name: World Movement for Democracy
aims: Facilitate linking of democrats from different countries and regions in order to exchange information more efficiently, work together and help one another; provide a meeting place for democrats who are active in different professional areas, such as human rights, law, political party development, workers' rights, economic reform, research and education; stimulate new initiatives and help shape the priorities of the broader community of institutions concerned with the promotion of democracy.
activities: Facilitates establishment of regional and functional networks, including: African Democracy Forum (ADF, #00358); Global Network on Local Governance (GNLG, #13286); Network of Democracy Research Institutes (NDRI, #23032); Transatlantic Democracy Network; World Forum for Democratization in Asia (WFDA, #29487); World Youth Movement for Democracy (WYMD, #29965).

name: European Digital Rights (EDRi)
aims: Promote, protect and uphold civil rights in the field of information – and communication technology.

name: Club of Madrid
aims: Respond to the demand for leader-to-leader support to confront today's global, regional and national democratic leadership challenges.
activities: Identifies and develops practical recommendations, action plans and implementation strategies to advance democratic development, through: consolidation of democratic values, practices, institutions, leadership and governance; promotion of sustainable, socio-economic development through democratic means including participation, consensus-building, transparency and accountability. Works with political leaders and civil society to strengthen governance and build more effective public policies; works with partners worldwide on democratizing international financial institutions, on democratic responses to terrorism, on leadership for climate change and energy challenges, on promoting dialogue and social inclusion and on analysing and formulating recommendations on the political dimensions of the world economic crisis from different regional and national perspectives. Priorities 2009-2011: Shared Societies Project - Leadership for Dialogue, Diversity and Social Cohesion; Energy and Democratic Leadership Programme.

name: Red Interamericana para la Democracia (RID)
aims: Strengthen democracy by encouraging responsible citizen participation and supporting implementation of mechanisms and laws that guarantee this participation; promote citizens' understanding of their democratic rights and responsibilities so that they can be effectively utilized at the community level; foster collaboration among civil society organizations, national and local governments and regional democratic leaders; strengthen members' technical and institutional capacities and finance strategic projects.
activities: Areas of expertise: Transparency and Anti-Corruption; Hemispheric Processes; Decentralization and Local Government Strengthening; Civic Responsibility; Political Parties; Citizen Deliberation. Services include: 'INFORID' - America Civic News Agency providing information about the activities conducted by Inter-American Democracy Network member non-governmental organizations to the mass media throughout the continent; 'Virtual Training Campus (VTC)'- access to virtual discussion fora, on-line library, calendar of events and 'Latin American Citizen Participation Index (LACPI)', which is a study evaluating fields, levels and motivation of citizen participation in each of the analysed countries.

name: Democracy and Human Rights Education in Europe (DARE Network)
aims: Promote understanding and commitment to human rights and democracy within the enlarged European Union through education.
activities: Organizes seminars.

name: European Civic Forum
aims: Encourage a civic and popular ownership of Europe by its citizens; trigger a real European civic dialogue based on clear thinking; encourage meetings and exchange programmes between associations and NGOs; carry out information and awareness campaigns for the European citizens.
activities: Organizes: meetings; European Civic Days.

name: Centre Afrika Obota (CAO)
aims: Promote human rights, democracy, development and solidarity in Africa.

name: Association of Non-Governmental Organizations of Southeast Europe (CIVIS)
aims: Promote and improve the rights of all citizens in the area of Southeast Europe; fulfill the highest standard of civil society; support civic dialogue; improve education, cooperation and exchange information between members and between European institutions committed to the same objective; provide assistance to all those having European integration as an objective, as well as the NGOs in the region and their activities and relations with European institutions and organizations.
activities: Organizes: conference; round tables; workshops; TV serial. Promotes COE documents. Advocates in the field of nature protection; campaigns for right to privacy.

name: Plataforma Interamericana de Derechos Humanos, Democracia y Desarrollo (PIDHDD)
aims: Promote information, exchange, formation and elaboration of proposals and monitoring of human rights, as well as economic, social and cultural rights on national and international levels; develop a culture and conscience of rights and peace with justice in society, as well as an ample political and social consensus around the integrality of human rights, democracy and development.
activities: Conceptual Production' – conceptual, methodical and instrumental document production on human rights, democracy and development. 'Public Action' – campaigns and investigative actions, education, diffusion and mobilization. Instrumental in setting up: Observatorio Control Interamericano de los Derechos de los Migrantes (OCIM, #23930).

name: Feminist Articulation Marcosur (FAM)
aims: Influence political discussion and systems that extend citizenship and deepen democracy; strengthen areas of joint communication among social movements; in particular reinforce these spheres with a feminist presence; serve as a think tank for regional organizations based on national organizational processes, so as to harness the political incidence of women in the integration process and in defence of economic, social and cultural rights.
activities: Launched the campaign "Against fundamentalisms, people are fundamental". Work is reflected with World Social Forum (WSF, #29801) events. Organizes "Feminist Dialogues (FD)". Organizes seminars.

name: Asia-Pacific Philosophy Education Network for Democracy (APPEND)
aims: Foster democracy through philosophy education in the Asia-Pacific region.

name: Southern African Judges Commission (SAJC)
aims: Promote: cooperation among courts in the Southern African region; the rule of law, democracy and the independence of the courts in the region; the welfare and dignity of judges in the member countries.
activities: Organizes meetings.

name: Association of European Administrative Judges (AEAJ)
aims: Further legal protection of individuals against public violence; further lawfulness of administrative actions; increase expansion of knowledge of European administrative judges in the European Union; strengthen the position of administrative judges in Europe.
activities: Organizes meetings. Working Groups (4): Effectiveness and Independence of Administrative Jurisdiction; Asylum and Immigration; Environmental Law; Tax Law.

name: Arab NGO Network for Development (ANSD)
aims: Strengthen civil society; enhance the values of democracy, respect for human rights and sustainable development in the Arab region.
activities: Programmes: Democracy; Development; Globalization and Trade.

name: European Network of Training Organizations for Local and Regional Authorities (ENTO)
aims: Develop the capacity of local and regional authorities to fulfill their roles by ensuring their staff are well-trained and qualified to undertake their duties in a democratic, legal, professional and efficient manner.
activities: Organizes seminars and conferences; initiates professional debates and exchanges of information; pools expertise in training and development, research, political administration and training resource management; develops partnerships for funding; participates in missions, seminars and other Council of Europe/European Union projects and programmes; facilitates placements, study tours and exchanges with members in other countries for staff training.

name: West Africa Civil Society Forum (WACSOF)
aims: Promote democratization, conflict prevention, economic development and poverty eradication through citizens' participation in the West African region; promote permanent dialogue with ECOWAS.
activities: Working Committees (10): ECOWAS and CSO Relations; Food, agriculture and environment; gender issues; governance, democracy and human rights; health, HIV/AIDS and education; media, telecommunications and information technology; peace and security; policy research and database; regional integration, economic development, trade and investment; youth.

name: European Inter-University Centre for Human Rights and Democratization (EIUC)
aims: Secure implementation of the European Master's Programme in Human Rights and Democratization (EMA); foster communication and cooperation with similar regional programmes supported by the European Union; initiate other training and research activities in the field of human rights and democracy.
activities: Programmes: 'European Master's Degree in Human Rights and Democratization (EMA)'; 'EMA Internship Programme'; 'EU-UN Advanced Internship Programme'. 'EIUC Human Rights Film Award' and 'EIUC Summer School on Cinema and Human Rights' are both in the framework of the Venice (Italy) Film Festival. Set up EMA Alumni Association. Organizes conferences, colloquia and training and research activities.

name: European Civil Liberties Network (ECLN)
aims: Provide a platform for groups working on civil liberties issues across Europe.

name: Alliance for Reform and Democracy in Asia (ARDA)
aims: Offer Asian democrats and reformers a network to provide information, support non-violent intervention during times of political crises; serve as a catalyst for new ideas and initiatives to promote democracy and freedom throughout Asia.

name: World Forum for Democratization in Asia (WFDA)
aims: Support democracy activists in Asia; focus attention of the Asian people on the democratization process in the region and encourage participation in it; seek international support for the democratization effort in Asia; stimulate and facilitate overall coordination of democracy programmes.
activities: Framework for Action includes following core activities: communicating Asia's commitment to democracy; regional standards-setting; action for defence of human rights; promoting political accountability; promoting the role of women in democracy and the political process; promoting dialogue and cooperation on issues of peace and conflict resolution; supporting free and fair elections.

name: European Alliance of Listeners' and Viewers' Associations (EURALVA)
aims: Advance the right of citizens to receive audiovisual media which serve the public interest; promote the free flow of information for everyone, including access to impartial news and information, so as to maximize their democratic, social and cultural potential; support the right of citizens to express themselves in public dialogue which is respectful of pluralism; cooperate with civil societies and regulators in Europe and worldwide; liaise with responsible media organizations which support the development of informed democracies, and which treat and portray all citizens fairly.

name: East African Human Rights Institute (EAHRI)
aims: Foster cooperation in the field of human rights, democracy and conflict management in Eastern Africa.
activities: Programmes (2006-2010): Eastern African Democracy; Eastern African Human Rights; Conflict and Human Security in East Africa. Organizes annual and biennial conference.

name: Student World Assembly (SWA)
aims: Promote global democracy by engaging students in the democratic process throughout the world.

name: African Democracy Forum (ADF)
aims: Work towards a democracy for peace, development and human rights in Africa.
activities: Organizes: discussions on democracy and human rights issues in Africa; workshops; training.

name: Southern Africa Editors' Forum (SAEF)
aims: Promote press freedom, professionalism and ethics among senior editorial executives in the print, broadcast and electric news media.

name: Gender and Media Southern Africa Network (GEMSA)
aims: Promote the mainstreaming of gender in the Southern African media as integral to the advocacy for freedom of expression, a free and independent media and for development of democratic societies in the region.

name: Young Liberals and Democrats of Asia (YLDA)
aims: Promote liberal values among the youth across Asia.

name: Great Lakes Parliamentary Forum on Peace (Amani Forum)
aims: Eliminate armed conflict in the Great Lakes region; promote peace and democratic governance.

name: Democratic Pacific Union (DPU)
aims: Safeguard human rights, democracy and the rule of law in the Pacific; ensure peaceful resolution of regional disputes and the protection of human security; promote maritime culture and sustainable development in the Pacific region; encourage development of cooperation in industry, trade and technology.

name: Global Network on Local Governance (GNLG)
aims: Develop an understanding of local governance and disseminate information; provide an interface for institutions working on issues of local governance to network and share information; provide an informal forum that seeks to harness ideas and solicit consensus of priority issues on local governance; promote a culture of good governance at the local level.

name: Network of Democracy Research Institutes (NDRI)
aims: Facilitate contacts among democracy scholars and activities; promote greater awareness of the diversity and vitality of democracy studies today.

name: Global Network for Good Governance (GNGG)
aims: Promote and sustain best practices in the management of public affairs and honesty in private business transactions as a prelude to sustainable development.
activities: Human Rights Education training programmes; budget tracking workshops; voter registration enhancement programmes for the rural population; advocacy training programmes; Football Anti-corruption Awareness project.

name: European Youth Press (EYP)
aims: Ensure strong cooperation among national youth media structures through group projects; strengthen the role of youth media; promote freedom of press in Europe.

name: West African Network on Security and Democratic Governance (WANSED)
aims: Facilitate exchange of information in democratic security sector governance; promote research, training and advocacy in security governance.

name: Arab Reform Initiative (ARI)
aims: Mobilize the Arab research capacity to advance knowledge and promote a homegrown programme for democratic reform; produce policy recommendations that can help promote reform in the region; raise awareness in the Arab world about successful transition to democracy in other parts of the world, and of the mechanisms and compromises which made such successful transitions possible.
activities: Member institutes foster, within their own national context, an informed debate on reform inclusive of a wide range of representatives from various sectors of society and government. Recommendations are formulated by experts and scholars from the Arab region. Partner institutions from the USA and Europe serve to facilitate collaboration through organizational backing for projects and help convey the message of the network to relevant constituencies in their own countries. Produces policy briefs; carries out thematic and country studies; conducts comparative public opinion surveys; sponsors occasional task forces. Organizes: Annual Conference; workshops.

name: Network of African Freedom of Expression Organizations (NAFEO)
aims: Strengthen coordination and collaboration among members in the promotion and defence of media freedom and freedom of expression across all regions of Africa.

name: Amnesty International
aims: Undertake a research and action focused on preventing and ending grave abuses of the rights to physical and mental integrity, freedom of conscience and expression and freedom from discrimination within the context of work to promote human rights; oppose abuses by opposing groups, including hostage-taking, torture and killing of prisoners and other deliberate and arbitrary killings.
activities: Assists asylum-seekers who are at risk of being returned to a country where they will be at risk of violations of basic and fundamental human rights; cooperates with other non-governmental organizations, the United Nations (UN) and with regional intergovernmental organizations; campaigns to increase accountability in international military, security and police relations; organizes human rights education and awareness and awareness-raising programs. October 2002 launch worldwide campaign to highlight discrepancy between human rights protection which those living in the Russian Federation have in international and national law and the reality of widespread human rights abuses committed in a climate of impunity. During 2003 delegates visited dozens of countries and territories to meet with victims of human rights violations, observe trial an interview local human rights activist and officials. Together with Oxfam International and IANSA, launched an arms control campaign calling for a global arms trade treaty - a draft resolution for Arms Trade Treaty (ATT, 2013) approved by United Nations in 2006 - and for local action to protect civilians from armed violence. Launched 'demand dignity campaign', 2009 - to stop and prevent the human rights abuses that drive and deepen poverty. Mainstream activities include both opposition to and denouncing violations of civil and political human rights and also preventative human rights work such as human rights awareness and human rights education programs. Approaches have included: lobbying to ensure incorporation of human rights into official training and education curricula of schools, universities, military and police academies, civil service and other professional training programs; advice and curricula; workshops and training programs for target groups. Highlights: conference for the abolition of torture, 1973. Conference for the abolition of the death penalty, 1977. International conference on extrajudicial executions, 1982. International conference on disappearances and political killings, 1992. Appeal for the establishment of an international criminal court by the year 2000, launched October 1996. In 1977, received the Nobel Peace Prize for its contribution to "securing the journal for freedom, for justice, and thereby also for peace in the world". In 1978, on the 30th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, award of the United Nations human rights prize for "outstanding achievements in the field of human rights." Campaign to mark the 50th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, culminated, 10 December 1998, Paris (France), with presentation of 13.2 million pledges from over 130 countries.

name: International Alliance of Women (IAW)
aims: Secure all such reforms as are necessary to establish a real equality of liberties, status, and opportunities between men and women in all spheres of life; urge women to accept their responsibilities and use their rights and influence in public life to ensure that the status of every individual, without distinction of sex, race, or creed, shall be based on respect for the person, the only guarantee for individual freedom and peace; promote a better quality of life and good understanding among peoples
activities: Organizes: triennial Congress with workshops to formulate an action program for next triennium, which is then approved in plenary sessions; regional board meeting and seminar (annual), with follow-up workshops and projects. Priorities for 2005-2007: human rights - women's rights; globalization; civil and political rights; education for all - legal literacy; poverty; violence, including - (a) trafficking in women and children, (b) domestic violence, (c) violence in general; health; nutrition; environment and habitat. Cooperates with other NGOs and with the United Nations specialized agencies on: peace and security; nationality of married women; equal pay and discrimination in employment; discrimination in education; slavery and suppression of traffic in persons; elimination of discrimination against women and girls; equal access to technology and resources

name: International Association of Democratic Lawyers (IADL)
aims: Facilitate contact and exchange of views between and among lawyers and lawyers associations of all countries; foster understanding and goodwill among them; work together to achieve the aims set out in the United Nations charter; ensure common action by lawyers in the study and practice of democratic principles, making for maintenance of peace and cooperation among nations; restore, defend and develop democratic rights and liberties in legislation and its practice; promote independence of all peoples and oppose any restrictions on this independence whether in law or in practice; defend and promote human rights and peoples rights; promote preservation of ecology and healthy environment; work for strict adherence to rule of law and independence of the judiciary and legal profession; defend peoples rights to development and to conditions of economic equality, enjoyment of the fruits of scientific progress and of natural resources.
activities: Main areas: research on legal issues affecting human, political and economic rights; study and practice of democratic principles for maintenance of peace and peaceful problem-solving, and cooperation among nations; defense and development of democratic rights and liberties and legislation and in the practice of law. Organizes international commission of inquiry and conferences; topics have included: the new economic order; racism and apartheid; human rights; decolonization and self-determination. Provides observer missions to trials.

name: International Bar Association
aims: Support the independence of the judiciary, the right of lawyers to practice their profession without interference, and human rights of lawyers worldwide; establish and maintain permanent relations and exchanges among bar associations and law societies and individual member lawyers; discuss problems of professional organization and status; advance the science of jurisprudence in all its phases; promote uniformity and definition in appropriate fields of law by common study of practical legal problems; promote administration of justice under law among peoples of the world; promote legal aspects of the principles and aims of the United Nations in executing these objectives; Cooperate with, and promote coordination among, international judicial organizations having similar purposes.
activities: Organizes: national, regional and international conferences; seminars. Works through: legal practice division, with over 50 specialist committees covering all areas of practice, those with common interests working together under sections; public and professional interests division, covering activities of the legal profession, organized in "Constituents", and also the activities and interests of member organizations; Human Rights Institute (HRI), covering human rights and rule of law issues, including working with IBA Task Force on International Terrorism.

name: International Commission of Jurists (ICJ)
aims: Support and advance the primacy, coherence and implementation of international law and principles that advance human rights; ensure that developments in international law adhere to human rights principles and that international standards are implemented at national level.
activities: Guidance/assistance/consulting; knowledge management/information dissemination.

name: International Council of Women (ICW)
aims: Unite women's voluntary organizations worldwide for consultation and action to promote welfare of mankind, the family and the individual; support the ideas of international peace and arbitration, equal legal status for women – including suffrage and rights of citizenship, equal pay for equal work – and family and child welfare; support efforts to achieve peace through negotiation, arbitration and conciliation; make known the principles of human rights and achieve their application in every aspect of life; promote recognition and respect for human rights and work for the removal of discrimination based on birth, race, sex, language or religion; promote equal rights and responsibilities for both sexes in all spheres; encourage women to recognize their responsibilities in the community and train and stimulate them to participate in public life on local, national and international levels; study questions which affect the status of women and their capacity to play an active part in all aspects of life; deepen understanding and increase mutual sympathy of women through international contact
activities: Organizes regional seminars on human rights, literacy, education, the advancement of women and their participation in economic and social development. European center of the international council of women (ECICW #05515) promotes women's interests with the European Union. International Standing Committees (5): 'Status of Women' Sub-Committees - Legislation; implementation of conventions; human rights; international relations and peace. 'Sustainable Development' Sub-Committees - economics; consumer affairs; women in employment; rural and urban women. 'General Wellbeing' Sub-Committees - health; environment; habitat; nutrition. 'Communication' Sub-Committees - education; mass media; arts and letters; music. 'Social issues' Sub-Committees - Child and family; youth; aging; migration.

name: International PEN
aims: As the World Association of writers, editors and translators in all branches in classes of literature, journalism, poetry, drama, fiction, history, biography, science, translation and philosophy, promote and maintain friendship and intellectual cooperation among writers and readers in all countries in the interest of literature, freedom of expression and international Goodwill; enable the unhampered transmission of thought within and among nations. PEN's charter affirms that literature should remain common currency in spite of political or international or peoples and that works of art are the property of humanity at large.
activities: Event/meetings. Committees (4): writers in prison committee - works for the release of writers in prison for expressing their opinions - foundation PEN emergency fund, based in the Netherlands, gives practical aid to the dependence of imprisoned or harassed writers; translations and linguistic rights committee - encourages translation from and in between minority languages; writers for peace committee, international PEN women writers committee (IPWWC)

name: International Union of Socialist Youth (IUSY)
aims: Propagate amongst the younger generation the principles of free and democratic socialism; further practical cooperation among democratic socialist youth and student organizations of all countries so as to strengthen international solidarity among young socialists worldwide in the fight against fascism, racism, discrimination and for the liberation of men and particularly women from all exploitation and for the rights of all peoples to free and independent development, for protection of environment and for human rights
activities: Organizes: international conferences; world festivals (about every 2 to 3 years) with political and cultural programs; summer camps; training seminars; briefings on specific topics; worldwide and regional political campaigns and gatherings; missions; delegations; solitary brigades; speaking tours; study sessions. Promotes exchange among the various organizations.

name: Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU)
aims: As focal point for worldwide parliamentary dialogue, work for peace and cooperation among peoples and for firm establishment of representative institutions. To that end: (a) foster contacts, coordination and exchange of experience among parliaments and parliamentarians of all countries; (b) consider questions of international interest and express views on such issues in order to bring about action by parliaments and parliamentarians; (c) contribute to defense and promotion of human rights - an essential factor of parliamentary democracy and development; (d) contribute to better knowledge of the working of representative institutions and to the strengthening and development of their means of action.
activities: Organizes two main sessions a year. Carries out objective examination of international questions suitable for settlement by parliamentary action. Main fields of work (5): promotion of democracy; action for peace and cooperation; human rights, including human rights of parliamentarians; women's issues with special emphasis on women's participation in politics; development. Since Nov 1979, organizes meetings of parliamentarians attending UN General Assembly in New York NY. In 1976, adopted 'procedure for the examination and treatment of communications concerning violations of the human rights of parliamentarians', applicable to any member of parliament from any country who is alleged to be victim of arbitrary measures during the exercise of his or her mandate, whether parliament was in session or in recess or had been dissolved by unconstitutional or emergency measures. Instrumental in setting up: Global Center for Information and Communication Technologies in parliament.

name: Women's International Democratic Federation (WIDF)
aims: Unite women regardless of race, nationality, religion and political opinion, so that they may work together to win, implement and defend their rights as mothers, workers and citizens; defend the rights of children to life, well-being and education; win and defend national independence and democratic freedoms, eliminate apartheid, racial discrimination and fascism; work for peace and universal disarmament
activities: Works for: (1) women's rights in society and in the family and for their right to work, to receive equal pay for equal work, to receive education at all levels and for recognition of their social and cultural life - supports women suffering oppression, racial discrimination, apartheid, any form of fascism, colonialism or neocolonialism, through solidarity activities, study trips, seminars, roundtable meetings and publications; (2) the right to healthcare and adequate nutrition, so children do not die of hunger; (3) children's, especially girls', right to education, protection of children from violence and respect for their individual rights. With respect to peace, works: (1) for preservation and consolidation of peace; against the arms race (including weapons of mass destruction and nuclear weapons); (2) against constantly increasing military expenditure. With respect to NGO activities: was an initiator of the proclamation by the United Nations of 'International Women's Year' and contributed to the implementation of 'United Nations Decade for Women: Equality, Development, Peace'.

name: World Federation of Democratic Youth (WFDY)
aims: Work for peace, freedom, democracy, independence and equality.
activities: Events/meetings; research/documentation.

name: CPU Media Trust
aims: Promote the concept and ideals of the Commonwealth; Foster mutual understanding and goodwill; advanced the welfare of the newspaper and periodical press of the Commonwealth through action to safeguard press freedom; watch for and oppose all measures or proposals likely to affect press freedom; promote measures for educating and training journalists in the Commonwealth.
activities: Organizes: annual meetings; conferences every two years. Instrumental in setting up International Press Telecommunications Council.

name: International Association for Religious Freedom (IARF)
aims: Work for freedom of religion and belief, as a human right, through: freedom from oppressive interference or discrimination by the state, government or society's institutions on the grounds of religion or belief; mutual understanding, respect and the promotion of harmony, or at least 'tolerance', among communities or individuals of different religions or beliefs; accountability of religious communities to ensure that their own practices uphold the fundamental dignity and human rights of their members and others.
activities: Supporting affected communities; non-formal diplomacy; young adult programs; codes of conduct; preventive strategies. Organizes quadrennial Congress, regional (Continental) conferences, commissions and chapters.

name: Union Internationale des Avocats (UIA)
aims: Promote the basic principles of the legal profession; participate in the development of legal knowledge at an international level; contribute to the establishment of an international legal order based on the principles of human rights and justice among nations, through the law and for the cause of peace; establish relations and exchanges between bars, bar associations and law societies at an International level; intervene in favour of lawyers imprisoned or persecuted for practicing their profession.
activities: Organizes congresses, symposia, seminars. Drafts Resolutions and Charters of general nature of dealing with legal profession issues. Has produced: an 'International charter of legal defense rights'; an 'International Charter of Access to Justice for All'; 'Charter of the Rights of Minorities'; 'Resolution on Multi-disciplinary Practice'; Principles of Professional Conduct for the Legal Profession in the 21st century', 'Resolution on the Abolition of Capital Punishment.' Commissions (c) and Working Groups (wg): A. 'Human rights in general practice': Administrative law (c); art law (c); the future of the lawyer (c); biotechnology law (wg); litigation (c); protection of lawyers (c); international criminal defense (c); human rights (c); environmental law and sustainable development (c); family law (c); international estate planning (c); private international law (c); real estate law (c); health law (c); tort law (c); criminal law (c); retirement and pension (c); sports law (c); management of law firms (c); mediation and conflict prevention (c); business and human rights (c). B. 'Business law': Transports law (c); international arbitration (c); banking law (c); EU law; (c) competition law (c); contract law (c); international bankruptcy (c); financial services (c); tax law (c); mergers and acquisitions (c); Computer and telecommunications (c); foreign investment (c); media law (c); labor law (c); intellectual property (c); corporate law (c); international sale of goods (c); insurance law (c); rights of the digital person(wg); fashion law (wg).

name: International Association of Judges (IAJ)
aims: Defend the independence of the judiciary, as an essential requirement of the judicial function and guarantee of human rights and freedom; protect constitutional and moral position of the judiciary; promote exchange of cultural relations; organize and intensify cordial relations among judges of different countries
activities: Organizes congresses and meetings for study of the judicial system and of unification of law generally; assists in arrangement of exchange visits. Study commissions: judicial administration and status of the judiciary; civil law and procedure; criminal law and procedure; public and social law

name: LAWASIA - Law Association for Asia and the Pacific
aims: Promote administration of justice, protection of human rights and maintenance of the rule of law; advance legal education; diffuse knowledge of laws of member countries; promote development of the law and uniformity where appropriate; further international understanding and goodwill; foster relations and intercourse between lawyers; uphold and advance the status of the legal profession in the region.
activities: Sections (5) with standing committees: 'business law' - banking and finance; franchising; business law education; infrastructure and privatization; communication and technology; intellectual property; corporate securities and investment; international trade and export; environmental law; taxation. 'Litigation and ADR' - ADR; comparative constitutional law; labor law; insurance; 'family law and family rights'; 'energy'; 'judicial'; standing committees (16): stand alone committees (3): human rights; young lawyers; women in law. Organizes conferences.

name: NATO Parliamentary Assembly (NATO PA)
aims: Foster dialogue among parliamentarians on major security issues; facilitate parliamentary awareness and understanding of alliance policies; strengthen the transatlantic relationship; assist in development of parliamentary democracy throughout the Euro-Atlantic area; assist in the development of parliamentary mechanisms, practices and 'know-how' related to democratic control of Armed Forces; contribute to making the policies of the alliance more transparent and comprehensible to parliaments and their public.
activities: Events/meetings.

name: International Association of Young Lawyers
aims: Encourage meetings and promote cooperation and mutual respect among young lawyers from all countries; defend the interest of young lawyers and study questions of relevance to them; help set up groups of young lawyers in countries where none as yet exists; play an active role in development of the legal profession and harmonization of its professional rules; contribute to provision of full and effective protection of the right of all lawyers to practice their profession freely and of every person to be added, counselled or represented by a lawyer freely chosen and to be entitled to a fair trial by an impartial and independent judge within a reasonable period of time.
activities: Organizes: annual Congress; seminars; law courses; inter-continental and regional meetings. Co-organizes the international competition of counsel's speeches in defense of human rights. Includes lawyers emergency events committee, which aims to ensure protection of the right of every lawyer to practice his profession freely and for every person to be entitled to legal representation and fair trial. Declaration of Athens Greece on defense of common principles, adopted 27 August 1966 Athens. Declaration of Lausanne on recognition that regard for professional confidentiality is fundamental to the principal of the right to a fair trial, adopted 27 August 1982, Lausanne Switzerland and to September 1983, Helinski Finland. Charter of the young lawyer, 2004, Naples Italy and 2012, Paris France. Standing commissions (18) address their specific areas to seminars, Congress working sessions and publications: Technology, media and intellectual property; international business law; skills, career, innovation, leadership and learning; private clients; litigation; tax law; international arbitration; transport law; banking, finance and securities law; corporate acquisition and joint ventures; insolvency law; environmental and energy law; distribution law; labor law; commercial fraud; antitrust; corporate counsel; real estate law; Intellectual property, technology, media and telecommunications.

name: Commonwealth Magistrates' and Judges' Association (CMJA)
aims: Advance administration of the law by promoting the independence of the judiciary; promote education in law, administration of justice, treatment of offenders and prevention of crime within the Commonwealth; disseminate information and literature on matters concerning the legal process; effect closest possible links between members.
activities: Represents judiciaries of the Commonwealth; provide support and advice on issues relating to judicial independence; organizes seminars, regional meetings, conferences and training on civil, criminal and procedural matters.

name: Society for Threatened Peoples International (STP International)
aims: Campaign against genocide and discrimination of threatened economic and religious minorities or nationalities worldwide.
activities: Organizes: rallies; demonstrations and visuals; international conferences and publicity-attracting actions; Press conferences and lecture tours; discussions.

name: Regional Council on Human Rights in Asia
aims: Adopt and disseminate a Regional Declaration of Human Rights that reflects the culture, values and aspirations of the people of the region and seek the support of the people in the region for that declaration; promote respect for individual and collective civil, political, social, economic and cultural human rights; receive petitions and complaints and assist in redressing violations of these rights; encourage governments of the region to ratify or concur in the international convention on human rights; undertake studies and research.
activities: In 1984, the council decided to concentrate on two tasks: to spread and explain the declaration of basic duties among people of the ASEAN region; to campaign for the release of political prisoners in the region.

name: Asian-Pacific Parliamentarians' Union (APPU)
aims: Achieve and preserve freedom and democracy, so as to secure enduring peace and prosperity in Asia and the Pacific; strengthen mutual understanding and unity of all nations and peoples in Asia and the Pacific; promote economic cooperation and exchanges of culture and technology so as to enhance common welfare on a humanitarian basis; discuss all matters affecting peace and security in Asia and the Pacific and carry out decisions that may be agreed upon; respect principles of sovereignty and territorial integrity of all nations, and the principles of non-interference in international affairs of other countries.

name: Christian Democratic Organization of America
aims: Serve as a link between Christian Democratic parties in Latin America.
activities: Knowledge management/information dissemination; research/documentation; networking/liaising.

name: Council of European Municipalities and Regions (CEMR)
aims: Secure, strengthen and protect autonomy of local and regional authorities; facilitate operations of local authorities, safeguard their liberties and contribute to their prosperity, in particular through the development of inter-authority arrangements and undertakings; develop the European spirit amongst local and regional authorities with a view to promoting a Federation of the European States founded on the autonomy of these communities; provide for the participation and representation of local and regional communities and authorities in European and international institutions; achieve establishment amongst existing and future European institutions of an Assembly representing local and regional communities and authorities
activities: Activities focus on: shaping the future of Europe; promoting local and regional democracy; influencing laws and policies of the European Union; exchanging experiences; acting in the world. 'Community Aid to Twinning Programme', through Twinning Department and Twinning Officers, assists European towns in searching for a twin authority and in applying for twinning grants. Involved in support of local and regional governments in new member states of the European Union. Facilitates, at the European level, the exchange of experiences, the sharing of ideas, best practices and know-how among members. Organizes: training seminars for twinning officers and organizers; Congress of Europe Twinned Towns (every 3-4 years); information seminars; study sessions; exchange of views concerning local and regional collectivities. Committees and working groups study European Union legislation proposals and prepare common positions. Committees (5): Environment; Transport; Employment and Social Policy; Euro-Mediterannean Partnership (COPPEM); CEMR Committee of Women Elected Representatives of Local and Regional Authorities (CWERLRA) and its European Network of Women Elected Representatives of Local and Regional Authorities (ENWERLRA), which includes all CEMR member countries. Working Groups (3): Cohesion Policy; Twinning; LOGON - Enlargement. Ad Hoc Working Groups. 'ELANET - Information Society' brings together representatives of associations and daughter companies dealing with information society issues. 'Employers' Platform' represents local and regional authority associations in their role as employers vis-à-vis the European institutions and organizes the exchanges of experience on issues related to labor market policy and working conditions. Instrumental in setting up:  'Standing Conference of Local and Regional Authorities of Europe' - the precursor to CLRAE; the previous Consultative Council of Local and Regional Authorities (inactive). National sections set their own policies, organize dialogue with central government as appropriate and ensure that central governments adopt and respect European Charter of Local Self-Government (1985).

name: Pacific Islands News Association (PINA)
aims: Develop and maintain freedom of information and expression; raise professional standards of journalism; assist training and communication.
activities: Professional development seminars; training; development of resource material; Pacific media awards. Participates in Pacific Media Assistance Scheme (PACMAS) project of Australian Agency for International Development (AusAID).

name: International Association of Broadcasting (IAB)
aims: Defend broadcasting, whether radio or television, as a free means of expression of thought; work for freedom of social communication media; promote cooperation of broadcasters in activities of public interest and social services and the effective representation of broadcasting interests in official or private national and international organizations; sponsor world and regional conferences of a technical, legal or educational nature.
activities: Standing Committees: Legal; Technical; On Copyright; On Freedom of Expression.

name: Inter-American Bar Association
aims: Provide a permanent forum for exchange of professional views and information for lawyers to promote the rule of law and protect democratic institutions in America; establish and maintain relations among national and local organizations of lawyers in the region; advanced the science of jurisprudence, particularly the study of comparative law; promote uniformity of laws; promote the rule of law and then ministration of justice, encouraging establishment and maintenance of independent judicial systems in all countries of the America; preserve and defend human rights and liberties; guarantee to all peoples of the hemisphere the free exercise of their civil and political rights under democratic principle; uphold the honor of this legal profession; encourage cordial intercourse and fellowship among lawyers in the Americas.
activities: Organizes conference about every 18 months; regional seminars. Permanent committees serving as a forum for presentation of papers relating to each committee's focus and reporting back to the conference: public and private international law; constitutional law; administrative law includes labor law municipal law food and drug lost; civil law and procedure; business, banking and securities law; criminal law and procedure; military law; development and integration law; legal education; fiscal law; natural resources and environmental protection; human rights law; practice of law; Labor law and Social Security; intellectual and industrial property law; telecommunications, scientific technology loss; corporate and institutional counsel; international arbitration law; women's rights. Affiliated organizations: inter-American Academy of comparative law no recent information, set up 1941, Havana Cuba.

name: Carribean Democrat Union (CDU)
aims: Advocate promotion of freedom and an economic system based on a social market economy through consideration of matters of political organization and policies.
activities: Charter covers: democracy; freedom and the individual; the individual in the community; private property and private enterprise; international relations program includes seminars on: environment; drug abuse; training of young leaders; woman and development.

name: Inter-American Press Association
aims: Protect freedom of the press in the Americas and defend and promote the right of the American peoples to be fully and freely informed through an independent press; foster and protect press freedom by publishing facts of any action or attempt to restrict that freedom in the western hemisphere; foster general and specific press interest; promote and maintain their dignity, rights and responsibilities of the profession of journalism; encourage uniform standards of professional and business conduct; promote greater exchange among American peoples in support of basic principles of a free society and individual liberty.
activities: Maintains: Interamerican Press Association Press Institute, which organizes seminars and produces publication; IAPA scholarship fund, set up 1954. Set up: office of certified circulation, started in 1954, which subsequently became autonomous and was replaced by national and regional organizations which continue helping to increase advertising income and thus financial independence.

name: Association internationale pour la defense de la liberte religieuse (AIDLR)
aims: In the belief that the right to religious freedom is a gift of God: encourage all those who are attached to the ideal of liberty, without any distinction of race, sex, language or religion, to participate in the crusade against all forms of intolerance and fanaticism; value human dignity such that each individual has access to true existence in every domain and to a flowering of his being so as to discover his true identity; serve freedom of faith throughout the world; create a climate of the greatest understanding and reciprocal respect among people of every faith and conviction, to assist humanity in solving the major problems of peace, liberty and justice.
activities: World Congress on Religious Liberty, jointly with International Religious Liberty Association; regional Congresses in cooperation with other NGOs.

name: International Federation of ACAT – Action by Christians for the Abolition of Torture
aims: Sensitize Christian communities to the atrocity of torture; invite all Church members to participate in action on behalf of tortured prisoners; bring messages of hope into the heart of the reality of torture; contribute to creation, promotion and dissemination of legal instruments against torture; exercise a preventive function of vigilance and human rights education.
activities: Initiates joint actions and campaigns; organizes regional and international training seminars; represents ACATs in international and regional bodies or in coalitions; works with other human rights NGOs and also with churches and religious congregations.

name: Confederation of Cooperatives of the Caribbean and Central America (CCC-CA)
aims: Foster and encourage development, integration, consolidation, representation and defense of cooperatives in the region; by this means achieve structural change in the countries concerned, so that they can democratize their political, social and economic life with a concept of justice, participation and peace.
activities: Organizes about 150 national and regional events annually. Sets out strategic guidelines for a common agenda under the heading: integration; development; inter-cooperation; solidarity; representation and defense; institutional consolidation; social justice. Programmes: education and training; strategic planning; research; communication; commercialization; development of sectors; business development; information; organization and development. Policies relate to participation of women and youth and environmental issues.

name: Andean Commission of Jurists (ACJ)
aims: Encourage institutional reform favourable to continuity of constitutional order and reinforcement of democracy; reform administration of justice, establishing an independent and efficient system with a spirit of democracy, increasing legitimacy of the judiciary and public confidence in it, and ensuring integrity of judges; promote recognition and observance of the rights of indigenous peoples in Andean countries so that legislation reflects the multi-ethnic and pluri-cultural nature of society in the region and the value and identity of the indigenous population; protect and work towards observance of human rights in the region, encouraging greater use and efficacy of mechanisms designed for this purpose nationally and throughout the region.
activities: Research/documentation; knowledge management/information dissemination.

name: Nordic Christian Democrats
aims: Promote Christian democracy in Nordic countries
activities: Congresses; Nordic meetings; meetings of presidents; meetings of general secretaries and international secretaries

name: European Union of Christian Democratic Workers (EUCDW)
aims: Unite Christian social workers and press for the political unification of a democratic Europe based on common values and fundamental rights; promote the development of the EPP in form and content on the basis of Christian social teaching; represent and defend worker interests within the EPP, the European institutions, especially the European Parliament, together with other social, political and trade union organizations on European level; work for the achievement of Christian social principles and policies in the European workers' movements; step up cooperation with the workers and their organizations, particularly those, in Europe and elsewhere, with a Christian outlook; spread Christian social ideas; promote the establishment of national and regional associations of Christian social workers.
activities: Organizes: seminars; colloquia; meeting; working groups.

name: International Federation of Resistance Movements
aims: Act against neofascism and extreme right wing, xenophobia and anti-Semitism, war and terrorism as well as their social roots.
activities: Awareness raising; research/documentation; events/meetings.

name: International League of Religious Socialists (ILRS)
aims: Promote development of democratic socialism; facilitate cooperation among and on behalf of organizations of religious socialists and circulate and provide information on their work; contribute to the official recognition of such organizations as coworkers in their respective socialist parties and in the wider socialist movement; maintain close links with socialist international; reduce historical prejudices and overcome traditional tensions between religious believers, religious communities and the socialist movement
activities: Organizes conferences, seminars and political campaigns on various issues of interest to the socialist movement as well as civil society

name: Union des avocats europeens (UAE)
aims: Unite lawyers who are members of a European Union bar so as to promote: professional practice within the Community; teaching and continuing education; right of establishment and the free movement of services; harmonization of legal statute, professional and deontological practices; practices of EC law as derived from the European Convention for the protection of human rights and fundamental freedoms.
activities: Organizes: Scientific congresses (held annually in May/June); colloquia and seminars; study days. Remevant treaty: Convention for the protection of human rights and fundamental freedoms (1950).

name: International Social Democratic Union for Education (ISDUE)
aims: Realize the idea of democratic socialism.
activities: Training/education; liaising/networking.

name: African Society of International and Comparative Law (ASICL)
aims: Promote advancement of public education in the field of law and civil liberties in Africa; protect individual liberties; raise standards in administration of justice; provide a comprehensive legal aid system in each African country; with cooperation of justice departments, organize an itinerant ombudsman service for dispute settlement in rural areas; promote the African contribution to the international law; promote formulation of clear, established rules to deal with multiplicity of legal systems - local, religious, national - found in many African countries.
activities: Fieldwork in rural areas to raise standards of justice administration, mainly through national branches. Encourages formation of women's groups to advise on their specific problems, and of law teachers' and practitioners' groups. Preparing legal documentation to provide a record of legal affairs in Africa. Establishing an African Research Library in Africa. Plans setting up a 'School for Diplomats' to provide centralized training for African diplomats. With law  enforcement agencies, organizes workshops for police and other law officers on civil liberties.

name: Pan-African Reconciliation Council (PARC)
aims: Promote peace, human rights, democracy, social justice, passive resistance to all forms of violence and oppression, emancipation of Africa and its siblings in the diaspora from the bondage of ignorance and party on the basis of active non-violence and self-giving love as a tool for social engineering and ultimate global order; build a social structure utilizing the resources of human ingenuity and wisdom for the benefit of all; ensure a society where no one is directly or indirectly oppressed for the benefit or pleasure of others; advocate fair and compassionate methods of treatment of offenders against society; protect, seek redress and provide welfare support for direct and indirect victims of war, natural and ecological disasters and encourage restitution and reconciliation; work towards abolition of war; help build morally disciplined homes; encourage vocational and collegial relations transcending all tribal, ethnic, creed, national or racial boundaries; promote the adversarial system of justice; uphold the truth in all facets of life.
activities: Current Programmes: Social and Economic Justice; Non-violence; Refugees: Social Conflicts: Inter-faith Activities; Youth and Women.

name: Youth Against Racism in Europe (YRE)
aims: Combat racism, prejudice and the far right.
activities: Organizes: international youth camps; demonstrations; Street campaigns; solidarity campaigns; pickets.

name: Inter-Pacific Bar Association (IPBA)
aims: Provide members with the opportunity to: contribute to the development of the legal profession, its status and organization in the "Region", comprising Asia and the jurisdiction within, or bordering the Pacific; contribute to development of law and legal structures within the Region; meet and exchange ideas with other lawyers who live in or are interested in the Region; share information on legal development affecting the region. Promote the rule of law.
activities: Organizes: annual meetings and conference; regional seminars, sometimes in conjunction with other organizations. Specialist working committees: aviation law; banking, finance and securities; competition law; corporate counsel; cross-border investment; dispute resolution and arbitration; employment and immigration law; energy and natural resources; environmental law; insolvency; insurance; intellectual property; international construction project; international trade; legal development and training; legal practice; maritime law; scholarship; tax law; technology and communications; Women business lawyers.

name: Confederacion Latino Americana de Asociaciones de Profesionales Universitarios (CLAPU)
aims: Seek consensus and integration based on the principles of inclusion and equality of justice to enable distributing the products of the national effort and the social, economic and cultural rights for all citizens to ensure the strengthening of democratic institutions.

name: International Association for Democracy in Africa
aims: Defend and promote: democracy and human rights in a government society for sustainable development in Africa; Government by the majority; respect for human, minority and individual rights and the right to differ; responsible government for just and transparent management of public affairs; people sovereignty, freedom of the press and other freedoms to counterbalance other power; independence of the judicial system and an acute sense of its responsibilities by the citizen. Monitor democracy and the achievement of the rule of law in Africa.
activities: Organizes: awareness campaign; training seminar; conferences; round table; workshop; fora for exchange of information; radio and TV program; exhibitions. Carries out research on: electoral processes; a charter for political parties. Acts as observer to elections. Participate in meetings and conferences. Programs: democratic culture and human rights; governance and peace; sustainable development; women, children and gender. Cooperates with national organizations.

name: Arab Lawyers' Union
aims: Act in the interests of the Arab Nation to achieve its national objectives; facilitate contacts between Arab lawyers; safeguard and develop legislative and judiciary language; assure the freedom of lawyers in their work and the independence of magistrates; allow all Arab lawyers to take cases in any Arab country; harmonize the conditions of the legal profession; establish and harmonize links with international legal organizations; restore the study of Muslim Law as a basis for law; promote and protect human rights
activities: Commissions (9): Arab affairs; Palestine; Unification of law in Arab countries; defense of civil liberties and rule of law in Arab countries; harmonization of legal terminology; rules on the legal profession; socialization; support of the Palestine Liberation Movement; Defense of Palestinian resistance workers. Engaged in founding an Arab Organization for Human Rights. Decolonization action against racism, racial discrimination and apartheid

name: International Association of Political Consultants (IAPC)
aims: Promote, sustain and foster the democratic process as a matter of principle and practice; bring together political consultants, both specialists and generalists, from various countries to exchange views and information about political developments and techniques.
activities: Organizes annual world conference where international democracy award is made.

name: Memorial - International Historical and Educational, Charity and Human Rights Society
aims: Struggle against totalitarianism in all its manifestations; struggle for rights of the individual, for formation of a civil society and of a state governed by the rule of law which excludes the return to totalitarianism and for active participation and democratic transformation; contribute to restoration of historical truth about crimes committed by totalitarian regimes; preserve and perpetuate the memory of victims of totalitarianism; promote the complete and open rehabilitation of victims of repression and take measures to compensate for damage inflicted upon them; protect the rights of repressed victims and of members of their families, including rendering them legal assistance.
activities: Main guidelines: 1. 'Historical' - collection, study and publication of information about the history of political repression and human rights violation. 2. 'Human Rights' - Collection and study of information on the contemporary status of human rights, including public initiatives in solving the most acute problems in this sphere. 3. 'Charity' - social and medical assistance to victims of political repression. Initiates and participates in erecting memorial stones and plaques in cities of the former Soviet Union where executions and mass burials of victims of political repression have occurred, including publication of lists of executed victims and organization of exhibitions and mass actions dedicated to the victims' memory. Organizes conferences.

name: European Democrat Students (EDS)
aims: Follow and advocate the principles of personal freedom, democracy, human rights and the rule of law, on a worldwide scale; develop contacts, exchanges and political cooperation among center-right, Christian Democrat, Conservative and Liberal students and youth in Europe; work for a free, democratic and united Europe, inside and outside the European Union; form a better understanding of cultural and political situations worldwide; promote the principles of market economy; exchange information on education policy and other political matters.
activities: Working groups (3): higher education and research; policies for Europe; human rights. Brings together students and young political leaders from all over Europe to promote a political pro-European exchange. Campaign: Knowledge Is Power. Organizes at least two major events a year: Winter University; Summer University. Also organizes seminars and conferences to provide practical training in international work for representatives of member organizations.

name: Federation of Arab Journalists (FAJ)
aims: Serve the objectives of the Arab people in their unity; defend the causes of Arab journalists and develop their talents and abilities; defend the rights and freedoms of Arab journalists and their human rights.
activities: Supports and coordinates the activities of member organizations; collaborates with international press associations and with organizations engaged in the defense of human rights and fundamental freedoms; organizes and sponsors meetings, fora, exhibitions, training courses and exchange of delegations. Publishing activity.

name: Conferencia Permanente de Partidos Politicos de America Latina (COPPPAL)
aims: Coordinate efforts for peace and democracy in Latin America and the Caribbean.
activities: Organizes seminars, Congresses, symposia and colloquia.

name: Nordic Organization of Workers' Educational Associations (WEA in the Nordic Countries)
aims: Promote development of society within the ideological framework of democratic socialism through independent and voluntary popular education.
activities: Organizes: annual Nordic AOF School to increase knowledge of social, economic and cultural conditions in Nordic countries; local, regional and Nordic seminars, courses and study tours. Projects emphasize learning about people in other Nordic countries, in particular the self-governing areas of Aland, Faeroe Is and Greenland

name: African Parliamentary Union (APU)
aims: Unite parliamentary institutions of African states; favor contacts among parliamentary Africans and with parliamentarians worldwide; contribute to strengthening the institution of parliament in Africa, to promoting democracy and human rights and to realizing of objectives of African unity for establishment of a durable peace.
activities: Observes elections in African countries. Organizes thematic conferences. Conducts information and training seminars.

name: Commonwealth Lawyers' Association (CLA)
aims: Maintain and promote the rule of law throughout the Commonwealth.
activities: Knowledge management/information dissemination; events/meetings; capacity building

name: Magistrats europeens pour la democratie et les libertes (MEDEL)
