aims: Promote a European jurisdictional culture based on the legal values of democracy, essentially respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms; protect differences between human beings and the rights of minorities, especially of immigrants and the disadvantaged, with a view to social emancipation; support European integration in creating a European political union and a greater social justice; defend the independence of the judiciary from other authorities and specific interests; Promote transparency of the judicial system, democratization of the magistrature and the right of judges to meet, to express themselves and to form unions; promote exchange of information and of democratic legal culture between judges of different countries.
activities: Events/meetings; training/education.

name: Union internationale des journalistes africains (UIJA)
aims: Work for the benefit of the continent and African journalists in a spirit of cooperation and African unity; promote cooperation among journalists; coordinate professional activities; defend the right to freedom of expression in the spirit of realistic understanding, especially in the struggle against apartheid; defend African cause in general.
activities: Training/education; events/meetings; knowledge management/information dissemination.

name: African Jurists' Association (AJA)
aims: Instigate reflection from which would emerge judicial systems adapted to socioeconomic and cultural realities of Africa; favor development of a current of opinion serving to promote and protect the rights of man, an individual and collective freedom, a necessary condition for autocentric and integral development of the African peoples. Given the critical situation of human rights in Africa, a pose in general: the death penalty; imprisonment for offenses of opinion; torture, ill-treatment and arbitrary arrest.

name: International Association of Prosecutors (IAP)
aims: Set and raise standards of professional conduct and ethics for prosecutors worldwide; promote the rule of law, fairness, impartiality and respect for human rights and improving international cooperation to combat crime.
activities: Works closely with the UN Secretariat to secure assistance of experienced prosecutors for projects and advice in developing countries; organizes annual conference and 4 regional conferences; develops and promulgates a series of standards for prosecutors.

name: European Association of Lawyers for Democracy and World Human Rights (ELDH)
aims: Promote human rights, peace, disarmament and understanding between peoples; fight against racism and fascism; fight against discrimination; promote equal entitlement of women and men and respect children's rights; protect the environment.
activities: Research/documentation; standards/guidelines; politics/policy/regulatory; events/meetings.

name: Christian Democrat Feminine International (CDFI)
aims: Promote and coordinate international action of Christian Democrat feminine organizations; pursue doctrinal studies and promote political studies; ensure the affirmation of humanist and Christian values and principles of freedom, democracy and social justice.
activities: Seminars, meetings, conferences on topics such as women, human rights, civil and political rights.

name: International Young Democrat Union (IYDU)
aims: Promote and defend the ideals and cultural heritage of pluralist democracies; contribute to and participate in the workings of IDU; extend and strengthen cooperation among member organizations
activities: Organizes: meetings; Freedom Forum.

name: Federacion Latinoamericana de Periodistas (FELAP)
aims: Defend the freedom of the press and of access to information; improve working conditions; contribute to friendship among the peoples of Latin America and the Caribbean; show solidarity with journalists who are persecuted.

name: Association of African Election Authorities (AAEA)
aims: Promote cooperation and mutual assistance among electoral organizations in the region in the pursuit of democracy by processes that ensure free, fair and peaceful elections.

name: Association of Caribbean Electoral Organizations (ACEO)
aims: Promote cooperation and mutual assistance among electoral organizations in the region in the pursuit of democracy by processes that ensure free, fair and peaceful elections.

name: Association of Asian Election Authorities (AAEA)
aims: Promote and institutionalize open and transparent elections, independent election authorities, professional election administration, citizen participation in the electoral and civic process, information sharing; develop information resources.
activities: Projects include: development of Asian-electoral information resources; election observation missions; exchange of election-related materials; arrangement of professional development opportunities.

name: Association of European Election Officials (ACEEEO)
aims: Provide a non-partisan forum, independent of national governments, for information exchange among election officials and experts throughout the Central and Eastern European region to discuss and act upon ways to promote open and transparent elections with the objective of supporting good governance and democracy
activities: Maintains an election documentation center. Offers electoral training and studies. Conducts election observation missions.

name: Union Interamericana de Organismos Electorales (UNIORE)
aims: Increase cooperation between member associations and individual electoral organizations belonging to the union; promote the sharing of information on electoral systems; foster participation of representatives of member organizations in an observer capacity in electoral processes, at the invitation of the country where they are held which shall provide the necessary facilities as far as practicable in terms of its own resources; formulate general recommendations for member organizations; promote honest, efficient and democratic electoral systems which guarantee universal suffrage and a free and secret ballot; provide support and assistance, as far as practicable, to electoral organizations which request it.

name: Asian Federation Against Involuntary Disappearances (AFAD)
aims: Promote, protect and defend the human rights of victims of involuntary disappearance in Asia and their families; facilitate the search for the disappeared, with the hope of rescuing lives; build, develop and promote international solidarity among organizations of families of the disappeared within Asia and among individual representatives of countries where these organizations cannot exist because of intense repression; assist member organizations in their local concerns on involuntary disappearance; promote awareness of disappearances and act urgently on specific cases; develop strategies and tactics for lobbying Asian government bodies at national, regional and international levels; transmit denunciations to competent international organizations; campaign actively against government measures to perpetuate impunity and for public acknowledgment of disappearances by governments and their commitment to establish mechanisms to make disappearances illegal; become a venue for discussion on substantive issues and training on relevant topics and for the holistic healing of families suffering the pain and economic loss of losing loved ones; work for adoption of international instruments aimed at preventing enforced disappearance.
activities: Formulates updates on the situation of disappearances in Asia and reports these to WGEID and other appropriate international and regional bodies; developing an e-mail urgent response network.

name: Democrat Union of Africa (DUA)
aims: Serve as a forum for dialogue between member organizations and policymakers on issues of democracy, good government, economic policy, human rights and human development.
activities: Organizes meetings and seminars.

name: International Democrat Union (IDU)
aims: Promote a free, open and democratic society, the free market economy, the rule of law, social justice, the role of the family, and a society where conditions are created to enable everyone to reach their full potential and carry out their responsibilities to their fellow men and women; Foster the common philosophy of member parties; establish permanent relations at a bilateral and multilateral level and encourage mutual support; provide a forum for the exchange of views and information on matters of interest to all or a considerable number of member parties
activities: Undertakes fact-finding missions, for example to: Central America; South Africa. SFCA develops internal reports on specific international questions, providing the basis for public communiques and for recommendations to the leadership of member parties. Occasional ad hoc groups monitor important national elections and prepare for future work.

name: South East Europe Media Organization (SEEMO)
aims: Promote and safeguard freedom of the press in the South East European region; improve the standards and practices of journalism; promote cooperation, understanding and the free exchange of news; ensure safety of journalists.
activities: Programs (3): media aid; media law; media in transition. Set up 'SEEMO Emergency Fund'; organizes conferences, congresses and regular meetings. Presents annual SEEMO-CEI Award for investigative journalism; annual SEEMO Award for Human Rights Photo; annual Dr Erhard Busek-SEEMO Award for Better Understanding in South East Europe; SEEMO Award for Mutual Cooperation in SEE (during International Human Rights Day, 10 Dec).

name: Organization of Eastern Caribbean Bar Associations (OECS Bar Association)
aims: Represent, promote and protect the interest of the legal profession within the region; be concerned with questions of human rights and the rule of law; protect the public's rights of access to the courts and to legal representation; work for the improvement of the administration of justice; and to take any action which contributes to the protection and preservation of fundamental conditions for a well-ordered society.
activities: Organizes annual law fair.

name: Federacion Latinoamericana de Trabajadores de la Cultura y de la Comunicacion Social (FELATRACCS)
aims: Promote the organization of workers in the press sector in all countries of Latin America, providing material and technical assistance as necessary, and organizing necessary services at the Latin American level, cooperating in national-level provision of such services; promote unity at the national level among all organizations in the sector to render the activities more effective; study, promote, defend and represent the interests of press workers with government bodies in Latin America and worldwide, in line with workers' rights and interests; defend and promote the right for free and democratic organization of all press workers; monitor respect for freedom of information and expression.
activities: Denounces violations of the liberty of information and free expression in Latin America and the Caribbean and defends the physical integrity and the human rights of journalists and press workers. Organizes meetings, seminars, training workshops, correspondence courses. Hold Congresses (every 4 years).

name: Avocats europeens democrats (AED)
aims: Introduce a debate between lawyers of various countries in order to promote a democratic Europe, in particular concerning recourse to the debate towards litigation solutions, the respect of the rights of defense and the harmonization of the statutes and practices of professional lawyers; guarantee independence of Bars and their members in any capacity, and in particular, the capacity of the state; defend and extend rights of prerogatives of defense, and in particular, of the physical integrity and the political, economic, social and individual freedom of lawyers at the international level; promote on behalf of citizens, notably the weakest or victims of infringements of human rights, the access to rights into modern and humane democratic justice; carry out action for respect of essential rights and fundamental public and individual freedoms, in particular against any abuse of the public power and in any capacity; develop European, democratic juridic culture, notably by regular exchange of information, continuous study of subject of common interest and organization of joint working meetings.
activities: Organizes seminars, colloquia and international conferences. As an association, AED is a civil party together with other human rights association in diverse trials. Members participate in international solidarity missions with lawyers from around the world.

name: Global Organization of Parliamentarians Against Corruption (GOPAC)
aims: Fight corruption; promote integrity through the enhancement of the effectiveness of parliament and legislators; provide a voice for global parliamentarians fighting corruption; make parliaments more effective institutions of democratic oversight.
activities: Training/education; guidance/assistance/counseling; knowledge management/information dissemination.

name: Association of the Local Democracy Agencies (ALDA)
aims: Coordinate the overall activities of the 12 Local Democracy Agencies in South East Europe and the Caucuses; promote democracy at local level; foster institution-building at local level through best practice exchanges with partners from all over Europe and training of local elected representatives as well as administrators; develop a Europe-wide network of citizens committed to the respect of human and minority rights; foster the development of an inclusive civil society; promote intercultural dialogue; foster sustainable development.
activities: Events/meetings; training/education.

name: European Association of Political Consultants (EAPC)
aims: Develop, support and maintain the democratic process; increase exchange of information and experience between political consultants.

name: Arab Organization for Human Rights (AOHR)
aims: Call for respect of human rights and fundamental freedoms of all citizens and individuals in Arab countries in accordance with provisions of international human rights instruments; defend any individual or group whose human rights are subjected to violations which are contrary to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant of Economic, Social, and Cultural Rights and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, as well as the other international human rights instruments; endeavor, regardless of political considerations, to obtain release of detained or imprisoned persons, and provide relief and assistance for persons whose freedom is restricted in any way or who are subjected to coercion of any kind because of their beliefs and political convictions, or for reasons of race, sex, color or language; protest in cases where a fair trial is not guaranteed; provide legal assistance where necessary and possible; call for improvements in conditions of prisoners of conscience; work for amnesty of persons sentenced for political reasons.
activities: Carries out fact finding missions to verify the human rights developments in the Arab region, and field missions in an effort to release political prisoners, in some cases as an observer and in others as a member of the defense panel. Receives complaints from individuals, groups and organizations and contacts the concerned authorities. In addition to the offering of legal assistance in several cases, the organization provides financial assistance to families of victims. In coordination with the Arab Lawyers' Union launched a campaign for 'Freedom for Prisoners of Conscience in the Arab World'. Conferences and seminars. Instrumental in setting up: Arab Human Rights Documentation and Information Network; Arab Institute for Human Rights.￼

name: Confederation of ASEAN Journalists (CJA)
aims: Cooperate fully in advancing journalism; promote free and responsible press in ASEAN countries; promote dialogue, discussion and cooperation with journalists, scholars and professionals worldwide.
activities: Organizes: ASEAN press conference convention every two years; seminars; regional and bilateral professional training workshop; courses. Kuala Lumpur Action Plan, signed 1 Oct 2009, Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia) promotes the cause of freedom of expression, mutual understanding, cooperation and development and maintenance of regional peace and prosperity.

name: Young European Socialists (YES)
aims: As an independent umbrella organization for socialist and social democratic youth in Europe: promote European citizenship amongst young people; contribute towards the construction of the democratic European state; defend the interest of youth in the EU; integrate member organizations on the European level.
activities: Meeting activity; politics/policy; financial and/or material support; advocacy/lobbying/activism.

name: Group of the European People's Party in the Committee of the Regions (EPP-CoR)
aims: Promote the ideals of Christian democratic movements as broadly as possible, as well as a greater and systematic involvement of cities and regions in EU policy-making.
activities: Range of activities with local and regional authorities throughout Europe. Preparation and discussion of opinions through Commissions: COTER (Commission for Territorial Cohesion); ECOS (Commission for Economic and Social Policy); ENVE (Commission for the Environment, Climate Change and Energy); EDUC (Commission for Education, Youth, Culture and Research); CAVEX (Commission for Citizenship, Governance, Institutional and External Affairs); NAT (Commission for Natural Resources); CAFA (Committee for Administrative Affairs). Annual external meeting and seminar; annual Summer University for Local and Regional Media; Annual Study Visit for Masters Students.

name: Comite international de Mauthausen (CIM)
aims: Safeguard the interests of former prisoners of the Mauthausen concentration camp, and their families; oppose fascism and Nazism in all forms.
activities: Collaborates with International Committees of other Nazi concentration camps.

name: Association for the Prevention of Torture (APT)
aims: Work towards a world in which no one is subjected to torture or to cruel, inhumane or degrading treatment or punishment; promote outside scrutiny and accountability of institutions where persons are deprived of their liberty, through independent visiting another monitoring mechanisms; ensure the international, regional and national legal norms for the prevention of torture and other ill-treatment are universally promoted, respected and implemented; strengthen the capacity of national and international actors concerned with persons deprived of their liberty by increasing knowledge and commitments to prevention practices.
activities: Management of treaties and agreements: Optional Protocol to the UN Convention against Torture and other Cruel, Inhumane or Degrading Treatment or Punishment (OPCAT, 2002); guidance/assistance/consulting; training/education; events/meetings.

name: Copenhagen Initiative for Central America and Mexico (CIFCA)
aims: Promote participatory European policies that subscribe to the integral respect of human rights, democratization and fair and sustainable development in Central America and Mexico; support implementation of protection and promotion of human rights, participatory democracy and sustainable support and inclusive development as the cornerstone of European policies concerning Central America and Mexico.
activities: Political objectives cover two main areas: human rights; natural resources. Promotes the fight against impunity and against femicide, the promotion and protection of human rights defenders and labor rights' unions; advocates for the EU, through political dialogue and development cooperation, in order to support and contribute to strengthening of civil society and the role of the States of Central America and Mexico in order to prevent and fight against impunity; contributes to ensure that the EU's policies on trade, development cooperation and political dialogue respect, promote and protect the defense and access to the right to food and land; draws attention to proposals of indigenous peoples of the region, aiming for EU policies to recognize and promote the defense of the right to territory and natural resources. In cooperation with other NGOs, organizes: conferences/debates in the European Parliament; meetings with civil society member representatives, politicians, MEPs, ambassadors, etc.

name: Comision Juridica para el Autodesarrollo de los Pueblos Originarios Andinos (CAPAJ)
aims: Contribute to combating discrimination or other acts that threaten indigenous peoples and their fundamental rights as contained in the constitutions of their countries and in the Universal Declaration of the Human Rights.
activities: Juridical support; participation in international and regional meetings and in national seminars.

name: Europe at School
aims: Help young people to develop personal and social confidence and skills to help them meet the challenge of modern society in Europe through: general education for democracy; intercultural education; readiness for lifelong learning; mastering of new information and communication technology; transnational cooperation in the field of European education. Create and promote European awareness among pupils, students and teachers.
activities: Europe at School - European Competition – L'Europe a l'ecole  -Concours europeen held under auspices of the joint patrons and comprising: annual art and essay competition; annual 'Europe at School-Internet Award Scheme'; series of youth gatherings involving prizewinners; training seminars for youth leaders; teacher seminars. Also organizes: Spring meeting alternatively in Strasbourg (France) or Brussels (Belgium); Autumn meeting; European experts' conferences on the European dimension in teaching and education; European Youth Gatherings in Strasbourg, in cooperation with EYCs. Participation in and contributes to programs and projects, in particular those of patrons.

name: International Federation for East Timor (IFET)
aims: Propagate the ideas and establish principles of decolonization and human rights; uphold internationally recognized principles enshrined in the UN charter, particularly with respect to decolonization process and especially as regards to decolonization of Timor-Leste; provide support from the international civil society for the people of Timor-Leste in free exercising their rights to political, economic and social self-determination; endeavor to guarantee internationally recognized human rights and justice for all in Timor-Leste's evolution to full and genuine independence; assist United Nations in helping Timor-Leste reach these goals by providing information to UN officials and organs, mobilizing international public opinion and advocating with UN officials and government of UN member states; facilitate consulting and dialogue among member NGOs and with other interested NGOs to coordinate activities on an international level; communicate common concerns of participant NGOs to relevant authorities and individuals.
activities: Main activities: lobbying advocacy; democracy development; human rights promotion; policy advice; citizen diplomacy. Disseminate information on the decolonization and transition to genuine independence of Timor-Leste; collects and disseminate data on human rights and political and justice situation in the country; organizes campaigns to support people and achieving their human, political and economic rights, according to internationally recognized standards. Send observers to 1999 UN consultation in Timor-Leste and continues to advocate the bringing to justice of those who committed human rights violations there from 1974 to 1999.

name: World Association of Judges (WAJ)
aims: Advance the administration of judicial justice through cooperation and communication among ranking judicial officials of all nations in an effort to bring to bear upon the common problems of humankind to universally accepted processes, procedures, principles and institutions of the rule of law.

name: Asian Legal Resource Centre (ALRC)
aims: Promote awareness among the oppressed of their inalienable rights as human beings and of remedies available to them under national, regional and international instruments; promote awareness and acceptance among jurists, and others whose activities affect human rights, of the responsibilities to serve and protect the oppressed; provide for exchange within Asia of expertise and experience among human rights organizations and legal resources in support of such human rights in the countries of the region; promote the training of lawyers to render effective legal assistance to the oppressed and victims of human rights violations; develop methodologies for, and assist in, the training of paralegal workers, and facilitate the sharing of such experience; develop programs of mass education about law, and support sharing of experience of those involved in such programs; promote creation and strengthening of legal resource organizations in the region; promote efforts to increase access for the oppressed to judicial administrative institutions, and efforts to reform such institutions to increase their ability to provide timely and effective relief.
activities: Main functions: coordinates and shares amongst local, national and sub-regional groups and individuals information on legal service programs and legal initiatives being taken in Asian countries, through such means as publications, exchange of materials and workshops; facilitates exchanges of people working in fields of human rights and legal resources, and encourages the sharing of information and skills and the development of such programs in places where they do not currently exist, through visits, internship and similar actions; develops training schemes to assist the creation and operation of legal resource and paralegal programs, and promotes such programs on a sub-regional basis; researches and analyses current legal issues concerning human rights violations and oppression of persons in peoples within Asia; encourages the development of a macro-perspective on these problems and provide such information for: Asian Human Rights Commission (AHRC, #01237).

name: Center for Democracy and Reconciliation in Southeast Europe (CDRSEE)
aims: Foster, within Europe: democratic and pluralist societies; European values and citizenship; market economies that operate within the framework of the rule of law and principles of social responsibility; social inclusion of disadvantaged groups; reconciliation amongst people.
activities: Advocacy/lobbying/activism; capacity building; events/meetings; networking/liaising.

name: World Press Freedom Committee (WPFC)
aims: Support the freedom and independence of news media and free flow of news and information; advocate and monitor press freedom concerns in inter-governmental organizations; assist news media, journalists and journalism schools in developing and post-communist countries through training programs, manuals, provision of equipment and other means.
activities: Serve as watchdog for news media at UNESCO, United Nations, nonaligned and other conferences. Coordinates cooperative press freedom activities with other groups for greater effectiveness. Administers the fund against censorship. Carries out projects to assist news media and journalism schools in Africa, Asia, Latin America, the Caribbean and Central and Eastern Europe.

name: Latin American Journalism Centre
aims: Promote a free and responsible press through ongoing education and training of journalists
activities: Specialized courses for journalists and media staff.

name: International Center for Not-for-Profit Law (ICNL)
aims: Create a world where civil society can freely develop in all its forms and participate in public decisions; promote an enabling legal environment for civil society and public participation worldwide.
activities: Helps establish legal framework for strong and effective civil society through technical assistance to over 100 countries.

name: European Parliament Former Members Association (FMA)
aims: Bring former members together and provide a forum for meetings, discussions, and cultural, scientific and social events; facilitate exchange of information and news between former members of the European Parliament; foster relations between former and current members of the European Parliament by establishing and using an information network; use the experience of former members to strengthen parliamentary democracy and to serve European unity; promote contacts between similar organizations in Europe and elsewhere, including former members' associations of national parliaments; promote debate on development of the European Union in the political field as well as in public opinion and to study its consequences for institutions, local authorities and citizens.
activities: Organizes: EP to Campus; seminars and conferences; annual study visits; election observation missions; technical assistance missions; annual dinner; dinner-debates.

name: Human Rights without Frontiers International (HRWF)
aims: Monitor, research and analyze the field of human rights, as well as promote democracy and the rule of law on national and international levels.
activities: Main strategies: information; communication; leverage. Advocacy activities through case studies.

name: Party of European Socialists (PES)
aims: Strengthen the socialist and social democratic movement in the European Union; contribute to forming a European awareness and to expressing the political will of the citizens of the EU; define common policies for the EU and influence the decisions of European institutions; lead the European election campaign with a common strategy, visibility, manifesto and candidate to the European commission presidency.
activities: Politics/policy/regulatory.

name: International Buchenwald-Dora Committee (IBDC)
aims: Group the survivors of the Nazi concentration camps of Buchenwald, Dora and their 'Kommandos', as well as their families and descendants, in order to safeguard the places of remembrance, the memory of the history, and the struggle of the anti-fascist resistance for the liberty and human solidarity

name: Comite international de Sachsenhausen (CIS)
aims: Commemorate the victims of the concentration camps at Sachsenhausen; promote peace and friendship between peoples so as to avoid all return to fascism.
activities: Conservation of the Memorial; contributions to youth education.

name: Centrist Democratic International (CDI)
aims: Promote and coordinate international activity of Christian Democratic parties, ensuring political solidarity; carry out doctrinal and political research of general interest for Christian democracy; disseminate Christian democratic ideas and promote knowledge of their achievements.
activities: Seminars on the ideological and political platform of CDI. Permanent committees (4) on: development; economic problems; human rights; relations with the United Nations. Information and documentation service for members. Coordinates political and vocational training centers in most member countries.

name: Christian Democratic Women of America (CDWA)
aims: Work for transforming Latin America according to the Christian Democratic principles; further and defend the values of the human being and the principles of liberty, democracy, justice and peace; strive to achieve the full promotion of women at all levels of society, especially in the political field.
activities: Training courses; fight for the promotion of women; seminars, meetings.

name: International Movement Against All Forms of Discrimination and Racism (IMADR)
aims: Eliminate discrimination and racism, forge international solidarity among discriminated minorities and advance international human rights system.
activities: Advocacy/lobbying/activism; awareness raising; research/documentation; events/meetings.

name: World Organization Against Torture (OMCT)
aims: Work to combat torture, summary executions, disappearances, psychiatric internment for political reasons and all other cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment.
activities: SOS-Torture Network assembles organizations in correspondents worldwide. Secretariat provides personalized medical, legal and/or social assistance to torture victims and ensures daily dissemination of urgent appeals across the world, so as to protect individuals and fight against impunity. Programs provide support to specific categories of vulnerable persons, such as women, children and human rights defenders. Also submits individual communications and alternative reports to the special mechanisms of the UN, and actively collaborates in the development of international norms for the protection of human rights.

name: Women and Law in Southern Africa Research Trust (WLSA)
aims: Improve legal status of women in Southern Africa; develop research skills of women's laws researchers; conduct research on gender issues in Southern Africa, particularly those related to legal rights; provide information on gender and the law and influencing policy and law reform in each country and exchange this information among member countries; explore and develop new methodologies and perspectives for the study of gender and the law; cooperate and liaise with other organizations in each country, regionally and internationally.
activities: Development of a regional network of women and men researching women's legal rights. Regional seminars. Studies for all seven member countries. Programs of action (6): activist research (core program); information dissemination and documentation; legal advice and services; lobbying and advocacy for policy, legal reform and change; networking; training and education on women's rights.

name: European Democrat Group (EDG)
aims: As a center-right coalition of members of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe, promote the respect of individual liberty and human rights and responsibilities under the rule of law, pluralist democracy and the support of a free market economy.
activities: Organizes seminars.

name: Nordic Christian Democratic Youth
aims: Increase, by a stronger and expanded cooperation between member organizations, Christian democratic influence, especially in Scandinavian politics.
activities: Act as a forum for political discussions. Discusses practical cooperating questions. Arranges meeting and seminars. Participates in the yearly Nordic youth Council and the Nordic Council sessions.

name: Asian-Pacific League for Freedom and Democracy (APLFD)
aims: Help unite peoples of Asia and the Pacific in promoting freedom, democracy and human rights and also enhancing friendly cooperation for the economic and social well-being and security of the peoples of Asia and the Pacific region.

name: Nonviolent Radical Party, Transnational and Transparty (PRNTT)
aims: As a Gandhian, non-violent organization, promote international political campaigns concerning: respect for human rights, particularly in non-democratic countries; promotion of democracy and freedom; anti-prohibitionist policies on drugs and against illegal trafficking and drugs; abolition of capital punishment; language rights and the use of Esperanto as the auxiliary language of international institutions; democratic reform of the United Nations.
activities: Campaign for the setting of international criminal court. Proposes to set up: United States of Europe and America; world organization of democracy and of democracies.

name: Carribean Human Rights Network
aims: Disseminate information to national, regional and international organization; promote human rights at the regional level - this includes embarking on regional campaigns; assist in the coordination of regional human rights action programs; facilitate the exchange of visits between persons or groups with a human rights interest; mount missions - fact-finding and election observer missions.
activities: Promotion of human rights in the Caribbean by means of (a) Coordination of regional campaigns on human rights issues; (b) Urging ratification of Conventions and strengthening inter-governmental machinery; (c) Creating an informed regional public opinion through education awareness; (d) Strengthening the capacity of local human rights bodies for effective action. As far as the methods of work are concerned, the Network: (a) Routinely cooperates with regional and international human rights bodies in the exchange of information, join actions and facilitating missions and visits in the region; (b)Takes initiatives at the request of affiliates; (c) Attempts to interest the Caribbean media in the human rights issues. Major areas of concern: police brutality; elections and democracy; freedom of expression. Current new programs: (i) Women's rights; (ii) Death penalty; (iii) Democracy within the region; (iv) Documentation; (v) Rights of people with disabilities; (vi) Monitoring socio-economic conditions and its negative impact on Caribbean peoples; (vii) Human rights education and training.

name: Helsinki Citizens' Assembly (hCa)
aims: As an international coalition of civil society initiatives, work for integration of a wider Europe from the citizens' level, especially in issues connected with basic values of democracy - tolerance, mutual understanding and confidence, human rights and political and economic reconstruction; carry out projects addressing issues of peace and integration among citizens.
activities: Functions as a network of NGOs across Europe, focusing on local and regional issues and cooperating through hCa International Network. Besides local activities of each organization, organizes joint activities such as: Annual Summer School for International Dialogue; youth network; investigative missions to conflict areas; fora for international dialogue among citizens. Projects have been implemented and Hungary, Poland, Czech Republic, Slovakia, the former Yugoslavia states, Turkey, Moldova, Armenia and Georgia.

name: Transparency International (TI)
aims: Work towards a world in which government, politics, business, civil society and the daily lives of people are free of corruption; focus on combating international and national corruption, increasing government accountability and raising public awareness of the need to curb corruption, through international and national coalitions encouraging governments to establish and implement effective laws, policies and anti-corruption programs; strengthen public support and understanding for anti-corruption programs and enhance public transparency and accountability in international business transactions and in the administration of public procurement; encourage all parties to international business transactions to operate at the highest levels of integrity, guided in particular by TI standards of conduct.
activities: Works through the national chapters, which fight corruption on national level through: bringing together relevant players from government, civil society, business and the media to promote transparency in elections, public administration, procurement and business; advocacy campaigns to lobby governments to implement anti-corruption reforms. 'Global corruption barometer' – survey assessing general public attitudes towards and experience of corruption. 'National integrity system' - country studies. 'Promoting revenue transparency project' – raise awareness in both the government and private sector of steps required for revenue transparency to be achieved, sustained and mainstreamed. 'Integrity Pact (IP)'- aims to prevent corruption in public contracting. 'Business principles for countering bribery' – provide a framework for companies to develop comprehensive anti-bribery programs. Annual TI integrity awards.

name: Alliance of Liberals and Democrats for Europe (ALDE Group)
aims: Create a strong and secure European union were member states agree to set high standards of public health, consumer protection and human rights; build and safeguard a free, fair and open society with a vision of a new, greener economy utilizing new skills and new technologies and providing prosperity and job opportunities.
activities: Priority areas: tackling the economic crisis and generating new jobs; greening the economy and preserving the planet; fighting discrimination and promoting equality; strengthening the union abroad and leading the world; finding a better way for Europe to finance its ambitions. Organizes seminars.

name: Parliamentarians for Global Action (PGA)
aims: Promote effective interparliamentary collaboration to mobilize global political action for an equitable, safe and democratic world. Serve a global constituency of legislators, governments, the UN system and civil society.
activities: Advocacy/lobbying/activism; events/meetings; awards/prizes/competitions.

name: Study and Research Group on Democracy, Economic and Social Development in Africa (GERDDES-Africa)
aims: Promote the democracy for favoring the economic and social development of African countries.
activities: Through its research and program execution body, international research center on democracy and development (IRCD), has initiated six Main programs since 1994: GERDDES-Elections; GERDDES-Good Governance; GERDDES-Humanitarian; GERDDES-Environment; publications and development of the independent press; general studies and research on democracy and development. Organizes seminars and conferences.

name: Commonwealth Local Government Forum (CLGF)
aims: Promote and strengthen effective democratic local government throughout the Commonwealth; facilitate the exchange of good practice in local government structures and services.
activities: Represents local government at Commonwealth level; represents members' interest on the international stage; designs and manages national, regional and pan-Commonwealth capacity-building programs; promotes the exchange of experience and information between spheres of government and with partner organizations who work with local government, especially through the biennial Commonwealth Local Government Conference; organizes regional events and workshops.

name: Socialist International (SI)
aims: Strengthen relations among member parties and organizations and coordinate their political views and activities by consent; establish contact with progressive forces worldwide working for application of the principles of democratic socialism - and international movement for freedom, social justice and solidarity.
activities: Meeting activities; campaigns.

name: Asian Forum for Human Rights and Development (FORUM-ASIA)
aims: Promote and protect all human rights, including the right to development through cooperation and collaboration among civil society organizations working on human rights development in Asia; empower people by advocating social justice, sustainable human development, participatory democracy, gender equality, peace and human security.
activities: Monitoring and documentation; campaigning and coalition-building; advocacy and lobbying; research and analysis; training and capacity building. Thematic programs: democracy and rule of law; peace and human security; anti-discrimination, minorities and vulnerable groups; ESCR; women's rights and gender; right to development. Linkage programs: UN/regional advocacy, information and communication; capacity building; movement and human rights defenders.

name: CIVICUS: World Alliance for Citizen Participation
aims: Strengthen citizen action and civil society throughout the world, especially in areas where participatory democracy and citizens freedom of association are threatened.
activities: Capacity building; advocacy/lobbying/activism; events/meetings.

name: International Freedom of Expression Exchange (IFEX)
aims: As a global network defending and promoting freedom of expression: enhance members' work by creating opportunities for capacity building, joint advocacy and increased visibility; maximize opportunities for collaboration, learning and engagement, thereby strengthening the impact of members' work as well as the network overall.
activities: Core programs (4): 'information and awareness raising' - free expression information service through (electronic) publications. Through the action network alert (AAN), member organizations provide the network with urgent appeals concerning threats to independent media and journalists that, in turn, the IFEX clearinghouse edits and distributes around the world. 'Free expression capacity building for development - outreach program' - strengthens free expression organizations in developing countries. 'Facilitating advocacy and joint campaigning' 'institutional strengthening' - IFEX clearing house.

name: World League for Freedom and Democracy (WLFD)
aims: Disseminate worldwide the ideals of freedom and democracy; encourage and support the universal application; promote respect for and observation of human rights and fundamental freedoms for all peoples; act as agent and coordinating center for international cooperation and economic development and educational and cultural exchange aimed at contributing to social progress and better living standards; combine efforts against aggression, imperialism, totalitarianism and authoritarianism of whatever form and pretension, whenever and wherever any of such forces appears.
activities: Organizes: annual general conference; annual event of the world freedom day; international academic symposium. Organizes, sponsors or cosponsors occasional exchanges, missions and symposia. Instrumental in setting up: Asian Pacific youth league for freedom and democracy (APYLFD, inactive); World youth league for freedom and democracy (WYLFD, inactive).

name: SADC Parliamentary Forum
aims: Facilitate strategic partnerships within the SADC region; promote information sharing; initiate and implement projects that enhance regional integration; promote effective and professional Parliamentary practice.
activities: Standing Committees (5): Democratization, Governance and Gender Equality; Trade, Development and Integration; Inter-Parliamentary Cooperation and Capacity Building; HIV and AIDS; Regional Women's Parliamentary Caucus Committee. Programmes (6): Regional Integration; Parliamentary Leadership Training - through SADC Parliamentary Leadership Centre (PLC, #25830); Elections Observations and Democratic Governance; HIV-AIDS; Engendering Parliaments; ICT for e-governance.

name: World Jurist Association (WJA)
aims: Mobilize the international legal profession through voluntary international cooperation to build law rules and legal institutions to promote the rule of law; coordinate the development of international law as a requisite foundation for the establishment and maintenance of world law and order; act as a world center for information and communication for the international legal profession; sponsor regional and world conferences on various aspects of public and private international law; promote projects and research to advance the development of international law; coordinate the computerization of law internationally.
activities: Networking/liaising; meeting activities; research and development.

name: Alliance of Liberals and Democrats for Europe (ALDE)
aims: Guard council of Europe values, through enhanced political action inside and outside the parliamentary assembly.
activities: Meeting activities.

name: ZaMir Transnational Net
aims: Help peace-oriented people and groups, humanitarian organizations, NGOs and the independent media in order to improve their communication possibilities. Serve people working for: the prevention of warfare; the elimination of militarism; protection of the environment; the advancement of human rights and the rights of people regardless of race, ethnic background, sex or religion or political convictions; achievement of social and economic justice; women's rights; elimination of poverty; promotion of sustainable and equitable development; more and better democratic structures in society, especially the advancement of participatory democracy; non-violent conflict resolution.
activities: Electronic-mail and news systems exchange public and private messages with each other and with other networks in Europe and worldwide several times daily. Organizes conferences/newsgroups.

name: Group confederal de la gauche unitaire europeene - gauche verte nordique (GUE/NGL)
aims: Work toward European integration based on fully democratic institutions with a priority commitment to ensuring a new model of development aimed at tackling issues such as unemployment, environment and the creation of a social area providing equal rights for all citizens; encourage a broad consultation of people.

name: International Campaign for Tibet (ICT)
aims: Monitor and promote internationally recognized human rights, democratic freedoms and self-determination for Tibetans and protect their culture and environment.
activities: Conducts fact-finding missions to Tibet, India and Nepal; monitors and investigates human rights conditions; testifies before national and international body; promote the news coverage of issues in Tibet. China project: networks with exiled Chinese democracy and overseas Chinese organizations, works with Chinese language media, conducts research on Chinese rule of Tibet. Contacts with academic, civic and community groups.

name: International Network of Political Leaders Promoting Democracy in Burma (PD Burma)
aims: Improve freedom of speech, respect for human rights; promote democratization process in Burma.
activities: Engages in lobby work, communication. Organizes workshops and conferences.

name: CIVITAS International
aims: Strengthen effective education for informed and responsible citizenship in new and established democracies worldwide.
activities: Provides online resources and services for international, civic, educational audience; maintains a worldwide network; promotes international exchanges; strives to bring the knowledge, skills, and experience of education for democracy to bear on the tasks that confront today's democracies.

name: Alliance of Universities for Democracy (AUDEM)
aims: Enhance the role of education in promoting democratic institutions and economic development

name: Free Burma Coalition (FBC)
aims: Serve as an umbrella group of organizations working for freedom and democracy in Burma; build a grassroots movement inspired by and modeled after the anti-apartheid movement in South Africa; support Daw Aung San Suu Kyi and the National League for Democracy as the sole legitimate leader of Burma.
activities: Coordinates campaigns opposing the junta ruling Burma, including: suspension of UN General Assembly seat; consumer boycotts of companies investing or operating in Burma. Organizes annual strategy conference.

name: Network of UNESCO Chairs on Human Rights, Democracy, Peace, Tolerance, and International Understanding
aims: Promote knowledge of and adherence to the values of human rights, democracy, peace, tolerance and mutual understanding at national and regional levels, based on the 'plan of action of the United Nations decade for human rights education (1995-2005)'

name: Avocats sans frontières (ASF)
aims: Promote and protect human rights, and particularly the right of defence; seek to ensure organization of proper defence and fair process of law; protect the right of more vulnerable persons and groups and ensure that they can exercise their rights; prevent conflict and promote respect for persons and peoples and for their social, cultural, economic and political development.
activities: Guidance/assistance/consulting; capacity building; knowledge management/information dissemination; monitoring/evaluation; advocacy/lobbying/activism.

name: Reporters sans frontieres - international (RSF)
aims: Defend the press freedom and protect journalists throughout the world.
activities: Defends journalists and media assistants in prison or prosecuted for doing their job and exposes the mistreatment and torture of them in many countries; fight against censorship and laws that undermine press freedom; gives financial aid each year to 100 or so journalist or media outlets in difficulty (to pay for lawyers, medical care and equipment) as well as to the families of imprisoned journalists; works to improve the safety of journalists, especially those reporting in war zones. Works closely with local and regional press freedom groups who are also members of the Reporters without Borders network in: Afghanistan; Bangladesh; Belarus; Myanmar; Columbia; Cuba; Congo DR; Eritrea; Kazakhstan; Pakistan; Peru; Romania; Russia; Somalia; USA; Tunisia; Ukraine. Awards: Fondation de France prize; Prix RFI-reporters sans Frontieres - OIF; prix francophone de la liberte de la presse.

name: Free Vietnam Alliance (FVA)
aims: Bring about a pluralist democracy in Vietnam through nonviolent means.
activities: Organizes conferences and campaigns.

name: Asian Network for Free Elections (ANFREL)
aims: Promote and support democratization at national and regional levels in Asia.
activities: Advocacy/lobbying/activism; Information dissemination; publishing activities; research/documentation; training/education; politics/policy/regulatory.

name: International Legal Assistance Consortium (ILAC)
aims: Facilitate and assist efforts to improve efficacy and credibility of legal institutions, focusing on situations of conflict or transition.
activities: Initiated legal reform programs in Afghanistan, Iraq, Liberia and Haiti.

name: European People's Party (EPP)
aims: Ensure close permanent collaboration among center-right political parties of Europe in order to achieve their common policies; promote and organize common action at European level; work to achieve a free and pluralist democracy; promote a Europe-wide social market economy; pursue the process of integration in Europe as a constituent element of the European Union; promote and consolidate democracy in transition countries; promote transatlantic and international relations.
activities: Events/meetings; networking/liaising; knowledge management/information dissemination.

name: World Movement for Democracy
aims: Strengthen democracy where it is weak, defend democracy where it is longstanding; support efforts of pro-democracy groups in non-democratic countries.
activities: Facilitates establishment of regional and functional networks, including: African Democrat Forum (ADF); Red Latinoamericana y del Caribe para la Democracia (RedLad); International Movement of Parliamentarians for Democracy (IMPD); International Women's Democracy Network (IWDN) ; Global Network on Local Governance (GNLG); Network for Democracy Research Institutes (NDRI); World Youth Movement for Democracy (WYMD). Project Support.

name: European Digital Rights (EDRi)
aims: Promote, protect and uphold civil rights in the field of information- and communication technology.

name: Club de Madrid
aims: Respond to the demand for leader-to-leader support to confront today's global, regional and national democratic leadership challenges.
activities: Identifies and develops practical recommendations, action plans and implementation strategies to advance democratic development, through: consolidation of democratic values, practices, institutions, leadership and governance; promotion of sustainable, socio-economic development through democratic means including participation, consensus-building, transparency and accountability. Works with political leaders and civil society to strengthen governance and build more effective public policies; works with partners worldwide and democratizing international financial institutions, on democratic responses to terrorism, on leadership for climate change and energy challenges, on promoting dialogue and social inclusion and on analyzing and formulating recommendations on the political dimensions of the world economic crisis from different regional and national perspectives. Priorities 2009-2011: Shared Societies Project - leadership for dialogue, diversity and social cohesion; energy and democratic leadership program.

name: Red Interamericana para la Democracia (RID)
aims: Strengthen democracy by encouraging responsible citizen participation and supporting implementation of mechanisms and laws that guarantee this participation; promote citizens' understanding of their democratic rights and responsibilities so that they can be effectively utilized at the community level; foster collaboration among civil society organizations, national and local governments and regional democratic leaders; strengthen members' technical and institutional capacities and finance strategic projects.
activities: Areas of expertise: transparency and anti-corruption; hemispheric processes; decentralization and local government strengthening; civic responsibility; political parties; citizen deliberation. Services include 'INFORID' - America Civic News Agency providing information about the activities conducted by Inter-American Democeacy Network member non-governmental organizations to the mass media throughout the continent; 'Virtual Training Campus (VTC)' - access to virtual discussion forum, online library, calendar of events and 'Latin American Citizen participation Index (LACPI)', which is a study evaluating fields, levels and motivation of citizen participation in each of the analyzed countries.

name: Democracy International (TDI)
aims: Strengthen democracy where it exists; revive democracy where it has been destroyed; inspire democracy where it is a distant dream; unite efforts of individuals seeking freedom from unrepresentative government.

name: Democracy and Human Rights Education in Europe (DARE Network)
aims: Promote understanding and commitment to human rights and democracy within the enlarged European Union through education.
activities: Organizes seminars and conferences; offers policy consultation in the field of education for democratic citizenship and human rights education.

name: European Civic Forum
aims: Encourage a civic and popular ownership of Europe by its citizens; trigger a real European civic dialogue based on clear thinking; encourage meetings and exchange programmes between associations and NGOs; carry out information and awareness campaigns for the European citizens.
activities: Events/meetings.

name: Centre Afrika Obota (CAO)
aims: Promote human rights, democracy, development and solidarity in Africa.
activities: Programs and projects: Program for the Promotion of Democracy by Support for Civil Society Organizations (ProDOSC); Regional Support Program for the Social Economic in Africa (PARESOC); Hydraulic Project; Observer of Justice; Women's agenda; Civic Education Project.

name: Association of Non-Governmental Organizations of Southeast Europe (CIVIS)
aims: Promote and improve the rights of all citizens in the area of Southeast Europe; fulfill the highest standard of civil society; support civic dialogue; improve education, cooperation and exchange information between members and between European institutions committed to the same objective; provide assistance to all those having European integration as an objective, as well as the NGOs in the region and their activities and relations with European institutions and organizations.
activities: Organizes: conference; round tables; workshops; TV serial. Promotes COE documents. Advocacy; publishing activity. Participates in: World Energy Efficiency Day (5 March); International Human Rights Day (10 December).

name: Asia Journalist Association (AJA)
aims: Promote press freedom, democratic ideas and world peace.

name: Association of Mediterranean Ombudsmen
aims: Promote the creation of new institutions of mediators, ombudsman, Diwan Al Madhalim or people's defenders; consolidate existing institutions and promote and defend their independence; promote and defend democracy, human rights and social peace around the Mediterranean region.
activities: Organizes: encounters among members and institutions for promotion of human rights in the region; training sessions; conferences and awareness programs.

name: Red Latinoamericana y del Caribe para la Democracia (RedLad)
aims: Provide support in solidarity to individuals and groups in situations where democracy is in danger.
activities: Initiates causes and complains of violations of human rights; reports acts of unconstitutional and undemocratic action; serves as a permanent observatory in each of the countries of the region in terms of democracy and human rights; monitors fundamental freedoms; publicize human rights violations; organizes meetings; monitors elections. Themes: world movement for democracy; counsel for a community of democracy; indigenous peoples and movements of afrodescendants; gender issues; youth movement; research and training; inter institutional affairs.

name: World Association of Newspapers and News Publishers (WAN-IFRA)
aims: Act as a partner of newspapers in the news publishing industry worldwide; defend and promote press freedom, quality journalism and editorial integrity; promote the industry with applied research in the fields of technology and business.
activities: Organizes: IFRA expo; world newspaper Congress; conferences; training; seminars. Runs world editors forum, exclusively dedicated to senior newsroom editors worldwide. Offers awards and prizes: Asian digital media awards; Asian media awards; color quality club; world young reader prize; XMA cross media awards. Operates: African Press Network for the 21st Century; Arab press network.

name: Plataforma Inreramericana de Derechos Humanos, Democracia y Desarrollo (PIDHDD)
aims: Promote information, exchange, formation and elaboration of proposals and monitoring of human rights, as well as economic, social and cultural rights on national and international level; develop a culture and conscience of rights and peace with justice in society, as well as an ample political and social consensus around the integrity of human rights, democracy and development.
activities: Conceptual production' - conceptual, methodical and instrumental document production on human rights, democracy and development. 'Public action' - campaigns and investigative actions, education, diffusion and mobilization. Instrumental in setting up: observatorio control Interamericano de los derechos de los migrantes.

name: Feminist Articulation Marcosur (FAM)
aims: Influence political discussion and systems that extend citizenship and deepen democracy; strengthen areas of joint communication among social movements; in particular reinforce these spheres with a feminist presence; serve as a think tank for regional organizations based on national organizational processes, so as to harness the political incidence of women in the integration process and in defense of economic, social and cultural rights.
activities: Launched the campaign "Against fundamentalisms, people are fundamental." Work is reflected with World Social Forum (WSF, #18735) events. Organizes "Feminist Dialogues (FD)." Organizes seminars.

name: Asia-Pacific Philosophy Education Network for Democracy (APPEND)
aims: Foster democracy through philosophy education in the Asia-Pacific region.

name: Southern African Judges Commission (SAJC)
aims: Promote: cooperation among courts in the Southern African region; the rule of law, democracy and the independence of the courts in the region; the welfare and dignity of judges in the member countries.
activities: Organizes meetings.

name: Association of European Administrative Judges (AEAJ)
aims: Further legal protection of individuals against public violence; further lawfulness of administrative actions; increase expansion of knowledge of European administrative judges in the European Union; strengthen the position of administrative judges in Europe.
activities: Organize meetings. Working groups (4): Effectiveness and Independence of Administrative Jurisdiction; Asylum and Immigration; Environmental Law; Tax Law.

name: Arab NGO Network for Development (ANND)
aims: Strengthen civil society; enhance the values of democracy, respect for human rights and sustainable development in the Arab region.
activities: Capacity building; advocacy/lobbying/activism; events/meetings.

name: Association for Democratic Development and Cooperation (EUROPENS)
aims: Promote the concept of European citizenship among citizens, institutions and regions that represent the European geographic space; facilitate the process of European integration; promote the democratic development of the regions in Europe.
activities: Presentation of proposals to various authorities and institutions; organization of workshops, fora, conferences and exhibitions; training; elaboration of programs; provision of guidelines and guidance.

name: International Coalition to End Torture (ICET)
aims: Promote the United Nations convention against torture and other cruel, inhumane or degrading treatment or punishment and thus raise human rights awareness around the world, with particular focus on the Middle East.
activities: Implementation of the UN convention in the entire Middle East; establishment of an independent constitutional court in Iran; establishment of a right to petition an independent court in Middle Eastern countries; establishment of a right to seek writ of habeas corpus in Middle Eastern countries.

name: Arab Center for the Development of the Rule of Law and Integrity (ACRLI)
aims: Reinforce its role as an Arab think tank and development organization contributing to the betterment of Arab societies through strengthening the rule of law and integrity.

name: European Alliance for Democratic Citizenship
aims: Promote active democratic citizenship among young Europeans.
activities: Maintains FutureLab.

name: Southern Africa Development Community Election Support Network (SADC-ESN)
aims: Promote democratic elections in the SADC region through networking of domestic observer groups.

name: West Africa Election Observers Network (WAEON)
aims: Stregthen and support citizens' election observation groups to participate effectively in electoral and democratic processes in West Africa.

name: European Platform for Democratic Elections (EPDE)
aims: Assist citizens' election observation in countries of the Eastern Partnership and in the Russian Federation; contribute to democratic election processes throughout Europe.
activities: Training/education; advocacy/lobbying/activism; monitoring/evaluation.

name: European Association of Former Parliamentarians (FP-AP)
aims: Promote the European ideal, based on individual and political liberties, the primacy of law and true democracy; contribute to the European construction.

name: Civil Society for the Renewal of European Democracy (Europe+)
aims: Relaunch and strengthen the European debate and civil dialogue between civil society and open and responsive institutions at all levels of democratic life.
activities: Advocacy/lobbying/activism; events/meetings.

name: Balkan Civil Society Development Network (BCSDN)
aims: Empower civil society and influence European and national policies towards more enabling environment for civil society development as to ensure sustainable and functioning democracies in the Balkans.

name: European Network of Training Organizations for Local and Regional Authorities (ENTO)
aims: Develop the capacity of local and regional authorities to fulfil their roles by ensuring their staff are well-trained and qualified to undertake their duties in a democratic, legal, professional and efficient manner.
activities: Organizes seminars and conferences; initiates professional debates and exchanges of information; pools expertise in training and development, research, political administration and training resource management; develops partnerships for funding; participate in missions, seminars and other Council of Europe/European Union projects and programs; facilitates placements, study tours and exchanges with members in other countries for staff training.

name: European Forum for Democracy and Solidarity (EFDS)
aims: Assist, with the help of socialist and social-democratic parties, the countries of Central and Eastern Europe in the process of transition.
activities: Inform the international social-democratic movement on the political situation in the countries of Central, Eastern and South Eastern Europe with an emphasis on the development of social democracy. Also coordinates projects in these countries.

name: West Africa Civil Society Forum (WACSOF)
aims: Promote democratization, conflict prevention, economic development and poverty eradication through citizens' participation in the West African region; promote permanent dialogue with ECOWAS.
activities: Working committees (10): ECOWAS and CSO Relations; food, agriculture and environment; gender issues; governance, democracy and human rights; health, HIV/AIDS and education; media, telecommunications and information technology; peace and security; policy research and database; regional integration, economic development, trade and investment; youth.

name: European Inter-University Centre for Human Rights and Democratization (EIUC)
aims: Develop innovative masters programs, research activities and training seminars for all those working in the field of human rights; manage the global campus of masters programs and diplomas in human rights and democratization fostering communication and cooperation with its regional programs supported by the European Union; develop the human rights village together with the city of Venice.
activities: Advances innovative programs and projects. Core activities: European Master's Program in Human Rights and Democratization; Global campus of masters programs in human rights and democratization; Venice school of human rights; Venice academy of human rights; training seminars; joint educational programs; FP7 – funded research project "FRAME" (fostering human rights among European external and internal policies); conferences and workshops; internship program; EU-UN advanced internship program; art exhibitions. Supports E.MAlumni association.

name: Global Greens
aims: Work cooperatively to implement democracy, nonviolence, sustainability and respect for diversity.

name: European Civil Liberties Network (ECLN)
aims: Provide a platform for groups working on civil liberties issues across Europe.

name: Alliance for Reform and Democracy in Asia (ARDA)
aims: Offer Asian democrats and reformers a network to provide information, support non-violent intervention during times of political crises; serve as a catalyst for new ideas and initiatives to promote democracy and freedom throughout Asia

name: World Forum for Democratization in Asia (WFDA)
aims: Support democracy activists in Asia; focus attention of the Asian people on the democratization process in the region and encourage participation in it; seek international support for the democratization effort in Asia; stimulate and facilitate overall coordination of democracy programmes.
activities: Framework for action includes the following core activities: communicating Asia's commitment to democracy; regional standard-setting; action for defense of human rights; promoting political accountability; promoting the role of women in democracy and the political process; promoting dialogue and cooperation on issues of peace and conflict resolution; supporting free and fair elections.

name: European Alliance of Listeners' and Viewers' Associations (EURALVA)
aims: Advance the right of citizens to receive audiovisual media which serve the public interest; promote the free flow of information for everyone, including access to impartial news and information, so as to maximize their democratic, social and cultural potential; support the right of citizens to express themselves in public dialogue which is respectful of pluralism; cooperate with civil societies and regulators in Europe and worldwide; liaise with responsible media organizations which support the development of informed democracies, and which treat and portray all citizens fairly.
activities: Meeting activities.

name: Student World Assembly (SWA)
aims: Promote global democracy by engaging students in the democratic process throughout the world.

name: African Democracy Forum (ADF)
aims: Work towards a democracy for peace, development and human rights in Africa
activities: Organizes: discussions on democracy and human rights issues in Africa; workshops; trainings.

name: Southern Africa Editors' Forum (SAEF)
aims: Promote press freedom, professionalism and ethics among senior editorial executives in the print, broadcast and electric news media.

name: Gender and Media Southern Africa Network (GEMSA)
aims: Promote the mainstreaming of gender in the Southern African media as integral to the advocacy for freedom of expression, a free and independent media and for development of democratic societies in the region.

name: Young Liberals and Democrats of Asia (YLDA)
aims: Promote liberal values among the youth across Asia

name: Great Lakes Parliamentary Forum on Peace (Amani Forum)
aims: Eliminate armed conflict in the Great Lakes region; promote peace and democratic governance.

name: Democratic Pacific Union (DPU)
aims: Safeguard human rights, democracy and the rule of law in the Pacific; ensure peaceful resolution of regional disputes and the protection of human security; promote maritime culture and sustainable development in the Pacific region; encourage development of cooperation in industry, trade and technology.

name: Global Network on Local Governance (GNLG)
aims: Develop an understanding of local governance and disseminate information; provide an interface for institutions working on issues of local governance to network and share information; provide an informal forum that seeks to harness ideas and solicit consensus of priority issues on local governance; promote a culture of good governance at the local level.

name: Network of Democracy Research Institutes (NDRI)
aims: Facilitate contacts among democracy scholars and activists; promote greater awareness of the diversity and vitality of democracy studies today.

name: Global Network for Good Governance (GNGG)
aims: Promote and sustain the practice of good governance principles (GGP) as a prelude to sustainable development.
activities: Human Rights Education training programmes; budget tracking workshops; voter registration enhancement programmes for the rural population; advocacy training programme; Football Anti-corruption Awareness project

name: European Youth Press (EYP)
aims: Ensure strong cooperation among national youth media structures through group projects; strengthen the role of youth media; promote freedom of the press in Europe.

name: West African Network on Security and Democratic Governance (WANSED)
aims: Facilitate exchange of information in democratic security sector governance; promote research, training and advocacy in security governance.

name: Arab Reform Initiative (ARI)
aims: Mobilize the Arab research capacity to advance knowledge and promote a homegrown program for democratic reform; produce policy recommendations that can help promote reform in the region; raise awareness in the Arab world about successful transitions to democracy in other parts of the world, and of the mechanisms and compromises which made such successful transitions possible.
activities: Member institute foster, within their own national context, an informed debate on reform inclusive of a wide range of representatives from various sectors of society and government. Recommendations are formulated by experts and scholars from the Arab region. Partner institutions from the USA and Europe serve to facilitate collaboration through organizational backing for projects and help convey the message of the networks to relevant constituencies in their own countries. Produces policy briefs; carries out thematic and country studies; conducts comparative public opinion surveys; sponsors occasional task forces. Organizes: annual conferences; Workshops.

name: Network of African Freedom of Expression Organizations (NAFEO)
aims: Strengthen coordination and collaboration among members in the promotion and defense of media freedom and freedom of expression across all the regions of Africa.

name: International Association of Press Clubs (IAPC)
aims: Uphold the ethics of journalism and free access to information as well as to support dialogue, cooperation and exchange of experience among journalists worldwide.

name: West African Bar Association (WABA)
aims: Enhance the professional and commercial interests of lawyers and bar associations in West Africa so as to promote democracy, rule of law initiatives and human rigths.
activities: Programmes; conferences; workshops; training.
